oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: trayī vārttā daṇḍa nītiś caiti mānavāḥ // trayī viśeṣo hy ānvīkṣikīiti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The school of Manu Manava hold that there are only three sciences the triple Vedas, Varta and the science of government, Kautilyas Arthashastra inasmuch as the science of Anvikshaki is nothing but a special branch of the Vedas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vārttā daṇḍanītiś caiti bārhaspatyāḥ // saṃvaraṇamātraṃ hi trayī lokayātrāvida iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The school of Brihaspati say that there are only two sciences Varta and the science of government, inasmuch as the Triple Vedas are merely an abridgment Samvarana, pretext? for a man experienced in affairs temporal Lokayatravidah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daṇḍanītir ekā vidyāity auśanasāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The school of Usanas declare that there is only one science, and that the science of government;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyāṃ hi sarvavidyāārambhāḥ pratibaddhā iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for, they say, it is in that science that all other sciences have their origin and end

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: catasra eva vidyā iti kauṭilyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But Kautilya holds that four and only four are the sciences;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tābhir dharmaarthau yad vidyāt tad vidyānāṃ vidyātvam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: wherefore it is from these sciences that all that concerns righteousness and wealth is learnt, therefore they are so called

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāṃkhyaṃ yogo lokāyataṃ caity ānvīkṣikī //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Anvikshaki comprises the Philosophy of Sankhya, Yoga, and Lokayata Atheism ?

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / dharmaadharmau trayyām arthaanarthau vārttāyāṃ nayaanayau daṇḍanītyāṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Righteous and unrighteous acts Dharmadharmau are learnt from the triple Vedas; wealth and nonwealth from Varta;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: balaabale ca etāsāṃ hetubhir anvīkṣamāṇā lokasya upakaroti vyasaneabhyudaye ca buddhim avasthāpayati prajñāvākyakriyāvaiśāradyaṃ ca karoti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the expedient and the inexpedient Nayanayau, as well as potency and impotency Balabale from the science of government When seen in the light of these sciences, the science of Anvikshaki is most beneficial to the world, keeps the mind steady and firm in weal and woe alike, and bestows excellence of foresight, speech and action

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pradīpaḥ sarvavidyānām upāyaḥ sarvakarmaṇām / āśrayaḥ sarvadharmāṇāṃ śaśvad ānvīkṣikī matā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Light to all kinds of knowledge, easy means to accomplish all kinds of acts and receptacle of all kinds of virtues, is the Science of Anvikshaki ever held to be CHAPTER THE END OF SCIENCES

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāmaṛgyajurvedās trayas trayī //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE three Vedas, Sama, Rik and Yajus, constitute the triple Vedas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: atharvavedaitihāsavedau ca vedāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: These together with Atharvaveda and the Itihasaveda are known as the Vedas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śikṣā kalpo vyākaraṇaṃ niruktaṃ chandovicitir jyotiṣam iti caaṅgāni //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Siksha Phonetics, Kalpa ceremonial injunctions, Vyakarana grammar, Nirukta glossarial explanation of obscure Vedic terms, Chandas Prosody, and Astronomy form the Angas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: eṣa trayīdharmaś caturṇāṃ varṇānām āśramāṇāṃ ca svadharmasthāpanād aupakārikaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: As the triple Vedas definitely determine the respective duties of the four castes and of the four orders of religious life, they are the most useful

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svadharmo brāhmaṇasya adhyayanam adhyāpanaṃ yajanaṃ yājanaṃ dānaṃ pratigrahaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The duty of the Brahman is study, teaching, performance of sacrifice, officiating in others sacrificial performance and the giving and receiving of gifts

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣatriyasyaadhyayanaṃ yajanaṃ dānaṃ śastraājīvo bhūtarakṣaṇaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That of a Kshatriya is study, performance of sacrifice, giving gifts, military occupation, and protection of life

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaiśyasyaadhyayanaṃ yajanaṃ dānaṃ kṛṣipāśupālye vaṇijyā ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That of a Vaisya is study, performance of sacrifice, giving gifts, agriculture, cattle breeding, and trade

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śūdrasya dvijātiśuśrūṣā vārttā kārukuśīlavakarma ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That of a Sudra is the serving of twiceborn dvijati, agriculture, cattlebreeding, and trade varta, the profession of artizans and courtbards karukusilavakarma

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gṛhasthasya svadharmaājīvas tulyair asamānaṛṣibhir vaivāhyam ṛtugāmitvaṃ devapitratithipūjā bhṛtyeṣu tyāgaḥ śeṣabhojanaṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra The duty of a householder is earning livelihood by his own profession, marriage among his equals of different ancestral Rishis, intercourse with his wedded wife after her monthly ablution, gifts to gods, ancestors, guests, and servants, and the eating of the remainder

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brahmacāriṇaḥ svādhyāyo agnikāryaabhiṣekau bhaikṣavratitvam ācārye prāṇaantikī vṛttis tadabhāve guruputre sabrahmacāriṇi vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That of a student Brahmacharin is learning the Vedas, fireworship, ablution, living by begging, and devotion to his teacher even at the cost of his own life, or in the absence of his teacher, to the teachers son, or to an elder classmate

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vānaprasthasya brahmacaryaṃ bhūmau śayyā jaṭāajinadhāraṇam agnihotraabhiṣekau devatāpitratithipūjā vanyaś caāhāraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That of a Vanaprastha forestrecluse is observance of chastity, sleeping on the bare ground, keeping twisted locks, wearing deerskin, fireworship, ablution, worship of gods, ancestors, and guests, and living upon food stuffs procurable in forests

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parivrājakasya jitaindriyatvam anārambho niṣkiṃcanatvaṃ saṅgatyāgo bhaikṣavratam anekatraaraṇye ca vāso bāhyaābhyantaraṃ ca
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That of an ascetic retired from the world Parivrajaka is complete control of the organs of sense, abstaining from all kinds of work, disowning money, keeping from society, begging in many places, dwelling in forests, and purity both internal and external

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarveṣām ahiṃsā satyaṃ śaucam anasūya ānṛśaṃsyaṃ kṣamā ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Harmlessness, truthfulness, purity, freedom from spite, abstinence from cruelty, and forgiveness are duties common to all

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svadharmaḥ svargāyaānantyāya ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The observance of ones own duty leads one to Svarga and infinite bliss Anantya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaatikrame lokaḥ saṃkarād ucchidyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When it is violated, the world will come to an end owing to confusion of castes and duties

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmāt svadharmaṃ bhūtānāṃ rājā na vyabhicārayet /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence the king shall never allow people to swerve from their duties;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svadharmaṃ saṃdadhāno hi pretya caiha ca nandati // vyavasthitaāryamaryādaḥ kṛtavarṇaāśramasthitiḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for whoever upholds his own duty, ever adhering to the customs of the Aryas, and following the rules of caste and divisions of religious life, will surely

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: trayyāabhirakṣito lokaḥ prasīdati na sīdati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For the world, when maintained in accordance with injunctions of the triple Vedas, will surely progress, but never perish

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛṣipāśupālye vaṇijyā ca vārtā dhānyapaśuhiraṇyakupyaviṣṭipradānād aupakārikī //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: AGRICULTURE, cattlebreeding and trade constitute Varta It is most useful in that it brings in grains, cattle, gold, forest produce kupya, and free labour vishti

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tayā svapakṣaṃ parapakṣaṃ ca vaśīkaroti kośadaṇḍābhyām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It is by means of the treasury and the army obtained solely through Varta that the king can hold under his control both his and his enemys party

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ānvīkṣikī trayī vārttānāṃ yogakṣemasādhano daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That sceptre on which the wellbeing and progress of the sciences of Anvikshaki, the triple Vedas, and Varta depend is known as Danda punishment

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasya nītir daṇḍa nītiḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That which treats of Danda is the law of punishment or science of government dandaniti

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: alabdhalābhaarthā labdhaparirakṣaṇī rakṣitavivardhanī vṛddhasya tīrthe pratipādanī ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It is a means to make acquisitions, to keep them secure, to improve them, and to distribute among the deserved the profits of improvement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyām āyattā lokayātrā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It is on this science of government that the course of the progress of the world depends

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmāl lokayātrāarthī nityam udyatadaṇḍaḥ syāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence, says my teacher, whoever is desirous of the progress of the world shall ever hold the sceptre raised udyatadanda

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: naiti kauṭilyaḥ // tīkṣṇadaṇḍo hi bhūtānām udvejanīyo bhavati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Never can there be a better instrument than the sceptre to bring people under control No, says Kautilya; for whoever imposes severe punishment becomes repulsive to the people;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mṛdudaṇḍaḥ paribhūyate //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: while he who awards mild punishment becomes contemptible

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathāarhadaṇḍaḥ pūjyate //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But whoever imposes Kautilyas Arthashastra punishment as deserved becomes respectable

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: suvijñātapraṇīto hi daṇḍaḥ prajā dharmaarthakāmair yojayati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For punishment danda when awarded with due consideration, makes the people devoted to righteousness and to works productive of wealth and enjoyment;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: duṣpraṇītaḥ kāmakrodhābhyām avajñānād vā vānaprasthaparivrājakān api kopayati, kiṃaṅga punar gṛhasthān // apraṇītas tu mātsyanyāyam udbhāvayati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: while punishment, when illawarded under the influence of greed and anger or owing to ignorance, excites fury even among hermits and ascetics dwelling in forests, not to speak of householders But when the law of punishment is kept in abeyance, it gives rise to such disorder as is implied in the proverb of fishes matsyanyayamudbhavayati;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: balīyān abalaṃ hi grasate daṇḍadharaabhāve //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for in the absence of a magistrate dandadharabhave, the strong will swallow the weak;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa tena guptaḥ prabhavati iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but under his protection, the weak resist the strong

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: caturvarṇaāśramo loko rājñā daṇḍena pālitaḥ / svadharmakarmaabhirato vartate sveṣu vartmasu //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This people loka consisting of four castes and four orders of religious life, when governed by the king with his sceptre, will keep to their respective paths, ever devotedly adhering to their respective duties and occupations

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmād daṇḍamūlās tisro vidyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: HENCE the first three sciences out of the four are dependent for their wellbeing on the science of government

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vinayamūlo daṇḍaḥ prāṇabhṛtāṃ yogakṣemaāvahaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Danda, punishment, which alone can procure safety and security of life is, in its turn, dependent on discipline vinaya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛtakaḥ svābhāvikaś ca vinayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Discipline is of two kinds artificial and natural;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kriyā hi dravyaṃ vinayati naadravyam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for Kautilyas Arthashastra instruction kriya can render only a docile being conformable to the rules of discipline, and not an undocile being adravyam

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śuśrūṣā śravaṇagrahaṇadhāraṇavijñānaūhaapohatattvaabhiniviṣṭabuddhiṃ vidyā vinayati naitaram //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The study of sciences can tame only those who are possessed of such mental faculties as obedience, hearing, grasping, retentive memory, discrimination, inference, and deliberation, but not others devoid of such faculties

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vidyānāṃ tu yathāsvam ācāryaprāmāṇyād vinayo niyamaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sciences shall be studied and their precepts strictly observed under the authority of specialist teachers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vṛttacaulakarmā lipiṃ saṃkhyānaṃ caupayuñjīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Having undergone the ceremony of tonsure, the student shall learn the alphabet lipi and arithmetic

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vṛttaupanayanas trayīm ānvīkṣikīṃ ca śiṣṭebhyo vārttām adhyakṣebhyo daṇḍanītiṃ vaktṛprayoktṛbhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: After investiture with sacred thread, he shall study the triple Vedas, the science of Anvikshaki under teachers of acknowledged authority sishta, the science of Vatra under government superintendents, and the science of Dandaniti under theoretical and practical politicians vaktriprayoktribhyah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brahmacaryaṃ ca ṣoḍaśād varṣāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He the prince shall observe celibacy till he becomes sixteen years old

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ato godānaṃ dārakarma caasya //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Then he shall observe the ceremony of tonsure godana and marry

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nityaś ca vidyāvṛddhasamyogo vinayavṛddhyartham, tanmūlatvād vinayasya //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In view of maintaining efficient discipline, he shall ever and invariably keep company with aged professors of sciences in whom alone discipline has its firm root

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūrvam aharbhāgaṃ hastyaśvarathapraharaṇavidyāsu vinayaṃ gacchet /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall spend the forenoon in receiving lessons in military arts concerning elephants, horses, chariots, and weapons, and the afternoon in hearing the Itihasa

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: purāṇam itivṛttam ākhyāyikaudāharaṇaṃ dharmaśāstram arthaśāstraṃ caitiitihāsaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Purana, Itivritta history, Akhyayika tales, Udaharana illustrative stories, Dharmasastra, and Arthasastra are known by the name Itihasa

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śeṣam ahorātrabhāgam apūrvagrahaṇaṃ gṛhītaparicayaṃ ca kuryāt, agṛhītānām ābhīkṣṇyaśravaṇaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra During the rest of the day and night, he shall not only receive new lessons and revise old lessons, but also hear over and again what has not been clearly understood

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śrutādd hi prajñāupajāyate prajñāyā yogo yogād ātmavattāiti vidyānāṃ sāmarthyam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For from hearing sutra ensues knowledge; from knowledge steady application yoga is possible; and from application selfpossession atmavatta is possible This is what is meant by efficiency of learning vidhyasamarthyam

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vidyāvinīto rājā hi prajānāṃ vinaye rataḥ ananyāṃ pṛthivīṃ bhuṅkte sarvabhūtahite rataḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The king who is well educated and disciplined in sciences, devoted to good Government of his subjects, and bent on doing good to all people will enjoy the earth unopposed CHAPTER RESTRAINT OF THE ORGANS OF SENSE

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vidyā vinayahetur indriyajayaḥ kāmakrodhalobhamānamadaharṣatyāgāt kāryaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: RESTRAINT of the organs of sense, on which success in study and discipline depends can be enforced by abandoning lust, anger, greed, vanity mána, haughtiness mada, and overjoy harsha

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karṇatvagakṣijihvāghrāṇaindriyāṇāṃ śabdasparśarūparasagandheṣv avipratipattir indriyajayaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Absence of discrepancy avipratipatti in the perception of sound, touch, colour, flavour, and scent by means of the ear, the skin, the eyes, the tongue, and the nose, is what is meant by the restraint of the organs of sense

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śāstraanuṣṭhānaṃ vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Strict observance of the precepts of sciences also means the same;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛtsnaṃ hi śāstram idam indriyajayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for the sole aim of all the sciences is nothing but restraint of the organs of sense

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tad viruddhavṛttir avaśyaindriyaś cāturanto api rājā sadyo vinaśyati // yathā dāṇḍakyo nāma bhojaḥ kāmād brāhmaṇakanyām abhimanyamānaḥ sabandhurāṣṭro vinanāśa,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whosoever is of reverse character, whoever has not his Kautilyas Arthashastra organs of sense under his control, will soon perish, though possessed of the whole earth bounded by the four quarters For example Bhoja, known also by the name, Dándakya, making a lascivious attempt on a Bráhman maiden, perished along with his kingdom and relations;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karālaś ca vaidehaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: So also Karála, the Vaideha

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kopāj janamejayo brāhmaṇeṣu vikrāntaḥ, tālajaṅghaś ca bhṛguṣu //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Likewise Janamejaya under the influence of anger against Bráhmans, as well as Tálajangha against the family of Bhrigus

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: lobhād ailaś cāturvarṇyam atyāhārayamāṇaḥ, sauvīraś caajabinduḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Aila in his attempt under the influence of greed to make exactions from Bráhmans, as well as Ajabindu, the Sauvíra in a similar attempt;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mānād rāvaṇaḥ paradārān aprayacchan, duryodhano rājyād aṃśaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Rávana unwilling under the influence of vanity to restore a strangers wife, as well as Duryodhana to part with a portion of his kingdom;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: madād dambhodbhavo bhūtaavamānī, haihayaś caarjunaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Dambhodbhava as well as Arjuna of Haihaya dynasty being so haughty as to despise all people;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: harṣād vātāpir agastyam atyāsādayan, vṛṣṇisaṃghaś ca dvaipāyanam iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Vátápi in his attempt under the influence of overjoy to attack Agastya, as well as the corporation of the Vrishnis in their attempt against Dvaipáyana

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ete caanye ca bahavaḥ śatruṣaḍvargam āśritāḥ / sabandhurāṣṭrā rājāno vineśur ajitaindriyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus these and other several kings, falling a prey to the aggregate of the six enemies and having failed to restrain their organs of sense, perished together with their kingdom and relations

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śatruṣaḍvargam utsṛjya jāmadagnyo jitaindriyaḥ / ambarīṣaś ca nābhāgo bubhujāte ciraṃ mahīm //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Having driven out the aggregate of the six enemies, as well as Ambarísha of Jámadagnya famous for his restraint of the organs of sense Nábhága long enjoyed the earth Kautilyas Arthashastra CHAPTER

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmād ariṣaḍvargatyāgenaindriyajayaṃ kurvīta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The Life of a Saintly King HENCE by overthrowing the aggregate of the six enemies, he shall restrain the organs of sense;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vṛddhasamyogena prajñām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: acquire wisdom by keeping company with the aged;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: cāreṇa cakṣuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: see through his spies;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: utthānena yogakṣemasādhanam, kāryaanuśāsanena svadharmasthāpanam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: establish safety and security by being ever active; maintain his subjects in the observance of their respective duties by exercising authority;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vinayaṃ vidyāupadeśena,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: keep up his personal discipline by receiving lessons in the sciences;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: lokapriyatvam arthasamyogena vṛttim //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and endear himself to the people by bringing them in contact with wealth and doing good to them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evaṃ vaśyaindriyaḥ parastrīdravyahiṃsāś ca varjayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus with his organs of sense under his control, he shall keep away from hurting the women and property of others;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svapnaṃ laulyam anṛtam uddhataveṣatvam anarthyasamyogam adharmasamyuktam anarthasamyuktaṃ ca vyavahāram //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: avoid not only lustfulness, even in dream, but also falsehood, haughtiness, and evil proclivities; and keep away from unrighteous and uneconomical transactions

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dharmaarthaavirodhena kāmaṃ seveta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Not violating righteousness and economy, he shall enjoy his desires

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na nihsukhaḥ syāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall never be devoid of happiness

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samaṃ vā trivargam anyonyaanubaddham // eko hy atyāsevito dharmaarthakāmānām ātmānam itarau ca pīḍayati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He may enjoy in an equal degree the three pursuits of life, charity, wealth, and desire, which are interdependent upon each other Any one of these three, when enjoyed to an excess, hurts not only the other two, but also itself

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: arthaeva pradhānaiti kauṭilyaḥ // arthamūlau hi dharmakāmāv iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilya holds that wealth and wealth alone is important, inasmuch as charity and desire depend upon wealth for their realisation

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: maryādāṃ sthāpayed ācāryān amātyān vā, yaenam apāya sthānebhyo vārayeyuḥ, chāyānālikāpratodena vā rahasi pramādyantam abhitudeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those teachers and ministers who keep him from falling a prey to dangers, and who, by striking the hours of the day as determined by measuring shadows chháyánálikápratodena warn Kautilyas Arthashastra him of his careless proceedings even in secret shall invariably be respected

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sahāyasādhyaṃ rājatvaṃ cakram ekaṃ na vartate /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sovereignty rájatva is possible only with assistance A single wheel can never move

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kurvīta sacivāṃs tasmāt teṣāṃ ca śṛṇuyān matam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence he shall employ ministers and hear their opinion

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sahaadhyāyino amātyān kurvīta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Restraint of the Organs of Sense is completed] CHAPTER

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dṛṣṭaśaucasāmarthyatvāt iti bhāradvājaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: CREATION OF MINISTERS THE King, says Bháradvája, shall employ his classmates as his ministers;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: te hy asya viśvāsyā bhavanti iti // naiti viśālaakṣaḥ // sahakrīḍitatvāt paribhavanty enam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for they can be trusted by him inasmuch as he has personal knowledge of their honesty and capacity No, says Visáláksha, for, as they have been his playmates as well, they would despise him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ye hy asya guhyasadharmāṇas tān amātyān kurvīta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But he shall employ as ministers those whose secrets, possessed of in common, are well known to him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samānaśīlavyasanatvāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Possessed of habits and defects in common

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: te hy asya marmajñabhayān naaparādhyanti iti // sādhāraṇaeṣa doṣaḥ iti pārāśarāḥ // teṣām api marmajñabhayāt kṛtaakṛtāny anuvarteta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: with the king, they would never hurt him lest he would betray their secrets Common is this fear, says Parásara, for under the fear of betrayal of his own secrets, the king may also follow them in their good and bad acts

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yāvadbhyo guhyam ācaṣṭe janebhyaḥ puruṣaadhipaḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Under the control of as many persons as are made aware by the king of his own secrets, might he place himself in all humility by that disclosure

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaenam āpatsu prāṇaābādhayuktāsv anugṛhṇīyus tān amātyān kurvīta, dṛṣṭaanurāgatvāt iti // naiti piśunaḥ // bhaktir eṣā na buddhiguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence he shall employ as ministers those who have proved faithful to him under difficulties fatal to life and are of tried devotion Kautilyas Arthashastra No, says Pisuna, for this is devotion, but not intelligence buddhigunah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃkhyātaartheṣu karmasu niyuktā ye yathāādiṣṭam arthaṃ saviśeṣaṃ vā kuryus tān amātyān kurvīta, dṛṣṭaguṇatvāt iti // naiti kauṇapadantaḥ // anyair amātyaguṇair ayuktā hy ete //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall appoint as ministers those who, when employed as financial matters, show as much as, or more than, the fixed revenue, and are thus of tried ability No, says Kaunapadanta, for such persons are devoid of other ministerial qualifications;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pitṛpaitāmahān amātyān kurvīta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: he shall, therefore, employ as ministers those whose fathers and grandfathers had been ministers before;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: te hy enam apacarantam api na tyajanti, sagandhatvāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: such persons, in virtue of their knowledge of past events and of an established relationship with the king, will, though offended, never desert him;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: amānuṣeṣv api caetad dṛśyate //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for such faithfulness is seen even among dumb animals;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gāvo hy asagandhaṃ gogaṇam atikramya sagandheṣv evaavatiṣṭhante iti // naiti vātavyādhiḥ // te hy asya sarvam avagṛhya svāmivat pracaranti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: cows, for example, stand aside from strange cows and ever keep company with accustomed herds No, says Vátavyádhi, for such persons, having acquired complete dominion over the king, begin to play themselves as the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmān nītivido navān amātyān kurvīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence he shall employ as ministers such new persons as are proficient in the science of polity

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: navās tu yamasthāne daṇḍadharaṃ manyamānā naaparādhyanti iti // naiti bāhudantī putraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It is such new persons who will regard the king as the real sceptrebearer dandadhara and dare not offend him No, says the son of Báhudantí a woman;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śāstravid adṛṣṭakarmā karmasu viṣādaṃ gacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for a man possessed of only theoretical knowledge and having no experience of practical politics is likely to commit serious blunders when engaged in actual works

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmād abhijanaprajñāśaucaśauryaanurāgayuktān amātyān kurvīta, guṇaprādhānyāt iti // sarvam upapannam iti kauṭilyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence he shall employ as ministers such as are born of high family and possessed of wisdom, purity of purpose, bravery and loyal feelings inasmuch as ministerial appointments shall purely depend on qualifications This, says Kautilya, is satisfactory in all respects;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāryasāmarthyādd hi puruṣasāmarthyaṃ kalpyate //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for a mans ability is inferred from his capacity shown in work

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāmarthyaś ca vibhajyaamātyavibhavaṃ deśakālau ca karma ca / amātyāḥ sarva evaete kāryāḥ syur na tu mantriṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: And in accordance in difference in the working capacity, Having divided the spheres of their powers and having Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 definitely taken into consideration the place and time where and when they have to work, such persons shall be employed not as councillors mantrinah but as ministerial officers amátyah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / jānapado abhijātaḥ svavagrahaḥ kṛtaśilpaś cakṣuṣmān prājño dhārayiṣṇur dakṣo vāgmī pragalbhaḥ pratipattimān utsāhaprabhāvayuktaḥ kleśasahaḥ śucir maitro dṛḍhabhaktiḥ śīlabalaārogyasattvayuktaḥ stambhacāpalahīnaḥ sampriyo vairāṇām
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE CREATION OF COUNCILLORS AND PRIESTS NATIVE, born of high family, influential, well trained in arts, possessed of foresight, wise, of strong memory, bold, eloquent, skillful, intelligent, possessed of enthusiasm, dignity, and endurance, pure in character, affable, firm in loyal devotion, endowed with excellent conduct, strength, health and bravery, free from procrastination and ficklemindedness, affectionate, and free from such qualities as excite hatred and enmitythese are the qualifications of a ministerial officer amátyasampat

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ataḥ pādaarghaguṇahīnau madhyamaavarau //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such as are possessed of onehalf or onequarter of the above qualifications come under middle and low ranks

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ janapadabhijanam avagrahaṃ caāptataḥ parīkṣeta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of these qualifications, native birth and influential position shall be ascertained from reliable persons;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samānavidyebhyaḥ śilpaṃ śāstracakṣuṣmattāṃ ca, karmaārambheṣu prajñāṃ dhārayiṣṇutāṃ dākṣyaṃ ca,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: educational qualifications silpa from professors of equal learning; theoretical and practical knowledge, foresight, retentive memory, and affability shall be tested from successful, application in works;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kathāyogeṣu vāgmitvaṃ prāgalbhyaṃ pratibhānavattvaṃ ca,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: eloquence, skillfulness and flashing intelligence from power shown in narrating stories katháyogeshu, ie, in conversation;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃvāsibhyaḥ śīlabalaārogyasattvayogam astambham acāpalaṃ ca, pratyakṣataḥ sampriyatvam avairatvaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: purity of life, friendly disposition, and loyal devotion by frequent association; Kautilyas Arthashastra conduct, strength, health, dignity, and freedom from indolence and ficklemindedness shall be ascertained from their intimate friends;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratyakṣaparokṣaanumeyā hi rājavṛttiḥ // svayaṃ drṣṭaṃ pratyakṣam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and affectionate and philanthrophic nature by personal experience The works of a king may be visible, invisible paroksha and inferential That which he sees is visible;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paraupadiṣṭaṃ parokṣam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and that which he is taught by another is invisible;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmasu kṛtenaakṛtaavekṣaṇam anumeyam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and inference of the nature of what is not accomplished from what is accomplished is inferential

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaugapadyāt tu karmaṇām anekatvād anekasthatvāc ca deśakālaatyayo mā bhūd iti parokṣam amātyaiḥ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: As works do not happen to be simultaneous, are various in form, and pertain to distant and different localities, the king shall, in view of being abreast of time and place, depute his ministers to carry them out

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ity amātyakarma /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such is the work of ministers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: purohitam uditauditakulaśīlaṃ saaṅge vede daive nimitte daṇḍanītyāṃ caabhivinītam āpadāṃ daivamānuṣīṇām atharvabhir upāyaiś ca pratikartāraṃ kurvīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Him whose family and character are highly spoken of, who is well educated in the Vedás and the six Angas, is skillful in reading portents providential or accidental, is well versed in the science of government, and who is obedient and who can prevent calamities providential or human by performing such expiatory rites as are prescribed in the Atharvaveda, the king shall employ as high priest

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tam ācāryaṃ śiṣyaḥ pitaraṃ putro bhṛtyaḥ svāminam iva caanuvarteta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: As a student his teacher, a son his father, and a servant his master, the king shall follow him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brāhmaṇenaedhitaṃ kṣatraṃ mantrimantraabhimantritam / jayaty ajitam atyantaṃ śāstraanugamaśastritam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That Kshatriya breed which is brought up by Bráhmans, is charmed with the counsels of good councillors, and which faithfully follows the precepts of the sástras becomes invincible and attains success though unaided with weapons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mantripurohitasakhaḥ sāmānyeṣv adhikaraṇeṣu sthāpayitvāamātyān upadhābhiḥ śodhayet // purohitam ayājyayājanaadhyāpane niyuktam amṛṣyamāṇaṃ rājāavakṣipet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: ASSISTED by his prime minister mantri and his high priest, the king shall, by offering temptations, examine the character of ministers amátya appointed in government departments of ordinary nature The king shall dismiss a priest who, when ordered, refuses to teach the Vedás to an outcaste person or to officiate in a sacrificial performance apparently undertaken by an outcaste person ayájya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa sattribhiḥ śapathapūrvam ekaikam amātyam upajāpayet adhārmiko ayaṃ rājā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Then the dismissed priest shall, through the medium of spies under the guise of classmates satri, instigate each minister one after another, saying on oath this king is unrighteous;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sādhu dhārmikam anyam asya tatkulīnam aparuddhaṃ kulyam ekapragrahaṃ sāmantam āṭavikam aupapādikaṃ vā pratipādayāmaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: well let us set up in his place another king who is righteous, or who is born of the same family as of this king, or who is kept imprisoned, or a neighbouring king of his family and of selfsufficiency ekapragraha, or a wild chief atavika, or an upstart aupapádika;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarveṣām etad rocate,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: this attempt is to the liking of all of us;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kathaṃ vā tava iti // pratyākhyāne śuciḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: what dost thou think ? If any one or all of the ministers refuse to acquiesce in such a measure, he or they shall be considered pure

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti dharmaupadhā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This is what is called religious allurement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: senāpatir asatpragraheṇaavakṣiptaḥ sattribhir ekaikam amātyam upajāpayet lobhanīyenaarthena rājavināśāya, sarveṣām etad rocate,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A commander of the army, dismissed from service for receiving condemnable things asatpragraha may, through the agency of spies under the guise of classmates satri, incite each minister to murder the king in view of acquiring immense wealth, each minister being asked this attempt is to the liking of all of us;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kathaṃ vā tava iti // pratyākhyāne śuciḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: what dost thou think? Kautilyas Arthashastra If they refuse to agree, they are to be considered pure

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ity arthaupadhā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This is what is termed monetary allurement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parivrājikā labdhaviśvāsāantaḥpure kṛtasatkārā mahāmātram ekaikam upajapet rājamahiṣī tvāṃ kāmayate kṛtasamāgamaupāyā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A womanspy under the guise of an ascetic and highly esteemed in the harem of the king may allure each prime minister mahámátra one after another, saying the queen is enamoured of thee and has made arrangements for thy entrance into her chamber;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mahān arthaś ca te bhaviṣyati iti // pratyākhyāne śuciḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: besides this, there is also the certainty of large acquisitions of wealth If they discard the proposal, they are pure

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti kāmaupadhā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This is what is styled loveallurement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prahavaṇanimittam eko amātyaḥ sarvān amātyān āvāhayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: With the intention of sailing on a commercial vessel prahavananimittam, a minister may induce all other ministers to follow him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tenaudvegena rājā tān avarundhyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Apprehensive of danger, the king may arrest them all

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāpaṭikaś caatra pūrvaavaruddhas teṣām arthamānaavakṣiptam ekaikam amātyam upajapet asat pravṛtto ayaṃ rājā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A spy under the guise of a fraudulent disciple, pretending to have suffered imprisonment may incite each of the ministers thus deprived of wealth and rank, saying, the king has betaken himself to an unwise course;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sādhv enaṃ hatvāanyaṃ pratipādayāmaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: well, having murdered him, let us put another in his stead

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarveṣām etad rocate,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: We all like this;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kathaṃ vā tava iti // pratyākhyāne śuciḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: what dost thou think? If they refuse to agree, they are pure

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti bhayaupadhā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This is what is termed allurement under fear

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatra dharmaupadhāśuddhān dharmasthīyakaṇṭakaśodhaneṣu karmasu sthāpayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of these tried ministers, those whose character has been tested under religious allurements shall be employed in civil and criminal courts dharmasthaníyakantaka sodhaneshu;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: arthaupadhāśuddhān samāhartṛsamnidhātṛnicayakarmasu, kāmaupadhā śuddhān bāhyaābhyantaravihārarakṣāsu,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those whose purity has been tested under monetary allurements shall be employed in the work of a revenue collector and chamberlain; those who have been tried under loveallurements shall be appointed to superintend the pleasuregrounds vihára both external and internal;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhayaupadhāśuddhān āsannakāryeṣu rājñaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those who have been tested by allurements under fear shall be appointed to immediate service;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvaupadhāśuddhān mantriṇaḥ kuryāt // sarvatraaśucīn khanidravyahastivanakarmaanteṣu upayojayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and those Kautilyas Arthashastra whose character has been tested under all kinds of allurements shall be employed as prime ministers mantrinah, while those who are proved impure under one or all of these allurements shall be appointed in mines, timber and elephant forests, and manufactories

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: trivargabhayasaṃśuddhān amātyān sveṣu karmasu / adhikuryād yathā śaucam ity ācāryā vyavasthitāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Teachers have decided that in accordance with ascertained purity, the king shall employ in corresponding works those ministers whose character has been tested under the three pursuits of life, religion, wealth and love, and under fear

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na tv eva kuryād ātmānaṃ devīṃ vā lakṣyam īśvaraḥ / śaucahetor amātyānām etat kauṭilyadarśanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Never, in the view of Kautilya, shall the king make himself or his queen an object laksham, butt of testing the character of his councillors, nor shall he vitiate the pure like water with poison

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kadācidd hi praduṣṭasya naadhigamyeta bheṣajam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sometimes the prescribed medicine may fail to reach the person of moral disease;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛtā ca kaluṣābuddhir upadhābhiś caturvidhā / naagatvāantaṃ nivarteta sthitā sattvavatāṃ dhṛtau //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the mind of the valiant, though naturally kept steadfast, may not, when once vitiated and repelled under the four kinds of allurements, return to and recover its original form

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmād bāhyam adhiṣṭhānaṃ kṛtvā kārye caturvidhe / śaucaaśaucam amātyānāṃ rājā mārgeta sattribhiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence having set up an external object as the butt for all the four kinds of allurements, the king shall, through the agency of spies satri, find out the pure or impure character of his ministers amátya CHAPTER

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: upadhābhiḥ śuddhaamātyavargo gūḍhapuruṣān utpādayet kāpaṭikaudāsthitagṛhapatikavaidehakatāpasavyañjanān sattritīṣkṇarasadabhikṣukīś
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: ASSISTED by the council of his ministers tried under Kautilyas Arthashastra espionage, the king shall proceed to create spies Spies under the guise of a fraudulent disciple kápatikachhátra, a recluse udásthita, a householder grihapaitika, a merchant vaidehaka, an ascetic practising austerities tápasa, a classmate or a colleague satri, a firebrand tíkshna, a poisoner rasada, and a mendicant woman bhikshuki

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paramarmajñaḥ pragalbhaś chātraḥ kāpaṭikaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A skillful person capable of guessing the mind of others is a fraudulent disciple

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tam arthamānābhyāṃ protsāhya mantrī brūyāt rājānaṃ māṃ ca pramāṇaṃ kṛtvā yasya yad akuśalaṃ paśyasi tat tadānīm eva pratyādiśa
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Having encouraged such a spy with honour and money rewards, the minister shall tell him, sworn to the king and myself, thou shalt inform us of whatever wickedness thou findest in others One who is initiated in asceticism and is possessed of foresight and pure character is a recluse

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa vārttākarmapradiṣṭāyāṃ bhūmau prabhūtahiraṇyaantevāsī karma kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This spy, provided with much money and many disciples, shall carry on agriculture, cattlerearing, and trade vártakarma on the lands allotted to him for the purpose

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmaphalāc ca sarvapravrajitānāṃ grāsaācchādanaāvasathān pratividadhyāt // vṛttikāmāṃś caupajapet etenaeva veṣeṇa rājaarthaś caritavyo bhaktavetanakāle caupasthātavyam iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Out of the produce and profits thus acquired, he shall provide all ascetics with subsistence, clothing and lodging, and send on espionage such among those under his protection as are desirous to earn a livelihood vrittikáma, ordering each of them to detect a particular kind of crime committed in connection with the kings wealth and to report of it when they come to receive their subsistence and wages

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvapravrajitāś ca svaṃ svaṃ vargam evam upajapeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: All the ascetics under the recluse shall severally send their followers on similar errands

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karṣako vṛttikṣīṇaḥ prajñāśaucayukto gṛhapatikavyañjanaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A cultivator, fallen from his profession, but possessed of foresight and pure character is termed a householder spy

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa kṛṣikarmapradiṣṭāyāṃ bhūmau iti samānaṃ pūrveṇa //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This spy shall carry on the cultivation of lands allotted to him for the purpose, and maintain cultivators, etcas before

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vāṇijako vṛttikṣīṇaḥ prajñāśaucayukto vaidehakavyañjanaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A trader, fallen from his profession, but possessed of foresight and pure character, is a merchant spy

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa vaṇikkarmapradiṣṭāyāṃ bhūmau iti samānaṃ pūrveṇa //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This spy shall carry on the manufacture of merchandise on lands allotted to him for the Kautilyas Arthashastra purpose, etc,as before

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: muṇḍo jaṭilo vā vṛttikāmas tāpasavyañjanaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A man with shaved head munda or braided hair jatila and desirous to earn livelihood is a spy under the guise of an ascetic practising austerities

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa nagaraabhyāśe prabhūtamuṇḍajaṭilaantevāsī śākaṃ yavamuṣṭiṃ vā māsadvimāsaantaraṃ prakāśam aśnīyāt, gūḍham iṣṭam āhāram //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such a spy surrounded by a host of disciples with shaved head or braided hair may take his abode in the suburbs of a city, and pretend as a person barely living on a handful of vegetables or meadow grass yavasamushti taken once in the interval of a month or two, but he may take in secret his favourite foodstuffs gúdhamishtamáháram

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaidehakaantevāsinaś caenaṃ samiddhayogair arcayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Merchant spies pretending to be his disciples may worship him as one possessed of preternatural powers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śiṣyāś caasyaāvedayeyuḥ asau siddhaḥ sāmedhikaḥ iti // / samedhaāśāstibhiś caabhigatānām aṅgavidyayā śiṣyasaṃjñābhiś ca karmāṇy abhijane avasitāny ādiśet alpalābham agnidāhaṃ corabhayaṃ dūṣyavadhaṃ tuṣṭidānaṃ videśapravṛttijñānam, idam adya śvo vā bhaviṣyati,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: His other disciples may widely proclaim that this ascetic is an accomplished expert of preternatural powers Regarding those persons who, desirous of knowing their future, throng to him, he may, through palmistry, foretell such future events as he can ascertain by the nods and signs of his disciples angavidyayá sishyasanjnábhischa concerning the works of highborn people of the country,viz, small profits, destruction by fire, fear from robbers, the execution of the seditious, rewards for the good, forecast of foreign affairs videsa pravrittivijnánam, saying, this will happen today, that tomorrow, and that this king will do Such assertions of the ascetic his disciples shall corroborate by adducing facts and figures

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sattvaprajñāvākyaśaktisampannānāṃ rājabhāgyam anuvyāharet, mantrisamyogaṃ ca brūyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall also foretell not only the rewards which persons possessed of foresight, eloquence, and bravery are likely to receive at the hands of the king, but also probable changes in the appointments of ministers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mantrī caeṣāṃ vṛttikarmabhyāṃ viyateta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The kings minister shall direct his affairs in conformity to the Kautilyas Arthashastra forecast made by the ascetic

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ye ca kāraṇād abhikruddhās tān arthamānābhyāṃ śamayet, akāraṇakruddhāṃs tūṣṇīṃ daṇḍena, rājadviṣṭakāriṇaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall appease with offer of wealth and honour those who have had some well known cause to be disaffected, and impose punishments in secret on those who are for no reason disaffected or who are plotting against the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūjitāś caarthamānābhyāṃ rājñā rājaupajīvinām / jānīyuḥ śaucam ity etāḥ pañcasaṃsthāḥ prakīrtitāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Honoured by the king with awards of money and titles, these five institutes of espionage samstháh shall ascertain the purity of character of the kings servants CHAPTER INSTITUTION OF SPIES

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ye caapy asmabandhino avaśyabhartavyās te lakṣaṇam aṅgavidyāṃ jambhakavidyāṃ māyāgatam āśramadharmaṃ nimittam antaracakram ity adhīyānāḥ sattriṇaḥ, saṃsargavidyāṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Creation of Wandering Spies THOSE orphans asambandhinah who are to be necessarily fed by the state and are put to study science, palmistry angavidya, sorcery máyágata, the duties of the various orders of religious life, legerdemain jambhakavidya, and the reading of omens and augury antarachakra, are classmate spies or spies learning by social intercourse samsargavidyasatrinah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ye janapade śūrās tyaktaātmāno hastinaṃ vyālaṃ vā dravyahetoḥ pratiyodhayeyus te tīkṣṇāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such brave desperados of the country who, reckless of their own life, confront elephants or tigers in fight mainly for the purpose of earning money are termed firebrands or fiery spies tíkshna

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ye bandhuṣu nihsnehāḥ krūrā alasāś ca te rasadāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who have no trace of filial affection left in them and who are very cruel and indolent are poisoners rasada

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parivrājikā vṛttikāmā daridrā vidhavā pragalbhā brāhmaṇy antaḥpure kṛtasatkārā mahāmātrakulāny abhigacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A poor widow of Bráhman caste, very clever, and desirous to Kautilyas Arthashastra earn her livelihood is a woman ascetic parivrájiká Honoured in the kings harem, such a woman shall frequent the residences of the kings prime ministers mahámátrakuláni

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: etayā muṇḍā vṛṣalyo vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rule shall apply to women with shaved head munda, as well as to those of súdra caste

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti saṃcārāḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: All these are wandering spies sancháráh

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / tān rājā svaviṣaye mantripurohitasenāpatiyuvarājadauvārikaantarvaṃśikapraśāstṛsamāhartṛsamnidhātṛpradeṣṭṛnāyakapauravyāvahārikakārmāntikamantripariṣadadhyakṣadaṇḍadurgaantapālaāṭavikeṣu śraddheyadeśaveṣaśilpabhāṣāabhijanaapadeśān bhaktitaḥ sāmarthyayogāc caapasarpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of these spies, those who are of good family, loyal, reliable, welltrained in the art of putting on disguises appropriate to countries and trades, and possessed of knowledge of many languages and arts shall be sent by the king to espy in his own country the movements of his ministers, priests, commanders of the army, the heirapparent, the doorkeepers, the officer in charge of the harem, the magistrate prasástri, the collectorgeneral samáhartri, the chamberlain sannidhátri, the commissioner pradeshtri, the city constable náyaka, the officer in charge of the city paura, the superintendent of transactions vyávahárika, the superintendent of manufactories karmántika, the assembly of councillors mantriparishad, heads of departments adhyaksháh, the commissarygeneral dandapála, and officers in charge of fortifications, boundaries, and wild tracts

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ bāhyaṃ cāraṃ chatrabhṛṅgāravyajanapādukaāsanayānavāhanaupagrāhiṇas tīkṣṇā vidyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Fiery spies, such as are employed to hold the royal umbrella, vase, fan, and shoes, or to attend at the throne, chariot, and conveyance shall espy the public character báhyam cháram of these officers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: taṃ sattriṇaḥ saṃsthāsv arpayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Classmate spies shall convey this information ie, that gathered by the fiery spies to the institutes of espionage samsthásvarpayeyuh

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / sūdaārālikasnāpakasaṃvāhakaāstarakakalpakaprasādhakaudakaparicārakā rasadāḥ kubjavāmanakirātamūkabadhirajaḍaandhacchadmāno naṭanartakagāyanavādakavāgjīvanakuśīlavāḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Poisoners such as a saucemaker súda, a cook arálika, procurer of water for bathing snápaka shampooer, the spreader of Kautilyas Arthashastra bed ástaraka, a barber kalpaka, toiletmaker prasádaka, a waterservant; servants such as have taken the appearance of a humpbacked person, a dwarf, a pigmy kiráta, the dumb, the deaf, the idiot, the blind; artisans such as actors, dancers, singers, players on musical instruments, buffoons, and a bard;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: striyaś caābhyantaraṃ cāraṃ vidyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: as well as women shall espy the private character of these officers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: taṃ bhikṣkyaḥ saṃsthāsv aprayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A mendicant woman shall convey this information to the institute of espionage

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃsthānām antevāsinaḥ saṃjñālipibhiś cārasaṃcāraṃ kuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The immediate officers of the institutes of espionage samsthánámantevásinah shall by making use of signs or writing samjnálipibhih set their own spies in motion to ascertain the validity of the information

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na caanyonyaṃ saṃsthās te vā vidyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Neither the institutes of espionage nor they the wandering spies shall know each other

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhikṣukīpratiṣedhe dvāhsthaparamparā mātāpitṛvyañjanāḥ śilpakārikāḥ kuśīlavā dāsyo vā gītapāṭhyavādyabhāṇḍagūḍhalekhyasaṃjñābhir vā cāraṃ nirhareyuḥ// dīrgharogaunmādaagnirasavisargeṇa vā gūḍhanirgamanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a mendicant woman is stopped at the entrance, the line of doorkeepers, spies under the guise of father and mother mátápitri vyanjanáh, women artisans, courtbards, or prostitutes shall, under the pretext of taking in musical instruments, or through cipherwriting gudhalekhya, or by means of signs, convey the information to its destined place cháram nirhareyuh Spies of the institutes of espionage may suddenly go out under the pretext of long standing disease, or lunacy, or by setting fire to something or by administering poison to some one

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: trayāṇām ekavākye sampratyayaḥ // teṣām abhīkṣṇavinipāte tūṣṇīṃdaṇḍaḥ pratiṣedhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When the information thus received from these three different sources is exactly of the same version, it shall be held reliable If they the three sources frequently differ, the spies concerned shall either be punished in secret or dismissed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kaṇṭakaśodhanauktāś caapasarpāḥ pareṣu kṛtavetanā vaseyur asampātinaś cāraartham //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those spies who are referred to in Book , Removal of Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 Thorns, shall receive their salaries from those kings para, ie, foreign with whom they live as servants;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ta ubhayavetanāḥ // gṛhītaputradārāṃś ca kuryād ubhayavetanān /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those whose sons and wives are kept as hostages shall be made recipients of salaries from two states and considered as under the mission of enemies

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tāṃś caariprahitān vidyāt teṣāṃ śaucaṃ ca tadvidhaiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Purity of character of such persons shall be ascertained through persons of similar profession

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evaṃ śatrau ca mitre ca madhyame caāvapec carān / udāsīne ca teṣāṃ ca tīrtheṣv aṣṭādaśasv api //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus with regard to kings who are inimical, friendly, intermediate, of low rank, or neutral, and with regard to their eighteen government departments ashtáldasatírtha, spies shall be set in motion

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śilpavatyaḥ striyo mūkāś citrāś ca mlecchajātayaḥ // durgeṣu vaṇijaḥ saṃsthā durgaante siddhatāpasāḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The humpbacked, the dwarf, the eunuch, women of accomplishments, the dumb, and various grades of Mlechcha caste shall be spies inside their houses Merchant spies inside forts; saints and ascetics in the suburbs of forts;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karṣakaudāsthitā rāṣṭre rāṣṭraante vrajavāsinaḥ // vane vanacarāḥ kāryāḥ śramaṇaāṭavikaādayaḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the cultivator and the recluse in country parts; herdsmen in the boundaries of the country; in forests, forestdwellers, sramanás, and chiefs of wild tribes, shall be stationed to ascertain the movements of enemies

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parapravṛttijñānaarthāḥ śīghrāścāraparamparāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Spies set up by foreign kings shall also be found out by local spies; spies by spies of like profession

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: cārasaṃcāriṇaḥ saṃsthā gūḍhāś caagūḍhasaṃjñitāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It is the institutes of espionage, secret or avowed, that set spies in motion

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akṛtyān kṛtyapakṣīyair darśitān kāryahetubhiḥ / paraapasarpajñānaarthaṃ mukhyān anteṣu vāsayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those chiefs whose inimical design has been found out by spies supporting the kings cause shall, in view of affording opportunity to detect the spies of foreign kings, be made to live on Kautilyas Arthashastra the boundaries of the state

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛtamahāmātraapasarpaḥ paurajānapadān apasarpayet // sattriṇo dvandvinas tīrthasabhāpūgajanasamavāyeṣu vivādaṃ kuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: HAVING set up spies over his prime ministers mahámátra, the king shall proceed to espy both citizens and country people Classmate spies satri formed as opposing factions shall carry on disputations in places of pilgrimage tírtha, in assemblies, houses, corporations púga, and amid congregations of people

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvaguṇasampannaś caayaṃ rājā śrūyate,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: One spy may say This king is said to be endowed with all desirable qualities;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na caasya kaścid guṇo dṛśyate yaḥ paurajānapadān daṇḍakarābhyāṃ pīḍayati iti // tatra yeanupraśaṃseyus tān itaras taṃ ca pratiṣedhayet // mātsyanyāyaabhibhūtāḥ prajā manuṃ vaivasvataṃ rājānaṃ cakrire //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: he seems to be a stranger to such tendencies as would lead him to oppress citizens and country people by levying heavy fines and taxes Against those who seem to commend this opinion, another spy may interrupt the speaker and say People suffering from anarchy as illustrated by the proverbial tendency of a large fish swallowing a small one mátsyanyáyábhibhútah prajáh, first elected Manu, the Vaivasvata, to be their king;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dhānyaṣaḍbhāgaṃ paṇyadaśabhāgaṃ hiraṇyaṃ caasya bhāgadheyaṃ prakalpayāmāsuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and allotted onesixth of the grains grown and onetenth of merchandise as sovereign dues

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena bhṛtā rājānaḥ prajānāṃ yogakṣemaāvahāḥ // teṣāṃ kilbiṣam adaṇḍakarā haranty ayogakṣemaāvahāś ca prajānām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Fed by this payment, kings took upon themselves the responsibility of maintaining the safety and security of their subjects Kautilyas Arthashastra yogakshemavaháh, and of being answerable for the sins of their subjects when the principle of levying just punishments and taxes has been violated

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmād uñchaṣaḍbhāgam āraṇyakāapi nirvapanti tasyaetad bhāgadheyaṃ yoasmān gopāyati iti // indrayamasthānam etad rājānaḥ pratyakṣaheḍaprasādāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence hermits, too, provide the king with onesixth of the grains gleaned by them, thinking that „it is a tax payable to him who protects us‟ It is the king in whom the duties of both Indra the rewarder and Yama the punisher are blended, and he is a visible dispenser of punishments and rewards hedaprasáda;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tān avamanyamānān daivoapi daṇḍaḥ spṛśati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: whoever disregards kings will be visited with divine punishments, too

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmād rājāno naavamantavyāḥ // ity evaṃ kṣudrakān pratiṣedhayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence kings shall never be despised Thus treacherous opponents of sovereignty shall be silenced

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kiṃvadantīṃ ca vidyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Spies shall also know the rumours prevalent in the state

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tair upakurvanti vyasaneabhyudaye vā, kupitaṃ bandhuṃ rāṣṭraṃ vā vyāvartayanti, amitram āṭavikaṃ vā pratiṣedhayanti, teṣāṃ muṇḍajaṭilavyañjanās tuṣṭaatuṣṭatvaṃ vidyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Spies with shaved heads or braided hair shall ascertain whether there prevails content or discontent among those who live upon the grains, cattle, and gold of the king, among those who supply the same to the king in weal or woe, those who keep under restraint a disaffected relative of the king or a rebellious district, as well as those who drive away an invading enemy or a wild tribe

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tuṣṭān bhūyoarthamānābhyāṃ pūjayet // atuṣṭāṃs tuṣṭihetos tyāgena sāmnā ca prasādayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The greater the contentment of such persons, the more shall be the honour shown to them; while those who are disaffected shall be ingratiated by rewards or conciliation;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parasparād vā bhedayed enān, sāmantaāṭavikatatkulīnaaparuddhebhyaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: or dissension may be sown among them so that they may alienate themselves from each other, from a neighbouring enemy, from a wild tribe, or from a banished or imprisoned prince

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tathāapy atuṣyato daṇḍakarasādhanaadhikāreṇa janapadavidveṣaṃ grāhayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Failing this measure, they may be so employed in collecting fines and taxes as to incur the displeasure of the people

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viviṣṭān upāṃśudaṇḍena janapadakopena vā sādhayet // guptaputradārān ākarakarmaanteṣu vā vāsayet pareṣām āspadabhayāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who are inebriated with feelings of enmity may be put down by punishment in secret or by making them incur the displeasure of the whole country Or having taken the sons and wives of such treacherous persons under State protection, they may be made to live in mines, lest they may afford shelter to enemies

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kruddhalubdhabhītamāninas tu pareṣāṃ kṛtyāḥ // teṣāṃ kārtāntikanaimittikamauhūrtikavyañjanāḥ parasparaabhisambandham amitraāṭavikasambandhaṃ vā vidyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those that are angry, those that are greedy, those that are alarmed, as well as those that despise the king are the instruments Kautilyas Arthashastra of enemies Spies under the guise of astrologers and tellers of omens and augury shall ascertain the relationship of such persons with each other and with foreign kings

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tuṣṭān arthamānābhyāṃ pūjayet / atuṣṭān sāmadānabhedadaṇḍaiḥ sādhayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Honours and rewards shall be conferred upon those that are contented, while those that are disaffected shall be brought round by conciliation, by gifts, or by sowing dissension, or by punishment

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evaṃ svaviṣaye kṛtyān akṛtyāṃś ca vicakṣaṇaḥ / paraupajāpāt samrakṣet pradhānān kṣudrakān api //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus in his own state a wise king shall guard factions among his people, friendly or hostile, powerful or powerless against the intrigue of foreign kings CHAPTER WINNING OVER FACTIONS FOR OR AGAINST AN ENEMYS CAUSE IN AN ENEMYS STATE

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛtyaakṛtyapakṣaupagrahaḥ svaviṣaye vyākhyātaḥ, paraviṣaye vācyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: PROTECTION of parties for or against ones own cause in ones own state has been dealt with Similar measures in connection with parties in a foreign state are to be treated of

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃśrutyaarthān vipralabdhaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who are deluded with false promise of large rewards;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tulyakāriṇoḥ śilpe vāupakāre vā vimānitaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those of whom one party, though equally skillful as another party in artistic work or in turning out productive or beneficial works, is slighted by bestowing larger rewards on its rival party;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vallabhaavaruddhaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those who are harassed by courtiers Vallabhávaruddháh;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samāhūya parājitaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those who are invited to be slighted;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pravāsaupataptaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those who are harassed by banishment;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛtvā vyayam alabdhakāryaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those who in spite of their large outlay of money have failed in their Kautilyas Arthashastra undertakings;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svadharmād dāyādyād vāuparuddhaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those who are prevented from the exercise of their rights or from taking possession of their inheritance;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mānaadhikārābhyāṃ bhraṣṭaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those who have fallen from their rank and honours in government service;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kulyair antarhitaḥ, prasabhaabhimṛṣṭastrīkaḥ, kāraabhinyastaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those who are shoved to the corner by their own kinsmen; those whose women are violently assaulted; those who are thrown in jail;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parauktadaṇḍitaḥ, mithyāācāravāritaḥ, sarvasvam
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those who are punished in secret; those who are warned of their misdeeds; those whose property has been wholly confiscated;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: āhāritaḥ, bandhanaparikliṣṭaḥ, pravāsitabandhuḥ iti kruddhavargaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those who have long suffered from imprisonment; those whose relatives are banishedall these come under the group of provoked persons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svayam upahataḥ, viprakṛtaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who has fallen a victim to misfortune by his own misdeeds;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pāpakarmaabhikhyātaḥ, tulyadoṣadaṇḍenaudvignaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: he whose sinful deeds are brought to light; he who is alarmed at the award of punishment on a man of like guilt;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paryāttabhūmiḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: he whose lands have been confiscated;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daṇḍenaupanataḥ, sarvaadhikaraṇasthaḥ, sahasāupacitaarthaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: he whose rebellious spirit is put down by coercive measures; he who, as a superintendent of all government departments, has suddenly amassed a large amount of wealth;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatkulīnaupāśaṃsuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: he who, as a relative of such a rich man aspires to inherit his wealth;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pradviṣṭo rājñā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: he who is disliked by the king;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājadveṣī ca iti bhītavargaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and he who hates the king,all these come under the group of persons alarmed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parikṣīṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who is impoverished;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kadaryaḥ, vyasanī, atyāhitavyavahāraś ca iti lubdhavargaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: he who is niggardly; he who is addicted to evil propensities; and he who is engaged in dangerous transactions,all these constitute the group of ambitious persons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ātmasambhāvitaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who is selfsufficient;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mānakāmaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: he who is fond of honours;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śatrupūjāamarṣitaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: he who is intolerant of his rivals honour;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tīkṣṇaḥ, sāhasikaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: he who is esteemed low; he who is of a fiery spirit;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhogenaasaṃtuṣṭaḥ iti mānivargaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: he who is foolhardy as well as he who is not content with what he has been enjoying,all these come under the group of haughty persons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ muṇḍajaṭilavyañjanair yo yadbhaktiḥ kṛtyapakṣīyas taṃ tenaupajāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of these, he who clings to a particular faction shall be so Kautilyas Arthashastra deluded by spies with shaved head or braided hair as to believe that he is intriguing with that party

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathā madaandho hastī mattenaadhiṣṭhito yad yad āsādayati tat sarvaṃ pramṛdnāti, evam ayam aśāstracakṣur andho rājā paurajānapadavadhāyaabhyutthitaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Partisans under provocation, for example, may be won over by telling that „just as an elephant in rut and mounted over by a driver under intoxication tramples under its foot whatever it comes across, so this king, dispossessed of the eye of science, blindly attempts to oppress both citizens and country people;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śakyam asya pratihastiprotsāhanenaapakartum,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: it is possible to restrain him by setting up a rival elephant against him;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathā līnaḥ sarpo yasmād bhayaṃ paśyati tatra viṣam utsṛjati, evam ayaṃ rājā jātadoṣaāśaṅkas tvayi purā krodhaviṣam utsṛjati,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: so have forbearance enough to wait‟ Likewise alarmed persons may be won over by telling that „just as a hidden snake bites and emits poison over whatever alarms it, so this king apprehensive of danger from thee will ere long emit the poison of his resentment on thee;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyatra gamyatām iti bhītavargaṃupajāpayet // yathā śvagaṇināṃ dhenuḥ śvabhyo duhyate na brāhmaṇebhyaḥ, evam ayaṃ rājā sattvaprajñāvākyaśaktihīnebhyo duhyate naātmaguṇasampannebhyaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: so thou mayest better go elsewhere‟ Similarly ambitious persons may be won over by telling that „just as a cow reared by dogkeepers gives milk to dogs, but not to Bráhmans, so this king gives milk rewards to those who are devoid of valour, foresight, eloquence and bravery, but not to those who are possessed of noble character;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathā caṇḍālaudapānaś caṇḍālānām evaupabhogyo naanyeṣām, evam ayaṃ rājā nīco nīcānām evaupabhogyo na tvadvidhānām āryāṇām, asau rājā puruṣaviśeṣajñaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: so the other king who is possessed of power to discriminate men from men may be courted‟ In like manner haughty persons may be won over by telling that „just as a reservoir of water belonging to Chándálas is serviceable only to Chándálas, but not to others, so this king of lowbirth confers his patronage only on lowborn people, but not on Aryas like thee;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tathāiti pratipannāṃs tān saṃhitān paṇakarmaṇā / yojayeta yathāśakti saapasarpān svakarmasu // labheta sāmadānābhyāṃ kṛtyāṃś ca parabhūmiṣu /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: so the other king who is possessed of power to distinguish between men and men may be courted‟ All these disaffected persons, when acquiescing to the above proposals, may be made under a solumn compact panakarmaná to form a combination together with the spies to achieve their end

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akṛtyān bhedadaṇḍābhyāṃ paradoṣāṃś ca darśayan // kṛtasvapakṣaparapakṣaupagrahaḥ kāryaārambhāṃś cintayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Likewise friends of a foreign king may also be won over by Kautilyas Arthashastra means of persuation and rewards, while implacable enemies may be brought round by sowing dissensions, by threats, and by pointing out the defects of their master

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mantrapūrvāḥ sarvaārambhāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: All kinds of administrative measures are preceded by deliberations in a wellformed council

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: taduddeśaḥ saṃvṛtaḥ kathānām anihśrāvī pakṣibhir apy anālokyaḥ syāt /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The subject matter of a council shall be entirely secret and deliberations in it shall be so carried that even birds cannot see them;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śrūyate hi śukasārikābhir mantro bhinnaḥ, śvabhir apy anyaiś ca tiryagyonibhir iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for it is said that the secrecy of counsels was divulged by parrots, minas, dogs and other low creatures of mean birth

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmān mantrauddeśam anāyukto naupagacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence without providing himself with sufficient safeguard against disclosure, he shall never enter into deliberations in a council

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ucchidyeta mantrabhedī //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever discloses counsels shall be torn to pieces

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mantrabhedo hi dūtaamātyasvāminām iṅgitaākārābhyām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The disclosure of counsels may be detected by observing changes in the attitude and countenance of envoys, ministers, and masters

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iṅgitam anyathāvṛttiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Change in conduct is change in attitude ingitamanyathávrittih;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ākṛtigrahaṇam ākāraḥ // tasya saṃvaraṇam āyuktapuruṣarakṣaṇam ākāryakālād iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Maintenance of the secrecy of a councilmatter, and keeping Kautilyas Arthashastra guard over officers that have taken part in the deliberation over it shall be strictly observed till the time of starting the work so considered approaches

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ hi pramādamadasuptapralāpāḥ, kāmaādir utsekaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Carelessness, intoxication, talking in sleep, love and other evil habits of councillors are the causes of the betrayal of counsels

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pracchannoavamato vā mantraṃ bhinatti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever is of hidden nature or is disregarded will disclose counsels

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmād ādrakṣen mantram //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence steps shall be taken to safeguard counsels against such dangers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mantrabhedo hy ayogakṣemakaro rājñas tadāyuktapuruṣāṇāṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Disclosure of counsels is advantageous to persons other than the king and his officers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmād guhyam eko mantrayeta iti bhāradvājaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence, says Bháradvája, the king shall singly deliberate over secret matters;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mantriṇām api hi mantriṇo bhavanti,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for ministers have their own ministers, and these latter some of their own;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāeṣā mantriparamparā mantraṃ bhinatti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: this kind of successive line of ministers tends to the disclosure of counsels

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmān naasya pare vidyuḥ karma kiṃcic cikīrṣitam /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence no outside person shall know anything of the work which the king has in view

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ārabdhāras tu jānīyur ārabdhaṃ kṛtam eva vā // naekasya mantrasiddhir asti iti viśālaakṣaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Only those who are employed to carry it out shall know it either when it is begun or when accomplished No deliberation, says Visáláksha, made by a single person will be successful;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratyakṣaparokṣaanumeyā hi rājavṛttiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the nature of the work which a sovereign has to do is to be inferred from the consideration of both the visible and invisible causes

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anupalabdhasya jñānam upalabdhasya niścitabalaādhānam arthadvaidhasya saṃśayacchedanam ekadeśadṛṣṭasya śeṣaupalabdhir iti
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The perception of what is not or cannot be seen, the conclusive decision of whatever is seen, the clearance of doubts as to whatever is susceptible of two opinions, and the inference of the whole when only a part is seenall this is possible of decision only by ministers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmād buddhivṛddhaiḥ sārdham adhyāsīta mantram //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence he shall sit at deliberation with persons of wide intellect

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na kaṃcid avamanyeta sarvasya śṛṇuyān matam /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall despise none, but hear the opinions of all

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bālasyaapy arthavadvākyam upayuñjīta paṇḍitaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A wise man shall make use of even a childs sensible utterance

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: naetan mantrarakṣaṇam iti pārāśarāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This is, says Parásara ascertaining the opinions of others, Kautilyas Arthashastra but not keeping counsels

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yad asya kāryam abhipretaṃ tatpratirūpakaṃ mantriṇaḥ pṛcchet kāryam idam evam āsīt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall ask his ministers for their opinion, on a work similar to the one he has in view, telling them that this is the work;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evaṃ vā yadi bhavet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: it happened thus;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tat kathaṃ kartavyam iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: what is to be done if it will turn out thus;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: te yathā brūyus tat kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and he shall do as they decide

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evaṃ mantraupalabdhiḥ saṃvṛtiś ca bhavati iti // naiti piśunaḥ // mantriṇo hi vyavahitam arthaṃ vṛttam avṛttaṃ vā pṛṣṭā anādareṇa bruvanti prakāśayanti vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If it is done thus, both the ascertainment of opinions and maintenance of secrecy can be attained Not so, says Pisuna, for ministers, when called for their opinions regarding a distant undertaking, or an accomplished or an unaccomplished work, either approach the subject with indifference or give their opinions halfheartedly

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa doṣaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This is a serious defect
