oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāliṅgaaṅgarajāḥ śreṣṭhāḥ prācyāś cedikarūṣajāḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Elephants bred in countries, such as Kálinga, Anga, Karúsa, and the East are the best;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dāśārṇāś caaparaantāś ca dvipānāṃ madhyamā matāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those of the Dasárna and western countries are of middle quality;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saurāṣṭrikāḥ pāñcanadās teṣāṃ pratyavarāḥ smṛtāḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and those of Sauráshtra and Panchajana countries are of low quality

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarveṣāṃ karmaṇā vīryaṃ javas tejaś ca vardhate //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The might and energy of all can, however, be improved by suitable training

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: caturdiśaṃ janapadaante sāmparāyikaṃ daivakṛtaṃ durgaṃ kārayet, antardvīpaṃ sthalaṃ vā nimnaavaruddham audakam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: CONSTRUCTION OF FORTS ON all the four quarters of the boundaries of the kingdom, defensive fortifications against an enemy in war shall be constructed on grounds best fitted for the purpose a waterfortification audaka such as an island in the midst of a river, or a plain surrounded by low ground;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prāstaraṃ guhāṃ vā pārvatam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: a mountainous Kautilyas Arthashastra fortification párvata such as a rocky tract or a cave;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nirudakastambam iriṇaṃ vā dhānvanam, khañjanaudakaṃ stambagahanaṃ vā vanadurgam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: a desert dhánvana such as a wild tract devoid of water and overgrown with thicket growing in barren soil; or a forest fortification vanadurga full of wagtail khajana, water and thickets

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ nadīparvatadurgaṃ janapadaārakṣasthānam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of these, water and mountain fortifications are best suited to defend populous centres;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dhānvanavanadurgam aṭavīsthānam āpady apasāro vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and desert and forest fortifications are habitations in wilderness atavísthánam

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: janapadamadhye samudayasthānaṃ sthānīyaṃ niveśayet, vāstukapraśaste deśe nadīsaṅgame hradasyaaviśoṣasyaaṅke sarasas taṭākasya vā, vṛttaṃ dīrghaṃ caturaśraṃ vā vāstuvaśena vā pradakṣiṇaudakaṃ paṇyapuṭabhedanam aṃsapathavāripathābhyām upetam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or with ready preparations for flight the king may have his fortified capital stháníya as the seat of his sovereignty samudayásthánam in the centre of his kingdom in a locality naturally best fitted for the purpose, such as the bank of the confluence of rivers, a deep pool of perennial water, or of a lake or tank, a fort, circular, rectangular, or square in form, surrounded with an artificial canal of water, and connected with both land and water paths may be constructed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasya parikhās tisro daṇḍaantarāḥ kārayet caturdaśa dvādaśa daśaiti daṇḍān vistīrṇāḥ, vistārād avagāḍhāḥ pādaūnam ardhaṃ vā, tribhāgamūlāḥ, mūlacaturaśrā vā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Round this fort, three ditches with an intermediate space of one danda ft from each other, fourteen, twelve and ten dandas respectively in width, with depth less by one quarter or by onehalf of their width, square at their bottom and onethird as wide as at their top, with sides built of stones or bricks, filled with perennial flowing water or with water drawn from some other source, and possessing crocodiles and lotus plants shall be constructed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / caturdaṇḍaapakṛṣṭaṃ parikhāyāḥ ṣaḍdaṇḍaucchritam avaruddhaṃ taddviguṇaviṣkambhaṃ khātād vapraṃ kārayed ūrdhvacayaṃ mañcapṛṣṭhaṃ kumbhakukṣikaṃ vā hastibhir gobhiś
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: At a distance of four dandas ft from the innermost ditch, a rampart six dandas high and twice as much broad shall be erected by heaping mud upwards and by making it square at the bottom, oval at the centre pressed by the trampling of elephants and bulls, and planted with thorny and poisonous plants in bushes

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ca kṣuṇṇaṃ kaṇṭakigulmaviṣavallīpratānavantam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Gaps in the rampart shall be filled up with fresh earth

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaprasyaupari prākāraṃ viṣkambhadviguṇautsedham aiṣṭakaṃ dvādaśahastād ūrdhvam ojaṃ yugmaṃ vā ā caturviṃśatihastād iti kārayet
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Above the rampart, parapets in odd or even numbers and with an intermediate, space of from to hastas from each other shall Kautilyas Arthashastra be built of bricks and raised to a height of twice their breadth

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rathacaryāsaṃcāraṃ tālamūlaṃ murajakaiḥ kapiśīrṣakaiś caācitaagram //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The passage for chariots shall be made of trunks of palm trees or of broad and thick slabs of stones with spheres like the head of a monkey carved on their surface;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na tv eva kāṣṭamayam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but never of wood as fire finds a happy abode in it

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viṣkambhacaturaśram aṭṭālakam utsedhasamaavakṣepasopānaṃ kārayet triṃśaddaṇḍaantaraṃ ca // dvayor aṭṭālakayor madhye saharmyadvitalām adhyardhāyaāyāmāṃ pratolīṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Towers, square throughout and with moveable staircase or ladder equal to its height, shall also be constructed In the intermediate space measuring thirty dandas between two towers, there shall be formed a broad street in two compartments covered over with a roof and twoandhalf times as long as it is broad

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aṭṭālakapratolīmadhye tridhānuṣkaadhiṣṭhānaṃ saapidhānacchidraphalakasaṃhatam indrakośaṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Between the tower and the broad street there shall be constructed an Indrakósa which is made up of covering pieces of wooden planks affording seats for three archers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: antareṣu dvihastaviṣkambhaṃ pārśve caturguṇaāyāmaṃ devapathaṃ kārayet // daṇḍaantarā dvidaṇḍaantarā vā caryāḥ kārayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: There shall also be made a road for Gods which shall measure two hastas inside the towers ?, four times as much by the sides, and eight hastas along the parapet Paths chárya, to ascend the parapet ? as broad as a danda ft or two shall also be made

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: agrāhye deśe pradhāvanikāṃ niṣkiradvāraṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In an unassailable part of the rampart, a passage for flight pradhávitikám, and a door for exit nishkuradwáram shall be made

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / bahirjānubhañjanīśūlaprakarakūpakūṭaavapātakaṇṭakapratisaraahipṛṣṭhatālapattraśṛṅgaaṭakaśvadaṃṣṭraargalaupaskandanapādukaambarīṣaudapānakaiḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Outside the rampart, passages for movements shall be closed by forming obstructions such as a kneebreaker jánubhanjaní, a trident, mounds of earth, pits, wreaths of thorns, instruments made like the tail of a snake, palm leaf, triangle, and of dogs teeth, rods, Kautilyas Arthashastra ditches filled with thorns and covered with sand, frying pans and waterpools

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / prākāram ubhayato meṇḍhakam adhyardhadaṇḍaṃ kṛtvā pratolīṣaṭtulāantaraṃ dvāraṃ niveśayet pañcadaṇḍād ekauttaram āaṣṭadaṇḍād iti caturaśraṃ ṣaḍbhāgam
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Having made on both sides of the rampart a circular hole of a dandaandahalf in diametre, an entrance gate to the fort onesixth as broad as the width of the street shall be fixed A square chaturásra is formed by successive addition of one danda up to eight dandas commencing from five, or in the proportion, onesixth of the length up to oneeighth

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: āyāmādadhikam aṣṭabhāgaṃ vā // pañcadaśahastād ekauttaram āaṣṭādaśahastād iti talautsedhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The rise in level talotsedhah shall be made by successive addition of one hasta up to hastas commencing from hastas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: stambhasya parikṣepaḥ ṣaḍāyāmo, dviguṇo nikhātaḥ, cūlikāyāś caturbhāgaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In fixing a pillar, six parts are to form its height, on the floor, twice as much parts to be entered into the ground, and onefourth for its capital

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: āditalasya pañcabhāgāḥ śālā vāpī sīmāgṛhaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of the first floor, five parts are to be taken for the formation of a hall sálá, a well, and a boundaryhouse;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daśabhāgikau dvau pratimañcau,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: twotenths of it for the formation of two platforms opposite to each other pratimanchau;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samucchrayād ardhatale sthūṇābandhaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: an upper storey twice as high as its width;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ardhavāstukam uttamaagāram, tribhāgaantaraṃ vā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: an uppermost storey, half or threefourths as broad as the first floor;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iṣṭakāavabaddhapārśvam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: side walls built of bricks;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vāmataḥ pradakṣiṇasopānaṃ gūḍhabhittisopānam itarataḥ // dvihastaṃ toraṇaśiraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: on the left side, a staircase circumambulating from left to right; on the right, a secret staircase hidden in the wall; a topsupport of ornamental arches toranasirah projecting as far as two hastas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tripañcabhāgikau dvau kapāṭayogau // dvau parighau //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: two doorpanels, each occupying threefourths of the space; two and two crossbars parigha, to fasten the door;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aratnir indrakīlaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: an ironbolt indrakila as long as an aratni angulas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañcahastam āṇidvāram //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: a boundary gate ánidváram five hastas in width;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: catvāro hastiparighāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: four beams to shut the door against elephants;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: niveśaardhaṃ hastinakham // mukhasamaḥ saṃkramaḥ saṃhāryo bhūmimayo vā nirudake //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and turrets hastinakha outside the rampart raised up to the height of the face of a man, removable or irremovable, or made of earth in places devoid of water

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prākārasamaṃ mukham avasthāpya tribhāgagodhāmukhaṃ gopuraṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 A turret above the gate and starting from the top of the parapet shall be constructed, its front resembling an alligator up to threefourths of its height

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prākāramadhye vāpīṃ kṛtvā puṣkariṇīdvāram,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the centre of the parapets, there shall be constructed a deep lotus pool;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: catuḥśālam adhyardhaantaraṃ sāṇikaṃ kumārīpuram, muṇḍaharmyadvitalaṃ muṇḍakadvāram,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: a rectangular building of four compartments, one within the other; an abode of the Goddess Kumiri Kumárípuram, having its external area oneandahalf times as broad as that of its innermost room; a circular building with an arch way;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhūmidravyavaśena vā niveśayet // tribhāgaadhikaāyāmā bhāṇḍavāhinīḥ kulyāḥ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and in accordance with available space and materials, there shall also be constructed canals kulyá to hold weapons and three times as long as broad

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tāsu pāṣāṇakuddālāḥ kuṭhārīkāṇḍakalpanāḥ / muṣuṇḍhīmudgarā daṇḍāś cakrayantraśataghnayaḥ // kāryāḥ kārmārikāḥ śūlā vedhanaagrāś ca veṇavaḥ / uṣṭragrīvyoagnisamyogāḥ kupyakalpe ca yo vidhiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In those canals, there shall be collected stones, spades kuddála, axes kuthári, varieties of staffs, cudgel musrinthi, hammers mudgara, clubs, discus, machines yantra, and such weapons as can destroy a hundred persons at once sataghni, together with spears, tridents, bamboosticks with pointed edges made of iron, camelnecks, explosives agnisamyógas, and whatever else can be devised and formed from available materials

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: trayaḥ prācīnā rājamārgās traya udīcīnā iti vāstuvibhāgaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: DEMARCATION of the ground inside the fort shall be made first by opening three royal roads from west to east and three from south to north

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa dvādaśadvāro yuktaudakabhramacchannapathaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra The fort shall contain twelve gates, provided with both a land and waterway kept secret

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: caturdaṇḍaantarā rathyāḥ // rājamārgadroṇamukhasthānīyarāṣṭravivītapathāḥ samyānīyavyūhaśmaśānagrāmapathāś caaṣṭadaṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Chariotroads, royal roads, and roads leading to drónamukha, stháníya, country parts, and pasture grounds shall each be four dandas ft in width Roads leading to sayóníya ?, military stations vyúha, burial or cremation grounds, and to villages shall be eight dandas in width

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: caturdaṇḍaḥ setuvanapathaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Roads to gardens, groves, and forests shall be four dandas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvidaṇḍo hastikṣetrapathaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Roads leading to elephant forests shall be two dandas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañcaaratnayo rathapathaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Roads for chariots shall be five aratnis ½ ft

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: catvāraḥ paśupathaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Roads for cattle shall measure four aratnis;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvau kṣudrapaśumanuṣyapathaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and roads for minor quadrupeds and men two aratnis

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pravīre vāstuni rājaniveśaś cāturvarṇyasamājīve // vāstuhṛdayād uttare navabhāge yathāuktavidhānam antaḥpuraṃ prānmukham udanmukhaṃ vā kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the midst of the houses of the people of all the four castes and to the north from the centre of the ground inside the fort, the king‟s palace, facing either the north or the east shall, as described elsewhere Chapter , Book , be constructed occupying oneninth of the whole site inside the fort

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasya pūrvauttaraṃ bhāgam ācāryapurohitaijyātoyasthānaṃ mantriṇaś caāvaseyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Royal teachers, priests, sacrificial place, waterreservoir and ministers shall occupy sites east by north to the palace

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūrvadakṣiṇaṃ bhāgm mahānasaṃ hastiśālā koṣṭhaagāraṃ ca // tataḥ paraṃ gandhamālyarasapaṇyāḥ prasādhanakāravaḥ kṣatriyāś ca pūrvāṃ diśam adhivaseyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Royal kitchen, elephant stables, and the storehouse shall be situated on sites east by south On the eastern side, merchants trading in scents, garlands, grains, and liquids, together with expert artisans and the people of Kautilyas Arthashastra Kshatriya caste shall have their habitations

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dakṣiṇapūrvaṃ bhāgaṃ bhāṇḍaagāram akṣapaṭalaṃ karmaniṣadyāś ca,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The treasury, the accountant‟s office, and various manufactories karmanishadyáscha shall be situated on sites south by east

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dakṣiṇapaścimaṃ bhāgaṃ kupyagṛham āyudhaagāraṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The storehouse of forest produce and the arsenal shall be constructed on sites south by west

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ paraṃ nagaradhānyavyāvahārikakārmāntikabalaadhyakṣāḥ pakvaannasurāmāṃsapaṇyā rūpājīvās tālāvacarā vaiśyāś ca dakṣiṇāṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: To the south, the superintendents of the city, of commerce, of manufactories, and of the army as well as those who trade in cooked rice, liquor, and flesh, besides prostitutes, musicians, and the people of Vaisya caste shall live

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paścimadakṣiṇaṃ bhāgaṃ kharauṣṭraguptisthānaṃ karmagṛhaṃ ca,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: To the west by south, stables of asses, camels, and working house

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paścimauttaraṃ bhāgaṃ yānarathaśālāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: To the west by north, stables of conveyances and chariots

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ param ūrṇāsūtraveṇucarmavarmaśastraāvaraṇakāravaḥ śūdrāś ca paścimāṃ diśam adhivaseyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: To the west, artisans manufacturing worsted threads, cotton threads, bamboomats, skins, armours, weapons, and gloves as well as the people of Súdra caste shall have their dwellings

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: uttarapaścimaṃ bhāgaṃ paṇyabhaiṣajyagṛham,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: To the north by west, shops and hospitals

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: uttarapūrvaṃ bhāgaṃ kośo gavaaśvaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: To the north by east, the treasury and the stables of cows and horses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ paraṃ nagararājadevatālohamaṇikāravo brāhmaṇāś cauttarāṃ diśam adhivaseyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: To the north, the royal tutelary deity of the city, ironsmiths, artisans working on precious stones, as well as Bráhmans shall reside

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vāstucchidraanuśāleṣu śreṇīprapaṇinikāyā āvaseyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the several corners, guilds and corporations of workmen shall reside

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aparaajitaapratihatajayantavaijayantakoṣṭhān śivavaiśravaṇaaśviśrīmadirāgṛhāṇi ca puramadhye kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra In the centre of the city, the apartments of Gods such as Aparájita, Apratihata, Jayanta, Vaijayanta, Siva, Vaisravana, Asvina divine physicians, and the honourable liquorhouse Srímadiragriham, shall be situated

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathāuddeśaṃ vāstudevatāḥ sthāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the corners, the guardian deities of the ground shall be appropriately set up

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brāhmaaindrayāmyasaināpatyāni dvārāṇi //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Likewise the principal gates such as Bráhma, Aindra, Yámya, and Sainápatya shall be constructed;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bahiḥ parikhāyā dhanuḥśataapakṛṣṭāś caityapuṇyasthānavanasetubandhāḥ kāryāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and at a distance of 00 bows dhanus 0 angulas from the ditch on the counterscarp side, places of worship and pilgrimage, groves and buildings shall be constructed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathādiśaṃ ca digdevatāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Guardian deities of all quarters shall also be set up in quarters appropriate to them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: uttaraḥ pūrvo vā śmaśānabhāgo varṇauttamānām, dakṣiṇena śmaśānaṃ varṇaavarāṇām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Either to the north or the east, burial or cremation grounds shall be situated; but that of the people of the highest caste shall be to the south of the city

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaatikrame pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Violation of this rule shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pāṣaṇḍacaṇḍālānāṃ śmaśānaante vāsaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Heretics and Chandálas shall live beyond the burial grounds

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmaantakṣetravaśena kuṭumbināṃ sīmānaṃ sthāpayet // teṣu puṣpaphalavāṭān dhānyapaṇyanicayāṃś caanujñātāḥ kuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Families of workmen may in any other way be provided with sites befitting with their occupation and field work Besides working in flowergardens, fruitgardens, vegetablegardens, and paddyfields allotted to them, they families shall collect grains and merchandise in abundance as authorised

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daśakulīvāṭaṃ kūpasthānam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: There shall be a waterwell for every ten houses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / sarvasnehadhānyakṣāralavaṇagandhabhaiṣajyaśuṣkaśākayavasavallūratṛṇakāṣṭhalohacarmaaṅgārasnāyuviṣaviṣāṇaveṇuvalkalasāradārupraharaṇaāvaraṇaaśmanicayān anekavarṣaupabhogasahān kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Oils, grains, sugar, salt, medicinal articles, dry or fresh vegetables, meadow grass, dried flesh, haystock, firewood, metals, skins, charcoal, tendons snáyu, poison, horns, bamboo, fibrous garments, strong timber, weapons, armour, and stones shall also be stored in the fort in such quantities as can be enjoyed for years together without feeling any want

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: navenaanavaṃ śodhayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of such collection, old things shall be replaced by new ones when received

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hastiaśvarathapādātam anekamukhyam avasthāpayet // anekamukhyaṃ hi parasparabhayāt paraupajāpaṃ naupaiti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Elephants, cavalry, chariots, and infantry shall each be officered with many chiefs inasmuch as chiefs, when many, are under the fear of betrayal from each other and scarcely liable to the insinuations and intrigues of an enemy

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: etenaantapāladurgasaṃskārā vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rule shall hold good with the appointment of boundary, guards, and repairers of fortifications

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na ca bāhirikān kuryāt pure rāṣṭraupaghātakān /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Never shall báhirikas who are dangerous to the well being of cities and countries be kept in forts

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣipej janapade caetān sarvān vā dāpayet karān //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They may either be thrown in country parts or compelled to pay taxes

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samnidhātā kośagṛhaṃ paṇyagṛhaṃ koṣṭhaagāraṃ kupyagṛham āyudhaagāraṃ bandhanaagāraṃ ca kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE Chamberlain sannidhátá one who ever attends upon the king shall see to the construction of the treasuryhouse, tradinghouse, the storehouse of grains, the storehouse of forest produce, the armoury and the jail

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / caturaśrāṃ vāpīm anudakaupasnehāṃ khānayitvā pṛthuśilābhir ubhayataḥ pārśvaṃ mūlaṃ ca pracitya sāradārupañjaraṃ bhūmisamaṃ tritalam anekavidhānaṃ kuṭṭimadeśasthānatalam ekadvāraṃ yantrayuktasopānaṃ bhūmigṛhaṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Having dug up a square well not too deep to be moist with water, having paved both the bottom and the sides with slabs of stone, he shall, by using strong timber, construct in that well a cagelike underground chamber of three stories high, the topmost being on a level with the surface of the ground, with many compartments of various design, with floor plastered with small stones, with one door, with a movable staircase, and solemnised with the presence of the guardian deity

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaupariubhayatoniṣedhaṃ sapragrīvam aiṣṭakaṃ bhāṇḍavāhinīparikṣiptaṃ kośagṛhaṃ kārayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Above this chamber, the treasury house closed on both sides, with projecting roofs and extensively opening into the storehouse shall be built of bricks

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prāsādaṃ vā // janapadaante dhruvanidhim āpadartham abhityaktaiḥ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He may employ outcast men abhityaktapurusha to build at the extreme boundary of the kingdom a palacious mansion to hold substantial treasure against dangers and calamities

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pakvaiṣṭakāstambhaṃ catuḥśālam ekadvāram anekasthānatalaṃ vivṛtastambhaapasāram ubhayataḥ paṇyagṛhaṃ koṣṭhaagāraṃ ca dīrghabahuśālaṃ kakṣyaāvṛtakuḍyam antaḥ kupyagṛham,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The tradinghouse shall be a quadrangle enclosed by four buildings with one door, with pillars built of burnt bricks, with many compartments, and with a row of pillars on both sides kept apart The storehouse shall consist of many spacious rooms and enclose within itself the storehouse of forest produce separated from it by means of wall and connected with both the underground chamber and the armoury

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pṛthagdharmasthīyaṃ mahāmātrīyaṃ vibhaktastrīpuruṣasthānam apasārataḥ suguptakakṣyaṃ bandhanaagāraṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The court dharmasthíya and the office of the ministers mahámátríya shall be built in a separate locality Provided with separate accommodation for men and women kept apart and with many compartments well guarded, a jail shall also be constructed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarveṣāṃ śālāḥ khātaudapānavarcasnānagṛhaagniviṣatrāṇamārjāranakulaārakṣāsvadaivatapūjanayuktāḥ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra All these buildings shall be provided with halls sála pits khátaprivy , waterwell, bathroom, remedies against fire and poison, with cats, mangooses, and with necessary means to worship the guardian gods appropriate to each

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: koṣṭhaagāre varṣamānam aratnimukhaṃ kuṇḍaṃ sthāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In front of the storehouse a bowl kunda with its mouth as wide as an aratni angulag shall be set up as raingauge varshamána

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatjātakaraṇaadhiṣṭhitaḥ purāṇaṃ navaṃ ca ratnaṃ sāraṃ phalgu kupyaṃ vā pratigṛhṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Assisted by experts having necessary qualifications and provided with tools and instruments, the chamberlain shall attend to the business of receiving gems either old or new, as well as raw materials of superior or inferior value

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatra ratnaupadhāv uttamo daṇḍaḥ kartuḥ kārayituś ca sāraupadhau madhyamaḥ, phalgukupyaupadhau tat ca tāvat ca daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In cases of deception in gems, both the deceiver and the abettor shall be punished with the highest amercement; in the case of superior commodities, they shall be punished with the middlemost amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rūpadarśakaviśuddhaṃ hiraṇyaṃ pratigṛhṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall receive only such gold coins as have been declared to be pure by the examiner of coins

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aśuddhaṃ chedayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Counterfeit coins shall be cut into pieces

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: āhartuḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever brings in counterfeit coins shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śuddhaṃ pūrṇam abhinavaṃ ca dhānyaṃ pratigṛhṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Grains pure and fresh shall be received in full measures;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viparyaye mūlyadviguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: otherwise a fine of twice the value of the grains shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena paṇyaṃ kupyam āyudhaṃ ca vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rule shall hold good with the receipt of merchandise, raw materials, and weapons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvaadhikaraṇeṣu yuktaupayuktatatpuruṣāṇāṃ paṇaādicatuṣpaṇaparamaapahāreṣu pūrvamadhyamauttamavadhā daṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra In all departments, whoever, whether as an officer yukta, a clerk upayukta, or a servant tatpurusha, misappropriates sums from one to four panas or any other valuable things shall be punished with the first, middlemost, and highest amercements and death respectively

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kośaadhiṣṭhitasya kośaavacchede ghātaḥ // tadvaiyāvṛtyakarāṇām ardhadaṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the officer who is in charge of the treasury causes loss in money, he shall be whipped ghátah, while his abettors shall receive half the punishment;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paribhāṣaṇam avijñāte //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if the loss is due to ignorance, he shall be censured

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: corāṇām abhipradharṣaṇe citro ghātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If, with the intention of giving a hint, robbers are frightened by the guards, the latter shall be tortured to death

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmād āptapuruWaadhiṣṭhitaḥ samnidhātā nicayān anutiṣṭhet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence assisted by trustworthy persons, the chamberlain shall attend to the business of revenue collection

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bāhyam abhyantaraṃ cāyaṃ vidyād varṣaśatād api / yathā pṛṣṭo na sajjeta vyaye śeṣe ca saṃcaye //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall have so thorough a knowledge of both external and internal incomes running even for a hundred years that, when questioned, he can point out without hesitation the exact amount of net balance that remains after expenditure has been met with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samāhartā durgaṃ rāṣṭraṃ khaniṃ setuṃ vanaṃ vrajaṃ vaṇikpathaṃ caavekṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE CollectorGeneral shall attend to the collection of revenue from forts durga, countryparts ráshtra, mines Kautilyas Arthashastra khani, buildings and gardens setu, forests vana, herds of cattle vraja, and roads of traffic vanikpatha

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / śulkaṃ daṇḍaḥ pautavaṃ nāgariko lakṣaṇaadhyakṣo mudrāadhyakṣaḥ surā
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Tolls, fines, weights and measures, the townclerk nágaraka, the superintendent of coinage lakshanádhyakshah, the superintendent of seals and passports, liquor, slaughter of animals, threads, oils,

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sūnā sūtraṃ tailaṃ ghṛtaṃ kṣāraḥ sauvarṇikaḥ paṇyasaṃsthā veśyā dyūtaṃ vāstukaṃ kāruśilpigaṇo devatāadhyakṣo dvārabahirikāādeyaṃ ca durgam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: ghee, sugar kshára, the stategoldsmith sauvarnika, the warehouse of merchandise, the prostitute, gambling, building sites vástuka, the corporation of artisans and handicraftsmen kárusilpiganah, the superintendent of gods, and taxes collected at the gates and from the people known as Báhirikas come under the head of forts

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sītā bhāgo baliḥ karo vaṇik nadīpālas taro nāvaḥ pattanaṃ vivicitaṃ vartanī rajjuś corarajjuś ca rāṣṭram //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Produce from crownlands sita, portion of produce payable to the government bhága, religious taxes bali, taxes paid in money kara, merchants, the superintendent of rivers, ferries, boats, and ships, towns, pasture grounds, roadcess vartani, ropes rajjú and ropes to bind thieves chórarajjú come under the head of country parts

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: suvarṇarajatavajramaṇimuktāpravālaśaṅkhalohalavaṇabhūmiprastararasadhātavaḥ khaniḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Gold, silver, diamonds, gems, pearls, corals, conchshells, metals loha, salt, and other minerals extracted from plains and mountain slopes come under the head of mines

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: puṣpaphalavāṭaṣaṇḍakedāramūlavāpāḥ setuḥ // paśumṛgadravyahastivanaparigraho vanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Flowergardens, fruitgardens, vegetablegardens, wet fields, and fields where crops are grown by sowing roots for seeds múlavápáh, ie, sugarcane crops, etc come under sétu

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gomahiṣam ajaavikaṃ kharauṣtram aśvaaśvataraṃ ca vrajaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Cows, buffaloes, goats, sheep, asses, camels, horses, and mules come under the head of herds

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sthalapatho vāripathaś ca vaṇikpathaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Land and water ways are the roads of traffic

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ity āyaśarīram //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: All these form the body of income áyasaríram

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mūlyaṃ bhāgo vyājī parighaḥ klptam(klṛptam) rūpikam atyayaś caāyamukham // devapitṛpūjādānaartham, svastivācanam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Capital múla, share bhága, premia vyáji, parigha ? fixed taxes klripta, premia on coins rúpika, and fixed fines atyaya are the several forms of revenue áyamukha, ie, the mouth from which income is to issue

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pattiaśvarathadvipaparigraho, gomaṇḍalam, paśumṛgapakṣivyālavāṭāḥ, kāṣṭhatṛṇavāṭāś caiti vyayaśarīram // rājavarṣaṃ māsaḥ pakṣo divasaś ca vyuṣṭam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The chanting of auspicious hymns during the worship of gods and ancestors, and on the occasion of giving gifts, the harem, the kitchen, the establishment of messengers, the storehouse, the armoury, the warehouse, the storehouse of raw materials, manufactories karmánta, free labourers vishti, maintenance of infantry, cavalry, chariots, and elephants, herds of cows, the museum of beasts, deer, birds, and snakes, and storage of firewood and fodder constitute the body of expenditure vyayasaríram

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: varṣāhemantagrīṣmāṇāṃ tṛtīyasaptamā divasaūnāḥ pakṣāḥ śeṣāḥ pūrṇāḥ, pṛthagadhimāsakaḥ, iti kālaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The royal year, the month, the paksha, the day, the dawn vyushta, the third and seventh pakshas of the seasons such as the rainy season, the winter season, and the summer short of their days, the rest complete, and a separate intercalary month are the divisions of time

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karaṇīyaṃ siddhaṃ śeṣam āyavyayau nīvī ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall also pay attention to the work in hand karaníya, the work accomplished siddham, part of a work in hand sésha, receipts, expenditure, and net balance

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃsthānaṃ pracāraḥ śarīraavasthāpanam ādānaṃ sarvasamudayapiṇḍaḥ saṃjātaṃ etat karaṇīyam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The business of upkeeping the government samsthánam, the routine work prachárah, the collection of necessaries of life, the collection and audit of all kinds of revenue,these constitute the work in hand That which has been credited to the treasury;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kośaarpitaṃ rājahāraḥ puravyayaś ca praviṣṭaṃ paramasaṃvatsaraanuvṛttaṃ śāsanamuktaṃ mukhaājñaptaṃ caapātanīyaṃ etat
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: that which has been taken by the king; that which has been spent in connection Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 with the capital city not entered into the register or continued from year before last, the royal command dictated or orally intimated to be entered into the register,all these constitute the work accomplished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: siddhikarmayogaḥ daṇḍaśeṣam āharaṇīyaṃ balātkṛtapratiṣṭabdham avamṛṣṭaṃ ca praśodhyaṃ etatśeṣam, asāram alpasāraṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Preparation of plans for profitable works, balance of fines due, demand for arrears of revenue kept in abeyance, and examination of accounts,these constitute what is called part of a work in hand which may be of little or no value

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vartamānaḥ paryuṣitoanyajātaś caāyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Receipts may be current, last balance, and accidental anyajátah received from external source

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: divasaanuvṛtto vartamānaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: What is received day after day is termed current vartamána

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paramasāṃvatsarikaḥ parapracārasaṃkrānto vā paryuṣitaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whatever has been brought forward from year before last, whatever is in the hands of others, and whatever has changed hands is termed last balance puryushita

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: naṣṭaprasmṛtam āyuktadaṇḍaḥ pārśvaṃ pārihīṇikam aupāyanikaṃ ḍamaragatakasvam aputrakaṃ nidhiś caanyajātaḥ // vikṣepavyādhitaantaraārambhaśeṣaṃ ca vyayapratyāyaḥ // vikriye paṇyānām arghavṛddhir upajā, mānaunmānaviśeṣo vyājī,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whatever has been lost and forgotten by others, fines levied from government servants, marginal revenue pársva, compensation levied for any damage párihínikam, presentations to the king, the property of those who have fallen victims to epidemics damaragatakasvam leaving no sons, and treasuretroves,all these constitute accidental receipts Investment of capital vikshépa, the relics of a wrecked undertaking, and the savings from an estimated outlay are the means to check expenditure vyayapratyayah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: krayasaṃgharṣe vārdhavṛddhiḥ ity āyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The rise in price of merchandise due to the use of different weights and measures in selling is termed vyáji;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nityo nityautpādiko lābho lābhautpādika iti vyayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Expenditure is of two kindsdaily expenditure and profitable expenditure

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: divasaanuvṛtto nityaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: What is continued every day is daily

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pakṣamāsasaṃvatsaralābho lābhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whatever is earned once in a paksha, a month, or a year is termed profit

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tayor utpanno nityautpādiko lābhautpādika iti vyayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whatever is spent on these two heads is termed as daily expenditure and profitable expenditure respectively

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃjātād āyavyayaviśuddhā nīvī, prāptā caanuvṛttā ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That which remains after deducting all the expenditure already incurred and excluding all revenue to be realised is net balance nívi which may have been either just realised or brought forward

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evaṃ kuryāt samudayaṃ vṛddhiṃ caāyasya darśayet /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus a wise collectorgeneral shall conduct the work of revenuecollection, increasing the income and decreasing the expenditure

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hrāsaṃ vyayasya ca prājñaḥ sādhayec ca viparyayam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE BUSINESS OF KEEPING UP ACCOUNTS IN THE OFFICE OF ACCOUNTANTS

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akṣapaṭalam adhyakṣaḥ prānmukham udanmukhaṃ vā vibhaktaupasthānaṃ nibandhapustakasthānaṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE superintendent of accounts shall have the accountants office constructed with its door facing either the north or the east, with seats for clerks kept apart and with shelves of accountbooks Kautilyas Arthashastra well arranged

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatraadhikaraṇānāṃ saṃkhyāpracārasaṃjātaagram,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Therein the number of several departments;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmaantānāṃ dravyaprayogavṛddhikṣayavyayaprayāmavyājīyogasthānavetanaviṣṭipramāṇam, ratnasāraphalgukupyānām arghaprativarṇakamānapratimānaunmānaavamānabhāṇḍam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the description of the work carried on and of the results realised in several manufactories Karmánta; the amount of profit, loss, expenditure, delayed earnings, the amount of vyáji premia in kind or cash realised, the status of government agency employed, the amount of wages paid, the number of free labourers engaged vishti pertaining to the investment of capital on any work;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: deśagrāmajātikulasaṃghānāṃ dharmavyavahāracaritrasaṃsthānam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the history of customs, professions, and transactions of countries, villages, families, and corporations;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājaupajīvināṃ pragrahapradeśabhogaparihārabhaktavetanalābham, rājñaś ca patnīputrāṇāṃ ratnabhūmilābhaṃ nirdeśautpātikapratīkāralābham,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the gains in the form of gifts to the kings courtiers, their title to possess and enjoy lands, remission of taxes allowed to them, and payment of provisions and salaries to them; the gains to the wives and sons of the king in gems, lands, prerogatives, and provisions made to remedy evil portents;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mitraamitrāṇāṃ ca saṃdhivigrahapradānaādānaṃ nibandhapustakasthaṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the treaties with, issues of ultimatum to, and payments of tribute from or to, friendly or inimical kings, all these shall be regularly entered in prescribed registers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ sarvaadhikaraṇānāṃ karaṇīyaṃ siddhaṃ śeṣam āyavyayau nīvīm upasthānaṃ pracāraṃ caritraṃ saṃsthānaṃ ca nibandhena prayacchet
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: From these books the superintendent shall furnish the accounts as to the forms of work in hand, of works accomplished, of part of works in hand, of receipts, of expenditure, of net balance, and of tasks to be undertaken in each of the several departments

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: uttamamadhyamaavareṣu ca karmasu tajjātikam adhyakṣaṃ kuryāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: To supervise works of high, middling and low description, superintendents with corresponding qualifications shall be employed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāmudayikeṣv avaklṛptikam(avakḷptikam) yam upahatya rājā naanutapyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The king will have to suffer in the end if he curtails the fixed amount of expenditure on profitable works

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sahagrāhiṇaḥ pratibhuvaḥ karmaupajīvinaḥ putrā bhrātaro bhāryā duhitaro bhṛtyāś caasya karmacchedaṃ vaheyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra When a man engaged by Government for any work absents himself, his sureties who conjointly received wages? from the government, or his sons, brothers, wives, daughters or servants living upon his work shall bear the loss caused to the Government

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: triśataṃ catuḥpañcāśat caahorātrāṇāṃ karmasaṃvatsaraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The work of days and nights is a year

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tam āṣāḍhīparyavasānam ūnaṃ pūrṇaṃ vā dadyāt // karaṇaadhiṣṭhitam adhimāsakaṃ kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such a work shall be paid for more or less in proportion to its quantity at the end of the month, Ashádha about the middle of July

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: apasarpaadhiṣṭhitaṃca pracāram //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The work during the intercalary month shall be separately calculated

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pracāracaritrasaṃsthānāny anupalabhamāno hi prakṛtaḥ samudayam ajñānena parihāpayati, utthānakleśaasahatvād ālasyena, śabdādiṣv indriyaartheṣu prasaktaḥ pramādena, saṃkrośaadharmaanarthabhīrubhāyena, kāryaarthiṣv anugrahabuddhiḥ kāmena,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A government officer, not caring to know the information gathered by espionage and neglecting to supervise the despatch of work in his own department as regulated, may occasion loss of revenue to the government owing to his ignorance, or owing to his idleness when he is too weak to endure the trouble of activity, or due to inadvertence in perceiving sound and other objects of sense, or by being timid when he is afraid of clamour, unrighteousness, and untoward results, or owing to selfish desire when he is favourably disposed towards those who are desirous to achieve their own selfish ends, or by cruelty due to anger, or by lack of dignity when he is surrounded by a host of learned and needy sycophants, or by making use of false balance, false measures, and false calculation owing to greediness

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: lobhena // teṣām ānupūrvyā yāvān arthaupaghātas tāvān ekauttaro daṇḍaḥ iti mānavāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The school of Manu hold that a fine equal to the loss of revenue and multiplied by the serial number of the circumstances of the guilt just narrated in order shall be imposed upon him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvatraaṣṭaguṇaḥ iti pārāśarāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The school of Parásara hold that the fine in all the cases shall be eight times the amount lost

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daśaguṇaḥ iti bārhaspatyāḥ // viṃśatiguṇaḥ ity auśanasāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The school of Brihaspathi say that it shall be ten times the amount Kautilyas Arthashastra The school of Usanas say that it shall be twenty times the amount

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathāaparādham iti kauṭilyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But Kautilya says that it shall be proportional to the guilt

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gāṇanikyāni āṣāḍhīm āgaccheyuḥ // āgatānāṃ samudrapustakabhāṇḍanīvīkānām ekatraasambhāṣāavarodhaṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Accounts shall be submitted in the month of Ashádha When they the accountants of different districts present themselves with sealed books, commodities and net revenue, they shall all be kept apart in one place so that they cannot carry on conversation with each other

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: āyavyayanīvīnām agrāṇi śrutvā nīvīm avahārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Having heard from them the totals of receipts, expenditure, and net revenue, the net amount shall be received

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yac caagrād āyasyaantaraparṇe nīvyāṃ vardheta vyayasya vā yat parihāpayet, tad aṣṭaguṇam adhyakṣaṃ dāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: By how much the superintendent of a department augments the net total of its revenue either by increasing any one of the items of its receipts or by decreasing anyone of the items of expenditure, he shall be rewarded eight times that amount

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viparyaye tam eva prati syāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But when it is reversed ie, when the net total is decreased, the award shall also be reversed ie, he shall be made to pay eight times the decrease

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathākālam anāgatānām apustakabhāṇḍanīvīkānāṃ vā deyadaśabandho daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those accountants who do not present themselves in time or do not produce their account books along with the net revenue shall be fined ten times the amount due from them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kārmike caupasthite kāraṇikasyaapratibadhnataḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a superintendent of accounts káranika does not at once proceed to receive and check the accounts when the clerks kármika are ready, he shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viparyaye kārmikasya dviguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the reverse case ie, when the clerks are not ready, the clerks shall be punished with double the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pracārasamaṃ mahāmātrāḥ samagrāḥ śrāvayeyur aviṣamamantrāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: All the ministers mahámáras shall together narrate the whole of the actual accounts pertaining to each department

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pṛthagbhūto mithyāvādī caeṣām uttamaṃ daṇḍaṃ dadyāt // akṛtaahorūpaharaṃ māsam ākāṅkṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Whoever of these ministers or clerks ? is of undivided counsel or keeps himself aloof, or utters falsehood shall be punished with the highest amercement When an accountant has not prepared the table of daily accounts akritáhorúpaharam, he may be given a month more for its preparation

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: māsād ūrdhvaṃ māsadviśatauttaraṃ daṇḍaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: After the lapse of one month he shall be fined at the rate of 00 panas for each month during which he delays the accounts

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: alpaśeṣalekhyanīvīkaṃ pañcarātram ākāṅkṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If an accountant has to write only a small portion of the accounts pertaining to net revenue, he may be allowed five nights to prepare it

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ paraṃ kośapūrvam ahorūpaharaṃ dharmavyavahāracaritrasaṃsthānasaṃkalananirvartanaanumānacāraprayogair avekṣeta
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Then the table of daily accounts submitted by him along with the net revenue shall be checked with reference to the regulated forms of righteous transactions and precedents and by applying such arithmetical processes as addition, subtraction, inference and by espionage

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: divasapañcarātrapakṣamāsacāturmāsyasaṃvatsaraiś ca pratisamānayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It shall also be verified with reference to such divisions of time as days, five nights, pakshás, months, fourmonths, and the year

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vyuṣṭadeśakālamukhautpattianuvṛttipramāṇadāyakadāpakanibandhakapratigrāhakaiś caayaṃ samānayet // vyuṣṭadeśakālamukhalābhakāraṇadeyayogapramāṇaājñāpakauddhārakavidhātṛkapratigrāhakaiś ca vyayaṃ samānayet // vyuṣṭadeśakālamukhaanuvartanarūpalakṣaṇapramāṇanikṣepabhājanagopāyakaiś ca nīvīṃ samānayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The receipt shall be verified with reference to the place and time pertaining to them, the form of their collection ie, capital, share, the amount of the present and past produce, the person who has paid it, the person who caused its payment, the officer who fixed the amount payable, and the officer who received it The expenditure shall be verified with reference to the cause of the profit from any source in the place and time pertaining to each item, the amount payable, the amount paid, the person who ordered the collection, the person who remitted the same, the person who delivered it, and the person who finally received it Likewise the net revenue shall be verified with reference to Kautilyas Arthashastra the place, time, and source pertaining to it, its standard of fineness and quantity, and the persons who are employed to guard the deposits and magazines of grains, etc

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājaarthe kāraṇikasyaapratibadhnataḥ pratiṣedhayato vāājñāṃ nibandhād āyavyayam anyathā nīvīm avalikhato dviguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When an officer káranika does not facilitate or prevents the execution of the kings order, or renders the receipts and expenditure otherwise than prescribed, he shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kramaavahīnam utkramam avijñātaṃ punaruktaṃ vā vastukam avalikhato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any clerk who violates or deviates from the prescribed form of writing accounts, enters what is unknown to him, or makes double or treble entries punaruktam shall be fined panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nīvīm avalikhato dviguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who scrapes off the net total shall be doubly punished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhakṣayatoaṣṭaguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who eats it up shall be fined eight times

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nāśayataḥ pañcabandhaḥ pratidānaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who causes loss of revenue shall not only pay a fine equal to five times the amount lost panchabandha, but also make good the loss

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mithyāvāde steyadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In case of uttering a lie, the punishment levied for theft shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paścātpratijñāte dviguṇaḥ, prasmṛtautpanne ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When an entry lost or omitted is made later or is made to appear as forgotten, but added later on recollection, the punishment shall be double the above

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aparādhaṃ sahetaalpaṃ tuṣyed alpeapi caudaye / mahāupakāraṃ caadhyakṣaṃ pragraheṇaabhipūjayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The king shall forgive an offence when it is trifling, have satisfaction even when the revenue is scanty, and honour with rewards pragraha such of his superintendents as are of immense benefit to him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kośapūrvāḥ sarvaārambhāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: ALL undertakings depend upon finance

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmāt pūrvaṃ kośam avekṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence foremost attention shall be paid to the treasury

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pracārasamṛddhiś caritraanugrahaś coranigraho yuktapratiṣedhaḥ sasyasampat paṇyabāhulyam upasargapramokṣaḥ parihārakṣayo
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Public prosperity prachárasamriddhih, rewards for good conduct charitránugrahah, capture of thieves, dispensing with the service of too many government servants, abundance of harvest, prosperity of commerce, absence of troubles and calamities upasargapramokshah, diminution of remission of taxes, and income in gold hiranyópáyanam are all conducive to financial prosperity

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratibandhaḥ prayogo vyavahāroavastāraḥ parihāpaṇam upabhogaḥ parivartanam apahāraś caiti kośakṣayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Obstruction pratibandha, loan prayóga, trading vyavahára, fabrication of accounts avastára, causing the loss of revenue parihápana, selfenjoyment upabhóga, barter parivartana, and defalcation apahára are the causes that tend to deplete the treasury

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: siddhīnām asādhanam anavatāraṇam apraveśanaṃ vā pratibandhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Failure to start an undertaking or to realise its results, or to credit its profits to the treasury is known as obstruction

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatra daśabandho daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Herein a fine of ten times the amount in question shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kośadravyāṇāṃ vṛddhiprayogāḥ prayogaḥ // paṇyavyavahāro vyavahāraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Lending the money of the treasury on periodical interest is a loan Carrying on trade by making use of government money is trading

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatra phaladviguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: These two acts shall be punished with a fine of twice the profit earned

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: siddhaṃ kālam aprāptaṃ karoti aprāptaṃ prāptaṃ vāity avastāraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Whoever makes as unripe the ripe time or as ripe the unripe time of revenue collection is guilty of fabrication

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatra pañcabandho daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Herein a fine of ten times the amount panchabandha shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: klṛptam(kḷptam) āyaṃ parihāpayati vyayaṃ vā vivardhayatiiti parihāpaṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever lessens a fixed amount of income or enhances the expenditure is guilty of causing the loss of revenue

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatra hīnacaturguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Herein a fine of four times the loss shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svayam anyair vā rājadravyāṇām upabhojanam upabhogaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever enjoys himself or causes others to enjoy whatever belongs to the king is guilty of selfenjoyment

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatra ratnaupabhoge ghātaḥ, sāraupabhoge madhyamaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ, phalgukupyaupabhoge tac ca tāvat ca daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Herein deathsentence shall be passed for enjoying gems, middlemost amercement for enjoying valuable articles, and restoration of the articles together with a fine equal to their value shall be the punishment for enjoying articles of inferior value

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājadravyāṇām anyadravyenaādānaṃ parivartanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The act of exchanging government articles for similar articles of others is barter

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tad upabhogena vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This offence is explained by selfenjoyment

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: siddham āyaṃ na praveśayati, nibaddhaṃ vyayaṃ na prayacchati, prāptāṃ nīvīṃ vipratijānīta ity apahāraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever does not take into the treasury the fixed amount of revenue collected, or does not spend what is ordered to be spent, or misrepresents the net revenue collected is guilty of defalcation of government money

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatra dvādaśaguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Herein a fine of twelve times the amount shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ haraṇaupāyāś catvāriṃśat //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: There are about forty ways of embezzlement what is realised earlier is entered later on;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūrvaṃ siddhaṃ paścād avatāritam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: what is realised later is entered earlier;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sādhyaṃ na siddham,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: what ought to be realised is not realised;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: asādhyaṃ siddham, siddham asiddhaṃ kṛtam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: what is hard to realise is shown as realised; what is collected is shown as not collected;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: asiddhaṃ siddhaṃ kṛtam, alpasiddhaṃ bahu kṛtam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: what has not been collected is shown as collected; what is collected in part is entered as collected in full;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bahusiddham alpaṃ kṛtam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: what is collected in full is entered as collected in part;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyat siddham anyat kṛtam, anyataḥ siddham anyataḥ kṛtam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: what is collected is of one sort, while what is entered is of another sort; what is realised from one source is shown as realised from another;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: deyaṃ na dattam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: what is payable is not paid;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāle na dattam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: not paid in time;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akāle dattam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: paid untimely;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: alpaṃ dattaṃ bahu kṛtam, bahu dattam alpaṃ kṛtam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: small gifts made large gifts; large gifts made small gifts;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyad dattam anyat kṛtam, anyato dattam anyataḥ kṛtam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: what is gifted is of one sort while what is entered is of another; the real donee is one while the person entered in the register as donee is another;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: apraviṣṭaṃ praviṣṭaṃ kṛtam, kupyam adattamūlyaṃ praviṣṭam, dattamūlyaṃ na praviṣṭaṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: what has been taken into the treasury is removed while what has not been credited to it is shown as credited; raw materials that are not paid for are entered, while those that are paid for are not entered;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃkṣepo vikṣepaḥ kṛtaḥ, vikṣepaḥ saṃkṣepo vā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: an aggregate is scattered in pieces; scattered items are converted into an aggregate;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mahāargham alpaargheṇa parivartitam, alpaarghaṃ mahāargheṇa vā
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: commodities of greater value are bartered for those of small value; what is of smaller value is bartered for one of greater value;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samāropitoarghaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: price of commodities enhanced;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃvatsaro māsaviṣamaḥ kṛtaḥ, māso divasaviṣamo vā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: number of nights decreased; the year not in harmony with its months; the month not in harmony with its days;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samāgamaviṣamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: inconsistency in the transactions carried on with personal supervision samágamavishánah;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mukhaviṣamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: misrepresentation of the source of income;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kārmikaviṣamaḥ nirvartanaviṣamaḥ, piṇḍaviṣamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: inconsistency in giving charities; incongruity in representing the work turned out; inconsistency in dealing with fixed items;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: varṇaviṣamaḥ, arghaviṣamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: misrepresentation of test marks or the standard of fineness of gold and silver;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mānaviṣamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: misrepresentation of prices of commodities;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: māpanaviṣamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: deception in counting articles;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhājanaviṣamaḥ iti haraṇaupāyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and making use of false cubic measures such as bhájan these are the several ways of embezzlement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatraupayuktanidhāyakanibandhakapratigrāhakadāyakadāpakamantrivaiyāvṛtyakarān ekaekaśoanuyuñjīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Under the above circumstances, the persons concerned such as the treasurer nidháyaka, the prescriber nibandhaka, the receiver pratigráhaka, the payer dáyaka, the person who caused the payment dápaka, the ministerial servants of the officer mantrivaiyávrityakara shall each be separately examined

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mithyāvāde caeṣāṃ yuktasamo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If any one of these tells a lie, he shall receive the same punishment as the chiefofficer, yukta who committed the offence

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pracāre caavaghoṣayet amunā prakṛtenaupahatāḥ prajñāpayantu iti // prajñāpayato yathāupaghātaṃ dāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A proclamation in public prachára shall be made to the effect whoever has suffered at the hands of this offender may Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 make their grievances known to the king Those who respond to the call shall receive such compensation as is equal to the loss they have sustained

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anekeṣu caabhiyogeṣv apavyayamānaḥ sakṛd eva parauktaḥ sarvaṃ bhajeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When there are a number of offences in which a single officer is involved, and when his being guilty of parókta in any one of those charges has been established, he shall be answerable for all those offences

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaiṣamye sarvatraanuyogaṃ dadyāt // mahaty arthaapahāre caalpenaapi siddhaḥ sarvaṃ bhajeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a government servant has been proved to be guilty of having misappropriated part of a large sum in question, he shall be answerable for the whole

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛtapratighātaavasthaḥ sūcako niṣpannaarthaḥ ṣaṣṭham aṃśaṃ labheta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any informant súchaka who supplies information about embezzlement just under perpetration shall, if he succeeds in proving it, get as reward onesixth of the amount in question;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvādaśam aṃśaṃ bhṛtakaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if he happens to be a government servant bhritaka, he shall get for the same act onetwelfth of the amount

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prabhūtaabhiyogād alpaniṣpattau niṣpannasyaaṃśaṃ labheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If an informant succeeds in proving only a part of a big embezzlement, he shall, nevertheless, get the prescribed share of the part of the embezzled amount proved

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aniṣpanne śārīraṃ hairaṇyaṃ vā daṇḍaṃ labheta, na caanugrāhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: An informant who fails to prove his assertion shall be liable to monetary or corporal punishment, and shall never be acquitted

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: niṣpattau nikṣiped vādam ātmānaṃ vāapavāhayet / abhiyuktaupajāpāt tu sūcako vadham āpnuyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When the charge is proved, the informant may impute the talebearing to someone else or clear himself in any other way from the blame Any informant who withdraws his assertion prevailed upon by the insinuations of the accused shall be condemned to death

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: amātyasampadāupetāḥ sarvaadhyakṣāḥ śaktitaḥ karmasu niyojyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THOSE who are possessed of ministerial qualifications shall, in accordance with their individual capacity, be appointed as superintendents of government departments

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmasu caeṣāṃ nityaṃ parīkṣāṃ kārayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: While engaged in work, they shall be daily examined;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aśvasadharmāṇo hi manuṣyā niyuktāḥ karmasu vikurvate //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for men are naturally fickleminded and like horses at work exhibit constant change in their temper

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmāt kartāraṃ karaṇaṃ deśaṃ kālaṃ kāryaṃ prakṣepam udayaṃ caeṣu vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence the agency and tools which they make use of, the place and time of the work they are engaged in, as well as the precise form of the work, the outlay, and the results shall always be ascertained

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: te yathāsaṃdeśam asaṃhatā avigṛhītāḥ karmāṇi kuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Without dissension and without any concert among themselves, they shall carry on their work as ordered

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃhatā bhakṣayeyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When in concert, they eat up the revenue

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vigṛhītā vināśayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When in disunion, they mar the work

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na caanivedya bhartuḥ kaṃcid ārambhaṃ kuryuḥ, anyatraāpatpratīkārebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Without bringing to the knowledge of their master bhartri, the king, they shall undertake nothing except remedial measures against imminent dangers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pramādasthāneṣu caeṣām atyayaṃ sthāpayed divasavetanavyayadviguṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A fine of twice the amount of their daily pay and of the expenditure incurred by them shall be fixed for any inadvertence on their part

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaś caeṣāṃ yathāādiṣṭam arthaṃ saviśeṣaṃ vā karoti sa sthānamānau labheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Whoever of the superintendents makes as much as, or more than, the amount of fixed revenue shall be honoured with promotion and rewards

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: alpaāyatiś cet mahāvyayo bhakṣayati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: My teacher holds that that officer who spends too much and brings in little revenue eats it up;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viparyaye yathāāyativyayaś ca na bhakṣayati ity ācāryāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: while he who proves the revenue ie, brings in more than he spends as well as the officer who brings inasmuch as he spends does not eat up the revenue

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: apasarpeṇaevaupalabhyetaiti kauṭilyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But Kautilya holds that cases of embezzlement or no embezzlement can be ascertained through spies alone

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaḥ samudayaṃ parihāpayati sa rājaarthaṃ bhakṣayati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever lessens the revenue eats the kings wealth

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa ced ajñānaādibhiḥ parihāpayati tad enaṃ yathāguṇaṃ dāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If owing to inadvertence he causes diminution in revenue, he shall be compelled to make good the loss

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaḥ samudayaṃ dviguṇam udbhāvayati sa janapadaṃ bhakṣayati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever doubles the revenue eats into the vitality of the country

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa ced rājaartham upanayaty alpaaparādhe vārayitavyaḥ, mahati yathāaparādhaṃ daṇḍayitavyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If he brings in double the amount to the king, he shall, if the offence is small, be warned not to repeat the same; but if the offence be grave he should proportionally be punished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaḥ samudayaṃ vyayam upanayati sa puruṣakarmāṇi bhakṣayati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever spends the revenue without bringing in any profit eats up the labour of workmen

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa karmadivasadravyamūlyapuruṣavetanaapahāreṣu yathāaparādhaṃ daṇḍayitavyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such an officer shall be punished in proportion to the value of the work done, the number of days taken, the amount of capital spent, and the amount of daily wages paid

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmād asya yo yasminn adhikaraṇe śāsanasthaḥ sa tasya karmaṇo yāthātathyam āyavyayau ca vyāsasamāsābhyām ācakṣīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence the chief officer of each department adhikarana shall thoroughly scrutinise the real amount of the work done, the receipts realised from, and the expenditure incurred in that departmental work both in detail and in the aggregate

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mūlaharatādātvikakadaryāṃś ca pratiṣedhayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall also check pratishedhayet prodigal, spendthrift and niggardly persons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaḥ pitṛpaitāmaham artham anyāyena bhakṣayati sa mūlaharaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever unjustly eats up the property left by his father and Kautilyas Arthashastra grandfather is a prodigal person múlahara

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yo yad yad utpadyate tat tad bhakṣayati sa tādātvikaḥ // yo bhṛtyaātmapīḍābhyām upacinoty arthaṃ sa kadaryaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever eats all that he earns is a spendthrift tádátvika Whoever hordes money, entailing hardship both on himself and his servants is niggardly

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa pakṣavāṃś ced anādeyaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever of these three kinds of persons has the support of a strong party shall not be disturbed;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viparyaye paryādātavyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but he who has no such support shall be caught hold of paryádátavyah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yo mahaty arthasamudaye sthitaḥ kadaryaḥ samnidhatteavanidhatteavasrāvayati vā samnidhatte svaveśmani, avanidhatte paurajānapadeṣu, avasrāvayati paraviṣaye tasya sattrī mantrimitrabhṛtyabandhupakṣam āgatiṃ gatiṃ ca dravyāṇām upalabheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever is niggardly in spite of his immense property, hordes, deposits, or sends outhordes in his own house, deposits with citizens or country people or sends out to foreign countries;a spy shall find out the advisers, friends, servants, relations, partisans, as well as the income and expenditure of such a niggardly person

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaś caasya paraviṣaye saṃcāraṃ kuryāt tam anupraviśya mantraṃ vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever in a foreign country carries out the work of such a niggardly person shall be prevailed upon to give out the secret

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: suvidite śatruśāsanaapadeśenaenaṃ ghātayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When the secret is known, the niggardly person shall be murdered apparently under the orders of his avowed enemy

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmād asyaadhyakṣāḥ saṃkhyāyakalekhakarūpadarśakanīvīgrāhakauttaraadhyakṣasakhāḥ karmaṇi kuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence the superintendents of all the departments shall carry on their respective works in company with accountants, writers, coinexaminers, the treasurers, and military officers uttarádhyaksha

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣām antevāsinaḥ śilpaśaucayuktāḥ saṃkhyāyakaādīnām apasarpāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who attend upon military officers and are noted for their honesty and good conduct shall be spies to watch the conduct of accountants and other clerks

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bahumukhyam anityaṃ caadhikaraṇaṃ sthāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Each department shall be officered by several temporary heads

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathā hy anāsvādayituṃ na śakyaṃ jihvātalasthaṃ madhu vā viṣaṃ vā / arthas tathā hy arthacareṇa rājñaḥ svalpoapy anāsvādayituṃ na śakyaḥ // matsyā yathāantaḥ salile caranto jñātuṃ na śakyāḥ salilaṃ pibantaḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Just as it is impossible not to taste the honey or the poison that finds itself at the tip of the tongue, so it is impossible for a Kautilyas Arthashastra government servant not to eat up, at least, a bit of the kings revenue Just as fish moving under water cannot possibly be found out either as drinking or not drinking water, so government servants employed in the government work cannot be found out while taking money for themselves

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: api śakyā gatir jñātuṃ patatāṃ khe patatriṇām /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It is possible to mark the movements of birds flying high up in the sky;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na tu pracchannabhāvānāṃ yuktānāṃ caratāṃ gatiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but not so is it possible to ascertain the movement of government servants of hidden purpose

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: āsrāvayec caupacitān viparyasyec ca karmasu / yathā na bhakṣayanty arthaṃ bhakṣitaṃ nirvamanti vā // na bhakṣayanti ye tv arthān nyāyato vardhayanti ca /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Government servants shall not only be confiscated of their illearned hordes, but also be transferred from one work to another, so that they cannot either misappropriate Government money or vomit what they have eaten up

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nityaadhikārāḥ kāryās te rājñaḥ priyahite ratāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who increase the kings revenue instead of eating it up and are loyally devoted to him shall be made permanent in service

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śāsane śāsanam ity ācakṣate //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: TEACHERS say that the word sásana, command, is applicable only to royal writs sásana

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śāsanapradhānā hi rājānaḥ, tanmūlatvāt saṃdhivigrahayoḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Writs are of great importance to kings inasmuch as treaties and ultimate leading to war depend upon writs

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmād amātyasampadāupetaḥ sarvasamayavid āśugranthaś cāruakṣaro lekhanavācanasamartho lekhakaḥ syāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Hence one who is possessed of ministerial qualifications, acquainted with all kinds of customs, smart in composition, good in legible writing, and sharp in reading shall be appointed as a writer lékhaka

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: soavyagramanā rājñaḥ saṃdeśaṃ śrutvā niścitaarthaṃ lekhaṃ vidadhyāt deśaaiśvaryavaṃśanāmadheyaupacāram īśvarasya, deśanāmadheyaupacāram anīśvarasya //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such a writer, having attentively listened to the kings order and having well thought out the matter under consideration, shall reduce the order to writing As to a writ addressed to a lord ísvara, it shall contain a polite mention of his country, his possessions, his family and his name, and as to that addressed to a common man anisvara, it shall make a polite mention of his country and name

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jātiṃ kulaṃ sthānavayaḥśrutāni karmaṛddhiśīlāny atha deśakālau / yaunaanubandhaṃ ca samīkṣya kārye lekhaṃ vidadhyāt puruṣaanurūpam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Having paid sufficient attention to the caste, family, social rank, age, learning sruta, occupation, property, character síla, bloodrelationship yaunánubandha of the addressee, as well as to the place and time of writing, the writer shall form a writ befitting the position of the person addressed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: arthakramaḥ sambandhaḥ paripūrṇatā mādhuryam audāryaṃ spaṣṭatvam iti lekhasampat //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Arrangement of subjectmatter arthakrama, relevancy sambandha, completeness, sweetness, dignity, and lucidity are the necessary qualities of a writ

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatra yathāvad anupūrvakriyā pradhānasyaarthasya pūrvam abhiniveśa ity arthakramaḥ // prastutasyaarthasyaanuparodhād uttarasya vidhānam āsamāpter iti sambandhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The act of mentioning facts in the order of their importance is arrangement When subsequent facts are not contradictory to facts just or previously mentioned, and so on till the completion of the letter, it is termed relevancy Avoidance of redundancy or deficiency in words or letters;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: arthapadaakṣarāṇām anyūnaatiriktatā hetuudāharaṇadṛṣṭāntair arthaupavarṇanāaśrāntapadatāiti paripūrṇatā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: impressive description of subject matter by citing reasons, Kautilyas Arthashastra examples, and illustrations; and the use of appropriate and suitably strong words asrántapada is completeness

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sukhaupanītacāruarthaśabdaabhidhānaṃ mādhuryam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The description in exquisite style of a good purport with a pleasing effect is sweetness

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: agrāmyaśabdaabhidhānam audāryam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The use of words other than colloquial agrámya is dignity

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratītaśabdaprayogaḥ spaṣṭatvam iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The use of wellknown words is lucidity

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akāraādayo varṇās triṣaṣṭiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The alphabetical letters beginning with Akára are sixtythree

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: varṇasaṃghātaḥ padam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The combination of letters is a word pada

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tac caturvidhaṃ nāmaākhyātaupasarganipātāś caiti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The word is of four kindsnouns, verbs, prefixes of verbs, and particles nipáta

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatra nāma sattvaabhidhāyi //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A noun is that which signifies an essence satva

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aviśiṣṭaliṅgam ākhyātaṃ kriyāvāci // kriyāviśeṣakāḥ praādaya upasargāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A verb is that which has no definite gender and signifies an action Pra and other words are the prefixes of verbs

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: avyayāś caādayo nipātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Cha and other indeclinable words are particles

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: padasamūho vākyam arthaparisamāptau //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A group of words conveying a complete sense is a sentence vákya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ekapadaavaras tripadaparaḥ parapadaarthaanuparodhena vargaḥ kāryaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Combination of words varga consisting of not more than three words and not less than one word shall be so formed as to harmonise with the meaning of immediately following words

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: lekhaparisaṃharaṇaartha itiśabdo vācikam asyaiti ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and also to indicate an oral message as in the phrase „váchikamasyeti,‟ an oral message along with this writ
