oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: haritālamanaḥśilāhiṅgulukacūrṇānām anyatamena kuruvindacūrṇena vā vastraṃ samyūhya yat parimṛdnanti tat parimardanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When, by a piece of cloth painted with the powder of sulphuret of arsenic haritála, red arsenic manassila, or vermilion or with the powder of kuruvinda black salt ?, gold or silver articles are rubbed, that act is termed rubbing

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena sauvarṇarājatāni bhāṇḍāni kṣīyante,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: By these acts, gold and silver articles bhándáni undergo Kautilyas Arthashastra diminution;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na caeṣāṃ kiṃcid avarugṇaṃ bhavati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but no other kind of injury is done to them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhagnakhaṇḍaghṛṣṭānāṃ samyūhyānāṃ sadṛśenaanumānaṃ kuryāt // / avalepyānāṃ yāvad utpāṭitaṃ tāvad utpāṭyaanumānaṃ kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In all those pieces which are hammered, cut, scratched, or rubbed the loss can be inferred by comparing them with intact pieces of similar description In amalgamated pieces avalepya which are cut off, the loss can be ascertained by cutting off an equal portion of a similar piece

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: virūpāṇāṃ vā tāpanam udakapeṣaṇaṃ ca bahuśaḥ kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those pieces the appearance of which has changed shall be often heated and drenched in water

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / avakṣepaḥ pratimānam agnir gaṇḍikā bhaṇḍikaadhikaraṇī piñchaḥ sūtraṃ cellaṃ bollanaṃ śira utsaṅgo makṣikā svakāyaīkṣā dṛtir udakaśarāvam agniṣṭham iti kācaṃ vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The state goldsmith shall infer deception kácham vidyát when throwing away, counterweight, fire, anvil gandika, working instruments bhandika, the seat adhikarani, the assaying balance, folds of dress chellachollakam, his head, his thigh, flies, eagerness to look at his own body, the waterpot, and the firepot

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājatānāṃ visraṃ malagrāhi paruṣaṃ prastīnaṃ vivarṇaṃ vā duṣṭam iti vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Regarding silver, bad smell like that of rotten meat, hardness due to any alloy mala, projection prastína, and bad colour may be considered as indicating adulteration

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evaṃ navaṃ ca jīrṇaṃ ca virūpaṃ caapi bhāṇḍakam / parīkṣetaatyayaṃ caeṣāṃ yathāuddiṣṭaṃ prakalpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus articles of gold and silver new or old, or of bad or unusual colour are to be examined and adequate fines as described above shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: koṣṭhaagāraadhyakṣaḥ sītārāṣṭrakrayimaparivartakaprāmityakaāpamityakasaṃhanikaanyajātavyayapratyāyaupasthānāny upalabhet
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE SUPERINTENDENT OF STOREHOUSE Kautilyas Arthashastra THE superintendent of storehouse Koshthágára shall supervise the accounts of agricultural produce síta; taxes coming under Ráshtra, countryparts; commerce krayima; barter parivartna;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sītāadhyakṣaupanītaḥ sasyavarṇakaḥ sītā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whatever in the shape of agricultural produce is brought in by the superintendent of agriculture, of crownlands is termed sítá

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: piṇḍakaraḥ ṣaḍbhāgaḥ senābhaktaṃ baliḥ kara utsaṅgaḥ pārśvaṃ pārihīṇikam aupāyanikaṃ kauṣṭheyakaṃ ca rāṣṭram // dhānyamūlyaṃ kośanirhāraḥ prayogapratyādānaṃ ca krayimam // sasyavarṇānām arghaantareṇa vinimayaḥ parivartakaḥ // sasyayācanam anyataḥ prāmityakam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The taxes that are fixed pindakara, taxes that are paid in the form of onesixth of produce shadbhága, provision paid by the people for the army senábhakta, taxes that are levied for religious purposes bali, taxes or subsidies that are paid by vassal kings and others kara, taxes that are specially collected on the occasion of the birth of a prince utsanga, taxes that are collected when there is some margin left for such collection pársva, compensation levied in the shape of grains for any damage done by cattle to crops párihínaka, presentation made to the king, aupáyanika, and taxes that are levied on lands below tanks, lakes, etc, built by the king Kaushtheyaka,all these come under the head „Ráshtra‟ Sale proceeds of grains, grains purchased and the collection of interest in kind or grain debts prayogapratyádána are termed commerce

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tad eva pratidānaartham āpamityakam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Profitable exchange of grains for grains is termed barter parivarthana

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kuṭṭakarocakasaktuśuktapiṣṭakarma tajjīvaneṣu tailapīḍanamaudracākrikeṣv ikṣūṇāṃ ca kṣārakarma saṃhanikā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Pounding rice, etc, dividing pulses, etc, frying corns and beans, manufacture of beverages suktakarma, manufacture of flour by employing those persons who live upon such works, extracting oil by employing shepherds and oilmakers, and manufacture of sugar from the juice of sugarcane are termed simhanika

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: naṣṭaprasmṛtaādir anyajātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whatever is lost and forgotten by others and the like form accidental revenue anyajáta

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vikṣepavyādhitaantaraārambhaśeṣaṃ ca vyayapratyāyaḥ // tulāmānaantaraṃ hastapūraṇam utkaro vyājī paryuṣitaṃ prārjitaṃ caupasthānam / iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Investment, the relic of a wrecked undertaking, and savings from an estimated outlay are the means to check expenditure vyayapratyaya That amount or quantity of compensation which is claimed for making use of a different balance or for any error in taking a handful is termed vyáji

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dhānyasnehakṣāralavaṇānāṃ dhānyakalpaṃ sītāadhyakṣe vakṣyāmaḥ // sarpistailavasāmajjānaḥ snehāḥ // phāṇitaguḍamatsyaṇḍikaakhaṇḍaśarkarāḥ kṣāravargaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Collection of arrears is termed „upasthána,‟ „recovery of past arrears‟ Of grains, oils, sugar, and salt, all that concerns grains will be treated of in connection with the duties of the „Superintendent of Agriculture‟ Clarified butter, oil, serum of flesh, and pith or sap of plants, etc, are termed oils sneha Decoction phánita, jaggory, granulated sugar, and sugarcandy are termed kshára

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saindhavasāmudrabiḍayavakṣārasauvarcalaudbhedajā lavaṇavargaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Yavakshara, nitre, Sauvarchala, that which is the product of the country of suvarchala; and udbhedaja, that which is extracted from saline soil are termed lavana, salt

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣaudraṃ mārdvīkaṃ ca madhu //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The honey of the bee as well as the juice extracted from grapes are called madhu

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / ikṣurasaguḍamadhuphāṇitajāmbavapanasānām anyatamo meṣaśṛṅgīpippalīkvāthaabhiṣuto māsikaḥ ṣāṇmāsikaḥ sāṃvatsariko vā cidbhiṭor vārukaikṣukāṇḍaāmraphalaāmalakaavasutaḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the, juice of grapes, the essence of the fruits of jambu Euginia Jambolana and of jaka treewith the essence of meshasringa a kind of plant and long pepper, with or without the addition of the essence of chirbhita a kind of gourd, cucumber, sugarcane, mangofruit and the fruit of myrobalam, the mixture being prepared so as to last for a month, or six months, or a year, constitute the group of astringents suktavarga

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vṛkṣaāmlakaramardaāmravidalaāmalakamātuluṅgakolabadarasauvīrakaparūṣakaādiḥ phalaāmlavargaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The fruits of those trees which bear acid fruits, those of karamarda Carissa Carandas, those of vidalámalka myrobalam, those of matulanga citron tree, those of kola small jujuba, those of badara Flacourtia Cataphracta, those of sauvíra big jujuba, and those of parushaka Grewia Asiatica and the like come under the group of acid fruits

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dadhidhānyaāmlaādir dravaāmlavargaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Curds, acid prepared from grains and the like are acids in liquid form

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pippalīmaricaśṛṅgiberāajājīkirātatiktagaurasarṣapakustumburucorakadamanakamaruvakaśigrukāṇḍaādiḥ kaṭukavargaḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Long pepper, black pepper, ginger, cumin seed, kiratatikta Agathotes Chirayta, white mustard, coriander, choraka a plant, damanaka Artemisia Indica, maruvaka Vangueria Spinosa, sigru Hyperanthera Moringa, and the like together with their roots kánda come under the group of pungent substances tiktavarga

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śuṣkamatsyamāṃsakandamūlaphalaśākaādi ca śākavargaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Dried fish, bulbous roots kándamúla, fruits and vegetables form the group of edibles sakavarga

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatoardham āpadarthaṃ jānapadānāṃ sthāpayed, ardham upayuñjīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of the store, thus, collected, half shall be kept in reserve to ward off the calamities of the people and only the other half shall be used

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: navena caanavaṃ śodhayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Old collection shall be replaced by new supply

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣuṇṇaghṛṣṭapiṣṭabhṛṣṭānām ārdraśuṣkasiddhānāṃ ca dhānyānāṃ vṛddhikṣayapramāṇāni pratyakṣīkurvīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The superintendent shall also personally supervise the increase or diminution sustained in grains when they are pounded kshunna, or frayed ghrishta, or reduced to flour pishta, or fried bhrashta, or dried after soaking in water

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kodravavrīhīṇām ardhaṃ sāraḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The essential part sára, ie, that which is fit for food of kodrava Paspalam Scrobiculatum and of vrihi rice is onehalf;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śālīnām ardhabhāgaūnaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: that of sáli a kind of rice is half less by oneeighth part;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tribhāgaūno varakāṇām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: that of varaka Phraseolus Trilobus is half less by onethird part;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tilā yavā mudgamāṣāś ca ghṛṣṭāḥ // pañcabhāgavṛddhirgodhūmaḥ, saktavaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: that of priyangu panic seed or millet is onehalf ; that of chamasi barley, of mudga Phraseolus Mungo and of masha Phraseolus Radiatus is half less by oneeighth part;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pādaūnā kalāyacamasī //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: that of saibya simbi is onehalf;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mudgamāṣāṇām ardhapādaūnā // ardhaṃ sāraḥ, tribhāgaūno masūrāṇām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: that of masúra Ervum Hirsutum is half less by onethird part than the raw material or grains from which it is prepared

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: piṣṭam āmaṃ kulmāṣāś caadhyardhaguṇāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Raw flour and kulmasha boiled and forced rice will be as much as one and a half of the original quantity of the grains

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dviguṇo yāvakaḥ, pulākaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Barley gruel as well as its flour baked will be twice the original quantity

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: piṣṭaṃ ca siddham // kodravavarakaudārakapriyaṅgūṇāṃ triguṇam annam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kodrava Paspalam Scrobiculatum, varaka Phraseolus Trilobus, udáraka Panicum, and priyangu millet will increase three times the original quantity when cooked

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: caturguṇaṃ vrīhīṇām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Vríhi rice will increase four times when cooked

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañcaguṇaṃ śālīnām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sáli a kind of rice will increase five times when cooked

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: timitam aparaannaṃ dviguṇam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and two and a half times when soaked to sprouting condition

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ardhaadhikaṃ virūḍhānām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Grains fried will increase by onefifth the original quantity;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kalāyo dviguṇaḥ, lājā bharujāś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: leguminous seeds kaláya, when fried, will increase twice the original;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tailam atasīnām // nimbakuśaāmrakapitthaādīnāṃ pañcabhāgaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Oil extracted from atasi linseed will be onesixth of the quantity of the seed; that extracted from the seeds, nimba Azadirachta Indica, kusámra ?, and Kapittha Feronia Elephantum will be onefifth;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: caturbhāgikās tilakusumbhamadhūkaiṅgudīsnehāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and that extracted from tila seasumum, kusumba a sort of kidney bean, madhúka Bassia Latifolia, and ingudi Terminalia Catappa will be onefourth

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kārpāsakṣaumāṇāṃ pañcapale palaṃ sūtram // pañcadroṇe śālīnāṃ dvādaśaāḍhakaṃ taṇḍulānāṃ kalabhabhojanam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Five palas of kárpása cotton and of kshauma flax will yield one pala of threads Rice prepared in such a way that five dróna of sáli yield ten ádhakas of rice will be fit to be the food of young elephants; eleven ádhakas from five drónas for elephants of bad temper vyála;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ekādaśakaṃ vyālānām, daśakam aupavāhyānāṃ navakaṃ sāmnāhyānām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: ten ádhakas from the same quantity for elephants trained for riding; nine ádhakas from the same quantity for elephants used in war;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aṣṭakaṃ pattīnām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: eight ádhakas from the same for infantry;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṣaṭkaṃ devīkumārāṇām, pañcakaṃ rājñām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: six ádhakas from the same for queens and princes and five ádhakas from the same quantity for kings

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akhaṇḍapariśuddhānāṃ vā tuaṇḍulānāṃ prasthaḥ // taṇḍulānāṃ prasthaḥ caturbhāgaḥ sūpaḥ sūpaṣoḍaśo lavaṇasyaaṃśaḥ caturbhāgaḥ sarpiṣas tailasya vāekam āryabhaktaṃ puṃsaḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: One prastha of rice, pure and unsplit, onefourth prastha of súpa, and clarified butter or oil equal to onefourth part of súpa will suffice to form one meal of an Arya Onesixth prastha of súpa for a man; and half the above quantity of oil will form one meal for low castes avara Kautilyas Arthashastra The same rations less by onefourth the above quantities will form one meal for a woman;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ardhaṃ bālānām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and half the above rations for children

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: māṃsapalaviṃśatyā snehaardhakuḍubaḥ paliko lavaṇasyaaṃśaḥ kṣārapalayogo dvidharaṇikaḥ kaṭukayogo dadhnuś caardhaprasthaḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For dressing twenty palas of flesh, half a kutumba of oil, one pala of salt, one pala of sugar kshára, two dharanas of pungent substances katuka, spices, and half a prastha of curd will be necessary

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tenauttaraṃ vyākhyātam // śākānām adhyardhaguṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For dressing greater quantities of flesh, the same ingredients can be proportionally increased

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śuṣkāṇāṃ dviguṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For dressing dried fish, the above ingredients are to be added twice as much

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hastyaśvayos tadadhyakṣe vidhāpramāṇaṃ vakṣyāmaḥ // balīvardānāṃ māṣadroṇaṃ yavānāṃ vā pulākaḥ, śeṣam aśvavidhānam // viśeṣo ghāṇapiṇyākatulā, kaṇakuṇḍakaṃ daśaāḍhakaṃ vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Measures of rations for elephants and horses will be described in connection with the Duties of Their Respective Superintendents For bullocks, one drona of masha Phraseolus Radiatus or one drona of barley cooked with other things, as prescribed for horses, is the requisite quantity of food, besides the special and additional provision of one tula of oilcakes ghánapinyaka or ten ádhakas of bran kanakuttanakundaka

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dviguṇaṃ mahiṣauṣṭrāṇām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Twice the above quantity for buffaloes and camels

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ardhadroṇaṃ kharapṛṣatarohitānām // āḍhakam eṇakuraṅgāṇām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Half a drona for asses, red spotted deer and deer with white stripes Kautilyas Arthashastra One ádhaka for an antelope and big red deer

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ardhaāḍhakam ajaeḍakavarāhāṇām, dviguṇaṃ vā kaṇakuṇḍakam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Half an ádhaka or one ádhaka of grain together with bran for a goat, a ram and a boar

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prasthaodanaḥ śunām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: One prastha of cooked rice for dogs

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: haṃsakrauñcamayūrāṇām ardhaprasthaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Half a prastha for a hamsa goose, a krauncha heron and a peacock

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śeṣāṇām ato mṛgapaśupakṣivyālānām ekabhaktād anumānaṃ grāhayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: From the above, the quantity of rations enough for one meal for other beasts, cattle, birds, and rogue elephants vyála may be inferred

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aṅgārāṃs tuṣān lohakarmaantabhittilepyānāṃ hārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Charcoal and chaff may be given over for iron smelting and limekiln bhittilepya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kaṇikā dāsakarmakarasūpakārāṇām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Bran and flour kánika may be given to slaves, labourers, and cooks

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: atoanyad audanikaapūpikebhyaḥ prayacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The surplus of the above may be given to those who prepare cooked rice, and ricecakes

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tulāmānabhāṇḍaṃ rocanīdṛṣanmusalaulūkhalakuṭṭakarocakayantrapattrakaśūrpacālanikaakaṇḍolīpiṭakasammārjanyaś caupakaraṇāni
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The weighing balance, weights, measures, millstone rochani, pestle, mortar, wooden contrivances for pounding rice, etc, kuttakayantra, contrivances for splitting seeds into pieces rochakayantra, winnowing fans, sieves chálani grainbaskets kandoli, boxes, and brooms are the necessary instruments Sweepers; preservers;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mārjakarakṣakadharakamāyakamāpakadāyakadāpakaśalākaapratigrāhakadāsakarmakaravargaś ca viṣṭiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those who weigh things dharaka; those who measure grains, etc; those who supervise the work of measuring grains mápaka; those who supervise the supply of Kautilyas Arthashastra commodities to the storehouse dápaka;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: uccair dhānyasya nikṣepo mūtāḥ kṣārasya saṃhatāḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: jaggory kshára is bound round in grassrope múta;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mṛtkāṣṭhakoṣṭhāḥ snehasya pṛthivī lavaṇasya ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: oils are kept in earthenware or wooden vessels; and salt is heaped up on the surface of the ground

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paṇyaadhyakṣaḥ sthalajalajānāṃ nānāvidhānāṃ paṇyānāṃ sthalapathavāripathaupayātānāṃ sāraphalgvarghaantaraṃ priyaapriyatāṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE SUPERINTENDENT OF COMMERCE THE Superintendent of Commerce shall ascertain demand or absence of demand for, and rise or fall in the price of, various kinds of merchandise which may be the products either of land or of water and which may have been brought in either by land or by water path

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tathā vikṣepasaṃkṣepakrayavikrayaprayogakālān //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall also ascertain the time suitable for their distribution, centralisation, purchase, and sale

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yac ca paṇyaṃ pracuraṃ syāt tad ekīkṛtyaargham āropayet // prāptearghe vāarghaantaraṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That merchandise which is widely distributed shall be centralised and its price enhanced When the enhanced rate becomes popular, another rate shall be declared

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svabhūmijānāṃ rājapaṇyānām ekamukhaṃ vyavahāraṃ sthāpayet, parabhūmijānām anekamukham //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That merchandise of the king which is of local manufacture shall be centralised; imported merchandise shall be distributed in Kautilyas Arthashastra several markets for sale

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ubhayaṃ ca prajānām anugraheṇa vikrāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Both kinds of merchandise shall be favourably sold to the people

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sthūlam api ca lābhaṃ prajānām aupaghātikaṃ vārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall avoid such large profits as will harm the people

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ajasrapaṇyānāṃ kālauparodhaṃ saṃkuladoṣaṃ vā nautpādayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: There shall be no restriction to the time of sale of those commodities for which there is frequent demand; nor shall they be subject to the evils of centralisation sankuladosha

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bahumukhaṃ vā rājapaṇyaṃ vaidehakāḥ kṛtaarghaṃ vikrīṇīran // chedaanurūpaṃ ca vaidharaṇaṃ dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or pedlars may sell the merchandise of the king at a fixed price in many markets and pay necessary compensation vaidharana proportional to the loss entailed upon it chhedánurúpam

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṣoḍaśabhāgo mānavyājī,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The amount of vyáji due on commodities sold by cubical measure is onesixteenth of the quantity shodasabhágo mánavyáji;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viṃśatibhāgas tulāmānam, gaṇyapaṇyānām ekādaśabhāgaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: that on commodities sold by weighing balance is onetwentieth of the quantity; and that on commodities sold in numbers is oneeleventh of the whole

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parabhūmijaṃ paṇyam anugraheṇaāvāhayet // naavikasaarthavāhebhyaś ca parihāram āyatikṣamaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The superintendent shall show favour to those who import foreign merchandise mariners návika and merchants who import foreign merchandise shall be favoured with remission of the tradetaxes, so that they may derive some profit áyatikshamam pariháram dadyát

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anabhiyogaś caartheṣv āgantūnām, anyatra sabhyāupakāribhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Foreigners importing merchandise shall be exempted from being sued for debts unless they are local associations and partners anabhiyogaschárthesshvágantúnámanyatassabhyopakári bhyah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paṇyaadhiṣṭhātāraḥ paṇyamūlyam ekamukhaṃ kāṣṭhadroṇyām ekacchidraapidhānāyāṃ nidadhyuḥ // ahnaś caaṣṭame bhāge paṇyaadhyakṣasyaarpayeyuḥ idaṃ vikrītam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who sell the merchandise of the king shall invariably put their sale proceeds in a wooden box kept in a fixed place and provided with a single aperture on the top Kautilyas Arthashastra During the eighth part of the day, they shall submit to the superintendent the sale report, saying this much has been sold and this much remains; they shall also hand over the weights and measures

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: idaṃ śeṣam iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such are the rules applicable to local traffic

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tulāmānabhāṇḍaṃ caarpayeyuḥ // iti svaviṣaye vyākhyātam // paraviṣaye tu paṇyapratipaṇyayor arghaṃ mūlyaṃ caāgamayya śulkavartanyāātivāhikagulmataradeyabhaktabhāgavyayaśuddham
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: As regards the sale of the kings merchandise in foreign countries Having ascertained the value of local produce as compared with that of foreign produce that can be obtained in barter, the superintendent will find out by calculation whether there is any margin left for profit after meeting the payments to the foreign king such as the toll sulka, roadcess vartaní, conveyancecess átiváhika, tax payable at military stations gulmadeya, ferrycharges taradeya, subsistence to the merchant and his followers bhakta, and the portion of merchandise payable to the foreign king bhága

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: asaty udaye bhāṇḍanirvahaṇena paṇyapratipaṇyaānayanena vā lābhaṃ paśyet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If no profit can be realised by selling the local produce in foreign countries, he has to consider whether any local produce can be profitably bartered for any foreign produce

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ sārapādena sthalavyavahāram adhvanā kṣemeṇa prayojayet // aṭavyantapālapurarāṣṭramukhyaiś ca pratisaṃsargaṃ gacched anugrahaartham //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Then he may send one quarter of his valuable merchandise through safe roads to different markets on land In view of large profits, he the deputed merchant may make friendship with the forestguards, boundaryguards, and officers in charge of cities and of countryparts of the foreign king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: āpadi sāram ātmānaṃ vā mokṣayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall take care to secure his treasure sára and life from danger

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ātmano vā bhūmiṃ prāptaḥ sarvadeyaviśuddhaṃ vyavahareta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If he cannot reach the intended market, he may sell the merchandise at any market free from all dues sarvadeyavisuddham

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vāripathe vā yānabhāgakapathyadanapaṇyapratipaṇyaarghapramāṇayātrākālabhayapratīkārapaṇyapattanacāritrāṇy upalabheta
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall also gather information as to conveyancecharges yánabhágaka, subsistence on the way pathyadana, value of Kautilyas Arthashastra foreign merchandise that can be obtained in barter for local merchandise, occasions of pilgrimages yátrakála, means that can be employed to ward off dangers of the journey, and the history of commercial towns panyapattanacháritra

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nadīpathe ca vijñāya vyavahāraṃ caritrataḥ / yato lābhas tato gacched alābhaṃ parivarjayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Having gathered information as to the transaction in commercial towns along the banks of rivers, he shall transport his merchandise to profitable markets and avoid unprofitable ones

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kupyaadhyakṣo dravyavanapālaiḥ kupyam ānāyayet // dravyavanakarmaantāṃś ca prayojayet // dravyavanacchidrāṃ ca deyam atyayaṃ ca sthāpayed anyatraāpadbhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE Superintendent of Forest Produce shall collect timber and other products of forests by employing those who guard productive forests He shall not only start productive works in forests, but also fix adequate fines and compensations to be levied from those who cause any damage to productive forests except in calamities

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāradāruvargaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The following are forest products

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: uṭajacimiyacāpaveṇuvaṃśasātinakaṇṭakabhāllūkaādir veṇuvargaḥ // vetraśīkavallīvāśīśyāmalatānāgalatāādir vallīvargaḥ // mālatīmūrvāarkaśaṇagavedhukāatasyādir valkavargaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Utaja, Chimiya, Chava, Vénu, Vamsa, Sátina, Kantaka, and Bhállúka, etc, form the group of bamboo Vetra cane, sokavalli, vási Justicia Ganderussa ?, syámalatá Ichnocarpus, nágalata betel, etc, form the group of creepers Málati Jasminum Grandiflorum, dúrvá panic grass, arka Calotropis Gigantea, sana hemp, gavedhuka Coix Barbata, atasí Linum Usitatis simum, etc, form the group of fibrous plants valkavarga

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: muñjabalbajaādi rajjubhāṇḍam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Munja Saccharum Munja, balbaja Eleusine Indica, etc, are plants which yield ropemaking material rajjubhánda

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tālītālabhūrjānāṃ pattram //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Táli Corypha Taliera, tála palmyra or Borassus Flabelliformis, and bhúrja birch yield leaves patram

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kiṃśukakusumbhakuṅkumānāṃ puṣpam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kimsuka Butea Frondosa, kusumbha Carthamus Tinctorius, and kumkuma Crocus Sativus yield flowers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kandamūlaphalaādir auṣadhavargaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Bulbous roots and fruits are the group of medicines

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarpāḥ kīṭāś ca ta eva kumbhagatāḥ viṣavargaḥ // godhāserakadvīpyṛkṣaśiṃśumārasiṃhavyāghrahastimahiṣacamarasṛmarakhaḍgagomṛgagavayānāṃ carmaasthipittasnāyvakṣidantaśṛṅgakhurapucchāni, anyeṣāṃ vāapi mṛgapaśupakṣivyālānām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kálakúta, Vatsanábha, Háláhala, Meshasringa, Mustá, Cyperus Rotundus, kushtha, mahávisha, vellitaka, gaurárdra, bálaka, márkata, haimavata, kálingaka, daradaka, kolasáraka, ushtraka, etc, are poisons Likewise snakes and worms kept in pots are the group of Kautilyas Arthashastra poisons Skins are those of godha alligator, seraka ?, dvípi leopard, simsumára porpoise, simha lion, vyághra tiger, hasti, elephant, mahisha buffalo, chamara bos grunniens, gomriga bos gavaeus, and gavaya the gayal

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kālaayasatāmravṛttakaṃsasīsatrapuvaikṛntakaārakūṭāni lohāni //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Bones, bile pittha, snáyu ?, teeth, horn, hoofs, and tails of the above animals as well as of other beasts, cattle, birds and snakes vyála

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aṅgāratuṣabhasmāni, mṛgapaśupakṣivyālavāṭāḥ kāṣṭhatṛṇavāṭāś ca / iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Utensils bhanda, are those made of cane, bark vidala, and clay mrittiká Charcoal, bran, and ashes are other things Menageries of beasts, cattle, and birds Collection of firewood and fodder

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bahir antaś ca karmaantā vibhaktāḥ sārvabhāṇḍikāḥ / ājīvapurarakṣāarthāḥ kāryāḥ kupyaupajīvinā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The superintendent of forest produce shall carry on either inside or outside the capital city the manufacture of all kinds of articles which are Kautilyas Arthashastra necessary for life or for the defence of forts

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / āyudhaagāraadhyakṣaḥ sāṃgrāmikaṃ daurgakarmikaṃ parapuraabhighātikaṃ ca yantram āyudham āvaraṇam upakaraṇaṃ ca tajjātakāruśilpibhiḥ kṛtakarmapramāṇakālavetanaphalaniṣpattibhiḥ kārayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE SUPERINTENDENT OF THE ARMOURY THE Superintendent of the Armoury shall employ experienced workmen of tried ability to manufacture in a given time and for fixed wages wheels, weapons, mail armour, and other accessory instruments for use in battles, in the construction or defence of forts, or in destroying the cities or strongholds of enemies

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svabhūmiṣu ca sthāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: All these weapons and instruments shall be kept in places suitably prepared for them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sthānaparivartanam ātapapravātapradānaṃ ca bahuśaḥ kuryāt // ūṣmaupasnehakrimibhir upahanyamānam anyathā sthāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They shall not only be frequently dusted and transferred from one place to another, but also be exposed to the sun Such weapons as are likely to be affected by heat and vapour úshmopasneha and to be eaten by worms shall be kept in safe localities

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jātirūpalakṣaṇapramāṇaāgamamūlyanikṣepaiś caupalabheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They shall also be examined now and then with reference to the class to which they belong, their forms, their characteristics, their size, their source, their value, and their total quantity

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvatobhadrajāmadagnyabahumukhaviśvāsaghātisaṃghāṭīyānakaparjanyakabāhuūrdhvabāhvardhabāhūni sthitayantrāṇi //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sarvatobhadra, jamadagnya, bahumukha, visvásagháti, samgháti, yánaka, parjanyaka, ardhabáhu, and úrdhvabáhu are immoveable machines sthirayantrám

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śaktiprāsakuntahāṭakabhiṇḍipālaśūlatomaravarāhakarṇakaṇayakarpaṇatrāsikaādīni ca hulamukhāni //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Pánchálika, devadanda, súkarika, musala, yashti, hastiváraka, tálavrinta, mudgara, gada, spriktala, kuddála, ásphátima, audhghátima, sataghni, trisúla, and chakra are moveable machines

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tālacāpadāravaśārṅgāṇi kārmukakodaṇḍadrūṇā dhanūṃṣi //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Bows made of tála palmyra, of chápa a kind of bamboo, of dáru a kind of wood, and sringa bone or horn are respectively called kármuka, kodanda, druna, and dhanus

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mūrvāarkaśanagavedhuveṇusnāyūni jyāḥ // veṇuśaraśalākādaṇḍaāsananārācāś caiṣavaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Bowstrings are made of múrva Sansviera Roxburghiana, arka Catotropis Gigantea, sána hemp, gavedhu Coix Barbata, venu bamboo bark, and snáyu sinew

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ mukhāni chedanabhedanatāḍanāny āyasaasthidāravāṇi //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The edges of arrows shall be so made of iron, bone or wood as to cut, rend or pierce

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nistriṃśamaṇḍalaagraasiyaṣṭayaḥ khaḍgāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Nistrimsa, mandalágra, and asiyashti are swords

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: khaḍgamahiṣavāraṇaviṣāṇadāruveṇumūlāni tsaravaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The handles of swords are made of the horn of rhinoceros, buffalo, of the tusk of elephants, of wood, or of the root of bamboo

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paraśukuṭhārapaṭṭasakhanitrakuddālakrakacakāṇḍacchedanāḥ kṣurakalpāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Parasu, kuthára, pattasa, khanitra, kuddála, chakra, and kándachchhedana are razorlike weapons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yantragoṣpaṇamuṣṭipāṣāṇarocanīdṛṣadaś caaśmaāyudhāni //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Yantrapáshána, goshpanapáshána, mushtipáshána, rochaní millstone, and stones are other weapons áyudháni

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: lohajālikāpaṭṭakavacasūtrakaṅkaṭaśiṃśumārakakhaḍgidhenukahastigocarmakhuraśṛṅgasaṃghātaṃ varmāṇi // / śirastrāṇakaṇṭhatrāṇakūrpāsakañcukavāravāṇapaṭṭanāgaudarikāḥ peṭīcarmahastikarṇatālamūladhamanikākapāṭakiṭikāapratihatabalāhakāntāś caāvaraṇāṇi //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Lohajáliká, patta, kavacha, and sútraka are varieties of armour made of iron or of skins with hoofs and horns of porpoise, rhinoceros, bison, elephant or cow Kautilyas Arthashastra Likewise sirastrána cover for the head, kanthatrána cover for the neck kúrpása cover for the trunk, kanchuka a coat extending as far as the knee joints, váravána a coat extending as far as the heels, patta, a coat without cover for the arms, and nágodariká gloves are varieties of armour Veti, charma, hastikarna, tálamúla, dharmanika, kaváta, kitika, apratihata, and valáhakánta are instruments used in selfdefence ávaranáni

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hastirathavājināṃ yogyābhāṇḍam ālaṃkārikaṃ samnāhakalpanāś caupakaraṇāni //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Ornaments for elephants, chariots, and horses as well as goads and hooks to lead them in battlefields constitute accessory things upakaranáni

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aindrajālikam aupaniṣadikaṃ ca karma // karmaantānāṃ ca icchām ārambhaniṣpattiṃ prayogaṃ vyājam uddayam /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: [Thus ends Chapter , The Superintendent of the Armoury in Book , The Duties of Government Superintendents, of the Arthasástra of Kautilya End of thirtyninth chapter from the beginning] CHAPTER

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣayavyayau ca jānīyāt kupyānām āyudhaīśvaraḥ // pautavaadhyakṣaḥ pautavakarmaantān kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE SUPERINTENDENT OF WEIGHTS AND MEASURES Kautilyas Arthashastra THE Superintendent of Weights and Measures shall have the same manufactured seeds of másha Phraseolus Radiatus or ,, gunja Cabrus Precatorius suvarnamásha

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: te ṣoḍaśa suvarṇaḥ karṣo vā // catuṣkarṣaṃ palam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: máshas suvarna or karsha karshas pala white mustard seeds silvermásha silver mashas or 0 saibya seeds dharana

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viṃśatitaṇḍulaṃ vajradharaṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: grains of rice dharana of a diamond

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ardhamāṣakaḥ māṣakaḥ dvau catvāraḥ aṣṭau māṣakāḥ suvarṇo dvau catvāraḥ, aṣṭau suvarṇāḥ daśa viṃśatiḥ triṃśat catvāriṃśat śatam iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Ardhamásha half a másha, one másha, two máshas, four máshas, eight máshas, one suvarna, two suvarnas, four suvarnas, eight suvarnas, ten suvarnas, twenty suvarnas, thirty suvarnas, forty suvarnas and one hundred suvarnas are different units of weights

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena dharaṇāni vyākhyātāni //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Similar series of weights shall also be made in dharanas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratimānāny ayomayāni māgadhamekalaśailamayāni yāni vā naudakapradehābhyāṃ vṛddhiṃ gaccheyur uṣṇena vā hrāsam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Weights pratimánáni shall be made of iron or of stones available in the countries of Magadha and Mekala; or of such things as will neither contract when wetted, nor expand under the influence of heat

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṣaḍaṅgulād ūrdhvam aṣṭaaṅgulauttarā daśa tulāḥ kārayet lohapalād ūrdhvam ekapalauttarāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Beginning with a lever of six angulas in length and of one pala in the weight of its metallic mass, there shall be made ten different balances with levers successively increasing by one pala in the weight of their metallic masses, and by eight angulas in their length

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yantram ubhayataḥśikyaṃ vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A scalepan shall be attached to each of them on one or both sides

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañcatriṃśatpalalohāṃ dvisaptatyaṅgulaāyāmāṃ samavṛttāṃ kārayet // tasyāḥ pañcapalikaṃ maṇḍalaṃ baddhvā samakaraṇaṃ kārayet // tataḥ karṣauttaraṃ palaṃ palauttaraṃ daśapalaṃ dvādaśa pañcadaśa viṃśatir iti padāni kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A scalepan of palas in the weight of its metallic mass being attached to its edge, the horizontal position of the lever samakarana when weighing a karsha shall be marked on that Kautilyas Arthashastra part of the lever where, held by a thread, it stands horizontal To the left of that mark, symbols such as pala, , and 0 palas shall be marked

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tata āśatād daśauttaraṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: After that, each place of tens up to 00 shall be marked

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akṣeṣu nāndīpinaddhaṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the place of Akshas, the sign of Nándi shall be marked

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dviguṇalohāṃ tulām ataḥ ṣaṇṇavatyaṅgulaāyāmāṃ parimāṇīṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Likewise a balance called parimání of twice as much metallic mass as that of samavrittá and of angulas in length shall be made

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyāḥ śatapadād ūrdhvaṃ viṃśatiḥ pañcāśat śatam iti padāni kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On its lever, marks such as 0, 0 and 00 above its initial weight of 00 shall be carved

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viṃśatitauliko bhāraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: tulas bhára

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daśadhāraṇikaṃ palam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: dharanas pala

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañcapalaavarā vyāvahārikī bhājany antaḥpurabhājanī ca // tāsām ardhadharaṇaavaraṃ palam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: such palas áyamání measure of royaPublic balance vyávaháriká, servants balance bhájiní, and hareantahpurabhájiní successively decrease by five palas compared with áyamáni

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvipalaavaram uttaraloham, ṣaḍaṅgulaavarāś caāyāmāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The metallic mass of the levers of each of the above successively decreases in weight by two ordinary palas and in length by six angulas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūrvayoḥ pañcapalikaḥ prayāmo māṃsalohalavaṇamaṇivarjam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Excepting flesh, metals, salt, and precious stones, an excess of five palas prayáma of all other commodities shall be given to the king when they are weighed in the two firstnamed balances

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāṣṭhatulā aṣṭahastā padavatī pratimānavatī mayūrapadaadhiṣṭhitā // kāṣṭhapañcaviṃśatipalaṃ taṇḍulaprasthasādhanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A Kautilyas Arthashastra wooden balance with a lever hands long, with measuring marks and counterpoise weights shall be erected on a pedestal like that of a peacock Twentyfive palas of firewood will cook one prastha of rice

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: eṣa pradeśo bahvalpayoḥ // iti tulāpratimānaṃ vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This is the unit for the calculation of any greater or less quantity of firewood Thus weighing balance and weights are commented upon

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: atha dhānyamāṣadvipalaśataṃ droṇam āyamānam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Then, drona which is an áyamána, a measure of royal 00 palas in the grains of másha income

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tuṭo lavo nimeṣaḥ kāṣṭhā kallā nālikā muhūrtaḥ pūrvaaparabhāgau divaso rātriḥ pakṣo māsa ṛtur ayanaṃ saṃvatsaro yugam iti kālāḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Then with regard to the measures of time The divisions of time are a truti, lava, nimesha, káshthá, kalá, náliká, muhúrta, forenoon, afternoon, day, night, paksha, month, ritu season, ayana solstice; samvatsara year, and yuga

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvau tuṭau lavaḥ // dvau lavau nimeṣaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: trutis are equal to lava lavas are equal to nimesha

Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: káshthás are equal to kalá náliká, or the time during which one ádhaka of water passes 0 kalás are equal to out of a pot through an aperture of the same diameter as that of a wire of angulas in length and made of máshas of gold nálikas are equal to muhúrta

Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Then after the period of six months it increases or diminishes by three muhúrtas

Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and when no shadow is cast, it is to be considered midday

Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Likewise when the day declines, the same process in reverse order shall be observed

Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It is in the month of Ashádha that no shadow is cast in midday

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ataḥ paraṃ śrāvaṇaādīnāṃ ṣaṇmāsānāṃ dvyaṅgulauttarā māghaādīnāṃ dvyaṅgulaavarā chāyā iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: After Ashádha, during the six months from Srávana Kautilyas Arthashastra upwards, the length of shadow successively increases by two angulas and during the next six months from Mágha upwards, it successively decreases by two angulas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañcadaśaahorātrāḥ pakṣaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Fifteen days and nights together make up one paksha

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: somaāpyāyanaḥ śuklaḥ // somaavacchedano bahulaḥ //

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvipakṣo māsaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Two pakshas make one month mása

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: triṃśadahorātraḥ karmamāsaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thirty days and nights together make one workamonth prakarmamásah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saardhaḥ sauraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same 0 days and nights with an additional half a day makes one solar month saura

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ardhanyūnaś cāndramāsaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same 0 less by half a day makes one lunar month chandramása

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saptaviṃśatir nākṣatramāsaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Twentyseven days and nights make a sidereal month nakshatramása

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañcatriṃśad aśvavāhāyāḥ // catvāriṃśaddhastivāhāyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Once in thirtyfive months there comes a malamása for Asvaváhas Once in forty months there comes a malamása for hastiváhas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvau māsāv ṛtuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Two months make one ritu season

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śrāvaṇaḥ prauṣṭhapadaś ca varṣāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Srávana and proshthapada make the rainy season varshá

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: āśvayujaḥ kārttikaś ca śarat //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Asvayuja and Kautilyas Arthashastra Kárthíka make the autumn sarad

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: māghaḥ phālgunaś ca śiśiraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Márgasírsha and Phausha make the winter hemanta Mágha and Phalguna make the dewy season sisira

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: caitro vaiśākhaś ca vasantaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Chaitra and Vaisákha make the spring vasanta

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jyeṣṭhāmūlīya āṣāḍhaś ca grīṣmaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Jyeshthámúlíya and Ashádha make the summer grishma

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śiśiraādy uttaraayaṇam // varṣaādi dakṣiṇaayanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Seasons from sisira and upwards are the summersolstice uttaráyana, and those from varshá and upwards are the winter solstice dakshináyana

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvyayanaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Two solstices ayanas make one year samvatsara

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañcasaṃvatsaro yugam / iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Five years make one yuga

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: divasasya haraty arkaḥ ṣaṣṭibhāgam ṛtau tataḥ / karoty ekam ahaśchedaṃ tathāevaekaṃ ca candramāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The sun carries off harati /0th of a whole day every day and thus makes one complete day in every two months ritau Likewise the moon falls behind by /0th of a whole day every day and falls behind one day in every two months

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evam ardhatṛtīyānām abdānām adhimāsakam /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: [Thus ends Chapter , Measurement of Space and Time in Book , The Duties of Government Superintendents of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: grīṣme janayataḥ pūrvaṃ pañcaabdaante ca paścimam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: End of the fortyfirst chapter from the beginning] Kautilyas Arthashastra CHAPTER

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śulkaadhyakṣaḥ śulkaśālāṃ dhvajaṃ ca prānmukham udanmukhaṃ vā mahādvāraabhyāśe niveśayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE SUPERINTENDENT OF TOLLS THE Superintendent of Tolls shall erect near the large gate of the city both the tollhouse and its flag facing either the north or the south

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śulkaādāyinaś catvāraḥ pañca vā sārthaupayātān vaṇijo likheyuḥ ke kutastyāḥ kiyatpaṇyāḥ kva caabhijñānaṃ mudrā vā kṛtā iti
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When merchants with their merchandise arrive at the tollgate, four or five collectors shall take down who the merchants are, whence they come, what amount of merchandise they have brought and where for the first time the sealmark abhijnánamudrá has been made on the merchandise

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: amudrāṇām atyayo deyadviguṇaḥ // kūṭamudrāṇāṃ śulkaaṣṭaguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those whose merchandise has not been stamped with sealmark shall pay twice the amount of toll For counterfeit seal they shall pay eight times the toll

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhinnamudrāṇām atyayo ghaṭikāsthāne sthānam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the sealmark is effaced or torn, the merchants in question shall be compelled to stand in ghatikásthána

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājamudrāparivartane nāmakṛte vā sapādapaṇikaṃ vahanaṃ dāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When one kind of seal is used for another or when one kind of merchandise has been otherwise named námakrite, the merchants shall pay a fine of ¼ panás for each load sapádapanikam vahanam dápayet

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dhvajamūlaupasthitasya pramāṇam arghaṃ ca vaidehikāḥ paṇyasya brūyuḥ etatpramāṇenaargheṇa paṇyam idaṃ kaḥ kretā iti // triruddhauṣitam arthibhyo dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The merchandise being placed near the flag of the tollhouse, the merchants shall declare its quantity and price, cry out thrice who will purchase this quantity of merchandise for this amount of price, and hand over the same to those who demand it for that price

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kretṛsaṃgharṣe mūlyavṛddhiḥ saśulkā kośaṃ gacchet // śulkabhayāt paṇyapramāṇa mūlyaṃ vā hīnaṃ bruvatas tad atiriktaṃ rājā haret // śulkam aṣṭaguṇaṃ vā dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When purchasers happen to bid for it, the enhanced amount of the price together with the toll on the merchandise shall be paid into the kings treasury When under the fear of having to pay a heavy toll, the quantity or the price of merchandise is lowered, the excess shall be taken by the king or the merchants shall be made to pay eight times the toll

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tad eva niviṣṭapaṇyasya bhāṇḍasya hīnaprativarṇakenaarghaapakarṣaṇe sārabhāṇḍasya phalgubhāṇḍena praticchādane ca kuryāt
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same punishment shall be imposed when the price of the merchandise packed in bags is lowered by showing an inferior sort as its sample or when valuable merchandise is covered over with a layer of an inferior one

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratikretṛbhayād vā paṇyamūlyād upari mūlyaṃ vardhayato mūlyavṛddhiṃ rājā haret, dviguṇaṃ vā śulkaṃ kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When under the fear of bidders enhancing the price, the Kautilyas Arthashastra price of any merchandise is increased beyond its proper value, the king shall receive the enhanced amount or twice the amount of toll on it

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tad evaaṣṭaguṇam adhyakṣasyac chādayataḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same punishment or eight times the amount of toll shall be imposed on the Superintendent of tolls if he conceals merchandise

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmād vikrayaḥ paṇyānāṃ dhṛto mito gaṇito vā kāryaḥ, tarkaḥ phalgubhāṇḍānām ānugrāhikāṇāṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence commodities shall be sold only after they are precisely weighed, measured, or numbered With regard to inferior commodities as well as those which are to be let off free of toll, the amount of toll due shall be determined after careful consideration

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dhvajamūlam atikrāntānāṃ caakṛtaśulkānāṃ śulkād aṣṭaguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those merchants who pass beyond the flag of the tollhouse without paying the toll shall be fined eight times the amount of the toll due from them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pathikautpathikās tad vidyuḥ // vaivāhikam anvāyanam aupāyikaṃ yajñakṛtyaprasavanaimittikaṃ devaijyācaulaupanayanagodānavratadīkṣāādiṣu kriyāviśeṣeṣu
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who pass by to and from the city shall ascertain whether or not toll has been paid on any merchandise going along the road Commodities intended for marriages, or taken by a bride from her parents house to her husbands anváyanam, or intended for presentation, or taken for the purpose of sacrificial performance, confinement of women, worship of gods, ceremony of tonsure, investiture of sacred thread, gift of cows godána, made before marriage, any religious rite, consecration ceremony dikshá, and other special ceremonials shall be let off free of toll

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhāṇḍam ucchulkaṃ gacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who utter a lie shall be punished as thieves

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyathāvādinaḥ steyadaṇḍaḥ // kṛtaśulkenaakṛtaśulkaṃ nirvāhayato dvitīyam ekamudrayā bhittvā paṇyapuṭam apaharato vaidehakasya tacca tāvac ca daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who smuggle a part of merchandise on which toll has not been paid with that on which toll has been paid as well as those who, with a view to smuggle with one pass a second portion of merchandise, put it along with the stamped merchandise after Kautilyas Arthashastra breaking open the bag shall forfeit the smuggled quantity and pay as much fine as is equal to the quantity so smuggled

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śulkasthānād gomayapalālaṃ pramāṇaṃ kṛtvāapaharata uttamaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who, falsely swearing by cowdung, smuggles merchandise, shall be punished with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śastravarmakavacaloharatharatnadhānyapaśūnām anyatamam anirvāhyaṃ nirvāhayato yathāavaghuṣito daṇḍaḥ paṇyanāśaśca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person imports such forbidden articles as weapons sastra, mail armour, metals, chariots, precious stones, grains and cattle, he shall not only be punished as laid down elsewhere, but also be made to forfeit his merchandise

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣām anyatamasyaānayane bahir evaucchulko vikrayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When any of such commodities has been brought in for sale, they shall be sold, free of toll far outside the fort

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: antapālaḥ sapādapaṇikāṃ vartanīṃ gṛhṇīyāt paṇyavahanasya,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The officer in charge of boundaries antapála shall receive a panaandaquarter as roadcess vartani on each load of merchandise panyavahanasya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paṇikām ekakhurasya, paśūnām ardhapaṇikāṃ kṣudrapaśūnāṃ pādikām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall levy a pana on a singlehoofed animal, half a pana on each head of cattle, and a quarter on a minor quadruped

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aṃsabhārasya māṣikām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall also receive a másha on a headload of merchandise

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: naṣṭaapahṛtaṃ ca pratividadhyāt // vaideśyaṃ sārthaṃ kṛtasāraphalgubhāṇḍavicayanam abhijñānaṃ mudrāṃ ca dattvā preṣayed adhyakṣasya //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall also make good whatever has been lost by merchants in the part of the country under his charge After carefully examining foreign commodities as to their superior or inferior quality and stamping them with his seal, he shall send the same to the superintendent of tolls

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaidehakavyañjano vā sārthapramāṇaṃ rājñaḥ preṣayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or he may send to the king a spy in the guise of a trader with information as to the quantity and quality of the merchandise

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena pradeśena rājā śulkaadhyakṣasya sārthapramāṇam upadiśet sarvajñakhyāpanaartham //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Having received this information, the king shall in turn send it to the superintendent of tolls in view of exhibiting the kings omniscient power

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ sārtham adhyakṣoabhigamya brūyāt idam amuṣyām uṣya ca sārabhāṇḍaṃ phalgubhāṇḍaṃ ca, na nihūhitavyam, eṣa rājñaḥ prabhāvaḥ iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The superintendent shall tell the merchants in Kautilyas Arthashastra question that such and such a merchant has brought such and such amount of superior or inferior merchandise, which none can possibly hide, and that that information is due to the omniscient power of the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nihūhataḥ phalgubhāṇḍaṃ śulkaaṣṭaguṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For hiding inferior commodities, eight times the amount of toll shall be imposed;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sārabhāṇḍaṃ sarvaapahāraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and for hiding or concealing superior commodities, they shall be wholly confiscated

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rāṣṭrapīḍākaraṃ bhāṇḍam ucchindyād aphalaṃ ca yat / mahāupakāram ucchulkaṃ kuryād bījaṃ ca durlabham // bāhyam ābhyantaraṃ caātithyam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whatever causes harm or is useless to the country shall be shut out; and whatever is of immense good as well as seeds not easily available shall be let in free of toll [Thus ends Chapter , The Superintendent of Tolls in Book , The Duties of Government Superintendents of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: niṣkrāmyaṃ praveśyaṃ ca śulkam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: End of the fortysecond chapter from the beginning CHAPTER REGULATION OF TOLLDUES

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: praveśyānāṃ mūlyapañcabhāgaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Imported commodities shall pay /th of their value as toll

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: puṣpaphalaśākamūlakandavāllikyabījaśuṣkamatsyamāṃsānāṃ ṣaḍbhāgaṃ gṛhṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of flower, fruit, vegetables sáka, roots múla, bulbous roots kanda, pallikya ?, seeds, dried fish, and dried meat, the superintendent shall receive /th as toll

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śaṅkhavajramaṇimuktāpravālahārāṇāṃ tajjātapuruṣaiḥ kārayet kṛtakarmapramāṇakālavetanaphalaniṣpattibhiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra As regards conchshells, diamonds, precious stones, pearls, corals, and necklaces, experts acquainted with the time, cost, and finish of the production of such articles shall fix the amount of toll

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / kṣaumadukūlakrimitānakaṅkaṭaharitālamanaḥśilāañjanahiṅgulukalohavarṇadhātūnāṃ candanaagurukaṭukakiṇvaavarāṇāṃ carmadantaāstaraṇaprāvaraṇakrimijātānām
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of fibrous garments kshauma, cotton cloths dukúla, silk krimitána, mail armour kankata, sulphuret of arsenic haritála, red arsenic manassilá, vermilion hingulaka, metals lóha, and colouring ingredients varnadhátu; of sandal, brown sandal agaru, pungents katuka, ferments kinva, dress ávarana, and the like;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ājaeḍakasya ca daśabhāgaḥ pañcadaśabhāgo vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and of wool and other products yielded by goats and sheep, he shall receive /0th or /th as toll

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / vastracatuṣpadadvipadasūtrakārpāsagandhabhaiṣajyakāṣṭhaveṇuvalkalacarmamṛdbhaaṇḍānāṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of cloths vastra, quadrupeds, bipeds, threads, cotton, scents, medicines, wood, bamboo, fibres valkala, skins, and claypots;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvārādeyaṃ śulkaṃ pañcabhāgaḥ ānugrāhikaṃ vā yathādeśaupakāraṃ sthāpaytet//
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: of grains, oils, sugar kshára, salt, liquor madya cooked rice and the like, he shall receive /0th or /th as toll Gatedues dvárádeya shall be /th of toll dues;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jātibhūmiṣu ca paṇyānāṃ vikrayaḥ//
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Commodities shall never be sold where they are grown or manufactured

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: puṣpaphalavāṭebhyaḥ puṣpaphalaādāne catuṣpañcāśatpaṇo daṇḍaḥ // ṣaṇḍebhyaḥ śākamūlakandaādāne pādaūnaṃ dvipañcāśatpaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When minerals and other commodities are purchased from mines, a fine of 00 panás shall be imposed When flower or fruits are purchased from flower or fruit gardens, a fine of panas shall be imposed When vegetables, roots, bulbous roots are purchased from vegetable gardens, a fine ¾ panas shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣetrebhyaḥ sarvasasyaādāne tripañcāśatpaṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When any kind of grass or grain is purchased from field, a fine of panas shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paṇoadhyardhapaṇaś ca sītāatyayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 Permanent fines of pana and ½ panas shall be levied on agricultural produce sítátyayah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ato navapurāṇāṃ deśajāticaritrataḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence in accordance with the customs of countries or of communities, the rate of toll shall be fixed on commodities, either old or new;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paṇyānāṃ sthāpayecśuklam atyayaṃ caapakārataḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and fines shall be fixed in proportion to the gravity of offences

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sūtraadhyakṣaḥ sūtravarmavastrarajjuvyavahāraṃ tajjātapuruṣaiḥ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: [Thus ends Chapter , Regulation of Tolldues, in Book , The Duties of Government Superintendents of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / ūrṇāvalkakārpāsatūlaśaṇakṣaumāṇi ca vidhavānyaṅgākanyāpravrajitādaṇḍapratikāriṇībhī rūpaājīvāmātṛkābhir vṛddharājadāsībhir vyuparataupasthānadevadāsībhiś ca kartayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE Superintendent of Weaving shall employ qualified persons to manufacture threads sútra, coats varma, cloths vastra, and ropes Widows, cripple women, girls, mendicant or ascetic women pravrajitá, women compelled to work in default of paying fines dandápratikáriní, mothers of prostitutes, old womenservants of the king, and prostitutes devadási who have ceased to attend temples on service shall be employed to cut wool, fibre, cotton, panicle túla, hemp, and flax

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ślakṣṇasthūlamadhyatāṃ ca sūtrasya viditvā vetanaṃ kalpayet, bahvalpatāṃ ca // sūtrapramāṇa jñātvā tailaāmalakaudvartanair etā anugṛhṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Wages shall be fixed according as the threads spun are fine, coarse sthúla, ie, big or of middle quality and in proportion to a greater or less quantity manufactured, and in consideration of the quantity of thread spun, those who turn out a greater quantity shall be presented with oil and dried cakes of myrobalan fruits tailámalakódvartanaih

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tithiṣu pratimānadānaiś ca karma kārayitavyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra They may also be made to work on holidays tithishu by payment of special rewards prativápadánamánaih

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sūtrahrāse vetanahrāso dravyasārāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Wages shall be cut short, if making allowance for the quality of raw material, the quantity of the threads spun out is found to fall short

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛtakarmapramāṇakālavetanaphalaniṣpattibhiḥ kārubhiś ca karma kārayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Weaving may also be done by those artisans who are qualified to turn out a given amount of work in a given time and for a fixed amount of wages

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratisaṃsargaṃ ca gacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The superintendent shall closely associate with the workmen

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣaumadukūlakrimitānarāṅkavakārpāsasūtravānakarmaantāṃś ca prayuñjāno gandhamālyadānair anyaiś caaupagrāhikair ārādhayet
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who manufacture fibrous cloths, raiments, silkcloths, woollen cloths, and cotton fabrics shall be rewarded by presentations such as scents, garlands of flowers, or any other prizes of encouragement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vastraāstaraṇaprāvaraṇavikalpān utthāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Various kinds of garments, blankets, and curtains shall be manufactured

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kaṅkaṭakarmaantāṃś ca tajjātakāruśilpibhiḥ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who are acquainted with the work shall manufacture mail armour

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yāś caaniṣkāsinyaḥ proṣitā vidhavā nyaṅgāḥ kanyakā vāātmānaṃ bibhṛyuḥ tāḥ svadāsībhir anusārya saupagrahaṃ karma kārayitavyāḥ svayam āgacchantīnāṃ vā sūtraśālāṃ pratyuṣasi bhāṇḍavetanavinimayaṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those women who do not stir out of their houses anishkásinyah, those whose husbands are gone abroad, and those who are cripple or girls may, when obliged to work for subsistence, be provided with work spinning out threads in due courtesy through the medium of maidservants of the weaving establishment Those women who can present themselves at the weaving house shall at dawn be enabled to exchange their spinnings for wages bhándavetanavinimayam

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sūtraparīkṣāarthamātraḥ pradīpaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Only so much light as is enough Kautilyas Arthashastra to examine the threads shall be kept

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: striyā mukhasaṃdarśaneanyakāryasambhāṣāyāṃ vā pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the superintendent looks at the face of such women or talks about any other work, he shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vetanakālaatipātane madhyamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Delay in paying the wages shall be punished with the middlemost amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akṛtakarmavetanapradāne ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Likewise when wages are paid for work that is not completed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gṛhītvā vetanaṃ karmaakurvatyā aṅguṣṭhasaṃdaṃśaṃ dāpayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: She who, having received wages, does not turn out the work shall have her thumb cut off

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhakṣitaapahṛtaavaskanditānāṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who misappropriate, steal, or run away with, the raw material supplied to them shall be similarly punished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vetaneṣu ca karmakarāṇām aparādhato daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Weavers, when guilty, shall be fined out of their wages in proportion to their offences

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rajjuvartakair varmakāraiś ca svayaṃ saṃsṛjyeta // bhāṇḍāni ca varatraādīni vartayet // sūtravalkamayī rajjur varatrā vaitravaiṇavīḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The superintendent shall closely associate with those who manufacture ropes and mail armour and shall carry on the manufacture of straps varatra and other commodities He shall carry on the manufacture of ropes from threads and fibres and of straps from cane and bamboo bark, with which beasts for draught are trained or tethered

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāmnāhyā bandhanīyāś ca yānayugyasya karayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: End of the fortyfourth chapter from the beginning] CHAPTER THE SUPERINTENDENT OF AGRICULTURE

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sītāadhyakṣaḥ kṛṣitantraśulbavṛkṣaāyurvedajñas tajjñasakho vā sarvadhānyapuṣpaphalaśākakandamūlavāllikyakṣaumakārpāsabījāni yathākālaṃ gṛhṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: POSSESSED of the knowledge of the science of agriculture Kautilyas Arthashastra dealing with the plantation of bushes and trees krishitantragulmavrikshsháyurvedajñah, or assisted by those who are trained in such sciences, the superintendent of agriculture shall in time collect the seeds of all kinds of grains, flowers, fruits, vegetables, bulbous roots, roots, pállikya ?, fibreproducing plants, and cotton

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bahuhalaparikṛṣṭāyāṃ svabhūmau dāsakarmakaradaṇḍapratikartṛbhir vāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall employ slaves, labourers, and prisoners dandapratikartri to sow the seeds on crownlands which have been often and satisfactorily ploughed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karṣaṇayantraupakaraṇabalīvardaiś caeṣām asaṅgaṃ kārayet, kārubhiś ca karmārakuṭṭākamedakarajjuvartakasarpagrāhaādibhiś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The work of the above men shall not suffer on account of any want in ploughs karshanayantra and other necessary instruments or of bullocks Nor shall there be any delay in procuring to them the assistence of blacksmiths, carpenters, borers medaka, ropemakers, as well as those who catch snakes, and similar persons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ karmaphalavinipāte tatphalahānaṃ daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any loss due to the above persons shall be punished with a fine equal to the loss

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṣoḍaśadroṇaṃ jāṅgalānāṃ varṣapramāṇam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The quantity of rain that falls in the country of jángala is dronas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: adhyardham ānūpānāṃ deśavāpānām, ardhatrayodaśaaśmakānām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: half as much more in moist countries anúpánám; as to the countries which are fit for agriculture désavápánam;½ dronas in the country of asmakas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: trayoviṃśatir avantīnām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: dronas in avantí;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: amitam aparaantānāṃ haimanyānāṃ ca, kulyāāvāpānāṃ ca kālataḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and an immense quantity in western countries aparántánám, the borders of the Himalayas, and the countries where water channels are made use of in agriculture kulyávápánám

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: varṣatribhāgaḥ pūrvapaścimamāsayoḥ, dvau tribhāgau madhyamayoḥ suṣamārūpam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When onethird of the requisite quantity of rain falls both during the commencement and closing months of the rainy season and twothirds in the middle, then the rainfall is considered very even sushumárúpam

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaupaladhir bṛhaspateḥ sthānagamanagarbhaādhānebhyaḥ śukraudayaastamayacārebhyaḥ sūryasya prakṛtivaikṛtāc ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra A forecast of such rainfall can be made by observing the position, motion, and pregnancy garbhádána of the Jupiter Brihaspati, the rise and set and motion of the Venus, and the natural or unnatural aspect of the sun

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sūryād bījasiddhiḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: From the sun, the sprouting of the seeds can be inferred;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bṛhaspateḥ sasyānāṃ stambakāritā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: from the position of the Jupiter, the formation of grains stambakarita can be inferred;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śukrād vṛṣṭiḥ / iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and from the movements of the Venus, rainfall can be inferred

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: trayaḥ saptaahikā meghā aśītiḥ kaṇaśīkarāḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Three are the clouds that continuously rain for seven days; eighty are they that pour minute drops;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṣaṣṭir ātapameghānām eṣā vṛṣṭiḥ samā hitā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and sixty are they that appear with the sunshinethis is termed rainfall

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vātam ātapayogaṃ ca vibhajan yatra varṣati / trīn karīṣāṃś ca janayaṃs tatra sasyaāgamo dhruvaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Where rain, free from wind and unmingled with sunshine, falls so as to render three turns of ploughing possible, there the reaping of good harvest is certain

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ prabhūtaudakam alpaudakaṃ vā sasyaṃ vāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence, ie, according as the rainfall is more or less, the superintendent shall sow the seeds which require either more or less water

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śālivrīhikodravatilapriyaṅguudārakavarakāḥ pūrvavāpāḥ // mudgamāṣaśaimbyā madhyavāpāḥ // kusumbhamasūrakulatthayavagodhūmakalāyaatasīsarṣapāḥ paścādvāpāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sáli a kind of rice, vríhi rice, kodrava Paspalum Scrobiculatum, tila sesamum, priyangu panic seeds, dáraka ?, and varaka Phraseolus Trilobus are to be sown at the commencement púrvávápah of the rainy season Mudga Phraseolus Mungo, másha Phraseolus Radiatus, and saibya ? are to be sown in the middle of the season

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathāṛtuvaśena vā bījavāpāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or seeds may be sown according to the changes of the Kautilyas Arthashastra season

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vāpaatiriktam ardhasītikāḥ kuryuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Fields that are left unsown vápátiriktam, ie, owing to the inadequacy of hands may be brought under cultivation by employing those who cultivate for half the share in the produce ardhasítiká;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svavīryaupajīvino vā caturthapañcabhāgikāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: or those who live by their own physical exertion svavíryopajívinah may cultivate such fields for ¼th or /th of the produce grown;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathāiṣṭam anavasitabhāgaṃ dadyuḥ, anyatra kṛcchrebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: or they may pay to the king as much as they can without entailing any hardship upon themselves anavasitam bhágam, with the exception of their own private lands that are difficult to cultivate

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svasetubhyo hastaprāvartimam udakabhāgaṃ pañcamaṃ dadyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who cultivate irrigating by manual labour hastaprávartimam shall pay /th of the produce as waterrate udakabhágam;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: skandhaprāvartimaṃ caturtham, srotoyantraprāvartimaṃ ca tṛtīyam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: by carrying water on shoulders skandhaprávartimam ¼th of the produce; by waterlifts srotoyantraprávartimam, ⅓rd of the produce;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: caturthaṃ nadīsarastaṭākakūpauddhāṭam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and by raising water from rivers, lakes, tanks, and wells nadisarastatákakúpodghátam,⅓rd or ¼th of the produce

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmaudakapramāṇena kaidāraṃ haimanaṃ graiṣmikaṃ vā sasyaṃ sthāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The superintendent shall grow wet crops kedára, wintercrops haimana, or summer crops graishmika according to the supply of workmen and water

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śālyādi jyeṣṭham,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Ricecrops and the like are the best jyáshtha, ie, to grow;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṣaṇḍo madhyamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: vegetables shanda are of intermediate nature;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ikṣuḥ pratyavaraḥ // ikṣavo hi bahvābādhā vyayagrāhiṇaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and sugarcane crops ikshu are the worst pratyavarah, ie, very difficult to grow, for they are subject to various evils and require much care and expenditure to reap

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: phenaāghāto vallīphalānām, parīvāhaantāḥ pippalīmṛdvīkaikṣūṇām, kūpaparyantāḥ śākamūlānām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Lands that are beaten by foam phenághátah, ie, banks of rivers, etc are suitable for growing vallíphala pumpkin, gourd and the like; lands that are frequently overflown by water paríváhánta for long pepper, grapes mridvíká, and sugarcane;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: haraṇīparyantā haritakānām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: low grounds hariníparyantáh for green crops;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pālyo lavānāṃ gandhabhaiṣajyauśīrahrīberapiṇḍālukaādīnām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and marginal furrows between any two rows of crops are suitable for the plantation of fragrant plants, medicinal herbs, cascus roots usínara, híra ?, beraka ?, and pindáluka lac and the like

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathāsvaṃ bhūmiṣu ca sthālyāś caānūpyāś caoṣadhīḥ sthāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such medicinal herbs as grow in marshy grounds are to be grown not only in grounds suitable for them, but also in pots sthályam

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tuṣārapāyanamuṣṇaśoṣaṇaṃ caāsaptarātrād iti dhānyabījānām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The seeds of grains are to be exposed to mist and heat tushárapáyanamushnam cha for seven nights;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: trirātraṃ vā pañcarātraṃ vā kośīdhānyānām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the seeds of kosi are treated similarly for three nights;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: madhughṛtasūkaravasābhiḥ śakṛdyuktābhiḥ kāṇḍabījānāṃ chedalepo, madhughṛtena kandānām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the seeds of sugarcane and the like kándabíjánam are plastered at the cut end with the mixture of honey, clarified butter, the fat of hogs, and cowdung; the seeds of bulbous roots kanda with honey and clarified butter;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: asthibījānāṃ śakṛdālepaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: cotton seeds asthibíja with cowdung;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śākhināṃ gartadāho goasthiśakṛdbhiḥ kāle dauhrdaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and water pits at the root of trees are to be burnt and manured with the bones and dung of cows on proper occasions

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prarūḍhāṃś caaśuṣkakaṭumatsyāṃś ca snuhikṣīreṇa pāyayet // kārpāsasāraṃ nirmokaṃ sarpasya ca samāharet /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The sprouts of seeds, when grown, are to be manured with a fresh haul of minute fishes and irrigated with the milk of snuhi Euphorbia Antiquorum

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na sarpās tatra tiṣṭhanti dhūmo yatraeṣa tiṣṭhati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Where there is the smoke caused by burning the essence of cotton seeds and the slough of a snake, there snakes will not stay

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvajījānāṃ tu prathamavāpe suvarṇaudakasamplutāṃ pūrvamuṣṭiṃ vāpayed, amuṃ ca mantraṃ brūyāt prajāpataye kāśyapāya devāya ca namaḥ sadā /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Always while sowing seeds, a handful of seeds bathed in water with a piece of gold shall be sown first and the following mantra recited Prajápatye Kasyapáya déváya Sadá Sítá medhyatám déví bíjéshu Kautilyas Arthashastra dhanéshu cha Chandaváta hé Salutation to God Prajápati Kasyapa

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sītā me ṛdhyatāṃ devī bījeṣu ca dhaneṣu ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Agriculture may always flourish and the Goddess may reside in seeds and wealth

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṣaṇḍavāṭagopālakadāsakarmakarebhyo yathāpuruṣaparivāpaṃ bhaktaṃ kuryāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Channdavata he Provisions shall be supplied to watchmen, slaves and labourers in proportion to the amount of work done by them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sapādapaṇikaṃ ca māsaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They shall be paid a panaandaquarter per mensem

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmaanurūpaṃ kārubhyo bhaktavetanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Artisans shall be provided with wages and provision in proportion to the amount of work done by them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: praśīrṇaṃ ca puṣpaphalaṃ devakāryaarthaṃ vrīhiyavam āgrayaṇaarthaṃ śrotriyās tapasvinaś caāhareyuḥ, rāśimūlam uñchavṛttayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those that are learned in the Vedas and those that are engaged in making penance may take from the fields ripe flowers and fruits for the purpose of worshipping their gods, and rice and barley for the purpose of performing ágrayana, a sacrificial performance at the commencement of harvest season, also those who live by gleaning grains in fields may gather grains where grains had been accumulated and removed from

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathākālaṃ ca sasyaādi jātaṃ jātaṃ praveśayet /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Grains and other crops shall be collected as often as they are harvested

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na kṣetre sthāpayet kiṃcit palālam api paṇḍitaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: No wise man shall leave anything in the fields, nor even chaff

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prākārāṇāṃ samucchrayān valabhīr vā tathāvidhāḥ /
