Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Crops, when reaped, shall be heaped up in high piles or in the form of turrets

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na saṃhatāni kurvīta na tucchāni śirāṃsi ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The piles of crops shall not be kept close, nor shall their tops be small or low

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: khalasya prakarān kuryān maṇḍalaante samāśritān / anagnikāḥ saudakāś ca khale syuḥ parikarmiṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Workmen in the fields shall always have water but no fire [Thus ends Chapter , The Superintendent of Agriculture in Book , The Duties of Government Superintendents of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: surāadhyakṣaḥ surākiṇvavyavahārān durge janapade skandhaāvāre vā tajjātasurākiṇvavyavahāribhiḥ kārayed,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE SUPERINTENDENT OF LIQUOR BY employing such men as are acquainted with the manufacture of liquor and ferments kinva, the Superintendent of Liquor shall carry on liquortraffic not only in forts and country parts, but also in camps

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ekamukham anekamukhaṃ vā vikrayakrayavaśena vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In accordance with the requirements of demand and supply krayavikrayavasena he may either centralize or decentralize the sale of liquor

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṣaṭśatam atyayam anyatra kartṛkretṛvikretṛṛṇāṃ sthāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A fine of 00 panas shall be imposed on all offenders other than those who are manufacturers, purchasers, or sellers in liquortraffic

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: grāmād anirṇayaṇam asampātaṃ ca surāyāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Liquor shall not be taken out of villages, nor shall liquor shops be close to each other

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pramādabhayāt karmasu ñjirdiṣṭānām, maryādaatikramabhayād āryāṇām, utsāhabhayāc ca tīṣkṇānām // lakṣitam alpaṃ vā caturbhāgam ardhakuḍubaṃ kuḍubam ardhaprasthaṃ prasthaṃ vāiti jñātaśaucā nirhareyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Lest workmen spoil the work in hand, and Aryas violate their decency and virtuous character, and lest firebrands commit indiscreet acts, liquor shall be sold to persons of well known character in such small quantities as onefourth or halfakudumba, one kudumba, halfaprastha, or one prastha Those who are well known and of pure character may take liquor out of shop

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pānaagāreṣu vā pibeyur asaṃcāriṇaḥ // nikṣepaupanidhiprayogaapahṛtānām aniṣṭaupagatānāṃ ca dravyāṇāṃ jñānaartham asvāmikaṃ kupyaṃ hiraṇyaṃ caupalabhya niṣkeptāram anyatra vyapadeśena grāhayed,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or all may be compelled to drink liquor within the shops and not allowed to stir out at once in view of detecting articles such as sealed deposits, unsealed deposits, commodities given for repair, stolen articles, and the like which the customers may have acquired by foul means When they are found to possess gold and other articles not their own, the superintendent shall contrive to cause them to be arrested outside the shop

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ativyayakartāram anāyativyayaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Likewise those who are too extravagant or spend beyond their income shall be arrested

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na caanargheṇa kālikāṃ vā surāṃ dadyād, anyatra duṣṭasurāyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra No fresh liquor other than bad liquor shall be sold below its price

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tām anyatra vikrāpayet // dāsakarmakarebhyo vā vetanaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Bad liquor may be sold elsewhere or given to slaves or workmen in lieu of wages;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vāhanapratipānaṃ sūkarapoṣaṇaṃ vā dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: or it may form the drink of beasts for draught or the subsistence of hogs

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pānaagārāṇyanekakakṣyāṇi vibhaktaśayanaāsanavanti pānauddeśāni gandhamālyaudakavanti ṛtusukhāni kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Liquor shops shall contain many rooms provided with beds and seats kept apart The drinking room shall contain scents, garlands of flowers, water, and other comfortable things suitable to the varying seasons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatrasthāḥ prakṛtyautpattikau vyayau gūḍhā vidyuḥ, āgantūṃś ca // kretṛṛṇāṃ mattasuptānām alaṅkārātchādanahiraṇyāni ca vidyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Spies stationed in the shops shall ascertain whether the expenditure incurred by customers in the shop is ordinary or extraordinary and also whether there are any strangers They shall also ascertain the value of the dress, ornaments, and gold of the customers lying there under intoxication

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tannāśe vaṇijas tac ca tāvac ca daṇḍaṃ dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When customers under intoxication lose any of their things, the merchants of the shop shall not only make good the loss, but also pay an equivalent fine

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaṇijaśs tu saṃvṛteṣu kakṣyāvibhāgeṣu svadāsībhiḥ peśalarūpābhir āgantūnāṃ vāstavyānāṃ caāryarūpāṇāṃ mattasuptānāṃ bhāvaṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Merchants seated in halfclosed rooms shall observe the appearance of local and foreign customers who, in real or false guise of Aryas lie down in intoxication along with their beautiful mistresses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: medakaprasannaāsavaariṣṭamaireyamadhūnām // udakadroṇaṃ taṇḍulānām ardhaāḍhakaṃ trayaḥ prasthāḥ kiṇvasyaiti medakayogaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of various kinds of liquor such as medaka, prasanna, ásava, arista, maireya, and madhu Medaka is manufactured with one drona of water, half, an ádaka of rice, and three prastha of kinva ferment

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvādaśaāḍhakaṃ piṣṭasya pañca prasthāḥ kiṇvasya kramukatvakphalayukto vā jātisambhāraḥ prasannāyogaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Twelve ádhakas of flour pishta, five prasthas of kinva ferment, with the addition of spices játisambhára together with the bark and fruits of putraká a species of tree constitute prasanná

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kapitthatulā phāṇitaṃ pañcataulikaṃ prastho madhuna ity āsavayogaḥ // pādadhiko jyeṣṭhaḥ pādahīnaḥ kaniṣṭhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 Onehundred palas of kapittha Feronia Elephantum 00 palas of phánita sugar, and one prastha of honey madhu form ásava With an increase of onequarter of the above ingredients, a superior kind of ásava is manufactured;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: cikitsakapramāṇāḥ pratyekaśo vikārāṇām ariṣṭāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The preparation of various kinds of arishta for various diseases are to be learnt from physicians

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: meṣaśṛṅgītvakkvāthaabhiṣuto guḍapratīvāpaḥ pippalīmaricasambhāras triphalāyukto vā maireyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A sour gruel or decoction of the bark of meshasringi a kind of poison mixed with jaggery guda and with the powder of long pepper and black pepper or with the powder of triphala Terminalia Chebula, Terminalia Bellerica, and Phyllanthus Emblica forms Maireya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: guḍayuktānāṃ vā sarveṣāṃ triphalāsambhāraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: To all kinds of liquor mixed with jaggery, the powder of triphala is always added

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mṛdvīkāraso madhu //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The juice of grapes is termed madhu

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasya svadeśo vyākhyānaṃ kāpiśāyanaṃ hārahūrakam iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Its own native place svadesa is the commentary on such of its various forms as kápisáyana and hárahúraka

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: māṣakalanīdroṇamāmaṃ siddhaṃ vā tribhāgaadhikataṇḍulaṃ moraṭaādīnāṃ kārṣikabhāgayuktaṃ kiṇvabandhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: One drona of either boiled or unboiled paste of másha Phraseolus Radiatus, three parts more of rice, and one karsha of morata Alangium Hexapetalum and the like form kinva ferment

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pāṭhāloghratejovatyelāvālukamadhukamadhurasāpriyaṅgudāruharidrāmaricapippalīnāṃ ca pañcakārṣikaḥ sambhārayogo medakasya
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the manufacture of medaka and prasanna, five karshas of the powder of each of páthá Clypea Hermandifolio, lodhra Symplocos Racemosa, tejovati Piper Chaba, eláváluka Solanum Melongena honey, the juice of grapes madhurasa, priyangu panic seeds, dáruharidra a species of turmeric black Kautilyas Arthashastra pepper and long pepper are added as sambhára, requisite spices

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: madhukaniryūhayuktā kaṭaśarkarā varṇaprasādanī ca // cocacitrakavilaṅgagajapippalīnāṃ ca kārṣikaḥ kramukamadhukamustālodhrāṇāṃ dvikārṣikaś caāsavasambhāraḥ // daśabhāgaś caeṣāṃ bījabandhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The requisite quantity of spices to be added to ásava is one karshá of the powder of each of chocha bark of cinnamon, chitraka Plumbago Zeylanica, vilanga, and gajapippalí Scindapsus Officinalis, and two karshas of the powder of each of kramuka betel nut, madhúka Bassia Latifolia, mustá Cyprus Rotundus, and lodhra Symlocos Racemosa The addition of onetenth of the above ingredients ie, chocha, kramuka, etc, is termed bíjabandha

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prasannāyogaḥ śvetasurāyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same ingredients as are added to prasanná are also added to white liquor svetasurá

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sahakārasurā rasauttarā bījauttarā vā mahāsurā sambhārikī vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The liquor that is manufactured from mango fruits sahakárasurá may contain a greater proportion of mango essence rasottara, or of spices bíjottara It is called mahásura when it contains sambhára spices as described above

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / tāsāṃ moraṭāpalāśapattūrameṣaśṛṅgīkarañjakṣīravṛkṣakaṣāyabhāvitaṃ dagdhakaṭaśarkarācūrṇaṃ loghracitrakavilaṅgapāṭhāmustākaliṅgayavadāruharidraindīvaraśatapuṣpaapāmārgasaptaparṇanimbaāsphotakalkaardhayuktam antarnakho muṣṭiḥ kumbhīṃ rājapeyāṃ prasādayati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a handful antarnakho mushtih, ie, so much as can be held in the hand, the fingers being so bent that the nails cannot be seen of the powder of granulated sugar dissolved in the decoction of moratá Alangium Hexapetalum, palása Butea Frondosa, dattúra Dattura Fastuosa, karanja Robinia Mitis, meshasringa a kind of poison and the bark of milky trees kshiravriksha mixed with onehalf of the paste formed by combining the powders of lodhra Symplocos Racemosa, chitraka Plumbago Zeylanica, vilanga, páthá clypea Hermandifolia, mustá cyprus Rotundus, kaláya leguminous seeds, dáruharidra Amonum Kautilyas Arthashastra Xanthorrhizon, indívara blue lotus, satapushpa Anethum Sowa, apámárga Achyranthes Aspera saptaparna Echites Scholaris, and nimba Nimba Melia is added to even a kumbha of liquor payable by the king, it renders it very pleasant

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: phāṇitaḥ pañcapalikaś caatra rasavṛddhir deyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Five palas of phánita sugar are added to the above in order to increase its flavour

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kuṭumbinaḥ kṛtyeṣu śvetasurām, auṣadhaarthaṃ vāriṣṭam, anyad vā kartuṃ labheran //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On special occasions krityeshu, people kutumbinah, ie, families shall be allowed to manufacture white liquor svetasura, arishta for use in diseases, and other kinds of liquor

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: utsavasamājayātrāsu caturahaḥ sauriko deyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On the occasions of festivals, fairs samája, and pilgrimage, right of manufacture of liquor for four days chaturahassaurikah shall be allowed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣv ananujñātānāṃ prahavanaantaṃ daivasikam atyayaṃ gṛhṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The Superintendent shall collect the daily fines daivasikamatyayam, ie, license fees from those who on these occasions are permitted to manufacture liquor

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: surākiṇvavicayaṃ striyo bālāś ca kuryuḥ // arājapaṇyāḥ pañcakaṃ śataṃ śulkaṃ dadyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Women and children shall collect „sura,‟ and „kinva,‟ „ferment‟ Those who deal with liquor other than that of the king shall pay five percent as toll

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: surakāmedakaariṣṭamadhuphalaāmlaāmlaśīdhūnāṃ ca // ahnaś ca vikrayaṃ jñātvā vyājīṃ mānahiraṇyayoḥ / tathā vaidharaṇaṃ kuryād ucitaṃ caanuvartayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: With regard to sura, medaka, arishta, wine, phalámla acid drinks prepared from fruits, and ámlasídhu spirit distilled from molasses Having ascertained the days sale of the above kinds of liquor, the difference of royal and public measures mánavyáji, and the excessive amount of sale proceeds realised thereby, the Superintendent shall fix the amount of compensation vaidharana due to the king from local or foreign merchants for entailing loss on the kings liquor traffic and shall always adopt the best course

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sūnāadhyakṣaḥ pradiṣṭaabhayānām abhayavanavāsināṃ ca mṛgapaśupakṣimatsyānāṃ bandhavadhahiṃsāyām uttamaṃ daṇḍaṃ kārayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE SUPERINTENDENT OF SLAUGHTERHOUSE WHEN a person entraps, kills, or molests deer, bison, birds, and fish which are declared to be under State protection or which live in forests under Stateprotection abhayáranya, he shall be punished with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kuṭumbinām abhayavanaparigraheṣu madhyamam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Householders trespassing in forest preserves shall be punished with the middlemost amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: apravṛttavadhānāṃ matsyapakṣiṇāṃ bandhavadhahiṃsāyāṃ pādaūnasaptaviṃśatipaṇam atyayaṃ kuryāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person entraps, kills, or molests either fish or birds that do not prey upon other animals, he shall be fined ¾ panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mṛgapaśūnāṃ dviguṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and when he does the same to deer and other beasts, he shall be fined twice as much

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pravṛttahiṃsānām aparigṛhītānāṃ ṣaḍbhāgaṃ gṛhṇīyāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of beasts of prey that have been captured, the Superintendent shall take onesixth;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: matsyapakṣiṇāṃ daśabhāgaṃ vāadhikam, mṛgapaśūnāṃ śulkaṃ vāadhikam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: of fish and birds of similar nature, he shall take onetenth or more than onetenth; and of deer and other beasts mrigapasu, onetenth or more than onetenth as toll

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pakṣimṛgāṇāṃ jīvat ṣaḍbhāgam abhayavaneṣu pramuñcet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Onesixth of live animals such as birds and beasts shall be let off in forests under Stateprotection

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / sāmudrahastyaśvapuruṣavṛṣagardabhaākṛtayo matsyāḥ sārasā naādeyās taṭākakulyāudbhavā vā krauñcautkrośakadātyūhahaṃsacakravākajīvanjīvakabhṛṅgarājacakoramattakokilamayūraśukamadanaśārikā vihārapakṣiṇo maṅgalyāś caanyeapi prāṇinaḥ pakṣimṛgā hiṃsābādhebhyo rakṣyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Elephants, horses or animals having the form of a man, bull or Kautilyas Arthashastra an ass living in oceans as well as fish in tanks, lakes, channels and rivers; and such gamebirds as krauncha a kind of heron, utkrosaka osprey, dátyúha a sort of cuckoo, hamsa flamingo, chakraváka a brahmany duck, jivanjívaka a kind of pheasant, bhringarája Lanius Malabaricus, chakora partridge, mattakokila cuckoo, peacock, parrot, and maina madanasárika as well as other auspicious animals, whether birds or beasts, shall be protected from all kinds of molestations

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rakṣāatikrame pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who violate the above rule shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mṛgapaśūnām anasthimāṃsaṃ sadyohataṃ vikrīṇīran // asthimataḥ pratipātaṃ dadyuḥ // tulāhīne hīnaaṣṭaguṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Butchers shall sell fresh and boneless flesh of beasts mrigapasu just killed If they sell bony flesh, they shall give an equivalent compensation pratipákam If there is any diminution in weight owing to the use of a false balance, they shall give eight times the diminution

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vatso vṛṣo dhenuś caeṣām avadhyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who slaughters or tortures them to death shall be fined 0 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kliṣṭaghātaṃ ghātayataś ca // pariśūnam aśiraḥpādaasthi vigandhaṃ svayaṃmṛtaṃ ca na vikrīṇīran //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The flesh of animals which have been killed outside the slaughterhouse parisúnam, headless, legless and boneless flesh, rotten flesh, and the flesh of animals which have suddenly died shall not be sold

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyathā dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Otherwise a fine of panas shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: duṣṭāḥ paśumṛgavyālā matsyaś caabhayacāriṇaḥ / anyatra guptisthānebhyo vadhabandham avāpnuyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Cattle, wild beasts, elephants vyala, and fish living in forests under State protection shall, if they become of vicious Kautilyas Arthashastra nature, be entrapped and killed outside the forest preserve

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gaṇikāadhyakṣo gaṇikāanvayām agaṇikāanvayāṃ vā rūpayauvanaśilpasampannāṃ sahasreṇa gaṇikāṃ kārayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE Superintendent of Prostitutes shall employ at the kings court on a salary of ,000 panas per annum a prostitute ganiká, whether born or not born of a prostitutes family, and noted for her beauty, youth, and accomplishments

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kuṭumbaardhena pratigaṇikām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A rival prostitute pratiganiká on half the above salary kutumbárdhéna shall also be appointed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: niṣpatitāpretayor duhitā bhaginī vā kuṭumbaṃ bhareta, mātā vā pratigaṇikāṃ sthāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whenever such a prostitute goes abroad or dies, her daughter or sister shall act for her and receive her property and salary Or her mother may substitute another prostitute

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tāsām abhāve rājā haret //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the absence of any of these, the king himself shall take the property

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saubhāgyaalaṃkāravṛddhyā sahasreṇa vāraṃ kaniṣṭhaṃ madhyamam uttamaṃ vāāropayet chatrabhṛṅgāravyajanaśibikāpīṭhikāratheṣu
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: With a view to add to the splendour of prostitutes holding the royal umbrella, golden pitcher, and fan, and attending upon the king seated on his royal litter, throne, or chariot, prostitutes shall be classified as of first, middle and highest rank according to their beauty and splendid jewellery;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ca viśeṣaartham //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: likewise their salary shall be fixed by thousands

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saubhāgyabhaṅge mātṛkāṃ kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: She who has lost her beauty shall be appointed as a nurse mátriká

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: niṣkrayaś caturviṃśatisāhasro gaṇikāyāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra A prostitute shall pay ,000 panas as ransom to regain her liberty;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvādaśasāhasro gaṇikāputrasya //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and a prostitutes son ,000 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aṣṭavarṣāt prabhṛti rājñaḥ kuśīlavakarma kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: From the age of eight years, a prostitute shall hold musical performance before the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gaṇikādāsī bhagnabhogā koṣṭhaagāre mahānase vā karma kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those prostitutes, female slaves, and old women who are incapable of rendering any service in the form of enjoyment bhagnabhogáh shall work in the storehouse or kitchen of the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aviśantī sapādapaṇam avaruddhā māsavetanaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A prostitute who, putting herself under the protection of a private person, ceases to attend the kings court shall pay a panaandaquarter per mensem to the Government

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhogaṃ dāyamāyaṃ vyayam āyatiṃ ca gaṇikāyā nibandhayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The superintendent shall determine the earnings, inheritance, income áya, expenditure, and future earnings áyati of every prostitute

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ativyayakarma ca vārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall also check their extravagant expenditure

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mātṛhastād anyatra abharaṇanyāse sapādacatuṣpaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a prostitute puts her jewellery in the hands of any person but her mother, she shall be fined ¼ panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svāpateyaṃ vikrayam ādhānaṃ vā nayantyāḥ sapādapañcāśatpaṇaḥ paṇoardhapaṇacchedane //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If she sells or mortgages her property svapateyam, she shall be fined 0¼ panas A prostitute shall be fined panas for defamation; twice as much for causing hurt; and 0¼ panas as well as ½ panas for cutting off the ear of any person

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akāmāyāḥ kumāryā vā sāhase uttamo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man has connection with a prostitute against her will or with a prostitute girl kumári, he shall be punished with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sakāmāyāḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But when he has connection with a willing Kautilyas Arthashastra prostitute, under age, he shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gaṇikām akāmāṃ rundhato niṣpātayato vā vraṇavidāraṇena vā rūpaṃupaghnataḥ sahasraṃ daṇḍaḥ // sthānviśeṣeṇa vā daṇḍavṛddhiḥ āniṣkrayadviguṇāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man keeps under confinement, or abducts, a prostitute against her will, or disfigures her by causing hurt, he shall be fined ,000 panas or more rising up to twice the amount of her ransom nishkraya according to the circumstances of the crime and the position and the status of the prostitute sthánaviseshena

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prāptaadhikāraṃ gaṇikāṃ ghatayato niṣkrayatriguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man causes hurt to a prostitute appointed at the court praptádhikáram, he shall be fined thrice the amount of her ransom

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mātṛkāduhitṛkārūpadāsīnāṃ ghāte uttamaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man causes hurt to a prostitutes mother, to her young daughter, or to a rúpadási, he shall be punished with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvatra prathameaparādhe prathamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In all cases of offences, punishment for offences committed for the first time shall be the first amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvitīye dviguṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: twice as much for offences committed for a second time;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tṛtīye triguṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: thrice as much for the third time;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: caturthe yathākāmī syāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and for offences committed for the fourth time, the king may impose any punishment he likes

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājaājñayā puruṣam anabhigacchantī gaṇikā śiphāsahasraṃ labheeta, pañcasahasraṃ vā daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a prostitute does not yield her person to any one under the orders of the king, she shall receive 000 lashes with a whip or pay a fine of ,000 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhogaṃ gṛhītvā dviṣatyā bhogadviguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When having received the requisite amount of fees, a prostitute dislikes to yield her person, she shall be fined twice the amount of the fees

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vasatibhogaapahāre bhogam aṣṭaguṇaṃ dadyād anyatra vyādhipuruṣadoṣebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When, in her own house, a prostitute deprives her paramour of his enjoyment, she shall be fined eight times the amount of the fees unless the paramour happens to be unassociable on account of disease and personal defects

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: puruṣaṃ ghnatyāś citāpratāpeapsu praveśanaṃ vā // gaṇikābharaṇam arthaṃ bhogaṃ vāapaharatoaṣṭaguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra When a prostitute murders her paramour, she shall be burnt alive or thrown into water When a paramour steals the jewellery or money of, or deceives to pay the fees due to, a prostitute, he shall be fined eight times that amount

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gaṇikā bhogam āyatiṃ puruṣaṃ ca nivedayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Every prostitute shall supply information to the superintendent as to the amount of her daily fees bhoga, her future income áyati, and the paramour under her influence

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: etena naṭanartakagāyanavādakavāgjīvanakuśīlavaplavakasaubhikacāraṇānāṃ strīvyavahāriṇāṃ striyo gūḍhaājīvāś ca vyākhyātāḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rules shall apply to an actor, dancer, singer, player on musical instruments, a buffoon vágjivana, a mimic player kusílava, ropedancer plavaka, a juggler saubhika, a wandering bard or herald chárana, pimps, and unchaste women

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ tūryam āgantukaṃ pañcapaṇaṃ prekṣāvetanaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When persons of the above description come from foreign countries to hold their performances, they shall pay panas as license fee prekshávetana

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rūpaājīvā bhogadvayaguṇaṃ māsaṃ dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Every prostitute rúpájivá shall pay every month twice the amount of a days earning bhogadvigunam to the Government

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / gītavādyapāṭhyanṛtyanāṭyaakṣaracitravīṇāveṇumṛdaṅgaparacittajñānagandhamālyasamyūhanasaṃvādanasaṃvāhanavaiśikakalājñānāni gaṇikā dāsī raṅgaupajīvinīś ca grāhayato rājamaṇḍalād ājīvaṃ kuryāt // gaṇikāputrān raṅgaupajīvināṃ ca mukhyān niṣpādayeyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who teach prostitutes, female slaves, and actresses, arts such as singing, playing on musical instruments, reading, dancing, acting, writing, painting, playing on the instruments like vina, pipe, and drum, reading the thoughts of others, manufacture of scents and garlands, shampooing, and the art of attracting and captivating the mind of others shall be endowed with maintenance from the State They the teachers shall train the sons of prostitutes to be chief actors rangopajívi on the stage

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvatālaavacarāṇāṃ ca // saṃjñābhāṣāantarajñāś ca striyas teṣām anātmasu / cāraghātapramādaarthaṃ prayojyā bandhuvāhanāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The wives of actors and others of similar profession who have Kautilyas Arthashastra been taught various languages and the use of signals sanja shall, along with their relatives, be made use of in detecting the wicked and murdering or deluding foreign spies

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nāvadhyakṣaḥ samudrasamyānanadīmukhatarapracārān devasarovisaronadītarāṃś ca sthānīyaādiṣv avekṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE Superintendent of Ships shall examine the accounts relating to navigation not only on oceans and mouths of rivers, but also on lakes natural or artificial, and rivers in the vicinity of stháníya and other fortified cities

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: matsyabandhakā naukābhāṭakaṃ ṣaḍbhāgaṃ dadyuḥ // pattanaanuvṛttaṃ śulkabhāgaṃ vaṇijo dadyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Villages on seashores or on the banks of rivers and lakes shall pay a fixed amount of tax kliptam Fishermen shall give /th of their haul as fees for fishing license naukáhátakam Merchants shall pay the customary toll levied in porttowns

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yātrāvetanaṃ rājanaubhiḥ sampatantaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Passengers arriving on board the kings ship shall pay the requisite amount of sailing fees yátrávetanam

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śaṅkhamuktāgrāhiṇo naubhāṭakaṃ dadyuḥ, svanaubhir vā tareyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who make use of the king‟s boats in fishing out conchshells and pearls shall pay the requisite amount of hire Naukáhátakam, or they may make use of their own boats

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: adhyakṣaś caeṣāṃ khanyadhyakṣeṇa vyākhyātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 The duties of the superintendent of mines will explain those of the superintendent of conchshells and pearls

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pattanaadhyakṣanibaddhaṃ paṇyapattanacāritraṃ nāvadhyakṣaḥ pālayet // mūḍhavātaāhatā nāvaḥ pitāivaanugṛhṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The superintendent of ships shall strictly observe the customs prevalent in commercial towns as well as the orders of the superintendent of towns pattana, port town Whenever a weatherbeaten ship arrives at a porttown, he shall show fatherly kindness to it

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: udakaprāptaṃ paṇyam aśulkam ardhaśulkaṃ vā kuryāt // yathānirdiṣṭāś caetāḥ paṇyapattanayātrākāleṣu preṣayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Vessels carrying on merchandise spoiled by water may either be exempted from toll or may have their toll reduced to half and let to sail when the time for setting sail approaches

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samyātīr nāvaḥ kṣetraanugatāḥ śulkaṃ yācet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Ships that touch at harbours on their way may be requested the payment of toll

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hiṃsrikā nirghātayet, amitraviṣayaatigāḥ paṇyapattanacāritraupaghātikāś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Pirate ships himsríká, vessels which are bound for the country of an enemy, as well as those which have violated the customs and rules in force in port towns shall be destroyed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śāsakaniryāmakadātraraśmigrāhakautsecakaadhiṣṭhitāś ca mahānāvo hemantagrīṣmatāryāsu mahānadīṣu prayojayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In those large rivers which cannot be forded even during the winter and summer seasons, there shall be launched large boats mahánávah provided with a captain sásaka, a steersman niyámaka, and servants to hold the sickle and the ropes and to pour out water

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣudrikāḥ kṣudrikāsu varṣāsrāviṇīṣu //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Small boats shall be launched in those small rivers which overflow during the rainy season

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bādhatīrthāś caetāḥ kāryā rājadviṣṭakāriṇāṃ taraṇabhayāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Fording or crossing the rivers without permission shall be prohibited lest traitors may cross them and escape

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akāleatīrthe ca tarataḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ // kāle tīrthe caaniṣṛṣṭatāriṇaḥ pādaūnasaptaviṃśatipaṇas taraatyayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person fords or crosses a river outside the proper place and in unusual times, he shall be punished with the first Kautilyas Arthashastra amercement When a man fords or crosses a river at the usual place and time without permission, he shall be fined ¾ panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kaivartakaaṣṭatṛṇabhārapuṣpaphalavāṭaṣaṇḍagopālakānām anatyayaḥ, sambhāvyadūtaanupātināṃ ca senābhāṇḍaprayogāṇāṃ ca svataraṇais taratām, bījabhaktadravyaupaskarāṃś caānūpagrāmāṇāṃ tārayatām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Fishermen, carriers of firewood, grass, flowers, and fruits, gardeners, vegetabledealers, and herdsmen, persons pursuing suspected criminals, messengers following other messengers going in advance, servants engaged to carry things, provisions, and orders to the army, those who use their own ferries, as well as those who supply villages of marshy districts with seeds, necessaries of life, commodities and other accessary things shall be exempted to cross rivers at any time and place

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brāhmaṇapravrajitabālavṛddhavyādhitaśāsanaharagarbhiṇyo nāvadhyakṣamudrābhis tareyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Bráhmans, ascetics pravrajita, children, the aged, the afflicted, royal messengers, and pregnant women shall be provided by the superintendent with free passes to cross rivers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛtapraveśāḥ pāraviṣayikāḥ sārthapramāṇā vā praviśeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Foreign merchants who have often been visiting the country as well as those who are well known to local merchants shall be allowed to land in porttowns

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / parasya bhāryāṃ kanyāṃ vittaṃ vāapaharantaṃ śavittaṃ vāapaharantaṃ śaṅkitam āvignam udbhāṇḍīkṛtaṃ mahābhāṇḍena mūrdhni bhāreṇaavacchādayantaṃ sadyogṛhītaliṅginam aliṅginaṃ vā pravrajitam alakṣyavyādhitaṃ bhayavikāriṇaṃ gūḍhasārabhāṇḍaśāsanaśastraagniyogaṃ viṣahastaṃ dīrghapathikam amudraṃ caupagrāhayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person who is abducting the wife or daughter of another, one who is carrying off the wealth of another, a suspected person, one who seems to be of perturbed appearance, one who has no baggage, one who attempts to conceal, or evade the cognisance of the valuable load in ones hand, one who has just put on a different garb, one who has removed or renounced ones usual garb, one who has just turned out an ascetic, one who pretends to be suffering from disease, one who seems to be alarmed, one who is stealthily carrying valuable things, or going on a secret mission, or carrying weapons or explosives agniyoga, one who holds poison in ones hand, and one who has come from a long distance without a pass shall all be arrested

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣudrapaśur manuṣyaś ca sabhāro māṣakaṃ dadyāt, śirobhāraḥ kāyabhāro gavaaśvaṃ ca dvau, uṣṭramahiṣaṃ caturaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra A minor quadruped as well as a man carrying some load shall pay one másha A headload, a load carried on shoulders káyabhárah, a cow, and a horse shall each pay máshas A camel and a buffalo shall each pay máshas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañca labhuyānam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A small cart laghuyána máshas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṣaḍ goliṅgam, sapta śakaṭam, panyabhāraḥ pādam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and a cart of medium size drawn by bulls golingam shall pay máshas and a big cart sakata máshas A headload of merchandise ¼ másha;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena bhāṇḍabhāro vyākhyātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: this explains other kinds of loads

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dviguṇo mahānadīṣu taraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In big rivers, ferryfees are double the above

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: klṛptam ānūpagrāmā bhaktavetanaṃ dadyuḥ // pratyanteṣu tarāḥ śulkam ātivāhikaṃ vartanīṃ ca gṛhṇīyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Villages near marshy places shall give to the ferrymen the prescribed amount of foodstuff and wages

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: atibhāreṇaavelāyām atirthe tarataś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In boundaries, ferrymen shall receive the toll, carriagecess, and roadcess

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: puruṣaupakaraṇahīnāyām asaṃskṛtāyāṃ vā nāvi vipannāyāṃ nāvadhhyakṣo naṣṭaṃ vinaṣṭaṃ vāabhyāvahet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They shall also confiscate the property of the person travelling without a pass The Superintendent of Boats shall make good the loss caused by the loss of the boat due to the heavy load, sailing in improper time or place, want of ferrymen, or lack of repair

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saptaahavṛttām āṣāḍhīṃ kārttikīṃ caantarā taraḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Boats should be launched between the months of Ashádha, the first seven days being omitted, and Kártika;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kārmikaḥ pratyayaṃ dadyān nityaṃ caāhnikam āvahet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the evidence of a ferryman should be given and the daily income should be remitted

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: goadhyakṣo vetanaupagrāhikaṃ karapratikaraṃ bhagnautsṛṣṭakaṃ bhāgaanupraviṣṭakaṃ vrajaparyagraṃ naṣṭaṃ vinaṣṭaṃ kṣīraghṛtasaṃjātaṃ caupalabheta // gopālakapiṇḍārakadohakamanthakalubdhakāḥ śataṃ śataṃ dhenūnāṃ hiraṇyabhṛtāḥ pālayeyuḥ // kṣīraghṛtabhṛtā hi vatsān upahanyuḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE SUPERINTENDENT OF COWS Kautilyas Arthashastra THE Superintendent of cows shall supervise herds maintained for wages vétanópagráhikam, herds surrendered for a fixed amount of dairy produce karapratikara, useless and abandoned herds bhagnotsrishtakam, herds maintained for a share in dairy produce bhágánupravishtam, classes of herds vrajaparyagram, cattle that strayed nashtam, cattle that are irrecoverably lost vinashtam, and the amassed quantity of milk and clarified butter

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jaradgudhenugarbhiṇīpaṣṭhauhīvatsatarīṇāṃ samavibhāgaṃ rūpaśatam ekaḥ pālayet // ghṛtasyaaṣṭau vārakān paṇikaṃ puccham aṅkacarma ca vārṣikaṃ dadyāt / iti karapratikaraḥ // vyādhitānyaṅgāananyadohīdurdohāputraghnīnāṃ ca samavibhāgaṃ rūpaśataṃ pālayantas tajjātikaṃ bhāgaṃ dadyuḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a cowherd, a buffaloherdsman, a milker, a churner, and a hunter lubdhaka fed by wages graze milch cows dhenu in hundreds satam satamfor if they graze the herds for the profit of milk and ghi, they will starve the calves to death,that system of rearing the cattle is termed „herds maintained for wages‟ When a single person rears a hundred heads rúpasatam made up of equal numbers of each of aged cows, milch cows, pregnant cows, heifers, and calves vatsatari and gives to the owner várakas of clarified butter per annum, as well as the branded skin of dead cows if any, that system is called „herds surrendered for a fixed amount of dairy produce‟ When those who rear a hundred heads made up of equal numbers of each of afflicted cattle, crippled cattle, cattle that cannot be milked by any one but the accustomed person, cattle that are not easily milked, and cattle that kill their own calves give in return to the owner a share in dairy produce, it is termed „useless and abandoned herd‟ When under the fear of cattlelifting enemies parachakrátavibhayát, cattle are kept under the care of the superintendent, giving him /0th of the dairy produce for his protection, it is termed herds maintained for a share in dairy produce When the superintendent classifies cattle as calves, steers, tameable ones, draught oxen, bulls that are to be trained to yoke, bulls kept for crossing cows, cattle that are fit only for the supply of Kautilyas Arthashastra flesh, buffaloes and draught buffaloes;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vatsikā vatsatarī paṣṭahuhī garbhiṇī dhenuś caaprajātā vandhyāś ca gāvo mahiṣyaś ca,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: female calves, female steer, heifer, pregnant cows, milch cattle, barren cattleeither cows or buffaloes;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: māsadvimāsajātās tāsām upajā vatsā vatsikāś ca // māsadvimāsajātān aṅkayet // māsadvimāsaparyuṣitam aṅkayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: calves that are a month or two old as well as those which are still younger; and when, as he ought to, he brands them all inclusive of their calves of one or two months old along with those stray cattle which have remained unclaimed in the herds for a month or two;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aṅkaṃ cihnaṃ varṇaṃ śṛṅgaantaraṃ ca lakṣaṇam evam upajā nibandhayet / iti vrajaparyagram // corahṛtam anyayūthapraviṣṭam avalīnaṃ vā naṣṭam // paṅkaviṣamavyādhijarātoyaāhāraavasannaṃ vṛkṣataṭakāṣṭhaśilāabhihatam īśānavyālasarpagrāhadāvaagnivipannaṃ vinaṣṭam
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and when he registers the branded marks, natural marks, colour and the distance from one horn to another of each of the cattle, that system is known as „class of herds‟ When an animal is carried off by thieves or finds itself into the herds of others or strays unknown, it is called „lost‟ When an animal is entangled in a quagmire or precipice or dies of disease or of old age, or drowned in water or when it is killed by the fall of a tree or of river bank, or is beaten to death with a staff or stone, or is struck by lightening ísána, or is devoured by a tiger or bitten by a cobra, or is carried off by a crocodile, or is involved in the midst of a forest fire, it is termed as irrecoverably lost Cowherds shall endeavour to keep them away from such dangers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svayaṃ hantā ghātayitā hartā hārayitā ca vadhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever hurts or causes another to hurt, or steals or causes another to steal a cow, should be slain

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parapaśūnāṃ rājaaṅkena parivartayitā rūpasya pūrvaṃ sāhasadaṇḍaṃ dadyāt // svadeśīyānāṃ corahṛtaṃ pratyānīya paṇitaṃ rūpaṃ haret //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person substitutes an animal rúpa bearing the royal brand mark for a private one, he shall be punished with the first amercement When a person recovers a local cattle from thieves, he shall receive the promised reward panitam rúpam; and when a man rescues a foreign cattle from thieves, he shall receive half its value

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bālavṛddhavyādhitānāṃ gopālakāḥ pratikuryuḥ // lubdhakaśvagaṇibhir apāstas tenaavyālaparābādhabhayam ṛtuvibhaktam araṇyaṃ cārayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Cowherds shall apply remedies to calves or aged cows or Kautilyas Arthashastra cows suffering from diseases They shall graze the herds in forests which are severally allotted as pasture grounds for various seasons and from which thieves, tigers and other molesting beasts are driven away by hunters aided by their hounds

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarpavyālatrāsanaarthaṃ gocaraanupātajñānaarthaṃ ca trasnūnāṃ ghaṇṭātūryaṃ ca badhnīyuḥ // samavyūḍhatīrtham akardamagrāham udakam avatārayeyuḥ pālayeyuś ca // stenavyālasarpagrāhagṛhītaṃ vyādhijarāavasannaṃ caāvedayeyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: With a view to scare out snakes and tigers and as a definite means of knowing the whereabouts of herds, sounding bells shall be attached to the neck of timid cattle Cowherds shall allow their cattle to enter into such rivers or lakes as are of equal depth all round, broad, and free from mire and crocodiles, and shall protect them from dangers under such circumstances Whenever an animal is caught hold of by a thief, a tiger, a snake, or a crocodile, or when it is too infirm owing to age or disease, they shall make a report of it;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyathā rūpamūlyaṃ bhajeran //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: otherwise they shall be compelled to make good the loss

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāraṇamṛtasyaaṅkacarma gomahiṣasya, karṇalakṣaṇam ajaavikānām, puccham aṅkacarma caaśvakharauṣṭrāṇām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When an animal dies a natural death, they shall surrender the skin with the brand mark, if it is a cow or a buffalo; the skin together with the ear karnalakshanam if it is a goat or sheep; the tail with the skin containing the brand mark, if it is an ass or a camel;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bālacarmabastipittasnāyudantakhuraśṛṅgaasthīni caāhareyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the skin, if it is a young one; besides the above, they shall also restore the fat vasti, bile, marrow snáyu, teeth, hoofs, horns, and bones

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: māṃsam ārdraṃ śuṣkaṃ vā vikrīṇīyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They the cowherds may sell either fresh flesh or dried flesh

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: udaśvitśvavarāhebhyo dadyuḥ // kūrcikāṃ senābhaktaartham āhareyuḥ // kilāṭo ghāṇapiṇyākakledaarthaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They shall give buttermilk as drink to dogs and hogs, and reserve a little buttermilk in a bronze vessel to prepare their own dish they may also make use of coagulated milk or cheese kíláta to render their oilcakes relishing ghánapinyákakledartha

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paśuvikretā pādikaṃ rūpaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra He who sells his cow from among the herds shall pay to the king ¼th rúpa value of the cow

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: varṣāśaraddhemantān ubhayataḥkālaṃ duhyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: During the rainy, autumnal, and the first part of winter hemanta seasons, they shall milk the cattle both the times morning and evening;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śiśiravasantagrīṣmān ekakālam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and during the latter part of winter and the whole of the spring and summer seasons, they shall milk only once ie, only in the morning

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvitīyakāladogdhur aṅguṣṭhacchedo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The cowherd who milks a cow a second time during these seasons shall have his thumb cut off

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dohanakālam atikrāmatas tatphalahānaṃ daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If he allows the time of milking to lapse, he shall forfeit the profit thereof ie, the milk

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: etena nasyadamyayugapiṅganavartanakālā vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rule shall hold good in case of negligence of the opportune moment for putting a string through the nose of a bull and other animals, and for taming or training them to the yoke

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣīradroṇe gavāṃ ghṛtaprasthaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: One drona of a cows milk will, when churned, yield one prastha of butter;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañcabhāgaadhiko mahiṣīṇām, dvibhāgaadhikoajaavīnām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the same quantity of a buffalos milk will yield /th prastha more; and the same quantity of milk of goats and sheep will produce ½ prastha more

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mantho vā sarveṣāṃ pramāṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In all kinds of milk, the exact quantity of butter shall be ascertained by churning;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhūmitṛṇaudakaviśeṣādd hi kṣīraghṛtavṛddhir bhavati // yūthavṛṣaṃ vṛṣeṇaavapātayataḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ, ghātayata uttamaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for increase in the supply of milk and butter depends on the nature of the soil and the quantity and quality of fodder and water When a person causes a bull attached to a herd to fight with another bull, he shall be punished with the first amercement; when a bull is injured under such circumstances, he shall be punished with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: varṇaavarodhena daśatī rakṣā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Cattle shall be grouped in herds of ten each of similar colour, while they are being grazed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: upaniveśadigvibhāgo gopracārād balaanvayato vā gavāṃ rakṣāsāmarthyāc ca//
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra According to the protective strength of the cowherds the capacity of the cattle to go far and wide to graze, cowherds shall take their cattle either far or near

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ajāvīnāṃ ṣaṇmāsikīmūrṇāṃ grāhayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Once in six months, sheep and other animals shall be shorn of their wool

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tenaaśvakharauṣṭravarāhavrajā vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rules shall apply to herds of horses, asses, camels, and hogs

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: balīvardānāṃ nasyaaśvabhadragativāhināṃ yavasasyaardhabhāras tṛṇasya dviguṇam, tulā ghāṇapiṇyākasya, daśaāḍhakaṃ kaṇakuṇḍakasya, pañcapalikaṃ mukhalavanAm, tailakuḍubo nasyaṃ prasthaḥ pānaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For bulls which are provided with noserings, and which equal horses in speed and in carrying loads, half a bhára of meadow grass yavasa, twice the above quantity of ordinary grass trina, one tulá 00 palas of oil cakes, 0 ádhakas of bran, palas of salt mukhalavanam, one kudumba of oil for rubbing over the nose nasya, prastha of drink pána, one tulá of flesh, ádhaka of curis, drona of barley or of cooked másha Phraseolus Radiatus, drona of milk;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣīradroṇam ardhaāḍhakaṃ vā surāyāḥ snehaprasthaḥ kṣāradaśapalaṃ śṛṅgiberapalaṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: or half an ádhaka of surá liquor, prastha of oil or ghi sneha 0 palas of sugar or jaggery, pala of the fruit of sringibera ginger may be substituted for milk pratipána

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pādaūnam aśvataragokharāṇām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same commodities less by one quarter each will form the diet for mules, cows, and asses;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dviguṇaṃ mahiṣauṣṭrāṇām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: twice the quantity of the above things for buffaloes and camels

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmakarabalīvardānāṃ pāyanaarthānāṃ ca dhenūnāṃ karmakālataḥ phalataś ca vidhādānam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Draught oxen and cows, supplying milk payah, shall be provided with subsistence in proportion to the duration of time the oxen are kept at work, and the quantity of milk which the cows supply

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarveṣāṃ tṛṇaudakaprākāmyam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: All cattle shall be supplied with abundance of fodder and water

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti gomaṇḍalaṃ vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Thus the manner of rearing herds of cattle has been dealt with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañcaṛṣabhaṃ kharaaśvānām ajaavīnāṃ daśaṛṣabham /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A herd of 00 heads of asses and mules shall contain male animals; that of goats and sheep ten;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śatyaṃ gomahiṣauṣṭrāṇāṃ yūthaṃ kuryāc caturvṛṣam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and a herd of ten heads of either cows or buffaloes shall contain four male animals [Thus ends Chapter , The Superintendent of Cows in Book , The Duties of Government Superintendents of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / aśvaadhyakṣaḥ paṇyaāgārikaṃ krayaupāgatam āhavalabdham ājātaṃ sāhāyyaāgatakaṃ paṇasthitaṃ yāvatkālikaṃ vāaśvaparyagraṃ kulavayovarṇacihnavargaāgamair lekhayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE Superintendent of Horses shall register the breed, age, colour, marks, group or classes, and the native place of horses, and classify as those that are kept in salehouse for sale panyágárikam, those that are recently purchased krayopágatam, those that have been captured in wars áhavalabdham, those that are of local breed ájátam, those that are sent thither for help sáháyyakágatam, those that are mortgaged panasthitam, and those that are temporarily kept in stables yávatkálikam

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: apraśastanyaṅgavyādhitāṃś caāvedayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall make a report to the king of such animals as are inauspicious, crippled, or diseased

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kośakoṣṭhaagārābhyāṃ ca gṛhītvā māsalābham aśvavāhaś cintayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Every horseman shall know how to make an economic use of whatever he has received from the kings treasury and storehouse

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / aśvavibhavenaāyatām aśvāyām adviguṇavistārāṃ caturdvāraupāvartanamadhyāṃ sapragrīvāṃ pradvāraāsanaphalakayuktānāṃ vānaramayūrapṛṣatanakulacakoraśukasārikaākīrṇāṃ śālāṃ niveśayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The superintendent shall have a stable constructed as spacious as required by the number of horses to be kept therein twice as broad as the length of a horse, with four doors facing the four quarters, with its central floor suited for the rolling of horses, with Kautilyas Arthashastra projected front provided with wooden seats at the entrance, and containing monkeys, peacocks, red spotted deer prishata, mangoose, partridges chakora, parrots, and maina birds sárika;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aśvāyām acaturaśraślakṣṇaphalakaāstāraṃ sakhādanakoṣṭhakaṃ samūtrapurīṣautsargam ekaekaśaḥ prānmukham udanmukhaṃ vā
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the room for every horse shall be four times as broad or long as the length of a horse, with its central floor paved with smoothened wooden planks, with separate compartments for fodder khádanakoshthakam, with passages for the removal of urine and dung, and with a door facing either the north or the east

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sthānaṃ niveśayet // śālāvaśena vā digvibhāgaṃ kalpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The distinction of quarters digvibhága may be made as a matter of fact or relatively to the situation of the building

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaḍavāvṛṣakiśorāṇām ekaanteṣu //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Steeds, stallions and colts shall be separately kept

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaḍavāyāḥ prajatāyās trirātraṃ ghṛtaprasthaḥ pānam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A steed that has just given birth to a colt shall be provided for the first three days with a drink of prastha of clarified butter;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ata ūrdhvaṃ saktuprasthaḥ snehabhaiṣajyapratipānaṃ daśarātram //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: afterwards it shall be fed with a prastha of flour saktu and made to drink oil mixed with medicine for ten nights;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ pulāko yavasam ārtavaś caāhāraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: after that time, it shall have cooked grains, meadow grass, and other things suited to the season of the day

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daśarātrād ūrdhvaṃ kiśorasya ghṛtacaturbhāgaḥ saktukuḍubaḥ kṣīraprasthaś caāhāra āṣaṇmāsāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A colt, ten days old, shall be given a kudumba of flour mixed with ¼th kudumba of clarified butter, and prastha of milk till it becomes six months old;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ paraṃ māsauttaram ardhavṛddhir yavaprastha ātrivarṣāt, droṇa ācaturvarṣāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: then the above rations shall be increased half as much during each succeeding month, with the addition of prastha of barley till it becomes three years old, then one drona of barley till it grows four years old;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ata ūrdhvaṃ caturvarṣaḥ pañcavarṣo vā karmaṇyaḥ pūrṇapramāṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: at the age of four or five, it attains its full development and becomes serviceable

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvātriṃśadaṅgulaṃ mukham uttamaaśvasya,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The face mukha of the best horse measures angulas; its length is times its face;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viṃśatyaṅgulā jaṅghā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: its shank is 0 angulas; and its height is times its shank

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tryaṅgulaavaraṃ madhyamaavarayoḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Horses of medium and lower sizes fall short of the above measurement by two and three angulas respectively

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śataaṅgulaḥ pariṇāhaḥ // pañcabhāgaavaro madhyamaavarayoḥ // uttamaaśvasya dvidroṇaṃ śālivrīhiyavapriyaṅgūṇām ardhaśuṣkam ardhasiddhaṃ vā mudgamāṣāṇāṃ vā pulākaḥ snehaprasthaś ca,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 The circumference parínáha of the best horse measures 00 angulas, and horses of medium and lower sizes fall short of the above measurement by five parts panchabhágávaram For the best horse the diet shall be dronas of any one of the grains, rice sáli, vríhi, barley, panic seeds priyangu soaked or cooked, cooked mudga Phraseolus Munga or másha Phraseolus Radiatus;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañcapalaṃ lavaṇasya, māṃsaṃ pañcāśatpalikaṃ rasasyaāḍhakaṃ dviguṇaṃ vā dadhnaḥ piṇḍakledanaartham,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: one prastha of oil, palas of salt, 0 palas of flesh, ádhaka of broth rasa or ádhakas of curd, palas of sugar kshára, to make their diet relishing, prastha of súrá, liquor, or prasthas of milk

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣārapañcapalikaḥ surāyāḥ prasthaḥ payaso vā dviguṇaḥ pratipānam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same quantity of drink shall be specially given to those horses which are tired of long journey or of carrying loads

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dīrghapathabhāraklāntānāṃ ca khādanaarthaṃ snehaprasthoanuvāsanaṃ kuḍubo nasyakarmaṇaḥ, yavasasyaardhabhāras tṛṇasya dviguṇaḥ ṣaḍaratniparikṣepaḥ puñjīlagraho vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: One prastha of oil for giving enema anuvásana, kudumba of oil for rubbing over the nose, ,000 palas of meadow grass, twice as much of ordinary grass trina; and haystalk or grass shall be spread over an area of aratnis The same quantity of rations less by onequarter for horses of medium and lower size

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pādaavaram etan madhyamaavarayoḥ // uttamasamo rathyo vṛṣaś ca madhyamaḥ // madhyamasamaś caavaraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A draught horse or stallion of medium size shall be given the same quantity as the best horse; and similar horses of lower size shall receive the same quantity as a horse of medium size

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pādahīnaṃ vaḍavānāṃ pāraśamānāṃ ca // atoardhaṃ kiśorāṇāṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Steeds and párasamas shall have one quarter less of rations Half of the rations given to steeds shall be given to colts

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti vidhāyogaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus is the distribution of ration dealt with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vidhāpācakasūtragrāhakacikitsakāḥ pratisvādabhājaḥ // yuddhavyādhijarākarmakṣīṇāḥ piṇḍagocarikāḥ syuḥ // / asamaraprayogyāḥ paurajānapadānām arthena vṛṣā vaḍavāsv āyojyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who cook the food of horses, grooms, and veterinary Kautilyas Arthashastra surgeons shall have a share in the rations pratisvádabhajah Stallions which are incapacitated owing to old age, disease or hardships of war, and, being therefore rendered unfit for use in war live only to consume food shall in the interests of citizens and country people be allowed to cross steeds

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prayogyānām uttamāḥ kāmbojasaindhavaāraṭṭavanāyujāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The breed of Kámbhoja, Sindhu, Aratta, and Vanáyu countries are the best;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: madhyamā bāhlīkapāpeyakasauvīrakataitalāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those of Báhlíka, Pápeya, Sauvira, and Taitala, are of middle quality;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śeṣāḥ pratyavarāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and the rest ordinary avaráh

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ tīṣkṇabhadramandavaśena sāmnāhyam aupavāhyakaṃ vā karma prayojayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: These three sorts may be trained either for war or for riding according as they are furious tíkshna, mild bhadra, or stupid or slow manda

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: caturaśraṃ karmaaśvasya sāmnāhyam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The regular training of a horse is its preparation for war sánnáhyam karma

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: valgano nīcair gato laṅghano ghoraṇo nāroṣṭraś caaupavāhyāḥ // tatraaupaveṇuko vardhamānako yamaka ālīḍhaplutaḥ pṛthugastrikacālī ca valganaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Circular movement valgana, slow movement níchairgata, jumping langhana, gallop dhorana, and response to signals nároshtra are the several forms of riding aupaváhya Aupavenuka, vardhmánaka, yamaka, álídhapluta, vrithatta and trivacháli are the varieties of circular movement valgana

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa eva śiraḥkarṇaviśuddho nīcair gataḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same kind of movements with the head and ear kept erect are called slow movements

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṣoḍaśamārgo vā // / prakīrṇakaḥ prakīrṇauttaro niṣaṇṇaḥ pārśvaanuvṛtta ūrmimārgaḥ śarabhakrīḍitaḥ śarabhaplutas tritālo bāhyaanuvṛttaḥ pañcapāṇiḥ siṃhaāyataḥ svādhūtaḥ kliṣṭaḥ śliṅgito bṛṃhitaḥ puṣpaabhikīrṇaś caiti nīcair gatamārgaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: These are performed in sixteen ways Prakírnaka, prakírnottara, nishanna, pársvánuvritta, úrmimárga, sarabhakrídita, sarabhapluta, tritála, báhyánuvritta, panchapáni, simháyata, svádhúta, klishta, slághita, brimhita, pushpábhikírna Kautilyas Arthashastra Jumping like a monkey kapipluta, jumping like a frog bhekapluta, sudden jump ekapluta, jumping with one leg ekapádapluta, leaping like a cuckoo kokilasamchári, dashing with its breast almost touching the ground urasya, and leaping like a crane bakasamchari are the several forms of jumping

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kapipluto bhekapluteṇaplutaekapādaplutaḥ kokilasaṃcāryurasyo bakacārī ca laṅghanaḥ // kāṅko vārikāṅko māyūroardhamāyūro nākulordhanākulo vārāhoardhavārāhaś caiti dhoraṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Flying like a vulture kánka, dashing like a waterduck várikánaka, running like a peacock máyúra halt the speed of a peacock ardhmáyúra, dashing like a mangoose nákula, half the speed of a mangoose ardhanákula, running like a hog váráha and half the speed of a hog ardhaváráha are the several forms of gallop

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃjñāpratikāro nārauṣṭraiti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Movement following a signal is termed nároshtra

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṣaṇṇava dvādaśaiti yojanāny dhvā rathyānām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Six, nine, and twelve yojanas a day are the distances to be traversed by carriagehorses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañca yojanāny ardhaaṣṭamāni daśaiti pṛṣṭhavāhinām aśvānām adhvā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Five, eight, and ten yojanas are the distances to be traversed by riding horses prishthaváhya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vikramo bhadraaśvāso bhāravāhya iti mārgāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Trotting according to its strength vikrama, trotting with good breathing bhadrásvása, and pacing with a load on its back are the three kinds of trot

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vikramo valgitam upakaṇṭham upajavo javaś ca dhārāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Trotting according to strength vikrama, trot combined with circular movement valgita, ordinary trot upakantha, middlemost speed upajava, and ordinary speed are also the several kinds of trot dhárá

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ bandhanaupakaraṇaṃ yogyaācāryāḥ pratidiśeyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Qualified teachers shall give instructions as to the manufacture of proper ropes with which to tether the horses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāṃgrāmikaṃ rathaaśvaalaṃkāraṃ ca sūtāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Charioteers shall see to the manufacture of necessary war accoutrements of horses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aśvānāṃ cikitsakāḥ śarīrahrāsavṛddhipratīkāram ṛtuvibhaktaṃ caāhāram // sūtragrāhakaaśvabandhakayāvasikavidhāpācakasthānapālakeśakārajāṅgulīvidaś ca svakarmabhir aśvān ārādhayeyuḥ // karmaatikrame caeṣāṃ divasavetanacchedanaṃ kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Veterinary surgeons shall apply requisite remedies against undue growth or diminution in the body of horses and also change the diet of horses according to changes in seasons Those who move the horses sútragráhaka, those whose business is to tether them in stables, those who supply meadowgrass, those who cook the grains for the horses, those who keep watch in the stables, those who groom them and those who apply remedies against poison shall satisfactorily discharge their specified duties and shall, in default of it, forfeit their daily wages

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nīrājanauparuddhaṃ vāhayataś cikitsakauparuddhaṃ vā dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ // kriyābhaiṣajyasaṅgena vyādhivṛddhau pratīkāradviguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who take out for the purpose of riding such horses as are kept inside the stables either for the purpose of waving lights nirájana or for medical treatment shall be fined panas When, owing to defects in medicine or carelessness in the treatment, the disease from which a horse is suffering becomes intense, a fine of twice the cost of the treatment shall be imposed;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tadaparādhena vailomye pattramūlyaṃ daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and when, owing to defects in medicine, or not administering it, the result becomes quite the reverse, a fine equal to the value of the animal patramúlya shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena gomaṇḍalaṃ kharauṣṭramahiṣam ajaavikaṃ ca vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rule shall apply to the treatment of cows, buffaloes, goats, and sheep

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvir ahnaḥ snānam aśvānāṃ gandhamālyaṃ ca dāpayet / kṛṣṇasaṃdhiṣu bhūtaijyāḥ śukleṣu svastivācanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Horses shall be washed, bedaubed with sandal powder, and garlanded twice a day On new moon days sacrifice to Bhútas, and on full moon days the chanting of auspicious hymns shall be performed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nīrājanām āśvayuje kārayen navameahani / yātrāādāv avasāne vā vyādhau vā śāntike rataḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Not only on the ninth day of the month of Asvayuja, but also both at the commencement and close of journeys yátra as well as in the time of disease shall a priest wave lights invoking blessings on the horses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / hastyadhyakṣo hastivanarakṣāṃ damyakarmakṣāntānāṃ hastihastinīkalabhānāṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: [Thus ends Chapter , The Superintendent of Horses in Book Kautilyas Arthashastra , The Duties of Government Superintendents, of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śālāsthānaśayyākarmavidhāyavasapramāṇaṃ karmasv āyogaṃ bandhanaupakaraṇaṃ sāṃgrāmikam alaṃkāraṃ cikitsakaanīkasthaaupasthāyikavargaṃ caanutiṣṭhet // hastyāyāmadviguṇautsedhaviṣkambhaāyāmāṃ hastinīsthānaadhikāṃ sapragrīvāṃ kumārīsaṃgrahāṃ prānmukhīm udanmukhīṃ vā śālāṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE Superintendent of elephants shall take proper steps to protect elephantforests and supervise the operations with regard to the standing or lying in stables of elephants, male, female, or young, when they are tired after training, and examine the proportional quantity of rations and grass, the extent of training given to them, their accoutrements and ornaments, as well as the work of elephantdoctors, of trainers of elephants in warlike feats, and of grooms, such as drivers, binders and others There shall be constructed an elephant stable twice as broad and twice as high as the length áyáma of an elephant, with separate apartments for female elephants, with projected entrance sapragrívám, with posts called kumári, and with its door facing either the east or the north

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hastyāyāmacaturaśraślakṣṇaālānastambhaphalakaāstarakaṃ samūtrapurīṣautsargaṃ sthānaṃ niveśayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The space in front of the smooth posts to which elephants are tied shall form a square, one side of which is equal to the length of an elephant and shall be paved with smooth wooden planks and provided with holes for the removal of urine and dung

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sthānasamāṃ śayyām ardhaapāśrayāṃ durge sāmnāhyaaupavāhyānāṃ bahir damyavyālānām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Elephants serviceable in war or for riding shall be kept inside Kautilyas Arthashastra the fort; and those that are still being tamed or are of bad temper shall be kept outside

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prathamasaptama aṣṭamabhāgāv ahnaḥ snānakālau,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The first and the seventh of the eight divisions of the day are the two bathing times of elephants;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tadanantaraṃ vidhāyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the time subsequent to those two periods is for their food;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūrvaahne vyāyāmakālaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: forenoon is the time for their exercise;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paścaahnaḥ pratipānakālaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: afternoon is the time for drink;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rātribhāgau dvau svapnakālā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: two out of eight parts of the night are the time for sleep;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tribhāgaḥ saṃveśanautthānikaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: onethird of the night is spent in taking wakeful rest

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: grīṣme grahaṇakālaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The summer is the season to capture elephants

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viṃśativarṣo grāhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That which is 0 years old shall be captured

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vikko moḍho makkaṇo vyāthito garbhiṇī dhenukā hastinī caagrāhyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Young elephants bikka, infatuated elephants mugdha, elephants without tusks, diseased elephants, elephants which suckle their young ones dhenuká, and female elephants hastiní shall not be captured

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saptaaratni utsedho navaāyāmo daśa pariṇāhaḥ pramāṇataś catvāriṃśadvarṣo bhavaty uttamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That which is seven aratnis in height, nine aratnis in length, ten aratnis in circumference and is as can be inferred from such measurement, 0 years old, is the best

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: triṃśadvarṣo madhyamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That which is 0 years old is of middle class;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañcaviṃśativarṣoavaraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and that which is years old is of the lowest class

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tayoḥ pādaavaro vidhāvidhiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The diet for the last two classes shall be lessened by onequarter according to the class

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aratnau taṇuladroṇaḥ, ardhaāḍhakaṃ tailasya, sarpiṣas trayaḥ prasthāḥ, daśapalaṃ lavaṇasya,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The rations for an elephant of seven aratnis in height shall be drona of rice, ½ ádhaka of oil, prasthas of ghi, 0 palas of salt, 0 palas of flesh, ádhaka of broth rasa or twice the quantity ie, ádhakas of curd;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rasasyaāḍhakaṃ dviguṇaṃ vā dadhnaḥ piṇḍakledanaartham, kṣāradaśapalikaṃ madyasyaāḍhakaṃ dviguṇaṃ vā payasaḥ pratipānam, gātraavasekas tailaprasthaḥ, śirasoaṣṭabhāgaḥ prādīpikaś ca,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: in order to render the dish tasteful, 0 palas of sugar kshára, ádhaka of liquor, or twice the Kautilyas Arthashastra quantity of milk payah; prastha of oil for smearing over the body, / prastha of the same for the head and for keeping a light in the stables; bháras of meadow grass, ¼ bháras of ordinary grass sashpa, and ½ bháras of dry grass and any quantity of stalks of various pulses kadankara

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saptaaratninā tulyabhojanoaṣṭaaratnir atyarālaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: An elephant in rut atyarála and of aratnis in height shall have equal rations with that of aratnis in height

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathāhastam avaśeṣaḥ ṣaḍaratniḥ pañcaaratniś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The rest of or aratnis in height shall be provided with rations proportional to their size

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣīrayāvasiko vikkaḥ krīḍāarthaṃ grāhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A young elephant bikka captured for the mere purpose of sporting with it shall be fed with milk and meadow grass

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃjātalohitā praticchannā samliptapakṣā samakakṣyā vyatikīrṇamāṃsā samatalpatalā jātadroṇikāiti śobhāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That which is bloodred samjátalóhita, that which is fleshed, that which has its sides evenly grown samaliptapakshá, that which has its girths full or equal samakakshyá, that whose flesh is evenly spread, that which is of even surface on its back samatalpatala and that which is of uneven surface játadróniká are the several kinds of physical splendour of elephants

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śobhāvaśena vyāyāmaṃ bhadrma mandaṃ ca kārayet / mṛgaṃ saṃkīrṇaliṅgaṃ ca karmasv ṛtuvaśena vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Suitably to the seasons as well as to their physical spendour, elephants of sharp or slow sense bhadra and mandra as well as elephants possessed of the characteristics of other beasts shall be trained and taught suitable work

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: (Activity of elephants) karmaskandhāś catvāro damyaḥ sāmnāhya aupavāhyo vyālaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: ELEPHANTS are classified into four kinds in accordance with the training they are given that which is tameable damya, that which is trained for war sánnáhya, that which is trained for riding aupaváhya, and rogue elephants vyála

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatra damyaḥ pañcavidhaḥ skandhagataḥ stambhagato vārigatoavapātagato yūthagataś caiti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those which are tameable fall under five groups that which suffers a man to sit on its withers skandhagata, that which allows itself to be tethered to a post stambhagata, that which can be taken to water várigata, that which lies in pits apapátagata, and that which is attached to its herd yúthagata

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaupavicāro vikkakarma //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: All these elephants shall be treated with as much care as a young elephant bikka

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāmnāhyaḥ saptakriyāpatha upasthānaṃ saṃvartanaṃ samyānaṃ vadhaāvadho hastiyuddhaṃ nāgarāyaṇaṃ sāṃgrāmikaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Military training is of seven kinds Drill upasthána, turning samvartana, advancing samyána, trampling down and killing vadhávadha, fighting with other elephants hastiyuddha, assailing forts and cities nágaráyanam, and warfare

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaupavicāraḥ kakṣyākarma graiveyakarma yūthakarma ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Binding the elephants with girths kakshyákarma, putting on collars graiveyakakarma, and making them work in company with their herds yúthakarma are the first steps upavichara of the above training

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aupavāhyoaṣṭavidha ācaraṇaḥ kuñjaraaupavāhyo dhoraṇa ādhānagatiko yaṣṭyupavāhyas totraupavāhyaḥ śuddhaupavāhyo mārgayukaś
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Elephants trained for riding fall under seven groups that which suffers a man to mount over it when in company with another elephant kunjaropaváhya, that which suffers riding when led by a warlike elephant sánnáhyopaváhya, that which is taught trotting dhorana, that which is taught various kinds of movements ádhánagatika, that which can be made to move by using a staff yashtyupaváhya, that which can be made to move by using an iron hook totropaváhya, that which can be made to move without whips suddhopaváhya, and that which is of help in Kautilyas Arthashastra hunting

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaupavicāraḥ śāradakarma hīnakarma nārauṣṭrakarma ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Autumnal work sáradakarma, mean or rough work hínakarma, and training to respond to signals are the first steps for the above training

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vyālaekakriyāpathaḥ śaṅkitoavaruddho viṣamaḥ prabhinnaḥ prabhinnaviniścayo madahetuviniścayaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It has a suspicious aversion to work, is obstinate, of perverse nature, unsteady, willful, or of infatuated temper under the influence of rut

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kriyāvipanno vyālaḥ śuddhaḥ suvrato viṣamaḥ sarvadoṣapraduṣṭaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Rogue elephants whose training proves a failure may be purely roguish suddha, clever in roguery suvrata, perverse vishama, or possessed of all kinds of vice

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ bandhanaupakaraṇam anīkasthapramāṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The form of fetters and other necessary means to keep them under control shall be ascertained from the doctor of elephants

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ālānagraiveyakakṣyāpāraayaṇaparikṣepauttaraādikaṃ bandhanam // aṅkuśaveṇuyantraādikam upakaraṇam // vaijayantīkṣurapramālaāstaraṇakuthāādikaṃ bhūṣaṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Tetherposts álána, collars, girths, bridles, legchains, frontal fetters are the several kinds of binding instruments A hook, a bamboo staff, and machines yantra are instruments Necklaces such as vaijavantí and kshurapramála, and litter and housings are the ornaments of elephants

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: varmatomaraśaraāvāpayantraādikaḥ sāṃgrāmikaalaṃkāraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Mailarmour varma, clubs totra, arrowbags, and machines are waraccoutrements

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: cikitsakaanīkasthaārohakaādhoraṇahastipakaupacārikavidhāpācakayāvasikapādapāśikakuṭīrrakṣakaaupaśayaikaādir aupasthāyikavargaḥ cikitsakakuṭīrakṣavidhāpācakāḥ prasthaodanaṃ snehaprasṛtiṃ kṣāralavaṇayoś ca dvipalikaṃ hareyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Elephant doctors, trainers, expert riders, as well as those who groom them, those who prepare their food, those who procure grass for them, those who tether them to posts, those who sweep elephant Kautilyas Arthashastra stables, and those who keep watch in the stables at night, are some of the persons that have to attend to the needs of elephants Elephant doctors, watchmen, sweepers, cooks and others shall receive from the storehouse, prastha of cooked rice, a handful of oil, land palas of sugar and of salt

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyatra cikitsakebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Excepting the doctors, others shall also receive 0 palas of flesh

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pathivyādhikarmamadajarāabhitaptānāṃ cikitsakāḥ pratikuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Elephant doctors shall apply necessary medicines to elephants which, while making a journey, happen to suffer from disease, overwork, rut, or old age

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sthānasyaaśuddhir yavasasyaagrahaṇaṃ sthale śāyanam abhāge ghātaḥ paraārohaṇam akāle yānam abhūmāv atīrtheavatāraṇaṃ taruṣaṇḍa
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Accumulation of dirt in stables, failure to supply grass, causing an elephant to lie down on hard and unprepared ground, striking on vital parts of its body, permission to a stranger to ride over it, untimely riding, leading it to water through impassable places, and allowing it to enter into thick forests are offences punishable with fines

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tam eṣāṃ bhaktavetanād ādadīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such fines shall be deducted from the rations and wages due to the offenders

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tisro nīrājanāḥ kāryāś cāturmāsyaṛtusaṃdhiṣu / bhūtānāṃ kṛṣṇasaṃdhīijyāḥ senānyaḥ śuklasaṃdhuṣu //
