Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: During the period of Cháturmásya the months of July, August, September and October and at the time when two seasons meet, waving of lights shall be performed thrice Also on newmoon and fullmoon days, commanders shall perform sacrifices to Bhútas for the safety of elephants

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dantamūlaparīṇāhadviguṇaṃ projjhya kalpayet / abde dvyardhe nadījānāṃ pañcaabde parvataokasām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Leaving as much as is equal to twice the circumference of the tusk near its root, the rest of the tusks shall be cut off once in ½ years in the case of elephants born in countries irrigated by rivers nadija, and once in years in the case of mountain elephants

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aśvaadhyakṣeṇa rathaadhyakṣo vyākhyātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE functions of the Superintendent of horses will explain those of the Superintendent of chariots

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa rathakarmaantān kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The Superintendent of chariots shall attend to the construction of chariots

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daśapuruṣo dvādaśaantaro rathaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The best chariot shall measure 0 purushas in height ,ie, 0 angulas, and purushas in width

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmād ekaantaraavarā āṣaḍantarād iti sapta rathāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: After this model, more chariots with width decreasing by one purusha successively down to a chariot of purushas in width shall be constructed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: devarathapuṣyarathasāṃgrāmikapāriyāṇikaparapuraabhiyānikavainayikāṃś ca rathān kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall also construct chariots of gods devaratha, festal chariots pushyaratha, battle chariots sángrámika, travelling chariots páriyánika, chariots used in assailing an enemys strongholds parapurabhiyánika, and training chariots

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iṣvastrapraharaṇaāvaraṇaupakaraṇakalpanāḥ sārathirathikarathyānāṃ ca karmasv āyogaṃ vidyāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall also examine the efficiency in the training of troops in shooting arrows, in hurling clubs and cudgels, in wearing mail armour, in equipment, in charioteering, in fighting seated on a chariot, and in controlling chariot horses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ākarmabhyaś ca bhaktavetanaṃ bhṛtānām abhṛtānāṃ ca yogyārakṣāanuṣṭhānam arthamānakarma ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall also attend to the accounts of provision and wages paid to those who are either permanently or temporarily employed to prepare chariots and other things Also he shall take steps to maintain the employed contented and happy by adequate reward yogyarakshanushthánam, and ascertain the distance of roads

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: etena pattyadhyakṣo vyākhyātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 The same rules shall apply to the superintendent of infantry

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa maulabhṛtaśreṇimitraamitraaṭavībalānāṃ sāraphalgutāṃ vidyāt, nimnasthalaprakāśakūṭakhanakaākāśadivārātriyuddhavyāyāmaṃ ca,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The latter shall know the exact strength or weakness of hereditary troops maula, hired troops bhrita, the corporate body of troops sreni, as well as that of the army of friendly or unfriendly kings and of wild tribes

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: āyogam ayogaṃ ca karmasu //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall also know the fitness or unfitness of troops on emergent occasions

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ted eva senāpatiḥ sarvayuddhapraharaṇavidyāvinīto hastyaśvarathacaryāsaṃghuṣṭaś caturaṅgasya balasyaanuṣṭhānaadhiṣṭhānaṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: With an eye to the position which the entire army chaturangabala trained in the skillful handling of all kinds of weapons and in leading elephants, horses, and chariots have occupied and to the emergent call for which they ought to be ready, the commanderinchief shall be so capable as to order either advance or retreat áyogamayógam cha

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vidyāt // svabhūmiṃ yuddhakālaṃ pratyanīkam abhinnabhedanaṃ bhinnasaṃdhānaṃ saṃhatabhedanaṃ bhinnavadhaṃ durgavadhaṃ yātrākālaṃ ca paśyet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall also know what kind of ground is more advantageous to his own army, what time is more favourable, what the strength of the enemy is, how to sow dissension in an enemys army of united mind, how to collect his own scattered forces, how to scatter the compact body of an enemys army, how to assail a fortress, and when to make a general advance

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tūryadhvajapatākābhir vyūhasaṃjñāḥ prakalpayet / sthāne yāne praharaṇe sainyānāṃ vinaye rataḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Being ever mindful of the discipline which his army has to maintain not merely in camping and marching, but in the thick of battle, he shall designate the regiments vyúha by the names of trumpets, boards, banners, or flags

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mudrāadhyakṣo mudrāṃ māṣakeṇa dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE Superintendent of Passports shall issue passes at the rate of a masha per pass

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samudro janapadaṃ praveṣṭuṃ niṣkramituṃ vā labheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever is provided with a pass shall be at liberty to enter into, or go out of, the country

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvādaśapaṇam amudro jānapado dadyāt // kūṭamudrāyāṃ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ tirojanapadasyauttamaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever, being a native of the country enters into or goes out of the country without a pass shall be fined panas He shall be punished with the first amercement for producing a false pass

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vivītaadhyakṣo mudrāṃ paśyet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The superintendent of pasture lands shall examine passes

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: grāmaantareṣu ca vivītaṃ sthāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Pasture grounds shall be opened between any two dangerous places

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: coravyālabhayānnimnaaraṇyāni śodhayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Valleys shall be cleared from the fear of thieves, elephants, and other beasts

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anudake kūpasetubandhautsān sthāpayet, puṣpaphalavāṭāṃś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In barren tracts of the country, there shall be constructed not only tanks, buildings for shelter, and wells, but also flower gardens and fruit gardens

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: lubdhakaśvagaṇinaḥ parivrajeyur araṇyāni //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hunters with their hounds shall reconnoitre forests

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: taskaraamitraabhyāgame śaṅkhadundubhiśabdam agrāhyāḥ kuryuḥ śailavṛkṣaadhirūḍhā vā śīghravāhanā vā // amitraaṭavīsaṃcāraṃ ca rājño gṛhakapotair mudrāyuktair hārayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: At the approach of thieves or enemies, they shall so hide themselves by ascending trees or mountains as to escape from the thieves, and Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 blow conchshells or beat drums As to the movements of enemies or wild tribes, they may send information by flying the pigeons of royal household with passes mudrá or causing fire and smoke at successive distances

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dhūmaagniparamparayā vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: End of the fiftyfifth chapter from the beginning] CHAPTER

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dravyahastivanaājīvaṃ vartanīṃ corarakṣaṇam /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE DUTY OF REVENUECOLLECTORS; SPIES IN THE GUISE OF HOUSEHOLDERS, MERCHANTS AND ASCETICS

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sārthaativāhyaṃ gorakṣyaṃ vyavahāraṃ ca kārayet // / samāhartā caturdhā janaapdaṃ vibhajya jyeṣṭhamadhyamakaniṣṭhavibhāgena
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: HAVING divided the kingdom janapada into four districts, and having also subdivided the villages gráma as of first, middle and lowest rank, he shall bring them under one or another of the following headsVillages that are exempted from taxation pariháraka; those that supply soldiers áyudhíya;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: grāmaagraṃ parihārakam āyudhīyaṃ dhānyapaśuhiraṇyakupyaviṣṭipratikaram idam
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: those that pay their taxes in the form of grains, cattle, gold hiranya, or raw material kupya; and those that supply free labour vishti, and dairy produce in lieu of taxes karapratikara

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatpradiṣṭaḥ pañcagrāmīṃ daśagrāmīṃ vā gopaś cintayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It is the duty of Gopa, village accountant, to attend to the accounts of five or ten villages as ordered by the CollectorGeneral

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sīmaavarodhena grāmaagram,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 By setting up boundaries to villages, by numbering plots of grounds as cultivated, uncultivated, plains, wet lands, gardens, vegetable gardens, fences váta, forests, altars, temples of gods, irrigation works, cremation grounds, feeding houses sattra, places where water is freely supplied to travellers prapá, places of pilgrimage, pasture grounds and roads, and thereby fixing the boundaries of various villages, of fields, of forests, and of roads, he shall register gifts, sales, charities, and remission of taxes regarding fields

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena sīmnāṃ kṣetrāṇāṃ ca karadaakaradasaṅkhyānena // teṣu caetāvaccāturvārṇyam, etāvantaḥ karṣakagorakṣakavaidehakakārukarmakaradāsāś ca, etāvac ca dvipadacatuṣpadam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Also having numbered the houses as taxpaying or nontaxpaying, he shall not only register the total number of the inhabitants of all the four castes in each village, but also keep an account of the exact number of cultivators, cowherds, merchants, artizans, labourers, slaves, and biped and quadruped animals, fixing at the same time the amount of gold, free labour, toll, and fines that can be collected from it each house

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kulānāṃ ca strīpuruṣāṇāṃ bālavṛddhakarmacaritraājīvavyayaparimāṇaṃ vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall also keep an account of the number of young and old men that reside in each house, their history charitra, occupation ájíva, income áya, and expenditure vyaya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evaṃ ca janapadacaturbhāgaṃ sthānikaś cintayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Likewise Sthánika, district officer, shall attend to the accounts of one quarter of the kingdom

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gopasthānikasthāneṣu pradeṣṭāraḥ kāryakaraṇaṃ balipragrahaṃ ca kuryuḥ // samāhartṛpradiṣṭāś ca gṛhapatikavyañjanā yeṣu grāmeṣu praṇihitās teṣāṃ grāmāṇāṃ kṣetragṛhakulaagraṃ vidyuḥ, mānasaṃjātābhyāṃ kṣetrāṇi bhogaparihārābhyāṃ gṛhāṇi varṇakarmabhyāṃ kulāni ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In those places which are under the jurisdiction of Gopa and Sthánika, commissioners prodeshtárah specially deputed by the Collectorgeneral shall not only inspect the work done and the means employed by the village and district officers, but also collect the special religious tax known as bali balipragraham kuryuh Spies under the disguise of householders grihapatika, cultivators who shall be deputed by the collectorgeneral for espionage shall ascertain the validity of the accounts of the village and district officers regarding the fields, houses and families of Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 each villagethe area and output of produce regarding fields, right of ownership and remission of taxes with regard to houses, and the caste and profession regarding families

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ jaṅghaagram āyavyayau ca vidyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They shall also ascertain the total number of men and beasts janghágra as well as the amount of income and expenditure of each family

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prasthitaāgatānāṃ ca pravāsaāvāsakāraṇam, anarthyānāṃ ca strīpuruṣāṇāṃ cārapracāraṃ ca vidyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They shall also find out the causes of emigration and immigration of persons of migratory habit, the arrival and departure of men and women of condemnable anarthya character, as well as the movements of foreign spies

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evaṃ vaidehakavyañjanāḥ svabhūmijānāṃ rājapaṇyānāṃ khanisetuvanakarmaantakṣetrajānāṃ pramāṇam arghaṃ ca vidyuḥ // parabhūmijātānāṃ vāristhalapathaupayātānāṃ sāraphalgupuṇyānāṃ karmasu ca śulkavartanyātivāhikagulmataradeyabhāgabhaktapaṇyaagārapramāṇaṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Likewise spies under the guise of merchants shall ascertain the quantity and price of the royal merchandise such as minerals, or products of gardens, forests, and fields or manufactured articles As regards foreign merchandise of superior or inferior quality arriving thither by land or by water, they shall ascertain the amount of toll, roadcess, conveyancecess, military cess, ferryfare, and onesixth portion paid or payable by the merchants, the charges incurred by them for their own subsistence, and for the accommodation of their merchandise in warehouse panyágára

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evaṃ samāhartṛpradiṣṭās tāpasavyañjanāḥ karṣakagorakṣakavaidehakānām adhyakṣāṇāṃ ca śaucaāśaucaṃ vidyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Similarly spies under the guise of ascetics shall, as ordered by the Collectorgeneral, gather information as to the proceedings, honest or dishonest, of cultivators, cowherds, merchants, and heads of Government departments

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / purāṇa coravyañjanāś caantevāsinaś caityacatuṣpathaśūnyapadaudapānanadīnipānatīrthaāyatanaāśramaaraṇyaśailavanagahaneṣu stenaamitrapravīrapuruṣāṇāṃ ca praveśanasthānagamanaprayojanāny upalabheran //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In places where altars are situated or where four roads meet, in ancient ruins, in the vicinity of tanks, rivers, bathing places, in places of pilgrimage and hermitage, and in desert tracts, mountains, and thick grown forests, spies under the guise of old and notorious thieves with their student bands shall ascertain the Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 causes of arrival and departure, and halt of thieves, enemies, and persons of undue bravery

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samāhartā janapadaṃ cintayed evam utthitaḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The Collectorgeneral shall thus energetically attend to the affairs of the kingdom

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: cintayeyuś ca saṃsthās tāḥ saṃsthāś caanyāḥ svayonayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Also his subordinates constituting his various establishments of espionage shall along with their colleagues and followers attend to their duties likewise

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samāhartṛvan nāgariko nagaraṃ cintayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: LIKE the Collectorgeneral, the Officer in charge of the Capital City Nágaraka shall look to the affairs of the capital

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daśakulīṃ gopo viṃśatikulīṃ catvāriṃśatkulīṃ vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A Gopa shall keep the accounts of ten households, twenty households, or forty households

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa tasyāṃ strīpuruṣāṇāṃ jātigotranāmakarmabhiḥ jaṅghaagram āyavyayau ca vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall not only know the caste, gotra, the name, and occupation of both men and women in those households, but also ascertain their income and expenditure

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evaṃ durgacaturbhāgaṃ sthānikaś cintayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Likewise, the officer known as Sthánika shall attend to the accounts of the four quarters of the capital

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dharmaāvasathinaḥ pāṣaṇḍipathikān āvedya vāsayeyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They shall allow ascetics and men learned in the Vedas to reside in such places only when those Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 persons are known to be of reliable character

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svapratyayāś ca tapasvinaḥ śrotriyāṃś ca // kāruśilpinaḥ svakarmasthāneṣu svajanaṃ vāsayeyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Artisans and other handicraftsmen may, on their own responsibility, allow others of their own profession to reside where they carry on their own work ie, in their own houses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaidehakāś caanyonyaṃ svakarmasthāneṣu // paṇyānām adeśakālavikretāram asvakaraṇaṃ ca nivedayeyuḥ // śauṇḍikapākvamāṃsikaaudanikarūpaājīvāḥ parijñātam āvāsayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They the merchants shall make a report of those who sell any merchandise in forbidden place or time, as well as of those who are in possession of any merchandise other than their own Vintners, sellers of cooked flesh and cooked rice as well as prostitutes may allow any other person to reside with them only when that person is wellknown to them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ativyayakartāram atyāhitakarmāṇaṃ ca nivedayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They vintners, etc shall make a report of spendthrifts and foolhardy persons who engage themselves in risky undertakings

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: cikitsakaḥ pracchannavraṇapratīkārakārayitāram apathyakāriṇaṃ ca gṛhasvāmī ca nivedya gopasthānikayor mucyeta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any physician who undertakes to treat in secret a patient suffering from ulcer or excess of unwholesome food or drink, as well as the master of the house wherein such treatment is attempted shall be innocent only when they the physician and the master of the house make a report of the same to either Gopa or Sthánika;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyathā tulyadoṣaḥ syāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: otherwise both of them shall be equally guilty with the sufferer

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prasthitaāgatau ca nivedayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Masters of houses shall make a report of strangers arriving at, or departing from their houses;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyathā rātridoṣaṃ bhajeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: otherwise they shall be guilty of the offence theft, etc committed during that night

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣemarātriṣu tripaṇaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Even during safe nights ie, nights when no theft, etc, seems to have been committed, they shall be fined panas for not making such a report

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / pathikautpathikāś ca bahirantaś ca nagarasya devagṛhapuṇyasthānavanaśmaśāneṣu savraṇam aniṣṭaupakaraṇam udbhāṇḍīkṛtam āvignam atisvapnam adhvaklāntam apūrvaṃ vā gṛhṇīyuḥ // evam abhyantare śūnyaniveśaāveśanaśauṇḍikaaudanikapākvamāṃsikadyūtapāṣaṇḍaāvāseṣu vicayaṃ kuryuḥ // agnipratīkāraṃ ca grīṣme //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 Wayfarers going along a high road or by a foot path shall catch hold of any person whom they find to be suffering from a wound or ulcer, or possessed of destructive instruments, or tired of carrying a heavy load, or timidly avoiding the presence of others, or indulging in too much sleep, or fatigued from a long journey, or who appears to be a stranger to the place in localities such as inside or outside the capital, temples of gods, places of pilgrimage, or burial grounds Spies shall also make a search for suspicious persons in the interior of deserted houses, in the workshops or houses of vintners and sellers of cooked rice and flesh, in gambling houses, and in the abode of heretics

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: madhyamayor ahnaś caturbhāgayor aṣṭabhāgoagnidaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kindling of fire shall be prohibited during the two middlemost parts of daytime divided into four equal parts during the summer

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bahiradhiśrayaṇaṃ vā kuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Masters of houses may carry on cooking operations outside their houses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pādaḥ pañcaghaṭīnāṃ kumbhadroṇinihśreṇīparaśuśūrpaaṅkuśakacagrahaṇīdṛtīnāṃ caakaraṇe // tṛṇakaṭacchannāny apanayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a houseowner is not found to have ready with him five waterpots pancha ghatínám, a kumbha, a dróna, a ladder, an axe, a winnowing basket, a hook such as is used to drive an elephant, pincers, kachagráhini, and a leather bag driti, he shall be fined ¼th of a pana They shall also remove thatched roofs

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: agnijīvina ekasthān vāsayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who work by fire blacksmiths shall all together live in a single locality

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svagṛhapradvāreṣu gṛhasvāmino vaseyuḥ asampātino rātrau // rathyāsu kuṭavrajāḥ sahasraṃ tiṣṭheyuḥ, catuṣpathadvārarājaparigraheṣu ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Each houseowner shall ever be present at night at the door of his own house Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 Vessels filled with water shall be kept in thousands in a row without confusion not only in big streets and at places where four roads meet but also in front of the royal buildings rajaprigraheshu

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pradīptam anabhidhāvato gṛhasvāmino dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any houseowner who does not run to give his help in extinguishing the fire of whatever is burning shall be fined panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pramādād dīpteṣu catuṣpañcāśatpaṇo daṇḍaḥ // pradīpikoagninā vadhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and a renter avakrayi, ie, one who has occupied a house for rent not running to extinguish fire shall be fined panas Whoever carelessly sets fire to a house shall be fined panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pāṃsunyāse rathyāyām aṣṭabhāgo daṇḍaḥ, paṅkaudakasamnirodhe pādaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever throws dirt in the street shall be punished with a fine of /th of a pana; whoever causes mire or water to collect in the street shall be fined ¼th of a pana;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājamārge dviguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: whoever commits the above offences in the kings road rájamárga shall be punished with double the above fines

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paṇyasthānaudakasthānadevagṛharājaparigraheṣu paṇauttarā viṣṭādaṇḍāḥ, mūtreṣv ardhadaṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever excretes faeces in places of pilgrimage, reservoirs of water, temples, and royal buildings shall be punished with fines rising from one pana and upwards in the order of the offences;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhaiṣajyavyādhibhayanimittam adaṇḍyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but when such excretions are due to the use of medicine or to disease no punishment shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mārjāraśvanakulasarpapretānāṃ nagarasyaantarutsarge tripaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever throws inside the city the carcass of animals such as a cat, dog, mangoose, and a snake shall be fined panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kharauṣṭraaśvataraaśvapretānāṃ ṣaṭpaṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: of animals such as an ass, a camel, a mule, and cattle shall be fined panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: manuṣyapretānāṃ pañcāśatpaṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and human corpse shall be punished with a fine of 0 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mārgaviparyāse śavadvārād anyataś ca śavanirṇayane pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a dead body is taken out of a city through a gate other than the usual or prescribed one or through a path other than the prescribed path, the first amercement shall be imposed;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śmaśānād anyatra nyāse dahane ca dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a dead body is interred or cremated beyond the burial or cremation grounds, a fine of panas shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viṣaṇṇaalikam ubhayator ātraṃ yāmatūryam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The interval between six nálikas / hours after the fall of night and six nálikas before the dawn shall be the period when a trumpet shall be sounded prohibiting the movement of the people

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tūryaśabde rājño gṛhaabhyāśe sapādapaṇaṃakṣaṇatāḍanaṃ prathamapaścimayāmikam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The trumpet having been sounded, whoever moves in the vicinity of royal buildings during the first or the last yáma hours ? of the period shall be punished with a fine of one pana and a quarter;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: madhyamayāmikaṃ dviguṇam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and during the middlemost yámas, with double the above fine;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: antaścaturguṇam // śaṅkanīye deśe liṅge pūrvaapadāne ca gṛhītam anuyuñjīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and whoever moves outside the royal buildings or the fort shall be punished with four times the above fine Whoever is arrested in suspicious places or as the perpetrator of a criminal act shall be examined

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājaparigrahaupagamane nagararakṣāārohaṇe ca madhyamaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever moves in the vicinity of royal buildings or ascends the defensive fortifications of the capital shall be punished with the middlemost amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sūtikācikitsakapretapradīpayānanāgarikatūryaprekṣāagninimittaṃ mudrābhiś caagrāhyāḥ // cārarātriṣu pracchannaviparītaveṣāḥ pravrajitā daṇḍaśastrahastāś ca manuṣyā doṣato daṇḍyāḥ // rakṣiṇām avāryaṃ vārayatāṃ vāryaṃ caāvārayatāṃ kṣaṇadviguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who go out at night in order to attend to the work of midwifery or medical treatment, or to carry off a dead body to the cremation or burial grounds, or those who go out with a lamp in hand at night, as well as those who go out to visit the officer in charge of the city, or to find out the cause of a trumpet sound turyapreksha, or to extinguish the outbreak of fire or under the authority of a pass shall not be arrested During the nights of free movement chárarátrishu those who move out under disguise, those who stir out though forbidden pravarjitah, as well as those who move with clubs and other weapons in hand shall be punished in proportion to the gravity of Kautilyas Arthashastra their guilt

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: striyaṃ dāsīm adhimehayatāṃ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a watchman has carnal connection with a slave woman, he shall be punished with the first amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: adāsīṃ madhyamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: with a free woman middlemost amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛtaavarodhām uttamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: with a woman arrested for untimely movement, the highest amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kulastriyaṃ vadhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and a woman of high birth kulastrí, he shall be put to death

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: cetanaacetanikaṃ rātridoṣam aśaṃsato nāgarikasya doṣaanurūpo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When the officer in charge of the city nágaraka does not make a report to the king of whatever nocturnal nuisance of animate or inanimate nature chetanâchetana has occurred, or when he shows carelessness in the discharge of his duty, he shall be punished in proportion to the gravity of his crime

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pramādasthāne ca // nityam udakasthānamārgabhramacchannapathavapraprākārarakṣāavekṣaṇaṃ naṣṭaprasmṛtaapasṛtānāṃ ca rakṣaṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall make a daily inspection of reservoirs of water, of roads, of the hidden passage for going out of the city, of forts, fortwalls, and other defensive works He shall also keep in his safe custody of whatever things he comes across as lost, forgotten or left behind by others

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bandhanaagāre ca bālavṛddhavyādhitaanāthānāṃ jātanakṣatrapaurṇamāsīṣu visargaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On the days to which the birth star of the king is assigned, as well as on full moon days, such prisoners as are young, old, diseased, or helpless anátha shall be let out from the jail bandhanâgâra;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paṇyaśīlāḥ samayaanubaddhā vā doṣaniṣkrayaṃ dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: or those who are of charitable disposition or who have made any agreement with the prisoners may liberate them by paying an adequate ransom

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: divase pañcarātre vā bandhanasthān viśodhayet / karmaṇā kāyadaṇḍena hiraṇyaanugraheṇa vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Once in a day or once in five nights, jails may be emptied of prisoners in consideration of the work they have done, or of whipping inflicted upon them, or of an adequate ransom paid by Kautilyas Arthashastra them in gold

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: apūrvadeśaadhigame yuvarājaabhiṣecane / putrajanmani vā mokṣo bandhanasya vidhīyate //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whenever a new country is conquered, when an heir apparent is installed on the throne, or when a prince is born to the king, prisoners are usually set free

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dharmasthās trayas trayoamātyā janapadasaṃdhisaṃgrahaṇadroṇamukhasthānīyeṣu vyāvahārikān arthān kuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: IN the cities of Sangrahana, Dronamukha, and Stháníya, and at places where districts meet, three members acquainted with Sacred Law dharmasthas and three ministers of the king amátyas shall carry on the administration of Justice

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tirohitaantaragāranaktaaraṇyaupadhyupahvarakṛtāṃś ca vyavahārān pratiṣedhayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Valid and Invalid Transactions They shall hold as void agreements vyavahára entered into in seclusion, inside the houses, in the dead of night, in forests, in secret, or with fraud

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kartuḥ kārayituḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The proposer and the accessory shall be punished with the first amercement [A fine ranging from to panas is called first amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śrotṛṛṇām ekaekaṃ pratyardhadaṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: , Book ]; the witnesses srotri voluntary hearers shall each be punished with half of the above fine;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śraddheyānāṃ tu dravyavyapanayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and accepters shall suffer the loss they may have sustained

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parokṣeṇaadhikaṛṇagrahaṇam avaktavyakarā vā tirohitāḥ sidhyeyuḥ // dāyanikṣepaupanidhivivāhayuktāḥ strīṇām aniṣkāsinīnāṃ vyādhitānāṃ caamūḍhasaṃjñānām antaragārakṛtāḥ sidhyeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those agreements which relate to the division of inheritance, sealed or unsealed deposits, or marriage; or those in which are concerned women who are either afflicted with disease or who do Kautilyas Arthashastra not stir out; as well as those entered into by persons who are not known to be of unsound mind shall be valid though they might be entered into inside houses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāhasaanupraveśakalahavivāharājaniyogayuktāḥ pūrvarātravyavahāriṇāṃ ca rātrikṛtāḥ sidhyeyuḥ // sārthavrajaāśramavyādhacāraṇamadhyeṣv araṇyacarāṇām araṇyakṛtāḥ sidhyeyuḥ // gūḍhaājīviṣu caupadhikṛtāḥ sidhyeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Transactions relating to robbery, duel, marriage, or the execution of the kings order, as well as agreements entered into by persons who usually do their business during the first part of the night shall be valid though they might be done at night With regard to those persons who live most part of their life in forests, whether as merchants, cowherds, hermits, hunters, or spies, their agreements though entered into in forests shall be valid

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mithaḥsamavāye caupahvarakṛtāḥ sidhyeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If fraudulent agreements, only such shall be valid as are entered into by spies

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: atoanyathā na sidhyeyuḥ, apāśrayavadbhiś ca kṛtāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such agreements ie, those entered into in seclusion, etc except as detailed above shall be void

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kaniṣṭhenaavibhaktaaṃśena, patimatyā putravatyā ca striyā, dāsaāhitakābhyām, aprāptaatītavyavahārābhyām, abhiśastapravrajitanyaṅgavyasanibhiś ca,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: So also agreements entered into by dependent or unauthorised persons, such as a fathers mother, a son, a father having a son, an outcast brother, the youngest brother of a family of undivided interests, a wife having her husband or son, a slave, a hired labourer, any person who is too young or too old to carry on business, a convict abhisasta, a cripple, or an afflicted person, shall not be valid

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyatra niṣṛṣṭavyavahārebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But it would be otherwise if he were authorised

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatraapi kruddhenaārtena mattenaunmattenaavagṛhītena vā kṛtā vyavahārā na sidhyeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Even agreements entered into by an authorised person shall be void if he was at the time of making the agreements under provocation, anxiety, or intoxication, or if he was a lunatic or a haunted person

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kartṛkārayitṛśrotṛṛṇāṃ pṛthag yathāuktā daṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra In all these cases, the proposer, his accessory, and witnesses shall each be punished as specified above

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sve sve tu varge deśe kāle ca svakaraṇakṛtāḥ sampūrṇaācārāḥ śuddhadeśā dṛṣṭarūpalakṣaṇapramāṇaguṇāḥ sarvavyavahārāḥ sidhyeyuḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But such agreements as are entered into in person by any one with others of his own community in suitable place and time are valid provided the circumstances, the nature, the description, and the qualities of the case are credible

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paścimaṃ caeṣāṃ karaṇam ādeśaādhivarjaṃ śraddheyam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such agreements with the exception of orders Adesaprobably a bill of exchange and hypothecations may be binding though entered into by a third person

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti vyavahārasthāpanā /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus the determination of the forms of agreement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / saṃvatsaram ṛtuṃ māsaṃ pakṣaṃ divasaṃ karaṇam adhikaraṇam ṛṇaṃ vedakaāvedakayoḥ kṛtasamarthaavasthayor deśagrāmajātigotranāmakarmāṇi caabhilikhya vādiprativādipraśnān arthaānupūrvyā niveśayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The Trial The year, the season, the month, the fortnight paksha, the date, the nature and place of the deed, the amount of the debt as well as the country, the residence, the caste, the gotra, the name and occupation of both the plaintiff and the defendant both of whom must be fit to sue and defend kritasamarthávasthayoh, having been registered first, the statements of the parties shall be taken down in such order as is required by the case

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: niviṣṭāṃś caavekṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: These statements shall then be thoroughly scrutinised

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūrvauktaṃ paścimenaarthena naabhisaṃdhatte, paravākyam anabhigrāhyam abhigrāhyaavatiṣṭhate, pratijñāya deśaṃ nirdiśaity ukte na nirdiśati,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The offence of Parokta Leaving out the question at issue, either of the parties takes resort to another; his previous statement is not consistent with his subsequent one; he insists on the necessity of considering the opinion of a third person, though it is not worthy of any such consideration;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nirdiṣṭād deśād anyaṃ deśam upasthāpayati, upasthite deśearthavacanaṃ naevam ity apavyayate,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: having commenced to answer the question at issue, he breaks off at once, even though he is ordered to continue; he introduces questions other than those specified by himself;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sākṣibhir avadhṛtaṃ naicchati,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: he withdraws his own statement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: asambhāṣye deśe sākṣibhir mithaḥ sambhāṣate,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and he holds secret conversation with his witnesses where he ought not to do so

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti parāuktahetavaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: These constitute the offence of Parokta

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parāuktadaṇḍaḥ pañcabandhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Punishment for Parokta Fine for parokta is five times the amount paroktadandah panchabandah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svayaṃvādidaṇḍo daśabandhaḥ // puruṣabhṛtir aṣṭaaṃśaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Fine for self assertion svayamvádi asserting without evidence is ten times the amount dasabandha Payments for Witnesses Fees for witnesses purushabhritih shall cover /th of the amount astánga

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pathibhaktam arghaviśeṣataḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Provision proportional to the amount sued for may also be made for the expenses incurred by witnesses in their journey

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tad ubhayaṃ niyamyo dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The defeated party shall pay these two kinds of costs

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: abhiyukto na pratyabhiyuñjīta, anyatra kalahasāhasasārthasamavāyebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Countersuits In cases other than duel, robbery, as well as disputes among merchants or tradeguilds, the defendant shall file no countercase against the plaintiff

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na caabhiyukteabhiyogeasti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Nor can there be a countercase for the defendant

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: abhiyoktā cet pratyuktas tadahar eva na pratibrūyāt parāuktaḥ syāt // kṛtakāryaviniścayo hy abhiyoktā naabhiyuktaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Adjournments The plaintiff shall „rejoin‟ reply soon after the defendant has answered the questions at issue Else he shall be guilty of parokta, for the plaintiff knows the determining factors of the case But the defendant does not do so

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaapratibruvatas trirātraṃ saptarātram iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The defendant may be allowed three or seven nights to prepare his defence

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ata ūrdhvaṃ tripaṇaavaraardhyaṃ dvādaśapaṇaparaṃ daṇḍaṃ kuryāt // tripakṣād ūrdhvam apratibruvataḥ parāuktadaṇḍaṃ kṛtvā yāny asya dravyāṇi syus tatoabhiyoktāraṃ pratipādayed,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If he is not ready with his defence within that time, he shall be punished with a fine Kautilyas Arthashastra ranging from to panas If he does not answer even after three fortnights, he shall be fined for parokta, and the plaintiff shall recover out of the defendants property the amount of the case But if the plaintiff sues for a mere return of gratitude pratyupakarana, then no decree shall be passed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tad eva niṣpatatoabhiyuktasya kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same punishment shall be meted out to such of the defendants as fail in their defence

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: abhiyoktur niṣpātasamakālaḥ parāuktabhāvaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the plaintiff fails to prove his case, he shall also be guilty of parokta

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pretasya vyasanino vā sākṣivacanam asāram // abhiyoktā daṇḍaṃ dattvā karma kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If he fails to substantiate his case against a dead or diseased defendant, he shall pay a fine and perform the funeral ceremonies of the defendant, as determined by the witnesses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ādhiṃ vā sa kāmaṃ praveśayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If he proves his case, he may be permitted to take possession of the property hypothecated to him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rakṣoghnarakṣitaṃ vā karmaṇā pratipādayed, anyatra brāhmaṇāt // caturvarṇaāśramasyaayaṃ lokasyaācārarakṣaṇāt / naśyatāṃ sarvadharmāṇāṃ rājā dharmapravartakaḥ // dharmaś ca vyavahāraś ca caritraṃ rājaśāsanam /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But if he is not a Bráhman, he may, on his failure to prove his case, be caused to perform such ceremonials as drive out demons rakshoghna rakshitakam In virtue of his power to uphold the observance of the respective duties of the four castes and of the four divisions of religious life, and in virtue of his power to guard against the violation of the Dharmas, the king is the fountain of justice dharmapravartaka Sacred law Dharma, evidence Vyavahára, history Charitra, and edicts of kings Rájasásana are the four legs of Law

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vivādaarthaś catuṣpādaḥ paścimaḥ pūrvabādhakaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of these four in order, the later is superior to the one previously named

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatra satye sthito dharmo vyavahāras tu sākṣiṣu /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Dharma is eternal truth holding its sway over the world; Vyavahára, evidence, is in witnesses;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: caritraṃ saṃgrahe puṃsāṃ rājñām ājñā tu śāsanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Charitra, history, is to be found in the tradition sangraha, of the people; and the order of kings is what is called sásana

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājñaḥ svadharmaḥ svargāya prajā dharmeṇa rakṣituḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: As the duty of a king consists in protecting his subjects with justice, its observance leads him to heaven

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: arakṣitur vā kṣeptur vā mithyādaṇḍam atoanyathā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who does not Kautilyas Arthashastra protect his people or upsets the social order wields his royal sceptre danda in vain

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daṇḍo hi kevalo lokaṃ paraṃ caimaṃ ca rakṣati / rājñā putre ca śatrau ca yathādoṣaṃ samaṃ dhṛtaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It is power and power danda alone which, only when exercised by the king with impartiality and in proportion to guilt either over his son or his enemy, maintains both this world and the next

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anuśāsadd hi dharmeṇa vyavahāreṇa saṃsthayā / nyāyena ca caturthena caturantāṃ vā mahīṃ jayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The king who administers justice in accordance with sacred law Dharma, evidence vyavahára, history samsthá and edicts of kings Nyáya which is the fourth will be able to conquer the whole world bounded by the four quarters Chaturantám mahím

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃsthā yā dharmaśāstreṇa śāstraṃ vā vyāvahārikam / yasminn arthe virudhyeta dharmeṇaarthaṃ vinirṇayet // śāstraṃ vipratipadyeta dharme nyāyena kenacit /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whenever there is disagreement between history and sacred law or between evidence and sacred law, then the matter shall be settled in accordance with sacred law But whenever sacred law sástra is conflict with rational law Dharmanyáyakings law, then reason shall be held authoritative;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nyāyas tatra pramāṇaṃ syāt tatra pāṭho hi naśyati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for there the original text on which the sacred law has been based is not available

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dṛṣṭadoṣaḥ svayaṃvādaḥ svapakṣaparapakṣayoḥ / anuyogaārjavaṃ hetuḥ śapathaś caarthasādhakaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Selfassertion svayamváda on the part of either of the parties has often been found faulty Examination anuyoga, honesty árjava, evidence hetu and asseveration by oath sapathathese alone can enable a man to win his cause

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūrvauttaraarthavyāghāte sākṣivaktavyakāraṇe / cārahastāc ca niṣpāte pradeṣṭavyaḥ parājayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whenever by means of the deposition of witnesses, the statements of either of the parties are found contradictory, and whenever the cause of either of the parties is found through the kings spies to be false, then the decree shall be passed against that party

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vivāhapūrvo vyavahāraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: [Thus ends Chapter , Determination of forms of Agreement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kanyādānaṃ kanyām alaṃkṛtya brāhmo vivāhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra MARRIAGE precedes the other calls of life vyavahára The giving in marriage of a maiden welladorned is called Bráhmamarriage

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sahadharmacaryā prājāpatyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The jointperformance of sacred duties by a man and a woman is known as prájápatya marriage

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gomithunaādānād ārṣaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The giving in marriage of a maiden for a couple of cows is called Arsha

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: antarvedyām ṛtvije dānād daivaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The giving in marriage of a maiden to an officiating priest in a sacrifice is called Daiva

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mithaḥsamavāyād gāndharvaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The voluntary union of a maiden with her lover is called Gándharva

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śulkaādānād āsuraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Giving a maiden after receiving plenty of wealth súlka is termed Asura

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prasahyaādānād rākṣasaḥ // suptamattaādānāt paiśācaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The abduction of a maiden is called Rákshasa The abduction of a maiden while she is asleep and in intoxication is called Paisácha marraige

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pitṛpramāṇāś catvāraḥ pūrve dharmyāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of these, the first four are ancestral customs of old and are valid on their being approved of by the father

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mātāpitṛpramāṇāḥ śeṣāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The rest are to be sanctioned by both the father and the mother;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tau hi śulkaharau duhituḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for it is they that receive the money súlka paid by the bridegroom for their daughter

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyataraabhāveanyataro vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In case of the absence by death of either the father or the mother, the survivor will receive the súlka

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvitīyaṃ śulkaṃ strī hareta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If both of them are dead, the maiden herself shall receive it

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarveṣāṃ prītyāropaṇam apratiṣiddham // iti vivāhadharmaḥ / vṛttir ābandhyaṃ vā strīdhanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any kind of marriage is approvable, provided it pleases all those that are concerned in it Property of Women Means of subsistence vritti or jewellery ábadhya constitutes what is called the property of a woman

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paradvisāhasrā sthāpyā vṛttiḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Means of subsistence valued at above two thousand shall be endowed on her name

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ābandhyaaniyamaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: There is no limit to jewellery

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tad ātmaputrasnuṣābharmaṇi pravāsaapratividhāne ca bhāryāyā bhoktum adoṣaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It is no guilt for the wife to make use of this property in maintaining her son, her daughterinlaw or herself whenever her absent husband has made no provision for her maintenance

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratirodhakavyādhidurbhikṣabhayapratīkāre dharmakārye ca patyuḥ, sambhūya vā dampatyor mithunaṃ prajātayoḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In calamities, disease and famine, in warding off dangers and in charitable acts, the husband, too, may make use of this property Neither shall there be any complaint against the enjoyment of this property by mutual Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 consent by a couple who have brought forth a twin

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: trivarṣaupabhuktaṃ ca dharmiṣṭheṣu vivāheṣu naanuyuñjīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Nor shall there be any complaint if this property has been enjoyed for three years by those who are wedded in accordance with the customs of the first four kinds of marriage

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gāndharvaāsuraupabhuktaṃ savṛddhikam ubhayaṃ dāpyeta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But the enjoyment of this property in the cases of Gándharva and Asura marriages shall be liable to be restored together with interest on it

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rākṣasapaiśācaupabhuktaṃ steyaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the case of such marriages as are called Rákshasa and Paisacha, the use of this property shall be dealt with as theft

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mṛte bhartari dharmakāmā tadānīm eva sthāpyaābharaṇaṃ śulkaśeṣaṃ ca labheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On the death of her husband a woman, desirous to lead a pious life, shall at once receive not only her endowment and jewellery sthápyábharanam, but also the balance of súlka due to her

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: labdhvā vā vindamānā savṛddhikam ubhayaṃ dāpyeta // kuṭumbakāmā tu śvaśurapatidattaṃ niveśakāle labheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If both of these two things are not actually in her possession, though nominally given to her, she shall at once receive both of them together with interest on their value If she is desirous of a second marriage kutumbakáma, she shall be given on the occasion of her remarriage nivesakále whatever either her fatherinlaw or her husband or both had given to her

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: niveśakālaṃ hi dīrghapravāse vyākhyāsyāmaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The time at which women can remarry shall be explained in connection with the subject of long sojourn of husbands

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śvaśuraprātilomyena vā niviṣṭā śvaśurapatidattaṃ jīyeta // jñātihastādabhimṛṣṭāyā jñātayo yathāgṛhītaṃ dadyuḥ // nyāyaupagatāyāḥ pratipattā strīdhanaṃ gopayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a widow marries any man other than of her fatherinlaws selection svasuraprátilomyenanivishtá, she shall forfeit whatever had been given to her by her fatherinlaw and her husband The kinsmen gnátis of a woman shall return to her whatever property of her own she had placed in their custody Whoever justly takes a woman under his protection shall equally protect her property

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: patidāyaṃ vindamānā jīyeta // dharmakāmā bhuñjīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If she lives a pious life, she may enjoy it dharmakámá bhunjíta

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: putravatī vindamānā strīdhanaṃ jīyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: No woman with a son or sons shall be at liberty to make free use of her own property strídhana;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tat tu strīdhanaṃ putrā hareyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for that property of hers Kautilyas Arthashastra her sons shall receive

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: putrabharaṇaarthaṃ vā vindamānā putraarthaṃ sphātīkuryāt // bahupuruṣaprajānāṃ putrāṇāṃ yathāpitṛdattaṃ strīdhanam avasthāpayet // kāmakaraṇīyam api strīdhanaṃ vindamānā putrasaṃsthaṃ kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a woman attempts to take possession of her own property under the plea of maintaining her sons, she shall be made to endow it in their name If a woman has many male children, then she shall conserve her own property in the same condition as she had received from her husband Even that property which has been given her with full powers of enjoyment and disposal she shall endow in the name of her sons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aputrā patiśayanaṃ pālayantī gurusamīpe strīdhanam āyuḥkṣayād bhuñjīta // āpadarthaṃ hi strīdhanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A barren widow who is faithful to the bed of her dead husband may, under the protection of her teacher, enjoy her property as long as she lives for it is to ward off calamities that women are endowed with property

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ūrdhvaṃ dāyādaṃ gacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On her death, her property shall pass into the hands of her kinsmen dáyáda

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jīvati bhartari mṛtāyāḥ putrā duhitaraś ca strīdhanaṃ vibhajeran,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the husband is alive and the wife is dead, then her sons and daughters shall divide her property among themselves

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aputrāyā duhitaraḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If there are no sons, her daughters shall have it

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tadabhāve bhartā // śulkam anvādheyam anyad vā bandhubhir dattaṃ bāndhavā hareyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In their absence her husband shall take that amount of money súlka which he had given her, and her relatives shall retake whatever in the shape of gift or dowry they had presented her

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti strīdhanakalpaḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus the determination of the property of a woman is dealt with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: varṣāṇy aṣṭāv aprajāyamānām aputrāṃ vandhyāṃ caākāṅkṣeta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Remarriage of Males If a woman either brings forth no live children, or has no male issue, or is barren, her husband shall wait for eight years, before marrying another

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daśa nindum, dvādaśa kanyāprasavinīm //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If she bears only a dead child, he has to wait for ten years If she brings forth only females, he has to wait for twelve years

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ putraarthī dvitīyāṃ vindeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Then if he is desirous to have sons, he may marry another

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaatikrame śulkaṃ strīdhanam ardhaṃ caādhivedanikaṃ dadyāt, caturviṃśatipaṇaparaṃ ca daṇḍam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In case of violating this rule, he shall be made to pay her not only sulka, her property strídhana and an adequate monetary compensation ádhivedanikamartham, but also a fine of panas to the Government

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śulkaṃ strīdhanam aśulkastrīdhanāyās tatpramāṇam ādhivedanikam anurūpāṃ ca vṛttiṃ dattvā bahvīr api vindeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Having given the necessary amount of sulka Kautilyas Arthashastra and property strídhana even to those women who have not received such things on the occasion of their marriage with him, and also having given his wives the proportionate compensation and an adequate subsistence vritti, he may marry any number of women;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: putraarthā hi striyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for women are created for the sake of sons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tīrthasamavāye caāsāṃ yathāvivāhaṃ pūrvaūḍhāṃ jīvatputrāṃ vā pūrvaṃ gacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If many or all of them are at the same time in menses, he shall lie with that woman among them, whom he married earlier or who has a living son

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tīrthagūhanaāgamane ṣaṇṇavatir daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In case of his concealing the fact of her being in menses or neglecting to lie with any of them after her menses, he shall pay a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: putravatīṃ dharmakāmāṃ vandhyāṃ ninduṃ nīrajaskāṃ vā naakāmām upeyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of women who either have sons or are pious or barren, or bring forth only a dead child or are beyond the age of menstruation, none shall be associated with against her liking

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na caakāmaḥ puruṣaḥ kuṣṭhinīm unmattāṃ vā gacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a man has no inclination, he may not lie with his wife who is either afflicted with leprosy or is a lunatic

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: strī tu putraartham evaṃbhūtaṃ vāupagacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But if a woman is desirous of having sons, she may lie with men suffering from such disease

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nīcatvaṃ paradeśaṃ vā prasthito rājakilbiṣī / prāṇaabhihantā patitas tyājyaḥ klīboapi vā patiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a husband either is of bad character or is long gone abroad or has become a traitor to his king or is likely to endanger the life of his wife or has fallen from his caste or has lost virility, he may be abandoned by his wife

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvādaśavarṣā strī prāptavyavahārā bhavati, ṣoḍaśavarṣaḥ pumān //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra WOMEN, when twelve years old, attain their majority práptavyavahára and men when sixteen years old

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ata ūrdhvam aśuśrūṣāyāṃ dvādaśapaṇaḥ striyā daṇḍaḥ, puṃso dviguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If after attaining their majority, they prove disobedient to lawful authority asusrúsháyám, women shall be fined panas and men, twice the amount

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bharmaṇyāyām anirdiṣṭakālāyāṃ grāsaācchādanaṃ vāadhikaṃ yathāpuruṣaparivāpaṃ saviśeṣaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Maintenance of a woman A woman who has a right to claim maintenance for an unlimited period of time shall be given as much food and clothing grásacchádana as is necessary for her or more than is necessary in proportion to the income of the maintainer yathapurushaparivápam vá

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nirdiṣṭakālāyāṃ tad eva saṃkhyāya bandhaṃ ca dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the period for which such things are to be given to her is limited, then a certain amount of money fixed in proportion to the income of the maintainer shall be given to her;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śulkastrīdhanaādhivedanikānām anādāne ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: so also if she has not been given her sulka, property, and compensation due to her for allowing her husband to remarry

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śvaśurakulapraviṣṭāyāṃ vibhaktāyāṃ vā naabhiyojyaḥ patiḥ // iti bharma /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If after parting with her husband, she places herself under the protection of any one belonging to her fatherinlaw‟s family svasrakula, or if she begins to live independently, then her husband shall not be sued for for her maintenance

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: naṣṭe vinaṣṭe nyaṅge apitṛke amātṛke ity anirdeśena vinayagrāhaṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Cruelty to women Women of refractive nature shall be taught manners by using such general expressions as „Thou, half naked; thou, fully naked; thou, cripple;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: veṇudalarajjuhastānām anyatamena vā pṛṣṭhe trir āghātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or three beats either with a bamboobark or with a rope or with the palm of the hand may be given on her hips

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaatikrame vāgdaṇḍapāruṣyadaṇḍābhyām ardhadaṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Violation of the above rules shall be liable to half the punishment levied for defamation and criminal hurt

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tad eva striyā bhartari prasiddhadoṣāyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same kind of punishment shall be meted out to a woman who, moved with jealousy or hatred, shows cruelty to Kautilyas Arthashastra her husband

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: īrṣyayā bāhyavihāreṣu dvāreṣv atyayo yathānirdiṣṭaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Punishments for engaging in sports at the door of, or outside her husbands house shall be as dealt with elsewhere

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti pāruṣyam /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus cruelty to women is dealt with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhartāraṃ dviṣatī strī saptaārtavāny amaṇḍayamānā tadānīm eva sthāpyaābharaṇaṃ nidhāya bhartāram anyayā saha śayānam anuśayīta
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Enmity between husband and wife A woman, who hates her husband, who has passed the period of seven turns of her menses, and who loves another shall immediately return to her husband both the endowment and jewellery she has received from him, and allow him to lie down with another woman

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhikṣukyanvādhijñātikulānām anyatame vā bhartā dviṣan striyam ekām anuśayīta // dṛṣṭaliṅge maithunaapahāre savarṇaapasarpaupagame vā mithyāvādī dvādaśapaṇaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A man, hating his wife, shall allow her to take shelter in the house of a mendicant woman, or of her lawful guardians or of her kinsmen If a man falsely accuses his wife of adultery with one of her or his kinsmen or with a spyan accusation which can only be proved by eyewitnesses drishtilingeor falsely accuses her of her intention to deprive him of her company, he shall pay a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: amokṣyā bhartur akāmasya dviṣatī bhāryā, bhāryāyāś ca bhartā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A woman, hating her husband, can not dissolve her marriage with him against his will Nor can a man dissolve his marriage with his wife against her will

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parasparaṃdveṣān mokṣaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But from mutual enmity, divorce may be obtained parasparam dveshánmokshah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: strīviprakārād vā puruṣaś cen mokṣam icched yathāgṛhītam asyai dadyāt // puruṣaviprakārād vā strī cen mokṣam icchen naasyai yathāgṛhītaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a man, apprehending danger from his wife desires divorce mokshamichhet, he shall return to her whatever she was given on the occasion of her marriage If a woman, under the apprehension of danger from her husband, desires divorce, she shall forfeit her claim to her property;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratiṣiddhā strī darpamadyakrīḍāyāṃ tripaṇaṃ daṇḍaṃ dadyāt // divā strīprekṣāvihāragamane ṣaṭpaṇo daṇḍaḥ, puruṣaprekṣāvihāragamane dvādaśapaṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Transgression If a woman engages herself in amorous sports, or drinking in the face of an order to the contrary, she shall be fined panas She shall pay a fine of panas for going out at day time to sports or to see a woman or spectacles She shall pay a fine of panas if she Kautilyas Arthashastra goes out to see another man or for sports

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rātrau niṣkasane dviguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For the same offences committed at night, the fines shall be doubled

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: strīpuṃsayor maithunaarthenaaṅgaviceṣṭāyāṃ rahoaślīlasambhāṣāyāṃ vā caturviṃśatipaṇaḥ striyā daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a woman abducts another woman while the latter is asleep or under intoxication suptamattapravrajane, or if she drags her husband as far as the door of the house, she shall be fined panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: puṃso dviguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a woman leaves her house at night, she shall pay double the above fine

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: keśanīvidantanakhaālambaneṣu pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ, puṃso dviguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A woman, holding out her hair, the tie of her dress round her loins, her teeth or her nails, shall pay the first amercement, and a man, doing the same, twice the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śaṅkitasthāne sambhāṣāyāṃ ca paṇasthāne śiphādaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For holding conversation in suspicious places, whips may be substituted for fines

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: strīṇāṃ grāmamadhye caṇḍālaḥ pakṣaantare pañcaśiphā dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the centre of the village, an outcaste person chandála may whip such women five times on each of the sides of their body

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paṇikaṃ vā prahāraṃ mokṣayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: She may get rid of being whipped by paying a pana for each whip panikam vá praharam mokshayet

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ity atīcāraḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus transgression is dealt with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratiṣiddhayoḥ strīpuṃsayor anyonyaupakāre kṣudrakadravyāṇāṃ dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ, sthūlakadravyāṇāṃ caturviṃśatipaṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Forbidden transactions With regard to a man and a woman who, though forbidden to carry on any mutual transaction, help each other, the woman shall be fined , and panas respectively according as the help consists of i small things, of ii heavy things and iii of gold or goldcoin hiranyasuvarnayoh;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: puṃsor dviguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and the man, at double the above rates

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tathā pratiṣiddhapuruṣavyavahāreṣu ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Similar punishment shall be meted out for any forbidden transaction with any men

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti pratiṣedhaḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus forbidden transactions are dealt with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājadviṣṭaaticārābhyām ātmaapakramaṇena ca / strīdhanaānītaśulkānām asvāmyaṃ jāyate striyāḥ // patikulān niṣpatitāyāḥ striyāḥ ṣaṭpaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Treason, transgression and wandering at will shall deprive a Kautilyas Arthashastra woman of her claim not only to i strídhana, some form of subsistence of above ,000 panas and jewellery, ii and áhita, compensation she may have obtained for allowing her husband to marry another woman, but also iii to sulka, money which her parents may have received from her husband

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyatra viprakārāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: [Thus ends Chapter , The Duty of a Wife;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratiṣiddhāyāṃ dvādaśapaṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Maintenance of a Woman;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prativeśagṛhaatigatāyāḥ ṣaṭpaṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: End of the sixtieth chapter from the beginning] CHAPTER VAGRANCY, ELOPEMENT AND SHORT AND LONG SOJOURNMENTS

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prātiveśikabhikṣukavaidehakānām avakāśabhikṣāpaṇyadāne dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If she goes beyond her neighbouring house prativesagrihatigatáyah, she shall be fined panas If she allows into her house her neighbour, takes into her house the alms of any mendicant, or the merchandise of any merchant, she shall be fined panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratiṣiddhānāṃ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If she deals as above though expressly forbidden, she shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paragṛhaatigatāyāś caturviṃśatipaṇaḥ // parabhāryāavakāśadāne śatyo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If she goes out beyond the surrounding houses parigrihátigatáyam, she shall be fined panas If under any other excuse than danger, she takes into her house the wife of another man, she shall be fined 00 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyatraāpadbhyaḥ // vāraṇaajñānayor nirdoṣaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But she will not be guilty if the entrance is effected without her knowledge or against her orders to the contrary

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pativiprakārāt patijñātisukhaavasthagrāmikaanvādhibhikṣukījñātikulānām anyatamam apuruṣaṃ gantum adoṣaḥ iti ācāryāḥ sapuruṣaṃ vā jñātikulam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra My teacher saysWith a view to avoid danger, it is no offence for women to go to any male person who is a kinsman of her husband, or is a rich and prosperous gentleman sukhávastha, or is the headman of the village or is one of her guardians anvádhikula, or who belongs to the family of a mendicant woman, or to any one of her own kinsmen

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kuto hi sādhvījanasyacchalam // sukham etad avaboddhum, iti kauṭilyaḥ // pretavyādhivyasanagarbhanimittam apratiṣiddham eva jñātikulagamanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But Kautilya questions How is it possible for good women sádhvíjana to know at least this fact that the family of her own kinsmen consisting of a number of males is good? It is no offence for women to go to the houses of kinsmen under the circumstances of death, disease, calamities, and confinement of women

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tannimittaṃ vārayato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever prevents her going under such circumstances, shall be fined panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatraapi gūhamānā strīdhanaṃ jīyeta, jñātayo vā chādayantaḥ śulkaśeṣam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If her kinsmen conceal her with a view to exempt her from giving her aid under such circumstances, they shall lose the balance of sulka, money due to them from her husband for giving her in marriage

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti niṣpatanam /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus vagrancy is dealt with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: patikulān niṣpatya grāmaantaragamane dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ sthāpyāābharaṇalopaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Elopement or Criminal Rendezvous If leaving her husbands house, a woman goes to another village, she shall not only pay a fine of panas, but also forfeit her endowment and jewels sthápyábharanalopascha

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gamyena vā puṃsā saha prasthāne caturviṃśatipaṇaḥ sarvadharmalopaś ca, anyatra bharmadānatīrthagamanābhyām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If under any other excuse than receiving her subsistence or pilgrimage bharmádánatirthagamanábhyámanyatra, a woman goes to any other place even in company with an associable man, she shall not only pay a fine of panas, but also lose all kinds of social privileges sarvadharmalopascha

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: puṃsaḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ tulyaśreyasoḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But the man who allows such a woman to accompany him in his journey shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pāpīyaso madhyamaḥ // bandhuradaṇḍyaḥ // pratiṣedheardhadaṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If both of them man, and woman have similar ideals in life tulyasreyasoh and are of sinful life pápiyasoh, each of them shall be punished with the middlemost amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pathi vyantare gūḍhadeśaabhigamane maithunaarthena śaṅkitapratiṣiddhāyāṃ vā pathyanusaraṇe saṃgrahaṇaṃ vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If on a road, or in the middle of a forest, or in any other concealed places a woman falls into the company of any other man, or if, with a view to enjoyment, she accompanies a suspicious or forbidden man, she shall be guilty of elopement sangrahanam vidyát

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tālaavacaracāraṇamatsyabandhakalubdhakagopālakaśauṇḍikānām anyeṣāṃ ca prasṛṣṭastrīkāṇāṃ pathyanusaraṇam adoṣaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It is no offence for women to fall into the company of actors, players, singers, fishermen, hunters, herdsmen, vintners, or persons of any other kind who usually travel with their women

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratiṣiddhe vā nayataḥ puṃsaḥ striyo vā gacchantyās ta evaardhadaṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a man takes a woman with him on his journey, though forbidden to do so, or if a woman accompanies a man though she is forbidden to do so, half of the above fines shall be meted out to them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti pathyanusaraṇam /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus elopement is dealt with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hrasvapravāsināṃ śūdravaiśyakṣatriyabrāhmaṇānāṃ bhāryāḥ saṃvatsarauttaraṃ kālam ākāṅkṣeran aprajātāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Remarriage of women Wives who belong to Súdra, Vaisya, Kshatriya or Bráhman caste, and who have not given birth to children should wait as long as a year for their husbands who have gone abroad for a short time;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃvatsaraadhikaṃ prajātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but if they are such as have given birth to children, they should wait for their absent husbands for more than a year

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prativihitā dviguṇaṃ kālam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If they are provided with maintenance, they should wait for twice the period of time just mentioned

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paraṃ catvāri varṣāṇy aṣṭau vā jñātayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If they are not so provided with, their welltodo gnátis should maintain them either for four or eight years

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tato yathādattam ādāya pramuñceyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Then the gnátis should leave them to marry after taking what had been presented to them on the occasion of their marriages

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brāhmaṇam adhīyānaṃ daśavarṣāṇy aprajātā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the husband is a Bráhman, studying abroad, his wife who has no issue should wait for him for ten years;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvādaśa prajātā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but if she has given birth to children, she should wait for twelve years

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājapuruṣam āyuḥkṣayād ākāṅkṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the husband is of Kshatriya caste, his wife should wait for him till her death;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: savarṇataś ca prajātā naapavādaṃ labheta // kuṭumbaṛddhilope vā sukhaavasthair vimuktā yathāiṣṭaṃ vindeta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the wife of an absent husband lacks maintenance and is deserted by welltodo gnátis, she may remarry one whom she likes and who is in a position to maintain her and relieve her misery

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jīvitaartham āpadgatā vā // dharmavivāhāt kumārī parigrahītāram anākhyāya proṣitam aśrūyamāṇaṃ sapta tīrthāny ākāṅkṣeta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A young wife kumárí who is wedded in accordance with the customs of the first four kinds of marriage dharmaviváhát, and whose husband has gone abroad and is heard of shall wait for him for the period of seven menses saptatirthányákánksheta, provided she has not publicly announced his name;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃvatsaraṃ śrūyamāṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but she shall wait for him a year in case of her having announced the name of her absent husband who is heard of

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ākhyāya proṣitam aśrūyamāṇaṃ pañca tīrthāny ākāṅkṣeta, daśa śrūyamāṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the case of a husband who is gone abroad but who is not heard of, his wife shall wait for the period of five menses, but if the absent husband is not heard of, his wife shall wait for him for the period of ten menses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ekadeśadattaśulkaṃ trīṇi tīrthāny aśrūyamāṇam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the case of a husband who is gone abroad and is not heard of, his wife shall, if she has received only a part of sulka from him, wait for him for the period of three menses;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śrūyamāṇaṃ sapta tīrthāny ākāṅkṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but if he is heard of, she shall wait for him for the period of seven menses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dattaśulkaṃ pañca tīrthāny aśrūyamāṇam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A young wife who has received the whole amount of sulka shall wait for the period of five menses for her absent husband who is not heard of;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daśa śrūyamāṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but if he is heard of, she shall wait for him for the period of ten menses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ paraṃ dharmasthair visṛṣṭā yathāiṣṭaṃ vindeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Then with the permission of judges dharmasthairvisrishtá, she may marry one whom she likes;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tīrthauparodho hi dharmavadha iti kauṭilyaḥ // iti hrasvapravāsaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for neglect of intercourse with wife after her monthly ablution is, in the opinion of Kautilya, a violation of ones duty tirthoparodho hi dharmavadha iti Kautilyah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dīrghapravāsinaḥ pravrajitasya pretasya vā bhāryā sapta tīrthāny ākāṅkṣeta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the case of husbands who have long gone abroad dirgrhapravásinah, who have become ascetics, or who have been dead, their wives, having no issue, shall wait for them for the period of seven menses;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃvatsaraṃ prajātā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but if they have given birth to children, they shall wait for a year

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ patisodaryaṃ gacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Then each of these women may marry the brother of her husband

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bahuṣu pratyāsannaṃ dhārmikaṃ bharmasamarthaṃ kaniṣṭham abhāryaṃ vā // tadabhāveapy asodaryaṃ sapiṇḍaṃ kulyaṃ vāāsannam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If there are a number of brothers to her lost husband, she shall marry such a one of them as is next in age to her former husband, or as is virtuous and is capable of protecting Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 her, or one who is the youngest and unmarried

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: eteṣām eṣa eva kramaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: [Thus ends Chapter , Vagrancy;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: etān utkramya dāyādān vedane jārakarmaṇi /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Elopement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jārastrīdātṛvettāraḥ samprāptāḥ saṃgrahaatyayam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and Short and Long Sojournments, in the section Concerning Marriage in Book , Concerning Law of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anīśvarāḥ pitṛmantaḥ sthitapitṛmātṛkāḥ putrāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: DIVISION OF INHERITANCE SONS whose fathers and mothers or ancestors are alive cannot be independent anísvarah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣām ūrdhvaṃ pitṛto dāyavibhāgaḥ pitṛdravyāṇām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: After their time, division of ancestral property among descendants from the same ancestor shall take place, calculating per sterpes according to fathers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svayaṃārjitam avibhājyam, anyatra pitṛdravyād utthitebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Selfacquired property of any of the sons with the exception of that kind of property which is earned by means of parental property is not divisible

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pitṛdravyād avibhaktaupagatānāṃ putrāḥ pautrā vā ācaturthād ity aṃśabhājaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sons or grandsons till the fourth generation from the first parent shall also have prescribed shares amsabhájah in that property which is acquired by means of their undivided ancestral property;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tāvad avicchinnaḥ piṇḍo bhavati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for the line pindah as far as the fourth generation is uninterrupted avichchhinnah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vicchinnapiṇḍāḥ sarve samaṃ vibhajeran //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But those Kautilyas Arthashastra whose line or genealogy from the first ancestor is interrupted vichchhinnapindáh, ie, those who are subsequent to the fourth generation, shall have equal divisions
