oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: apitṛdravyā vibhaktapitṛdravyā vā saha jīvantaḥ punar vibhajeran //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who have been living together shall redivide their property whether they had already divided their ancestral property before or they had received no such property at all

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dravyam aputrasya sodaryā bhrātaraḥ sahajīvino vā hareyuḥ kanyāś ca // rikthaṃ putravataḥ putrā duhitaro vā dharmiṣṭheṣu vivāheṣu jātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of sons, he who brings the ancestral property to a prosperous condition shall also have a share of the profit If a man has no male issue, his own brothers, or persons who have been living with him, saha jívino vá, shall take possession of his movable property dravyam;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tadabhāve pitā dharamāṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If one has sons, they shall have the property;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pitrabhāve bhrātaro bhrātṛputrāś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if there are neither sons nor such daughters, the dead mans father, if living, shall have it;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: apitṛkā bahavoapi ca bhrātaro bhrātṛputrāś ca pitur ekam aṃśaṃ hareyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if there are many fatherless brothers, all of them shall divide it; and each of the many sons of such brothers shall have one share due to his father piturekamamsam;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sodaryāṇām anekapitṛkāṇāṃ pitṛto dāyavibhāgaḥ // /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if the brothers sodarya are the sons of many fathers, they shall divide it calculating from their fathers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pitṛbhrātṛputrāṇāṃ pūrve vidyamāne naaparam avalambante,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Among a dead mans father, brother, and brothers sons, the succeeding ones shall depend on the preceding ones if living for their shares;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jyeṣṭhe ca kaniṣṭham arthagrāhiṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: likewise the youngest or the eldest claiming his own share

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jīvadvibhāge pitā naekaṃ viśeṣayet // na caekam akāraṇān nirvibhajeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A father, distributing his property while he is alive, shall make no distinction in dividing it among his sons Nor shall a father deprive without sufficient reason any of the sons of his share

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pitur asaty arthe jyeṣṭhāḥ kaniṣṭhān anugṛhṇīyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Father being dead, the elder sons shall show favour to the Kautilyas Arthashastra younger ones, if the latter are not of bad character

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prāptavyavahārāṇāṃ vibhāgaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Time of dividing inheritance Division of inheritance shall be made when all the inheritors have attained their majority

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aprāptavyavahārāṇāṃ deyaviśuddhaṃ mātṛbandhuṣu grāmavṛddheṣu vā sthāpayeyuḥ āvyavahāraprāpaṇāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If it is made before, the minors shall have their shares, free of all debts These shares of the minors shall be placed in the safe custody of the relatives of their mothers, or of aged gentlemen of the village, till they attain their majority

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: proṣitasya vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rule shall hold good in the case of those who have gone abroad

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samniviṣṭasamam asamniviṣṭebhyo naiveśanikaṃ dadyuḥ, kanyābhyaś ca prādānikam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Unmarried brothers shall also be paid as much marriage cost as is equal to that incurred in the marriages of married brothers sannivishtasamamasannivishtebhyonaivesanikam dadyuh

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṛṇarikthayoḥ samo vibhāgaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Both assets and liabilities shall be equally divided

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: udapātrāṇy api niṣkiṃcanā vibhajeran ity ācāryāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: My teacher says that poor people nishkinchanáh shall equally distribute among themselves even the mudvessels udapátram

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: chalam etad iti kauṭilyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the opinion of Kautilya, it is unnecessary to say so chhalam;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: satoarthasya vibhāgo naasataḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for as a rule, division is to be made of all that is in existence, but of nothing that is not in existence

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: etāvān arthaḥ sāmānyas tasyaetāvān pratyaṃśa ity anubhāṣya bruvan sākṣiṣu vibhāgaṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Having declared before witnesses the amount of property common to all sámánya as well as the property constituting additional shares amsa of the brothers in priority of their birth, division of inheritance shall be carried on

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: durvibhaktam anyonyaapahṛtam antarhitam avijñātautpannaṃ vā punar vibhajeran //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whatever is badly and unequally divided or is involved in deception, concealment or secret acquisition, shall be redivided

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: adāyādakaṃ rājā haret strīvṛttipretakāryavarjam, anyatra śrotriyadravyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Property for which no claimant is found ádáyádakam shall go to the king, except the property of a woman, of a dead man for Kautilyas Arthashastra whom no funeral rites have been performed, or of a niggardly man with the exception of that of a Bráhman learned in the Vedas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tat traivedyebhyaḥ prayacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That the property of the learned shall be made over to those who are wellversed in the three Vedas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: patitaḥ patitāj jātaḥ klībaś caanaṃśāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Persons fallen from caste, persons born of outcaste men, and eunuchs shall have no share;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jaḍaunmattaandhakuṣṭhinaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: likewise idiots, lunatics, the blind and lepers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sati bhāryaarthe teṣām apatyam atadvidhaṃ bhāgaṃ haret //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the idiots, etc, have wives with property, their issues who are not equally idiots, etc, shall share inheritance

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: grāsaācchādanam itare patitavarjāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: All these persons excepting those that are fallen from caste patitavarjah shall be entitled to only food and clothing

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ ca kṛtadārāṇāṃ lupte prajanane sati / sṛjeyur bāndhavāḥ putrāṃs teṣām aṃśān prakalpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If these persons have been married before they became fallen, etc and if their line is likely to become extinct, their relatives may beget sons for them and give proportional shares of inheritance to those sons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ekastrīputrāṇāṃ jyeṣṭhaaṃśaḥ brāhmaṇānām ajāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: SPECIAL SHARES IN INHERITANCE GOATS shall be the special shares of the eldest of sons, born of the same mother, among, Bráhmans;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣatriyāṇām aśvāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: horses among Kshatriyas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaiśyānāṃ gāvaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: cows among Vaisyas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śūdrāṇām avayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and sheep among Súdras

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāṇalaṅgās teṣāṃ madhyamaaṃśaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The blind of the same animals shall be the special shares to the middlemost sons;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhinnavarṇāḥ kaniṣṭhaaṃśaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: species of variegated colour of the same animals shall be the special shares to the youngest of sons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: catuṣpadaabhāve ratnavarjānāṃ daśānāṃ bhāgaṃ dravyāṇām ekaṃ jyeṣṭho haret //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the absence of quadruped, the eldest shall take an additional share of the whole property Kautilyas Arthashastra excepting precious stones;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratimuktasvadhāpāśo hi bhavati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for by this act alone, he will be bound in his duty to his ancestors

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ity auśanaso vibhāgaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The above method is in accordance with the rules observed among the followers of Usanas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pituḥ parivāpād yānam ābharaṇaṃ ca jyeṣṭhaaṃśaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The father being dead, his carriage and jewellery shall be the special share to the eldest;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śayanaāsanaṃ bhuktakāṃsyaṃ ca madhyamaaṃśaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: his bed, seat, and bronze plate in which he used to take his meals bhuktakámsyam, to the middlemost;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛṣṇaṃ dhānyaāyasaṃ gṛhaparivāpo gośakaṭaṃ ca kaniṣṭhaaṃśaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and black grains, iron, domestic utensils, cows and cart to the youngest

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śeṣadravyāṇām ekadravyasya vā samo vibhāgaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The rest of the property, or the above things, too, may be equally divided among themselves

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: adāyādā bhaginyaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sisters shall have no claim to inheritance;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mātuḥ parivāpād bhuktakāṃsyaābharaṇabhāginyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: they shall have the bronze plate and jewellery of their mother after her death

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mānuṣahīno jyeṣṭhas tṛtīyam aṃśaṃ jyeṣṭhaaṃśāl labheta, caturtham anyāyavṛttiḥ, nivṛttadharmakāryo vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: An impotent eldest son shall have only /rd of the special share usually given to the eldest; if the eldest son follows a condemnable occupation or if he has given up the observance of religious duties, he shall have only ¼ of the special share;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāmaācāraḥ sarvaṃ jīyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if he is unrestrained in his actions he shall have nothing

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena madhyamakaniṣṭhau vyākhyātau //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rule shall hold good with the middlemost and youngest sons;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tayor mānuṣaupeto jyeṣṭhaaṃśād ardhaṃ labheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: of these two, one who is endowed with manliness mánushopetah, shall have half the special share usually given to the eldest

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nānāstrīputrāṇāṃ tu saṃskṛtaasaṃskṛtayoḥ kanyākṛtakṣatayor abhāve ca ekasyāḥ putrayor yamayor vā pūrvajanmanā jyeṣṭhabhāvaḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: With regard to sons of many wives Of sons of two wives of whom only one woman has gone through all the necessary religious ceremonials, or both of whom have not, as maidens, observed necessary religious rites, or one of whom has brought forth twins, it is by birth that primogenitureship is decided

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sūtamāgadhavrātyarathakārāṇām aiśvaryato vibhāgaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Shares in inheritance for such sons as Súta, Mágadha, Vrátya and Rathakára shall depend on the abundance of paternal property;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śeṣās tam upajīveyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the rest, ie, sons other than Súta, etc, of inferior birth, shall be Kautilyas Arthashastra dependent on the eldest for their subsistence

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anīśvarāḥ samavibhāgāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Dependent sons shall have equal divisions

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: cāturvarṇyaputrāṇāṃ brāhmaṇīputraś caturoaṃśān haret,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of sons begotten by a Bráhman in the four castes, the son of a Bráhman woman shall take four shares;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣatriyāputrastrīn aṃśān,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the son of a Kshatriya woman three shares;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaiśyāputro dvāv aṃśau, ekaṃ śūdrāputraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the son of a Vaisya woman two shares, and the son of a Súdra woman one share

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena trivarṇadvivarṇaputravibhāgaḥ kṣatriyavaiśyayor vyākhyātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rule shall hold good in the case of Kshatriya and Vaisya fathers begetting sons in three or two castes in order

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brāhmaṇasyaanantarāputras tulyaaṃśaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: An Anantara son of a Bráhman, ie

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣatriyavaiśyayor ardhaaṃśaḥ tulyaaṃśo vā mānuṣaupetaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: similarly Anantara sons of Kshatriya or Vaisya fathers shall if endowed with manly or superior qualities, take half or equal shares with others

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tulyaatulyayor ekaputraḥ sarvaṃ haret, bandhūṃś ca bibhṛyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: An only son to two mothers of different castes shall take possession of the whole property and maintain the relatives of his father

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brāhmaṇānāṃ tu pāraśavas tṛtīyam aṃśaṃ labheta, dvāv aṃśau sapiṇḍaḥ kulyo vāāsannaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A Palrasava son begotten by a Bráhman on a Súdra woman, shall take /rd share; a sapinda, an agnate or a kulya the nearest cognate, of the Bráhman shall take the remaining two shares, being thereby obliged to offer funeral libation;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tadabhāve pitur ācāryoantevāsī vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: in the absence of agnates or cognates, the deceased fathers teacher or student shall take the two shares

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣetre vā janayed asya niyuktaḥ kṣetrajaṃ sutam / mātṛbandhuḥ sagotro vā tasmai tat pradiśed dhanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or on the wife of such a Bráhman shall a sagotra, relative bearing the same family name, or a mátribandha relative of his mother, beget a natural son kshetraja, and this son may take that wealth

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paraparigrahe bījam utsṛṣṭaṃ kṣetriṇaḥ ity ācāryāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: DISTINCTION BETWEEN SONS MY preceptor says that the seed sown in the field of another shall belong to the owner of that field

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mātā bhastrā, yasya retas tasyaapatyam ity apare //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Others hold that the mother being only the receptacle for the seed mátá bhastrá, the child must belong to him from whose seed it is born

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vidyamānam ubhayam iti kauṭilyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilya says that it must belong to both the living parents

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svayaṃjātaḥ kṛtakriyāyām aurasaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The son begotten by a man on his wife who has gone through all the required ceremonials is called aurasa, natural son;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena tulyaḥ putrikāputraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: equal to him is the son of an appointed daughter putrikáputra;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sagotreṇaanyagotreṇa vā niyuktena kṣetrajātaḥ kṣetrajaḥ putraḥ // janayitur asaty anyasmin putre sa eva dvipitṛko dvigotro vā dvayor api svadhārikthabhāg bhavati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the son begotten on a wife by another man, appointed for the purpose, and of the same gotra as that of the husband; or of a different gotra, is called kshetraja; on the death of the begetter, the kshetraja son will be the son to both the fathers, follow the gotras of both, offer funeral libations to both, and take possession of the immovable property ríktha of both of them;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatsadharmā bandhūnāṃ gṛhe gūḍhajātas tu gūḍhajaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: of the same status as the kshetraja is he who is secretly begotten in the house of relatives and is called gúdhaja, secretly born;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bandhunāutsṛṣṭoapaviddhaḥ saṃskartuḥ putraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the son cast off by his natural parents is called apaviddha and will belong to that man who performs necessary religious ceremonials to him;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kanyāgarbhaḥ kānīnaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the son born of a maiden before wedlock is called kánína;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sagarbhaūḍhāyāḥ sahaūḍhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the son born of a woman married while carrying is called sahodha;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: punarbhūtāyāḥ paunarbhavaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the son of a remarried woman punarbhátáyáh is called paunarbhava

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svayaṃjātaḥ pitur bandhūnāṃ ca dāyādaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A natural son can claim relationship both with his father and his fathers relatives;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parajātaḥ saṃskartur eva na bandhūnām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but a son born to another man can have relationship only with his adopter

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatsadharmā mātāpitṛbhyām adbhir mukto dattaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of the same status as the latter is he who is given in adoption with water by both the father and mother and is called datta

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svayaṃ bandhubhir vā putrabhāvaupagata upagataḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The son who, either of his own accord or following the intention of his relatives, offers himself to be the son of another, is called upagata

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: putratveadhikṛtaḥ kṛtakaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who is appointed as a son is called kritaka;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parikrītaḥ krītaḥ // iti /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and he who is purchased is called kríta

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aurase tuutpanne savarṇās tṛtīyaaṃśaharāḥ, asavarṇā grāsaācchādanabhāginaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra On the birth of a natural son, savarna sons shall have /rd of inheritance while savarna sons shall have only food and clothing

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brāhmaṇakṣatriyayor anantarāputrāḥ savarṇāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sons begotten by Bráhmans or Kshatriyas on women of next lower caste anantaráputráh are called savarnas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ekaantarā asavarṇāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but on women of castes lower by two grades are called asavarnas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brāhmaṇasya vaiśyāyām ambaṣṭhaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of such asavarna sons, the son begotten by a Bráhman on a Vaisya woman is called Ambashtha;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śūdrāyāṃ niṣādaḥ pāraśavo vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: on a Súdra woman is called Nisháda or Párasava

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣatriyasya śūdrāyām ugraḥ // śūdra eva vaiśyasya //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The son begotten by a Kshatriya on a Súdra woman is known as Ugra; the son begotten by a Vaisya on a Súdra woman is no other than a Súdra

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: savarṇāsu caeṣām acaritavratebhyo jātā vrātyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sons begotten by men of impure life of any of the four castes on women of lower castes next to their own are called Vrátyas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ity anulomāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The above kinds of sons are called anuloma, sons begotten by men of higher on women of lower castes

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śūdrād āyogavakṣattacaṇḍālāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sons begotten by a Súdra on women of higher castes are Ayogava, Kshatta, and Chandála;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaiśyān māgadhavaidehakau //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: by a Vaisya, Mágadha, and Vaidehaka;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣatriyāt sūtaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and by a Kshatriya, Súta

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paurāṇikas tv anyaḥ sūto māgadhaś ca, brahmakṣatrād viśeṣaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But men of the, names, Súta and Mágadha, celebrated in the Puránas, are quite different and of greater merit than either Bráhmans or Kshatriyas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ta ete pratilomāḥ svadharmaatikramād rājñaḥ sambhavanti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The above kinds of sons are pratiloma, sons begotten by men of lower on women of higher castes, and originate on account of kings violating all dharmas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ugrān naiṣādyāṃ kukkuṭaḥ, viparyaye pulkasaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The son begotten by an Ugra on a Nisháda woman is called kukkuta and the same is called Pulkasa, if begotten in the inverse order

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaidehikāyām ambaṣṭhād vaiṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The son begotten by an Ambhashtha on a Vaidehaka woman is named Vaina;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viparyaye kuśīlavaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: the same in the reverse order is called Kusílava

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣattāyām ugrātśvapākaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: An Ugra begets on a Kshatta woman as vapáka

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ity eteanye caantarālāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: These and other sons are of mixed castes Antarálas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmaṇā vaiśyo rathakāraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A Vainya becomes a Rathakára, chariotmaker, by profession

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ svayonau vivāhaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Members of this caste shall marry among themselves

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūrvaaparagāmitvaṃ vṛttaanuvṛttaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Both in customs and avocations they shall follow their ancestors

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śūdrasadharmāṇo vā, anyatra caṇḍālebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They may either become Súdras or embrace any other lower castes excepting Chandálas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kevalam evaṃ vartamānaḥ svargam āpnoti rājā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The king who guides his subjects in accordance with the above rules will attain to heaven;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: narakam anyathā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: otherwise he will fall into the hell

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarveṣām antarālānāṃ samo vibhāgaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Offsprings of mixed castes Antarálas shall have equal divisions of inheritance

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: deśasya jātyāḥ saṃghasya dharmo grāmasya vāapi yaḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Partition of inheritance shall be made in accordance with the customs prevalent in the country, caste, guild sangha, or the village of the inheritors

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāmantapratyayā vāstuvivādāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: DISPUTES concerning Vástu are dependent for settlement on the evidences to be furnished by people living in the neighbourhood

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gṛhaṃ kṣetram ārāmaḥ setubandhas taṭākam ādhāro vā vāstuḥ // karṇakīlaāyasasambandhoanugṛhaṃ setuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Houses, fields, gardens, building of any kind setubandhah, lakes and tanks are each called Vástu The fastening of the roof of a house to the transverse beam by means of iron bolts is called setu karnakílayasabandho’ Kautilyas Arthashastra nugriham setuh

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathāsetubhogaṃ veśma kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In conformity to the stability of the setu, houses shall be constructed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: abhūtaṃ vā parakuḍyād apakramya dvāv aratnī tripadīṃ vā deśabandhaṃ kārayet // avaskaraṃ bhramam udapānaṃ vā na gṛhaucitād anyatra, anyatra sūtikākūpād ānirdaśaahād iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Not encroaching upon what belongs to others, new houses may be constructed Foundation pade bandhah shall be aratnis by padas Except in the case of temporary structures for the confinement of women for ten days, all permanent houses shall be provided with a dunghill avaskara, water course bhrama, and a well udapánum

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaatikrame pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Violation of this rule shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tenaindhanāvaghātanakṛtaṃ kalyāṇakṛtyeṣv ācāmaudakamārgāś ca vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rule shall hold good regarding the necessity of constructing closets, pits and water courses on festive occasions

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tripadīpratikrāntam adhyardham aratniṃ vā gāḍhaprasṛtam udakamārgaṃ prasravaṇaprapātaṃ vā kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: From each house a water course of sufficient slope and padas or aratnis long shal be so constructed that water shall either flow from it in a continuous line or fall from it into the drain

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaatikrame catuṣpañcāśatpaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Violation of this rule shall be punished with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ekapadīpratikrāntam aratniṃ vā cakricatuṣpadasthānam agniṣṭham udanjarasthānaṃ rocanīṃ kuṭṭanīṃ vā kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Beginning with a pada or an aratni, an apartment measuring padas by padas shall be made for locating the fire for worship agnishtham, or a waterbutt, udanjaram, or a cornmill rochaním, or a mortar kuttinín

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaatikrame caturviṃśatipaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Violation of this rule shall be punished with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvavāstukayoḥ prākṣiptakayor vā śālayoḥ kiṣkur antarikā tripadī vā // tayoś caturaṅgulaṃ nīpraantaram samārūḍhakaṃ vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Between any two houses or between the extended portions of any two houses, the intervening space shall be padas, or padas The roofs of adjoining houses may either be angulas apart, or one of them may cover the other

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kiṣkumātram āṇidvāram antarikāyāṃ khaṇḍaphullaartham asampātaṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The front door anidváram shall Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 measure a kishku; there shall be no impediment inside the house for opening one or the other of the folds of the door

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prakāśaartham alpam ūrdhvaṃ vātaayanaṃ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The upper story shall be provided with a small but high window

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sambhūya vā gṛhasvāmino yathāiṣṭaṃ kārayeyuḥ, aniṣṭaṃ vārayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The owners of houses may construct their houses in any other way they collectively like, but they shall avoid whatever is injurious

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vānalaṭyāś caūrdhvam āvāryabhāgaṃ kaṭapracchannam avamarśabhittiṃ vā kārayed varṣaābādhabhayāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: With a view to ward off the evil consequences of rain, the top of the roof vánalatyaschordhvam shall be covered over with a broad mat, not blowable by the wind Neither shall the roof be such as will easily bend or break

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaatikrame pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Violation of this rule shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratilomadvāravātaayanabādhāyāṃ ca, anyatra rājamārgarathyābhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same punishment shall be meted out for causing annoyance by constructing doors or windows facing those of others houses except when these houses are separated by the kings road or the high road

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: khātasopānapraṇālīniśreṇyavaskarabhāgair bahirbādhāyāṃ bhoganigrahe ca // parakuḍyam udakenaupaghnato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a pit, steps, watercourse, ladder, dunghill, or, any other parts of a house offer or cause annoyance to outsiders, or in any way obstruct the enjoyment of others bhoganigrahe cha, or cause water to collect and thereby injure the wall of a neighbouring house, the owner shall be punished with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mūtrapurīṣaupaghāte dviguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the annoyance is due to feces and urine, the fine shall be double the above

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: praṇālīmokṣo varṣati,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The watercourse or gutter shall offer free passage for water;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyathā dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: otherwise the fine shall be panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratiṣiddhasya ca vasataḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who voluntarily evacuates a house shall pay the balance of the annual rent

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nirasyataś caavakrayiṇam anyatra pāruṣyasteyasāhasasaṃgrahaṇamithyābhogebhyaḥ // svayaṃabhiprasthito varṣaavakrayaśeṣaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If any one of a party does not take part in the construction of a building which is intended for the common use of all the members of that party or if any one obstructs another member of a party in Kautilyas Arthashastra making use of any part of such a building, he shall be fined panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāmānyam uparundhato bhogaṃ ca gṛhe dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Similarly if any one mars anothers enjoyment of such a building, he shall be fined double the above

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: koṣṭhakaaṅgaṇavarcānām agnikuṭṭanaśālayoḥ / vivṛtānāṃ ca sarveṣāṃ sāmānyo bhoga iṣyate //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: With the exception of private rooms and parlours, angana all other open parts of houses as well as apartments where fire is ever kindled for worship or a mortar is situated shall be thrown open for common use

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jñātisāmantadhanikāḥ krameṇa bhūmiparigrahān kretum abhyābhaveyuḥ // tatoanye bāhyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: SALE OF BUILDINGS, BOUNDARY DISPUTES, DETERMINATION OF BOUNDARIES, AND MISCELLANEOUS HINDRANCES RICH persons among kinsmen or neighbours shall in succession go for the purchase of land and other holdings

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāmantacatvāriṃśatkulyeṣu gṛhapratimukhe veśma śrāvayeyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Neighbours of good family, forty in number and different from the purchasers above mentioned, shall congregate in front of the building for sale and announce it as such

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāmantagrāmavṛddheṣu kṣetram ārāmaṃ setubandhaṃ taṭākam ādhāraṃ vā maryādāsu yathāsetubhogaṃ anenaargheṇa kaḥ kretā iti // trir āghuṣitam avyāhataṃ kretā kretuṃ labheta // spardhayā vā mūlyavardhane mūlyavṛddhiḥ saśulkā kośaṃ gacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Accurate description of the exact boundaries of fields, gardens, buildings of any kind, lakes or tanks shall be declared before the elders of the village or of the neighbourhood If, on crying aloud thrice „Who will purchase this at such and such a price‟? no opposition is offered, the purchaser may proceed to purchase the holding in question If at this time the value of the property is increased by bidding even among persons of the same community, the increased amount together with the toll on the value shall be handed over into the kings treasury

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vikrayapratikroṣṭā śulkaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The bidder vikrayapratikroshtá shall pay the toll

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: asvāmipratikrośe caturviṃśatipaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Bidding for a Kautilyas Arthashastra property in the absence of its owner shall be punished with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saptarātrād ūrdhvam anabhisarataḥ pratikruṣṭo vikrīṇīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the owner does not come forward even on the expiration of seven nights, the bidder may take possession of the property

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratikruṣṭaatikrame vāstuni dviśato daṇḍaḥ, anyatra caturviṃśatipaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sale of building, etc, vástu to other than the bidder shall be punished with a fine of 00 panas; if the property is other than buildings, etc, vástu, the fine for the above offence shall be panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti vāstuvikrayaḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus the sale of buildings is dealt with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sīmavivādaṃ grāmayor ubhayoḥ sāmantā pañcagrāmī daśagrāmī vā setubhiḥ sthāvaraiḥ kṛtrimair vā kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Boundary disputes In all disputes regarding the boundary between any two villages, neighbours or elders of five or ten villages panchagrámí dasagrámí vá shall investigate the case on the evidence to be furnished from natural or artificial boundary marks

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karṣakagopālakavṛddhāḥ pūrvabhuktikā vā bāhyāḥ setūnām abhijñā bahava eko vā nirdiśya sīmasetūn viparītaveṣāḥ sīmānaṃ nayeyuḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Elders among cultivators and herdsmen, or outsiders who have had the experience of former possession in the place, or one or many persons not personally acquainted with the boundary marks under dispute shall first describe the boundary marks, and then, wearing unusual dress viparítaveshah, shall lead the people to the place

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: uddiṣṭānāṃ setūnām adarśane sahasraṃ daṇḍaḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the boundary marks just described are not found, a fine of ,000 panas shall be imposed on the misleading or guilty person

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pranaṣṭasetubhogaṃ vā sīmānaṃ rājā yathāupakāraṃ vibhajet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The king shall beneficially distribute among others those holdings which have no boundarymarks or which have ceased to be enjoyed by any person

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣetravivādaṃ sāmantagrāmavṛddhāḥ kuryuḥ // teṣāṃ dvaidhībhāve yato bahavaḥ śucayoanumatā vā tato niyaccheyuḥ madhyaṃ vā gṛhṇīyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Disputes about fields Disputes concerning fields shall be decided by the elders of the neighbourbood or of the village If they are divided in their opinions, decision shall be sought for from a number of pure and Kautilyas Arthashastra respectable people, or, the disputants may equally divide the disputed holding among themselves

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tadubhayaparāuktaṃ vāstu rājā haret,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If both of these methods fail, the holding vástu under dispute shall be taken possession of by the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathāupakāraṃ vā vibhajet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: or it may beneficially be distributed among the people

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prasahyaādāne vāstuni steyadaṇḍaḥ // kāraṇaādāne prayāsam ājīvaṃ ca parisaṃkhyāya bandhaṃ dadyāt // iti kṣetravivādaḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Occupation of a holding vástu by force shall be punished as theft If a holding is taken possession of by another on some reasonable grounds, he shall be made to pay to the owner some rent, the amount of which is to be fixed after mature considerations of what is necessary for the subsistence of the cultivator of the holding by him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: maryādāapaharaṇe pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ // maryādābhede caturviṃśatipaṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Encroachment upon boundaries shall be punished with the first amercement Destruction of boundaries shall be punished with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena tapovanavivītamahāpathaśmaśānadevakulayajanapuṇyasthānavivādā vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rules shall hold good in disputes concerning hermitage in forests, pasture lands, high roads, cremationgrounds, temples, sacrificial places, and places of pilgrimage

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti maryādāsthāpanam /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus the determination of boundaries is dealt with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarva eva vivādāḥ sāmantapratyayāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Miscellaneous hindrances All kinds of disputes shall depend for their settlement on the evidence to be furnished by neighbours

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vivītasthalakedāraṣaṇḍakhalaveśmavāhanakoṣṭhānāṃ pūrvaṃpūrvam ābādhaṃ saheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of pasture lands, fields kedára, flower gardens, a threshingfloor khala, houses, and stables of horses váhanakoshtha, hindrance to any one coming first in order shall be removed in preference to the one or more coming later in the series

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brahmasomaaraṇyadevayajanapuṇyasthānavarjāḥ sthalapradeśāḥ // ādhāraparivāhakedāraupabhogaiḥ parakṣetrakṛṣṭabījahiṃsāyāṃ yathāupaghātaṃ mūlyaṃ dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: With the exception of people in forests of Bráhmans and of Somaplants, temples, and places of sacrifice and pilgrimage, any person causing, while making use of a bypath to go to tanks, rivers, or fields, damage to the seeds sown in the fields of others, shall pay as much compensation to the sufferers as is equivalent to the damage

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kedāraārāmasetubandhānāṃ parasparahiṃsāyāṃ hiṃsādviguṇo daṇḍaḥ // paścānniviṣṭam adharataṭākaṃ nauparitaṭākasya kedāram udakenaāplāvayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra If the owner of any one of the following, viz, wetfields, parks, or any kinds of buildings, causes damage to the rest owned by others, the fine shall be double the value of the damage The water of a lower tank shall not submerge the field irrigated by a higher tank

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: upariniviṣṭaṃ naadharataṭākasya pūraāsrāvaṃ vārayed, anyatra trivarṣauparatakarmaṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The natural flow of water from a higher to a lower tank shall not be stopped unless the lower tank has ceased to be useful for three consecutive years

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaatikrame pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Violation of this rule shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: taṭākavāmanaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same punishment shall be meted out for emptying a tank of its water tatákavámanam cha

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañcavarṣauparatakarmaṇaḥ setubandhasya svāmyaṃ lupyeta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Buildings of any kind setubandha, neglected for five consecutive years shall be forfeited, except in calamities

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: taṭākasetubandhānāṃ navapravartane pāñcavarṣikaḥ parihāraḥ, bhagnautsṛṣṭānāṃ cāturvarṣikaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Remission of taxes In the case of construction of new works, such as tanks, lakes, etc, taxes on the lands below such tanks shall be remitted for five years panchavárshikah parihárah For repairing neglected or ruined works of similar nature, taxes shall be remitted for four years

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samupārūḍhānāṃ traivarṣikaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For improving or extending waterworks, taxes shall be remitted for three years

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sthalasya dvaivarṣikaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If uncultivated tracts are acquired for cultivation by mortgage, purchase or in any other way, remission of taxes shall be for two years

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: khātaprāvṛttim anadīnibandhaāyatanataṭākakedāraārāmaṣaṇḍavāpānāṃ sasyavarṇabhāgauttarikam anyebhyo vā yathāupakāraṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Out of crops grown by irrigation by means of wind power or bullocks vátapravartimanandinibandháyatana or below tanks, in fields, parks, flower gardens, or in any other way, so much of the produce as would not entail hardship on the cultivators may be given to the Government

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: otherwise they shall be punished with a fine of double the loss

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prakrayaavakrayaadhibhāgabhoganiṣṛṣṭaupabhoktāraś caeṣāṃ pratikuryuḥ // arpatīkāre hīnadviguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Persons, letting out the water of tanks, etc, at any other place than their sluice gate apáre, shall pay a fine of panas; and persons who recklessly obstruct the flow of water from the sluicegate of tanks shall also pay the same fine

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: setubhyo muñcatas toyam avāre ṣaṭpaṇo damaḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: End of the sixtysixth chapter from the beginning] CHAPTER

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vāre vā toyam anyeṣāṃ pramādenauparundhataḥ // karmaudakamārgam ucitaṃ rundhataḥ kurvatoanucitaṃ vā pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: DESTRUCTION OF PASTURELANDS, FIELDS AND ROADS, AND NONPERFORMANCE OF AGREEMENTS PERSONS who obstruct, or make any kind of mischief with the flow of water intended for cultivation shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: setukūpapuṇyasthānacaityadevaāyatanāni ca parabhūmau niveśayataḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Construction in the sites belonging to others, of any buildings with a view to attract pilgrims thereto, of abodes of worship chaitya, or of temples of gods;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūrvaanuvṛttaṃ dharmasetum ādhānaṃ vikrayaṃ vā nayato nāyayato vā madhyamaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: as also the sale or mortgage, or causing the sale or mortgage, of any long continued charitable building púrvánuvrittam dharmasetum shall be punished with the middlemost amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śrotṛṛṇām uttamaḥ, anyatra bhagnautsṛṣṭāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who are witnesses to such transactions shall be punished with the highest amercement excepting in the case of neglected or ruined buildings

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svāmy abhāve grāmāḥ puṇyaśīlā vā pratikuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the absence of claimants to dilapidated religious buildings, villagers grámáh, or charitable people punyasíláva may repair them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pathipramāṇaṃ durganiveśe vyākhyātam // kṣudrapaśumanuṣyapathaṃ rundhato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Blocking the roads Forms of roads and paths have been dealt with in connection with the construction of forts First Chapter, Book Obstruction to roads for inferior beasts or men shall be punished with a fine of panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mahāpaśupathaṃ caturviṃśatipaṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: to roads for superior beasts panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hastikṣetrapathaṃ catuṣpañcāśatpaṇaḥ, setuvanapathaṃ ṣaṭśataḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: to roads for elephants or to those leading to fields, panas; to those leading to any buildings or forests setuvanapatham, 00 panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śmaśānagrāmapathaṃ dviśataḥ, droṇamukhapathaṃ pañcaśataḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: to those for burial grounds or villages, 00 panas; to those for dronamukha, a fortress, 00 panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sthānīyarāṣṭravivītapathaṃ sāhasraḥ // atikarṣaṇe caeṣāṃ daṇḍacaturthā daṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and those leading to sthániya, country parts, or pasture grounds, ,000 panas The same fines shall be meted out in case of ploughing the several roads too deep atikarshane chaishám;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karṣaṇe pūrvauktāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and ¼th of the same fines for ploughing merely on their surface

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣetrikasyaakṣipataḥ kṣetram upavāsasya vā tyajato bījakāle dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ, anyatra doṣaupanipātaaviṣahyebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a cultivator or a neighbour makes encroachment upon a field during the time of sowing seeds, he shall be fined panas, unless the encroachment is due to evils, calamities or intolerable occurrences arising otherwise from the field anyatra doshopanipatávishahyebhyah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karadāḥ karadeṣv ādhānaṃ vikrayaṃ vā kuryuḥ, brahmadeyikā brahmadeyikeṣu //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Settling in villages Taxpayers shall sell or mortgage their fields to taxpayers alone; Bráhmans shall sell or mortgage their Brahmadaya or gifted lands only to those who are endowed with such lands;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyathā pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: otherwise they shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karadasya vāakaradagrāmaṃ praviśataḥ // karadaṃ tu praviśataḥ sarvadravyeṣu prākāmyaṃ syāt, anyatraagārāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same punishment shall be meted out to a taxpayer who settles in a village not inhabited by taxpayers If a taxpayer takes the place of another taxpayer, he shall enjoy all the holdings but the house of the latter

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tad apy asmai dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Even the house may be given to the new settler

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anādeyam akṛṣatoanyaḥ pañcavarṣāṇy upabhujya prayāsaniṣkrayeṇa dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a person cultivates an inalienable land of another person who does not cultivate it, such a person shall restore the same after five years Kautilyas Arthashastra enjoyment on taking a certain amount of compensation equivalent to the improvement he made on the lands

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akaradāḥ paratra vasanto bhogam upajīveyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Persons who are not taxpayers and who sojourn abroad shall retain the right of ownership bhogam of their lands

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: grāmaarthena grāmikaṃ vrajantam upavāsāḥ paryāyeṇaanugaccheyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The Headman of the village When the headman of a village has to travel on account of any business of the whole village, the villagers shall by turns accompany him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ananugacchantaḥ paṇaardhapaṇikaṃ yojanaṃ dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who cannot do this shall pay ½ panas for every yojana

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: grāmikasya grāmād astenapāradārikaṃ nirasyataś caturviṃśatipaṇo daṇḍaḥ, grāmasyauttamaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the headman of a village sends out of the village any person except a thief, or an adulterer, he shall be punished with a fine of panas, and the villagers with the first amercement for doing the same

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nirastasya praveśo hy abhigamena vyākhyātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Reentrance into a village for a person previously sent out of it nirastasya, is explained by „settlement of persons in villages‟ treated of above

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: stambhaiḥ samantato grāmād dhanuḥśataapakṛṣṭam upasālaṃ kārayet // paśupracāraarthaṃ vivītam ālavanenaupajīveyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: At a distance of 00 angulas around every village, an enclosure with timber posts shall be constructed Trespassing cattle Pasture lands, plains, and forests may be availed of for grazing cattle For camels or buffaloes allowed to stray after grazing in pasture grounds, the fine shall be ¼th of a pana;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gavaaśvakharāṇāṃ caardhapādikam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for cows, horses, or asses, /th of a pana;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣudrapaśūnāṃ ṣoḍaśabhāgikam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for inferior quadrupeds /th of a pana;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhakṣayitvā niṣaṇṇānām eta eva dviguṇā daṇḍāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and for cattle found lying thereon after grazing, fines shall be double the above;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parivasatāṃ caturguṇāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for cattle ever found to live in the vicinity of pasture grounds, the fines shall be four times the above

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: grāmadevavṛṣā vāanirdaśaahā vā dhenur ukṣāṇo govṛṣāś caadaṇḍyāḥ // sasyabhakṣaṇe sasyaupaghātaṃ niṣpattitaḥ parisaṃkhyāya dviguṇaṃ dāpayet // svāminaś caanivedya cārayato dvādaśapaṇo daṇdaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Bulls, let out in the name of the village deity grámadevavrishah, cows which have not passed ten days inside the enclosure after calving, or bulls or bullocks kept for crossing cows shall not be punished If crops are eaten away by animals, the owner or owners of them shall, if proved guilty, be made to pay twice as much as the loss Persons driving their cattle through a field without intimating the owner shall be fined panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pālinām ardhadaṇḍāḥ // tad eva ṣaṇḍabhakṣaṇe kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person who allows his cattle to stray shall be fined panas; cowherds doing the same with the cattle under their care shall be fined half the above

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vāṭabhede dviguṇaḥ veśmakhalavalayagatānāṃ ca dhānyānāṃ bhakṣaṇe //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same punishment shall be meted out for letting cattle graze in flower gardens For breaking the fence of fields, the punishment shall be double the above

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hiṃsāpratīkāraṃ kuryāt // abhayavanamṛgāḥ parigṛhītā vā bhakṣayantaḥ svāmino nivedya yathāavadhyās tathā pratiṣeddhavyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If cattle are allowed to stray and eat the grains stored in houses, a threshing floor, or a court yard, the owners of the cattle shall pay adequate compensation If beasts maintained in reserveforests are found grazing in a field, they shall be brought to the notice of the forest officers and the beasts shall be driven out without being hurt or killed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paśavo raśmipratodābhyāṃ vārayitavyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Stray cattle shall be driven out by the use of ropes or whips

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣām anyathā hiṃsāyāṃ daṇḍapāruṣyadaṇḍāḥ // prārthayamānā dṛṣṭaaparādhā vā sarvaupāyair niyantavyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Persons hurting them in any way shall be liable to the punishment for assault or violence Persons who invite cattle to graze in the fields of others or who are caught while committing such offences shall by all means be put down

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti kṣetrapathahiṃsā /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus the destruction of pasture lands, fields, and roads is dealt with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karṣakasya grāmam abhyupetyaakurvato grāma evaatyayaṃ haret //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Nonperformance of agreement The fine levied on a cultivator who arriving at a village for work, does not work shall be taken by the village itself

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmaakaraṇe karmavetanadviguṇam, hiraṇyaadāne pratyaṃśadviguṇam, bhakṣyapeyaadāne ca prahavaṇeṣu dviguṇam aṃśaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall refund not only double the amount of the wages he received promising to work, but also double the value of food and drink with which he has been provided If the work is one of sacrificial performance prahavaneshu, then also he shall pay double the amount of the wages

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prekṣāyām anaṃśadaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person who does not cooperate in the work of preparation for a public show, shall, together with his Kautilyas Arthashastra family, forfeit his right to enjoy the show prekshá

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sasvajano na prekṣeta // pracchannaśravaṇaīkṣaṇe ca sarvahite ca karmaṇi nigraheṇa dviguṇam aṃśaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a man who has not cooperated in preparing for a public play or spectacle is found hearing or witnessing it under hiding, or if any one refuses to give his aid in a work beneficial to all, he shall be compelled to pay double the value of the aid due from him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvahitam ekasya bruvataḥ kuryur ājñām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The order of any person attempting to do a work beneficial to all shall be obeyed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akaraṇe dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ // taṃ cet sambhūya vā hanyuḥ pṛthag eṣām aparādhadviguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Disobedience in such a case shall be punished with a fine of panas If others unitedly beat or hurt such a person so ordering, each of them shall pay double the amount of the fine usually levied for such offence

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brāhmaṇaś caeṣāṃ jyaiṣṭhyaṃ niyamyeta // prahavaṇeṣu caeṣāṃ brāhmaṇā naakāmāḥ kuryuḥ, aṃśaṃ ca labheran //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If among the above offenders one is a Bráhman or a person superior to a Bráhman, he shall first be punished If a Bráhman does not take part in the combined performance of any sacrifice of his village, he shall not be violated, but may be persuaded to pay a share

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena deśajātikulasaṃghānāṃ samayasyaanapākarma vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The above rules shall also apply to nonperformance of agreements among countries desa, castes, families, and assemblies

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājā deśahitān setūn kurvatāṃ pathi saṃkramān / grāmaśobhāś ca rakṣāś ca teṣāṃ priyahitaṃ caret //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who, with their united efforts construct on roads buildings of any kind setubandha beneficial to the whole country and who not only adorn their villages, but also keep watch on them shall be shown favourable concessions by the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sapādapaṇā dharmyā māsavṛddhiḥ paṇaśatasya,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and of nonperformance of agreements End of the sixtyseventh chapter from the beginning] CHAPTER

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañcapaṇā vyāvahārikī,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Five panas per month per cent is commercial interest vyávaháriki

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daśapaṇā kāntāragāṇām, viṃśatipaṇā sāmudrāṇām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Ten panas per month per cent prevails among forests Twenty panas per month per cent prevails among seatraders sámudránám

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ paraṃ kartuḥ kārayituś ca pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ, śrotṛṛṇām ekaekaṃ pratyardhadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Persons exceeding, or causing to exceed the above rate of interest shall be punished with the first amercement; and hearers of such transactions shall each pay half of the above fine

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājany ayogakṣemaāvahe tu dhanikadhāraṇikayoś caritram avekṣeta // dhānyavṛddhiḥ sasyaniṣpattāv upārdhā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The nature of the transactions between creditors and debtors, on which the welfare of the kingdom depends, shall always be scrutinised Interest in grains in seasons of good harvest shall not exceed more than half when valued in money

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paraṃ mūlyakṛtā vardheta // prakṣepavṛddhir udayād ardhaṃ samnidhānasannā vārṣikī deyā // cirapravāsaḥ stambhapraviṣṭo vā mūlyadviguṇaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Interest on stocks prakshepa shall be onehalf of the profit and be regularly paid as each year expires If it is allowed to accumulate owing either to the intention or to the absence abroad of the receiver or payer, the amount payable shall be equal to twice the share or principal múlyadvigunah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akṛtvā vṛddhiṃ sādhayato vardhayato vā, mūlyaṃ vā vṛddhim āropya śrāvayato bandhacaturguṇo daṇḍaḥ // tucchaśrāvaṇāyām abhūtacaturguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A person claiming interest when it is not due, or representing as principal the total amount of his original principal and the interest thereon shall pay a fine of four times the amount under dispute bandhachaturgunah A creditor who sues for four times the amount lent by him shall pay a fine of four times the unjust amount

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasya tribhāgam ādātā dadyāt, śeṣaṃ pradātā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Of this fine, the creditor shall pay ¾ths and the debtor ¼th

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dīrghasattravyādhigurukulauparuddhaṃ bālam asāraṃ vā naṛṇam anuvardheta // mucyamānam ṛṇam apratigṛhṇato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Interest on debts due from persons who are engaged in sacrifices taking a long time dírghasatra, or who are suffering from disease, or who are detained in the houses of their teachers for learning, or who are either minors or too poor, shall not accumulate A creditor refusing to receive the payment of his debt shall pay a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāraṇaapadeśena nivṛttavṛddhikam anyatra tiṣṭhet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the refusal is due to some reasonable Kautilyas Arthashastra cause, then the amount free from interest for subsequent time shall be kept in the safe custody of others

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daśavarṣaupekṣitam ṛṇam apratigrāhyam, anyatra bālavṛddhavyādhitavyasaniproṣitadeśatyāgarājyavibhramebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Debts neglected for ten years, except in the case of minors, aged persons, diseased persons, persons involved in calamities, or persons who are sojourning abroad or have fled the country and except in the case of disturbances in the kingdom rájyavibhrama, shall not be received back

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pretasya putrāḥ kusīdaṃ dadyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sons of a deceased debtor shall pay the principal with interest kusí dam

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dāyādā vā rikthaharāḥ, sahagrāhiṇaḥ, pratibhuvo vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the absence of sons, kinsmen claiming the share of the dead man or sureties, such as joint partners of the debt, sahagráhinah pratibhuvo vá shall pay the same

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na prātibhāvyam anyat //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: No other kind of surety is valid na prátibhávyamanyat;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: asāraṃ bālaprātibhāvyam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: a minor, as surety, is inefficient bálaprátibhavyam asáram surety of a minor is not strong

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: asaṃkhyātadeśakālaṃ tu putrāḥ pautrā dāyādā vā rikthaṃ haramāṇā dadyuḥ // jīvitavivāhabhūmiprātibhāvyam asaṃkhyātadeśakālaṃ tu putrāḥ pautrā vā vaheyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A debt, the payment of which is not limited by time or place or both asamkhyátadesakálam, shall be paid by the sons, grandsons or any other heirs of the dead debtor Any debt, the payment of which is not limited by time or place or both and for which life, marriage, or land is pledged, shall be borne by sons or grandsons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nānāṛṇasamavāye tu naekaṃ dvau yugapad abhivadeyātām, anyatra pratiṣṭhamānāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Regarding many debts against one Excepting the case of a debtor going abroad, no debtor shall simultaneously be sued for more than one debt by one or two creditors

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatraapi gṛhītaānupūrvyā rājaśrotriyadravyaṃ vā pūrvaṃ pratipādayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Even in the case of a debtor going abroad, he shall pay his debts in the order in which he borrowed them or shall first pay his debts due to the king or a learned Bráhman

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dampatyoḥ pitāputrayoḥ bhrātṛṛṇāṃ caavibhaktānāṃ parasparakṛtam ṛṇam asādhyam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Debts contracted from each other by either a husband or wife, either a son or a father, or by any one among brothers of undivided interests shall be irrecoverable

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: agrāhyāḥ karmakāleṣu karṣakā rājapuruṣāś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Cultivators or government servants shall not be caught hold of for debts while they are engaged in their duties or at work

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: strī caapratiśrāviṇī patikṛtam ṛṇam, anyatra gopālakaardhasītikebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A wife, though she has not heard of the debt pratisrávaní, shall not be caught hold of for the debt contracted by her husband, excepting in the case of herdsmen and joint cultivators gopálakárdhasítikebhyah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: patis tu grāhyaḥ strīkṛtam ṛṇam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But a husband may be caught for the debt contracted by his wife

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: apratividhāya proṣita iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if not admitted, witnesses shall be depended upon

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: asmapratipattau tu sākṣiṇaḥ pramāṇaṃ prātyayikāḥ śucayoanumatā vā trayoavaraardhyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Witnesses It is obligatory to produce three witnesses who are reliable, honest and respected

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pakṣaanumatau vā dvau,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: At least two witnesses acceptable to the parties are necessary;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṛṇaṃ prati na tv evaekaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: never one witness in the case of debts

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratiṣiddhāḥ syālasahāyaanvarthidhanikadhāraṇikavairinyaṅgadhṛtadaṇḍāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Wifes brothers, copartners, prisoners ábaddha, creditors, debtors, enemies, maintained persons, or persons once punished by the Government shall not be taken as witnesses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūrve caavyavahāryāḥ // rājaśrotriyagrāmabhṛtakakuṣṭhivraṇinaḥ patitacaṇḍālakutsitakarmāṇoandhabadhiramūkaahaṃvādinaḥ strīrājapuruṣāś ca, anyatra svavargebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Likewise persons legally unfit to carry on transactions, the king, persons learned in the Vedas, persons depending for their maintenance on villages grámabhritaka, lepers, persons suffering from bodily erruptions, outcast persons, persons of mean avocation, the blind, the deaf, the dumb, egotistic persons, females, or government servants shall not be taken as witnesses excepting in the case of transactions in ones own community

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pāruṣyasteyasaṃgrahaṇeṣu tu vairisyālasahāyavarjāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In dispute concerning assault, theft, or abduction, persons other than wifes brothers, enemies, and copartners, can be witnesses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rahasyavyavahāreṣv ekā strī puruṣa upaśrotā upadraṣṭā vā sākṣī syād rājatāpasavarjam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In secret dealings, a single woman or a single man who has stealthily heard or seen them can be a witness, with the exception of the king or an ascetic

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svāmino bhṛtyānām ṛtvigācāryāḥ śiṣyāṇāṃ mātāpitarau putrāṇāṃ caanigraheṇa sākṣyaṃ kuryuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On the side of prosecution masters against servants, priests or teachers against their disciples, and parents against their sons can be witnesses Kautilyas Arthashastra nigrahanasákshyam kuryuh;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tesām itare vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Persons other than these may also be witnesses in criminal cases

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parasparaabhiyoge caeṣām uttamāḥ parāuktā daśabandhaṃ dadyuḥ, avarāḥ pañcabandham //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Creditors guilty of parokta shall pay a fine of 0 times the amount dasabandha but if incapable to pay so much, they shall at least pay five times the amount sued for panchabandham;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti sākṣyadhikāraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: thus the section on witnesses is dealt with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brāhmaṇaudakumbhaagnisakāśe sākṣiṇaḥ parigṛhṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Taking oaths Witness shall be taken before Bráhmans, vessels of water and fire

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatra brāhmaṇaṃ brūyāt satyaṃ brūhi iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A Bráhman witness shall be told „Tell the truth‟;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājanyaṃ vaiśyaṃ vā mā tavaiṣṭāpūrtaphalam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: a Kshatriya or a Vaisya witness shall be told thus„If thou utterest falsehood, thou, do not attain the fruit of thy sacrificial and charitable deeds;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śūdraṃ janmamaraṇaantare yad vaḥ puṇyaphalaṃ tad rājānaṃ gacched, rājñaś ca kilbiṣaṃ yuṣmān anyathāvāde, daṇḍaś caanubaddhaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but having broken the array of thy enemies in war, thou, do go a beggar with a skull in thy hand‟ A Súdra witness thus„Whatever thy merits are, in thy former birth or after thy death, shall they go to the king and whatever sins the king may have committed, shall they go to thee, if thou utterest falsehood;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paścād api jñāyeta yathādṛṣṭaśrutam, ekamantrāḥ satyam upaharata iti // anupaharatāṃ saptarātrād ūrdhvaṃ dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: fines also shall be levied on thee, for facts as they have been heard or seen will certainly be subsequently revealed‟ If in the course of seven nights, witnesses are found to have unanimously made a false consert among themselves, a fine of panas shall be levied

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tripakṣād ūrdhvam abhiyogaṃ dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If they are thus found in the course of three fortnights, they shall pay the amount sued for abhiyogam dadyuh

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sākṣibhede yato bahavaḥ śucayoanumatā vā tato niyaccheyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If witnesses differ, judgment may be given in accordance with the statements of a majority of pure and respectable witnesses;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: madhyaṃ vā gṛhṇīyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: or the mean of their statements may be followed;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tad vā dravyaṃ rājā haret //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: or the amount under dispute may be taken by the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sākṣiṇaś ced abhiyogād ūnaṃ brūyur atiriktasyaabhiyoktā bandhaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If witnesses give testimony for a less amount, the plaintiff shall pay a fine proportional to the Kautilyas Arthashastra increased amount;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: atiriktaṃ vā brūyus tadatiriktaṃ rājā haret //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if they attest to a greater amount, the excess shall go to the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bāliśyād abhiyoktur vā duhśrutaṃ durlikhitaṃ pretaabhiniveśaṃ vā samīkṣya sākṣipratyayam eva syāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In cases where the plaintiff proves himself stupid, or where bad hearing on the part of witnesses at the time of the transaction or bad writing is the cause of difficulty, or where the debtor is dead, the evidence of witnesses alone shall be depended on sákshipratyayameva syát

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sākṣibāliṣyeṣv eva pṛthaganuyoge deśakālakāryāṇāṃ pūrvamadhyamauttamā daṇḍāḥ ity auśanasāḥ // kūṭasākṣiṇo yam artham abhūtaṃ kuryur bhūtaṃ vā nāśayeyus tad daśaguṇaṃ daṇḍaṃ dadyuḥ iti mānavāḥ // bāliśyād vā visaṃvādayatāṃ citro ghātaḥ iti bārhaspatyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Only, say the followers of Usanas, in those cases where witnesses prove themselves to have been stupid or senseless and where the investigation of the place, time or nature of the transaction is of no avail, the three amercements shall be levied False witnesses, say the followers of Manu, shall be fined ten times the amount which, no matter whether it is true or false, they cause to be lost If, say the followers of Brihaspati, owing to their having been stupid, they render a case suspicious, they shall be tortured to death No says KautilyaIt is the truth that witnesses have to hear when they are called to attest to any transaction;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: naiti kauṭilyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if they have not minded it, they shall be fined panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dhruvaṃ hi sākṣibhiḥ śrotavyam // aśṛṇvatāṃ caturviṃśatipaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if they have attested to a false case without scrutinising, they shall be fined half of the above fine

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatoardham abruvāṇānām // deśakālaavidūrasthān sākṣiṇaḥ pratipādayet / dūrasthān aprasārān vā svāmivākyena sādhayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Parties shall themselves produce witnesses who are not far removed either by time or place; witnesses who are very far removed either by time or place; witnesses who are very far, or who will not, stir out, shall be made to present themselves by the order of the judges

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: upanidhir ṛṇena vyākhyātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE rules concerning debts shall also apply to deposits

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paracakraāṭavikābhyāṃ durgarāṣṭravilope vā, pratirodhakair vā grāmasārthavrajavilope,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whenever forts or country parts are destroyed by enemies or wild tribes; whenever villages, merchants, or herds of cattle are subjected to the inroads of invaders;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: cakrayuktanāśe vā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: whenever the kingdom itself is destroyed;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: grāmamadhyaagnyudakaābādhe jvālāvegauparuddhe vā, nāvi nimagnāyāṃ muṣitāyāṃ vā svayam uparūḍho naupanidhim abhyāvahet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: whenever extensive fires or floods bring about entire destruction of villages, or partly destroy immovable properties, movable properties having been rescued before; whenever the spread of fire or rush of floods is so sudden that even movable properties could not be removed; or whenever a ship laden with commodities is either sunk or plundered by pirates;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: upanidhibhoktā deśakālaanurūpaṃ bhogavetanaṃ dadyāt, dvādaśapaṇaṃ ca daṇḍam // upabhoganimittaṃ naṣṭaṃ vinaṣṭaṃ vāabhyāvahet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The depositary who has made use of the deposit for his own comfort shall not only pay a compensation bhogavetanam to be fixed after considering the circumstances of the place and time but also a fine of panas Not only shall any loss in the value of the deposit, due to its use, be made good, but a fine of panas also be paid

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyathā vā niṣpatane //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Deposits damaged or lost in any way shall also be made good

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pretaṃ vyasanagataṃ vā naupanidhim abhyāvahet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When the depositary is either dead or involved in calamities, the deposit shall not be sued for

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ādhānavikrayaapavyayaneṣu caasya caturguṇapañcabandho daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the deposit is either mortgaged or sold or lost, the depositary shall not only restore four times its value, but pay a fine of five times the stipulated value pancbabandho dandah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parivartane niṣpātane vā mūlyasamaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the deposit is exchanged for a similar one by the depositary, or lost in any other way, its value shall be paid

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tenaādhipraṇāśaupabhogavikrayaādhānaapahārā vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Pledges The same rules shall hold good in the case of pledges Kautilyas Arthashastra whenever they are lost, used up, sold, mortgaged, or misappropriated

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: naādhiḥ saupakāraḥ sīdet, na caasya mūlyaṃ vardheta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: a usufructory mortgage, shall never be lost to the debtor nádhissopakárassídet, nor shall any interest on the debt be charged;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyatra nisargāt // nirupakāraḥ sīdet, mūlyaṃ caasya vardheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but if unproductive ie, hypothecation, it may be lost, and interest on the debt shall accumulate

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: upasthitasyaādhim aprayacchato dvādaśaṇpaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The pledgee who does not reconvey the pledge when the debtor is ready for it shall be fined panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prayojakaasamnidhāne vā grāmavṛddheṣu sthāpayitvā niṣkrayam ādhiṃ pratipadyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the absence of the creditor or mediator prayojahásannidhána, the amount of the debt may be kept in the custody of the elders of the village and the debtor may have the pledged property redeemed;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nivṛttavṛddhiko vāādhis tatkālakṛtamūlyas tatraevaavatiṣṭheta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: or with its value fixed at the time and with no interest chargeable for the future, the pledge may be left where it is

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anāśavināśakaraṇaadhiṣṭhito vā // dhāraṇikaasamnidhāne vā vināśabhayād udgataarghaṃ dharmasthaanujñāto vikrīṇīta, ādhipālapratyayo vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When there is any rise in the value of the pledge or when it is apprehended that it may be depriciated or lost in the near future, the pledgee may, with permission from the judges dharmasthas, or on the evidence furnished by the officer in charge of pledges ádhipálapratyayo vá, sell the pledge either in the presence of the debtor or under the presidency of experts who can see whether such apprehension is justified

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sthāvaras tu prayāsabhogyaḥ phalabhogyo vā prakṣepavṛddhimūlyaśuddham ājīvam amūlyakṣayeṇaupanayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: An immovable property, pledged and enjoyable with or without labour prayásabhogyhah phalabhogyová, shall not be caused to deteriorate in value while yielding interest on the money lent, and profit on the expenses incurred in maintaining it

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anisṛṣṭaupabhoktā mūlyaśuddham ājīvaṃ bandhaṃ ca dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The pledgee who enjoys the pledge without permission shall not only pay the net profit he derived from it, but also forfeit the debt

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śeṣam upanidhinā vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The rules regarding deposits shall hold good in other matters connected with pledges

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: etenaādeśoanvādhiś ca vyākhyātau //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Property entrusted to another for delivery to a third person Kautilyas Arthashastra The same rules shall apply to orders ádesa, and property entrusted for delivery to a third person anvádhi

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sārthenaanvādhihasto vā pradiṣṭāṃ bhūmim aprāptaś corair bhagnautsṛṣṭo vā naanvādhim abhyāvahet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If, through a merchant, a messenger is entrusted with a property for delivery to a third person anvádhihasta and such messenger does not reach the destined place, or is robbed of the property by thieves, the merchant shall not be responsible for it;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: antare vā mṛtasya dāyādoapi naabhyāvahet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: nor shall a kinsman of the messenger who dies on his way be responsible for the property

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śeṣam upanidhinā vyakahyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For the rest, the rules regarding deposits shall also hold good here

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yācitakam avakrītakaṃ vā yathāvidhaṃ gṛhṇīyus tathāvidham evaarpayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Borrowed or hired properties Properties either borrowed yáchitakam or hired avakrítakam shall be returned as intact as they were when received

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhreṣaupanipātābhyāṃ deśakālauparodhi dattaṃ naṣṭaṃ vinaṣṭaṃ vā naabhyāvaheyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If owing to distance in time or place, or owing to some inherent defects of the properties or to some unforeseen accidents, properties either borrowed or hired are lost or destroyed, they need not be made good

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śeṣam upanidhinā vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The rules regarding deposits shall also apply here

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaiyāvṛtyavikrayas tu vaiyāvṛtyakarā yathādeśakālaṃ vikrīṇānāḥ paṇyaṃ yathājātaṃ mūlyam udayaṃ ca dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Retail sale Retail dealers, selling the merchandise of others at prices prevailing at particular localities and times shall hand over to the wholesale dealers as much of the sale proceeds and profit as is realised by them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: deśakālaatipātane vā parihīṇaṃ sampradānakālikenaargheṇa mūlyam udayaṃ ca dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If owing to distance in time or place there occurs any fall in the value of the merchandise, the retail dealers shall pay the value and profit at that rate which obtained when they received the merchandise

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mūlyam eva dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They shall only return the actual sale proceeds

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: arghapatane vā parihīṇaṃ yathāparihīṇaṃ mūlyam ūnaṃ dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If prices fall, they shall pay only as much of the sale proceeds as is realised at the low rate

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāṃvyavahārikeṣu vā prātyayikeṣv arājavācyeṣu bhreṣaupanipātābhyāṃ naṣṭaṃ vinaṣṭaṃ vā mūlyam api na dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But such merchants as belong to tradeguilds samvyavaharikeshu or are trustworthy and are not condemned by the king need not restore even the value of that merchandise which is lost or destroyed owing to its inherent defects or to some unforeseen accidents

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: deśakālaantaritānāṃ tu paṇyānāṃ kṣayavyayaviśuddhaṃ mūlyam udayaṃ ca dadyuḥ, paṇyasamavāyānāṃ ca pratyaṃśam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But of such merchandise as is distanced by time or place, they shall restore as much value and profit as remains after making allowance for the wear and tear of the merchandise

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: etena vaiyāvṛtyavikrayo vyākhyātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For the rest the rules regarding deposits shall apply here It explains retail sale

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nikṣepaś caupanidhinā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sealed deposits The rules laid down concerning unsealed deposits upanidhis shall apply to sealed deposits also

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tam anyena nikṣpitam anyasyaarpayato hīyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A man handing over a sealed deposit to other than the real depositor shall be punished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nikṣepaapahāre pūrvaapadānaṃ nikṣeptāraś ca pramāṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the case of a depositarys denial of having received a deposit, the antecedent circumstances púrvápadánam of the deposit and the character and social position of the depositor are the only evidences

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aśucayo hi kāravaḥ // naeṣāṃ karaṇapūrvo nikṣepadharmaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Artisans káravah are naturally of impure character It is not an approved custom with them to deposit for some reliable reason
