oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karaṇahīnaṃ nikṣepam apavyayamānaṃ gūḍhabhittinyastān sākṣiṇo nikṣeptā rahasi praṇipātena prajñāpayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a depositary denies having received a sealed deposit which was not, however, deposited for any reasonable cause, the depositor may obtain secret permission from the judges to produce such witnesses as he might have stationed under a wall gúdhabhitti while depositing

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vanaante vā madyaprahavaṇaviśvāsena // rahasi vṛddho vyādhito vā vaidehakaḥ kaścit kṛtalakṣaṇaṃ dravyam asya haste nikṣipyaapagacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the midst of a forest or in the middle of a voyage an old or Kautilyas Arthashastra afflicted merchant might with confidence put in the custody of a depositary some valuable article with certain secret mark, and go on his way

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasya pratideśena putro bhrātā vāabhigamya nikṣepaṃ yāceta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On his sending this information to his son or brother, the latter may ask for the sealed deposit

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dāne śuciḥ, anyathā nikṣepaṃ steyadaṇḍaṃ ca dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the depositary dishonestly denies it, he shall not only be made to restore it, but be liable to the punishment for theft

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pravrajyāabhimukho vā śraddheyaḥ kaścit kṛtalakṣaṇaṃ dravyam asya haste nikṣipya pratiṣṭheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: By recognising the sealed deposit in the custody of a man, any one of the depositors family may probably ask not only for the deposit, but also for information as to the whereabouts of the depositor If the custodian denies either, he shall be treated as before

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ kālaantaraāgato yāceta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: End of the sixtyninth chapter from the beginning] CHAPTER

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛtalakṣaṇena vā dravyeṇa pratyānayed enam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: RULES REGARDING SLAVES AND LABOURERS

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bāliśajātīyo vā rātrau rājadāyikākṣaṇabhītaḥ sāram asya haste nikṣipyaapagacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE selling or mortgaging by kinsmen of the life of a Súdra who is not a born slave, and has not attained majority, but is an Arya in birth shall be punished with a fine of panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaiśyaṃ dviguṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: of a Vaisya, panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣatriyaṃ triguṇaḥ, brāhmaṇaṃ caturguṇaḥ // parajanasya pūrvamadhyamauttamavadhā daṇḍāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: of a Kshatriya, panas; and of a Bráhman, panas If persons other than kinsmen do the same, they shall be liable to the three amercements and capital punishment respectively purchasers and abettors shall likewise be punished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mlecchānām adoṣaḥ prajāṃ vikretum ādhātuṃ vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It is no crime for Mlechchhas to sell or mortgage the life of their own offspring

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na tv evaāryasya dāsabhāvaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But never shall an Arya be subjected to slavery

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: athavāāryam ādhāya kulabandhana āryāṇām āpadi, niṣkrayaṃ caadhigamya bālaṃ sāhāyyadātāraṃ vā pūrvaṃ niṣkrīṇīran // sakṛdātmaādhātā niṣpatitaḥ sīdet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But if in order to tide over family troubles, to find money for fines or court decrees, or to recover the confiscated household implements, the life of an Arya is mortgaged, they his kinsmen shall as soon as possible redeem him from bondage; and more so if he is a youth or an adult capable of giving help

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvir anyenaāhitakaḥ, sakṛd ubhau paraviṣayaabhimukhau //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Both of these two sorts of men shall, if they are once found desirous to run away to foreign countries, be slaves for life

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vittaapahāriṇo vā dāsasyaāryabhāvam apaharatoardhadaṇḍaḥ // niṣpatitapretavyasaninām ādhātā mūlyaṃ bhajeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Deceiving a slave of his money or depriving him of the privileges he can exercise as an Arya Aryabhava, shall be punished with half the fine levied for enslaving the life of an Arya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pretaviṇmūtraucchiṣṭagrāhaṇam āhitasya nagnasnāpanaṃ daṇḍapreṣaṇam atikramaṇaṃ ca strīṇāṃ mūlyanāśakaraṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Employing a slave to carry the dead or to sweep ordure, urine, or the leavings of food; keeping a slave naked; or hurting or abusing him; or violating the chastity of a female slave shall cause the forfeiture of the value paid for him or her

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dhātrīparicārikaardhasītikaupacārikāṇāṃ ca mokṣakaram //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Violation of the chastity of nurses, female cooks, or female servants of the class of joint cultivators or of any other description shall at once earn their liberty for them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: siddham upacārakasyaabhiprajātasyaapakramaṇam // dhātrīm āhitikāṃ vāakāmāṃ svavaśāṃ gacchataḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Violence towards an attendant of high birth shall entitle him to run away When a master has connection with a nurse or pledged female slave against her will, he shall be punished with the first amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paravaśāṃ madhyamaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: a stranger doing the same shall be punished with the middlemost amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kanyām āhitikāṃ vā svayam anyena vā duṣayato mūlyanāśaḥ śulkaṃ taddvuguṇaś ca daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man commits or helps another to commit rape with a girl or a female slave pledged to him, he shall not only forfeit the purchase value, but also pay a certain amount of money sulka to her and a fine of twice the amount of sulka to the Government

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ātmavikrayiṇaḥ prajām āryāṃ vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The offspring of a man who has sold off himself as a slave shall be an Arya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ātmaadhigataṃ svāmikarmaaviruddhaṃ labheta, pitryaṃ ca dāyam // mūlyena caāryatvaṃ gacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A slave shall be entitled to enjoy not only whatever he has earned without prejudice to his master‟s work, but Kautilyas Arthashastra also the inheritance he has received from his father On paying the value for which one is enslaved, a slave shall regain his Aryahood

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tenaudaradāsaāhitakau vyākhyātau //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rule shall apply either to born or pledged slaves

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prakṣepaanurūpaś caasya niṣkrayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The ransom necessary for a slave to regain his freedom is equal to what he has been sold for

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daṇḍapraṇītaḥ karmaṇā daṇḍam upanayet // āryaprāṇo dhvajaāhṛtaḥ karmakālaanurūpeṇa mūlyaardhena vā vimucyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person who has been enslaved for fines or court decrees dandapranítah shall earn the amount by work An Arya, made captive in war shall for his freedom pay a certain amount proportional to the dangerous work done at the time of his capture, or half the amount

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / gṛhejātadāyaāgatalabdhakrītānām anyatamaṃ dāsam ūnaaṣṭavarṣaṃ vibandhum akāmaṃ nīce karmaṇi videśe dāsīṃ vā sagarbhām aprativihitagarbhabharmaṇyāṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a slave who is less than eight years old and has no relatives, no matter whether he is born a slave in his masters house, or fell to his masters share of inheritance, or has been purchased or obtained by his master in any other way, is employed in mean avocations against his will or is sold or mortgaged in a foreign land;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vikrayaādhānaṃ nayataḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: or if a pregnant female slave is sold or pledged without any provision for her confinement, his or her master shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kretṛśrotṛṛṇāṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The purchaser and abettors shall likewise be punished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dāsam anurūpeṇa niṣkrayeṇaāryam akurvato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Failure to set a slave at liberty on the receipt of a required amount of ransom shall be punished with a fine of panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃrodhaś caākaraṇāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: putting a slave under confinement for no reason samrodhaschákaranát shall likewise be punished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dāsadravyasya jñātayo dāyādāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The property of a slave shall pass into the hands of his kinsmen;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣām abhāve svāmī //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: in the absence of any kinsmen, his master shall take it

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svāminaḥ svasyāṃ dāsyāṃ jātaṃ samātṛkam adāsaṃ vidyāt // gṛhyā cet kuṭumbaarthacintanī mātā bhrātā bhaginī caasyā adāsāḥ syuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a child is begotten on a female slave by her master, both the child and its mother shall at once be recognised as free If for the sake of subsistence, the mother has to remain in her Kautilyas Arthashastra bondage, her brother and sister shall be liberated

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dāsaṃ dāsīṃ vā niṣkrīya punar vikrayaādhānaṃ nayato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ, anyatra svayaṃvādibhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Selling or mortgaging the life of a male or a female slave once liberated shall be punished with a fine of panas with the exception of those who enslave themselves

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti dāsakalpaḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus the rules regarding slaves

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmakarasya karmasambandham āsannā vidyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Power of Masters over their hired servants Neighbours shall know the nature of agreement between a master and his servant

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathāsambhāṣitaṃ vetanaṃ labheta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The servant shall get the promised wages

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmakālaanurūpam asambhāṣitavetanaḥ // karṣakaḥ sasyānāṃ gopālakaḥ sarpiṣāṃ vaidehakaḥ paṇyānām ātmanā vyavahṛtānāṃ daśabhāgam asambhāṣitavetano labheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: As to wages not previously settled the amount shall be fixed in proportion to the work done and the time spent in doing it karmakálánurúpam at the rate prevailing at the time Wages being previously unsettled, a cultivator shall obtain /0th of the crops grown, a herdsman /0th of the butter clarified, a trader /0th of the sale proceeds

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sambhāṣitavetanas tu yathāsambhāṣitam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Wages previously settled shall be paid and received as agreed upon

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāruśilpikuśīlavacikitsakavāgjīvanaparicārakaādir āśākārikavargas tu yathāanyas tadvidhaḥ kuryād yathā vā kuśalāḥ kalpayeyus
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Artisans, musicians, physicians, buffoons, cooks, and other workmen, serving of their own accord, shall obtain as much wages as similar persons employed elsewhere usually get or as much as experts kusaláh shall fix

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tathā vetanaṃ labheta // sākṣipratyayam eva syāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Disputes regarding wages shall be decided on the strength of evidences furnished by witnesses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sākṣiṇām abhāve yataḥ karma tatoanuyuñjīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the absence of witnesses, the master who has provided his servant with work shall be examined

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vetanaādāne daśabandho daṇḍaḥ, ṣaṭpaṇo vā // apavyayamāne dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ, pañcabandho vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Failure to pay wages shall be punished with a fine of ten times the amount of wages dasabandhah, or panas; misappropriation of wages shall be punished with a fine of panas or of five times the amount of the wages panchabandho vá

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nadīvegajvālāstenavyālauparuddhaḥ sarvasvaputradāraātmadānenaārtas trātāram āhūya niṣtīrṇaḥ kuśalapradiṣṭaṃ vetanaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person who, while he is being carried away by floods, or is caught in a fire, or is in danger from elephants or tigers, is rescued on his promise to offer to his rescuer not only the whole of Kautilyas Arthashastra his property, but also his sons, wife, and himself as slaves, shall pay only as much as will be fixed by experts

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena sarvatraārtadānaanuśayā vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This rule shall apply to all cases where help of any kind is rendered to the afflicted

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: labheta puṃścalī bhogaṃ saṃgamasyaupaliṅganāt /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A public woman shall surrender her person as agreed upon;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: atiyācnā tu jīyeta daurmatyaavinayena vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but insistence on the observance of any agreement which is illconsidered and improper shall not succeed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gṛhītvā vetanaṃ karmaakurvato bhṛtakasya dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: [Thus ends Chapter , Rules regarding slaves in the section of Rules regarding slaves and the Right of Masters in the section of Rules regarding Labourers in Book , Concerning Law of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃrodhaś caākaraṇāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: End of the seventieth chapter from the beginning] CHAPTER

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aśaktaḥ kutsite karmaṇi vyādhau vyasane vāanuśayaṃ labheta, pareṇa vā kārayitum //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A servant neglecting or unreasonably putting off work for which he has received wages shall be fined panas and be caughthold of till the work is done

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyavyayakarmaṇā labheta bhartā vā kārayitum //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The loss incurred by his master or employer owing to such delay shall be made good by extra work

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mayā vā naanyasya kartavyam ity avarodhe bhartur akārayato bhṛtakasyaakurvato vā dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra An employer not taking work from his labourer or an employee not doing his employers work shall be fined panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmaniṣṭhāpane bhartur anyatra gṛhītavetano naasakāmaḥ kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: An employee who has received wages to do a certain work which is however, not brought to termination shall not, of his own accord, go elsewhere for work

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: upasthitam akārayataḥ kṛtam eva vidyād ity ācāryāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: My preceptor holds that not taking work on the part of an employer from his employee when the latter is ready, shall be regarded as work done by the labourer

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: naiti kauṭilyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But Kautilya objects to it;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛtasya vetanaṃ naakṛtasyaasti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for wages are to be paid for work done, but not for work that is not done

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa ced alpam api kārayitvā na kārayet kṛtam evaasya vidyāt // deśakālaatipātanena karmaṇām anyathākaraṇe vā naasakāmaḥ kṛtam anumanyeta // sambhāṣitād adhikakriyāyāṃ prayāsaṃ na moghaṃ kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If an employer, having caused his labourer to do a part of work, will not cause him to do the rest for which the latter may certainly be ready, then also the unfinished portion of the work has to be regarded as finished But owing to consideration of changes that have occurred in time and place or owing to bad workmanship of the labourer, the employer may not be pleased with what has already been turned out by the labourer Also the workman may, if unrestrained, do more than agreed upon and thereby cause loss to the employer

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena saṃghabhṛtā vyākhyātāḥ // teṣām ādhiḥ saptarātram āsīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rules shall apply to guilds of workmen sanghabhritáh Guilds of workmen shall have a grace of seven nights over and above the period agreed upon for fulfilling their engagement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tatoanyam upasthāpayet, karmaniṣpākaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Beyond that time they shall find substitutes and get the work completed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na caanivedya bhartuḥ saṃghaḥ kaṃcit parihared upanayed vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Without taking permission from their employer, they shall neither leave out anything undone nor carry away anything with them from the place of work

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃghena parihṛtasyaardhadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They shall be fined panas for taking away anything and panas for leaving out anything undone

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti bhṛtakaadhikāraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus the Rules regarding labourers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃghabhṛtāḥ sambhūyasamutthātāro vā yathāsambhāṣitaṃ vetanaṃ samaṃ vā vibhajeran // karṣaṇavaidehakā vā sasyapaṇyaārambhaparyavasānaantare sannasya yathākṛtasya karmaṇaḥ pratyaṃśaṃ dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Guilds of workmen sanghabhritáh, workmen employed by Companies as well as those who carry on any cooperative work Kautilyas Arthashastra sambhúya samutthátarah shall divide their earnings vetanam wages either equally or as agreed upon among themselves Cultivators or merchants shall, either at the end or in the middle of their cultivation or manufacture, pay to their labourers as much of the latters share as is proportional to the work done

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃsiddhe tuuddhṛtapaṇye sannasya tadānīm eva pratyaṃśaṃ dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But when commodities are being manufactured, wages shall be paid out according to the amount of work turned out;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāmānyā hi pathisiddhiś caasiddhiś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for such payment does not affect the favourable or unfavourable results on the way ie, in the sale of merchandise by peddlars

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prakrānte tu karmaṇi svasthasyaapakrāmato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A healthy person who deserts his company after work has been begun shall be fined panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na ca prākāmyam apakramaṇe //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for none shall, of his own accord, leave his company

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: coraṃ tv abhayapūrvaṃ karmaṇaḥ pratyaṃśena grāhayed, dadyāt pratyaṃśam abhayaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person who is found to have neglected his share of work by stealth shall be shown mercy abhayam for the first time and given a proportional quantity of work anew with promise of proportional share of earnings as well

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: punaḥsteye pravāsanam, anyatragamane ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In case of negligence for a second time or of going elsewhere, he shall be thrown out of the Company pravásanam

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mahāaparādhe tu dūṣyavad ācaret //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If he is guilty of a glaring offence maháparádhe, he shall be treated as the condemned

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yājakāḥ svāpracāradravyavarjaṃ yathāsambhāṣitaṃ vetanaṃ samaṃ vā vibhajeran //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Cooperation in sacrificial acts Priests cooperating in a sacrifice shall divide their earnings either equally or as agreed upon excepting what is especially due to each or any of them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: agniṣṭomaādiṣu ca kratuṣu dīkṣaṇād ūrdhvaṃ tṛtīyam aṃśaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a priest employed in such sacrifices as Agnishtoma, etc, dies after the ceremony of consecration, his claimant shall get /th of the promised or prescribed present dakshiná;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: madhyamaupasada ūrdhvam ardham aṃśaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: after the ceremony called Madhyamopasad;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sutye prātaḥsavanād ūrdhvaṃ pādaūnam aṃśam // mādhyandināt savanād ūrdhvaṃ samagram aṃśaṃ labheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and after the ceremony called Maya, ½ of the share If in the sacrifice called Sutya, the same thing happens after the ceremony called Prátassavana, ¾ths, of the share shall be paid; after the ceremony called Madhyandina, the present shall be paid in full;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nītā hi dakṣiṇā bhavanti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for by that time the payment of presents shall be over

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bṛhaspatisavavarjaṃ pratisavanaṃ hi dakṣiṇā dīyante //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In every sacrifice except the one called Brihaspatisavana, it is usual to pay presents

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tenaahargaṇadakṣiṇā vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rule shall apply to the presents payable in Aharganas, sacrifices so called

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sanānām ādaśaahorātrātśeṣabhṛtāḥ karma kuryuḥ, anye vā svapratyayāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The surviving priests carrying the balance of the present or any other relatives of a dead priest shall perform the funeral ceremony of the dead for ten days and nights

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmaṇy asamāpte tu yajamānaḥ sīded,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a sacrificer sends out any priest before completing the sacrifice, he shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: asamāpte tu karmaṇi yājyaṃ yājakaṃ vā tyajataḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ // anāhitaagniḥ śataguruyajvā ca sahasraguḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a sacrificer sending out a priest happens to be a person who has not kept the sacrificial fire, or to be a preceptor or one who has already performed sacrifices, then the fines shall be 00, 000, and 000 panas respectively

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: surāpo vṛṣalībhartā brahmahā gurutalpagaḥ // asatpratigrahe yuktaḥ stenaḥ kutsitayājakaḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: As it is certain that sacrificial merits fall in value when performed in company with a drunkard, the husband of a Súdra woman, a murderer of a Bráhman, or one who has violated the chastify of the wife of his preceptor, a receiver of condemnable gifts, or is a thief, or one whose performance of sacrificial acts is condemnable, it is no offence to send out such a priest

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: adoṣas tyaktum anyonyaṃ karmasaṃkaraniścayāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: [Thus ends Chapter , Rules regarding labourers, and Cooperative undertaking in the section of Rules regarding slaves and labourers, in Book , Concerning Law of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vikrīya paṇyam aprayacchato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ, anyatra doṣaupanipātaaviṣahyebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A merchant refusing to give his merchandise that he has sold shall be punished with a fine of panas, unless the merchandise is naturally bad, or is dangerous, or is intolerable

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paṇyadoṣo doṣaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That which has inherent defects is termed naturally bad;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājacoraagnyudakabādha upanipātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: whatever is liable to be confiscated by the king, or is subject to destruction by thieves, fire, or floods is termed as being dangerous;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bahuguṇahīnam ārtakṛtaṃ vāaviṣahyam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and whatever is devoid of all good qualities, or is manufactured by the deceased is called intolerable

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaidehakānām ekarātram anuśayaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Time for rescission of a sale is one night for merchants;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karṣakāṇāṃ trirātraṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: nights for cultivators; nights for herdsmen;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vyāmiśrāṇām uttamānāṃ ca varṇānāṃ vṛttivikraye saptarātram //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and with regard to the sale or barter of precious things and articles of mixed qualities vivrittivikraye, nights

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ātipātikānāṃ paṇyānāṃ anyatraavikreyam ity avarodhenaanuśayo deyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Merchandise which is likely to perish sooner may, if there is no loss to others, be shown the favour of early disposal by prohibiting the sale elsewhere of similar merchandise which is not likely to perish so soon

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaatikrame caturviṃśatipaṇo daṇḍaḥ, paṇyadaśabhāgo vā // /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Violation of this rule shall be punished with a fine of panas or /0th of the value of the merchandise sold against this rule

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: krītvā paṇyam apratigṛhṇato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ, anyatra doṣaupanipātaaviṣahyebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A person who attempts to return an article purchased by him shall if the article is other than what is naturally bad, or is dangerous, or is intolerable, be punished with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samānaś caanuśayo vikretur anuśayena //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rescission rules that apply to a seller shall apply to the purchaser also

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vivāhānāṃ tu trayāṇāṃ pūrveṣāṃ varṇānāṃ pāṇigrahaṇāt siddham upāvartanaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Marriage Contracts [As regards marriages among the three higher castes, rejection of a bride before the rite of pánigrahana, clasping of Kautilyas Arthashastra hands, is valid;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śūdrāṇāṃ ca prakarmaṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: likewise among the Súdras, observing religious rites

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vṛttapāṇigrahaṇayor api doṣam aupaśāyikaṃ dṛṣṭvā siddham upāvartanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Even in the case of a couple that has gone through the rite of pánigrahana,] rejection of a bride whose guilt of having lain with another man has been afterwards detected is valid

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na tv evaabhiprajātayoḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But never so in the case of brides and bridegrooms of pure character and high family

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kanyādoṣam aupaśāyikam anākhyāya prayacchataḥ kanyāṃ ṣaṇṇavatir daṇḍaḥ, śulkastrīdhanapratidānaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person who has given a girl in marriage without announcing her guilt of having lain with another shall not only be punished with a fine of panas, but also be made to return the sulka and strídhana

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: varayitur vā varadoṣam anākhyāya vindato dviguṇaḥ, śulkastrīdhananāśaś ca // dvipadacatuṣpadānāṃ tu kuṇṭhavyādhitaaśucīnām utsāhasvāsthyaśucīnām ākhyāne dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person receiving a girl in marriage without announcing the blemishes of the bridegroom shall not only pay double the above fine, but also forfeit the sulka and strídhana he paid for the bride Sale of bipeds, etc Sale of bipeds and quadrupeds as strong, healthy, and clean though they are either unclean or actually suffering from leprosy and other diseases, shall be punished with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ātripakṣād iti catuṣpadānām upāvartanam, āsaṃvatsarād iti manuṣyāṇām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The time of rescission of sale is three fortnights for quadrupeds and one year for men;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tāvatā hi kālena śakyaṃ śaucaāśauce jñātum //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for it is possible to know by that time their good or bad condition

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dātā pratigrahītā ca syātāṃ naupahatau yathā / dāne kraye vāanuśayaṃ tathā kuryuḥ sabhāsadaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: An assembly convened for the purpose shall, in the matter of rescending sales or gifts, decide in such a way that neither the giver nor the receiver shall be injured thereby

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dattasyaapradānam ṛṇaādānena vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: [Thus ends Chapter , Rescission of purchase and sale in Book , Concerning Law of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dattam avyavahāryam ekatraanuśaye varteta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Invalid gifts shall be kept in the safe custody of some persons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvasvaṃ putradāram ātmānaṃ vā pradāyaanuśayinaḥ prayacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person who has given as gift not only his whole property, his sons, and his wife, but also his own life shall bring the same for the consideration of rescissors

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: arthadānam anupakāriṣv apakāriṣu vā, kāmadānam anarheṣu ca // yathā ca dātā pratigrahītā ca naupahatau syātāṃ tathāanuśayaṃ kuśalāḥ kalpayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Gifts or charitable subscriptions to the wicked or for unworthy purposes, monetary help to such persons as are malevolent or cruel, and promise of sexual enjoyment to the unworthy shall be so settled by rescissors that neither the giver nor the receiver shall be injured thereby

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daṇḍabhayād ākrośabhayād anarthabhayād vā bhayadānaṃ pratigṛhṇataḥ steyadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who receive any kind of aid from timid persons, threatening them with legal punishment, defamation, or loss of money, shall be liable to the punishment for theft;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prayacchataś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and the persons who yield such aids shall likewise be punished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: roṣadānaṃ parahiṃsāyāṃ, rājñām upari darpadānaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Cooperation in hurting a person, and showing a haughty attitude towards the king shall be punished with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prātibhāvyaṃ daṇḍaśulkaśeṣam ākṣikaṃ saurikaṃ ca naakāmaḥ putro dāyādo vā rikthaharo dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: No son, or heir claiming a dead man‟s property shall, against his own will, pay the value of the bail borne by the dead man prátibhávyadanda, the balance of any dowry sulkasesha, or the stakes of gambling;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti dattasyaanapākarma /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus resumption of gifts is dealt with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: asvāmivikrayas tu naṣṭaapahṛtam āsādya svāmī dharmasthena grāhayet // deśakālaatipattau vā svayaṃ gṛhītvāupaharet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sale without ownership As regards sale without ownershipOn the detection of a lost property in the possession of another person, the owner shall cause the offender to be arrested through the judges of a court If time or place does not permit this action, the owner himself shall catch hold of the offender and bring him before the judges

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dharmasthaś ca svāminam anuyuñjīta kutas te labdham iti // sa ced ācārakramaṃ darśayeta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The judge shall put the question; how the offender came by the property If he Kautilyas Arthashastra narrates how he got it, but cannot produce the person who sold it to him, he shall be left off, and shall forfeit the property

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na vikretāraṃ, tasya dravyasyaatisargeṇa mucyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But the seller, if produced, shall not only pay the value of the property, but also be liable to the punishment for theft

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mūlyaṃ steyadaṇḍaṃ ca dadyāt // sa ced apasāram adhigacched apasared āapasārakṣayāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a person with a stolen property in his possession runs away or hides himself till the property is wholly consumed, he shall not only pay the value, but also be liable to the punishment for theft

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nāṣṭikaś ca svakaraṇaṃ kṛtvā naṣṭapratyāhṛtaṃ labheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: After proving his claim to a lost property svakaranam kritva, its owner shall be entitled to take possession of it

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svakaraṇaabhāve pañcabandho daṇḍaḥ // tac ca dravyaṃ rājadharmyaṃ syāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On his failure to prove his title to it, he shall be fined times the value of the property, panchabandhadandah, and the property shall be taken by the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: naṣṭaapahṛtam anivedyautkarṣataḥ svāminaḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the owner takes possession of a lost article without obtaining permission from the court, he shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śulkasthāne naṣṭaapahṛtautpannaṃ tiṣṭhet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Stolen or lost articles shall, on being detected, be kept in the tollgate

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tripakṣād ūrdhvam anabhisāraṃ rājā haret,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If no claimant is forthcoming within three fortnights, such articles shall be taken by the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svāmī vā svakaraṇena // pañcapaṇikaṃ dvipadarūpasya niṣkrayaṃ dadyāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who proved his title to a lost or stolen biped shall pay panas towards ransom before taking possession of it

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: catuṣpaṇikam ekakhurasya, dvipaṇikaṃ gomahiṣasya,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Likewise the ransom for a singlehoofed animal shall be panas; for a cow or a buffalo, panas, for minor quadrupeds ¼th of a pana;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ratnasāraphalgukupyānāṃ pañcakaṃ śataṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and for articles such as precious stones, superior or inferior raw materials, five per cent of their value

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paracakraaṭavīhṛtaṃ tu pratyānīya rājā yathāsvaṃ prayacchet // corahṛtam avidyamānaṃ svadravyebhyaḥ prayacchet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whatever of the property of his own subjects the king brings back from the forests and countries of enemies, shall be handed over to its owner Whatever of the property of citizens robbed by thieves the king cannot recover, shall be made good from his own Kautilyas Arthashastra pocket

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svayaṃgrāheṇaāhṛtaṃ pratyānīya tanniṣkrayaṃ vā prayacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the king is unable to recover such things, he shall either allow any selfelected person svayamgráha to fetch them, or pay an equivalent ransom to the sufferer

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paraviṣayād vā vikrameṇaānītaṃ yathāpradiṣṭaṃ rājñā bhuñjīta, anyatraāryaprāṇebhyo devabrāhmaṇatapasvidravyebhyaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: An adventurer may enjoy whatever the king graciously gives him out of the booty he has plundered from an enemys country, excepting the life of an Arya and the property belonging to gods, Bráhmans or ascetics

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ity asvāmivikrayaḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus sale without ownership is dealt with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svasvāmisambandhas tu bhogaanuvṛttir ucchinnadeśānāṃ yathāsvaṃ dravyāṇām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Ownership As to the title of an owner to his property The owners who have quitted their country where their property lies shall continue to have their title to it

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yat svaṃ dravyam anyair bhujyamānaṃ daśa varṣāṇy upekṣeta, hīyetaasya, anyatra bālavṛddhavyādhitavyasaniproṣitadeśatyāgarājyavibhramebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When the owners other than minors, the aged, those that are afflicted with decease or calamities, those that are sojourning abroad, or those that have deserted their country during national disturbances, neglect for ten years their property which is under the enjoyment of others, they shall forfeit their title to it

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viṃśativarṣaupekṣitam anavasitaṃ vāstu naanuyuñjīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Buildings left for 0 years in the enjoyment of others shall not be reclaimed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jñātayaḥ śrotriyāḥ pāṣaṇḍā vā rājñām asaṃnidhau paravāstuṣu vivasanto na bhogena hareyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But the mere occupation of the buildings of others during the absence of the king by kinsmen, priests, or heretics shall not give them the right of possession

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: upanidhim ādhiṃ nidhiṃ nikṣepaṃ striyaṃ sīmānaṃ rājaśrotriyadravyāṇi ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same shall obtain with regard to open deposits, pledges, treasure trove nidhi, boundary, or any property belonging to kings or priests srotriyas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: āśramiṇaḥ pāṣaṇḍā vā mahaty avakāśe parasparam abādhamānā vaseyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Ascetics and heretics shall, without disturbing each other, reside in a large area

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūrvaāgato vā vāsaparyāyaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A new comer shall, however, be provided with the space occupied by an old resident

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: apradātā nirasyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If not willing to do so, the old occupier shall be sent out

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vānaprasthayatibrahmacāriṇām ācāryaśiṣyadharmabhrātṛsamānatīrthyā rikthabhājaḥ krameṇa //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The property of hermits, vánaprastha ascetics yati, or bachelors learning the Vedas Brahmachári shall on their death be taken by their preceptors, disciples, their brethren dharmabhrátri, or classmates in succession

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vivādapadeṣu caeṣāṃ yāvantaḥ paṇā daṇḍās tāvatī rātrīḥ kṣapaṇaabhiṣekaagnikāryamahākacchavardhanāni rājñaś careyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Whenever hermits, etc, have to pay any fines, they may, in the name of the king, perform penance, oblation to gods, fireworship, or the ritual called Mahákachchhavardhana for as many nights as the number of panas of their fines

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ahiraṇyasuvarṇāḥ pāṣaḍhāḥ sādhavaḥ // te yathāsvam upavāsavratair ārādhayeyuḥ, anyatra pāruṣyasteyasāhasasaṃgrahaṇebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those heretics páshandáh who have neither gold nor goldcoin shall similarly observe their fasts except in the case of defamation, theft, assault and abduction of women

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣu yathāuktā daṇḍāḥ kāryāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Under these circumstances, they shall be compelled to undergo punishment

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pravrajyāsu vṛthāācārān rājā daṇḍena vārayet / dharmo hy adharmaupahataḥ śāstāraṃ hanty upekṣitaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The king shall, under penalty of fines, forbid the wilful or improper proceedings of ascetics for vice overwhelming righteousness will in the long run destroy the ruler himself

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sāhasam anvayavat prasabhakarma //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: SUDDEN and direct seizure of person or property is termed sáhasa;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: niranvaye steyam, apavyayane ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: fraudulent or indirect seizure niranvaye’pavyayanecha is theft

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ratnasāraphalgukupyānāṃ sāhase mūlyasamo daṇḍaḥ iti mānavāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The school of Manu hold that the fine for the direct seizure of precious stones and superior or inferior raw materials shall be equal to their value

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mūlyadviguṇaḥ ity auśanasāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It is equal to twice the value of the articles according to the followers of Usanas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathāaparādha iti kauṭilyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But Kautilya holds that it shall be proportional to the gravity of the crime

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: puṣpaphalaśākamūlakandapakvaannacarmaveṇumṛdbhāṇḍaādīnāṃ kṣudrakadravyāṇāṃ dvādśapaṇaavaraś caturviṃśatipaṇaparo
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra In the case of such articles of small value as flowers, fruits, vegetables, roots, turnips, cooked rice, skins, bamboo, and pots earthenware the fine shall range from to papas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kālaāyasakāṣṭharajjudravyakṣudrapaśupaṭaādīnāṃ sthūlakadravyāṇāṃ caturviṃśatipaṇaavaroaṣṭacatvāriṃśatpaṇaparo daṇḍaḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for articles of great value such as iron káláyasa, wood, roping materials, and herds of minor quadrupeds, the fine shall range from to panas; and for such articles of still greater value as copper, brass, bronze, glass, ivory and vessels, etc, it shall range from to panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mahāpaśumanuṣyakṣetragṛhahiraṇyasuvarṇasūkṣmavastraādīnāṃ sthūlakadravyāṇāṃ dviśataavaraḥ pañcaśataparo madhyamaḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For the seizure of such as big quadrupeds, men, fields, houses, gold, goldcoins, fine fabrics, etc, the fine shall range from 00 to 00 panas, which is termed the middlemost amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: striyaṃ puruṣaṃ vāabhiṣahya badhnato bandhayato bandhaṃ vā mokṣayataḥ pañcaśataavaraḥ sahasrapara uttamaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: My preceptor holds that keeping or causing to keep by force either men or women in prison, or releasing them by force from imprisonment, shall be punished with fines ranging from 00 to ,000 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ity ācāryāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This fine is termed the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaḥ sāhasaṃ pratipattā iti kārayati sa dviguṇaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who causes another to commit sáhasa after the plans prepared by himself shall be fined twice the value of the person or property seized

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yāvadd hiraṇyam upayokṣyate tāvad dāsyāmi iti sa caturguṇaṃ daṇḍaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: An abettor who employs a hireling to comit sáhasa by promising „ shall pay thee as much gold as thou makest use of,‟ shall be fined four times the value

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaḥ etāvadd hiraṇyaṃ dāsyāmi iti pramāṇam uddiśya kārayati sa yathāuktaṃ hiraṇyaṃ daṇḍaṃ ca dadyāt iti bārhaspatyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The school of Brihaspati are of opinion that if with the promise „ will pay thee this amount of gold,‟ an abettor causes another to commit sáhasa, the former shall be compelled to pay the promised amount of gold and a fine

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa cet kopaṃ madaṃ mohaṃ vāapadiśed yathāuktavad daṇḍam enaṃ kuryād iti kauṭilyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But Kautilya holds that if an abettor extenuates his crime by pleading anger, intoxication or loss of sense moham, he shall be punished as described above

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daṇḍakarmasu sarveṣu rūpam aṣṭapaṇaṃ śatam / śatāt pareṣu vyājīṃ ca vidyāt pañcapaṇaṃ śatam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In all kinds of fines below a hundred panas, the king shall take in addition to the fine per cent more as rúpa and in fines above hundred, five per cent more;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prajānāṃ doṣabāhulyād rājñāṃ vā bhāvadoṣataḥ / rūpavyājyāv adharmiṣṭhe dharmyā tu prakṛtiḥ smṛtā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: these two kinds of exaction, are Kautilyas Arthashastra just inasmuch as the people are full of sins on the one hand, and kings are naturally misguided on the other [Thus ends Chapter , Robbery in Book , Concerning Law of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vākpāruṣyam upavādaḥ kutsanam abhibhartsanam iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: DEFAMATION CALUMNY, contemptuous talk, or intimidation constitutes defamation

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śarīraprakṛtiśrutavṛttijanapadānāṃ śarīraupavāde kāṇakhañjaādibhiḥ satye tripaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Among abusive expressions relating to the body, habits, learning, occupation, or nationalities, that of calling a deformed man by his right name such as „the blind‟, „the lame‟, etc

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mithyāupavāde ṣaṭpaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: shall be punished with a fine of panas; and by false name panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śobhanaakṣimantaḥ iti kāṇakhañjaādīnāṃ stutinindāyāṃ dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the blind, the lame, etc, are insulted with such ironical expressions as „a man of beautiful eyes‟, „a man of beautiful teeth‟, etc the fine shall be panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kuṣṭhaunmādaklaibyaādibhiḥ kutsāyāṃ ca satyamithyāstutinindāsu dvādaśapaṇauttarā daṇḍās tulyeṣu //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Likewise when a person is taunted for leprosy, lunacy, impotency and the like Abusive expressions in general, no matter whether true, false, or reverse with reference to the abused, shall be punished with fines ranging above panas, in the case of persons of equal rank

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viśiṣṭeṣu dviguṇāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If persons abused happen to be of superior rank, the amount of the fines shall be doubled;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hīneṣv ardhadaṇḍāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if of lower rank, it shall be halved

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parastrīṣu dviguṇāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For calumniating the wives of others, the amount of the fines shall be doubled

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pramādamadamohaādibhir ardhadaṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If abuse is due to carelessness, intoxication, or loss of sense, etc, the fines shall be halved

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kuṣṭhaunmādayoś cikitsakāḥ saṃnikṛṣṭā pumāṃsaś ca pramāṇaṃ, klībabhāve striyo mūtraphenoapsu viṣṭhānimajjanaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: As to the reality of leprosy and lunacy, physicians or Kautilyas Arthashastra neighbours shall be authorities As to the reality of impotency, women, the scum of urine, or the low specific gravity of faeces in water the sinking of faeces in water shall furnish the necessary evidence

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prakṛtyupavāde brāhmaṇakṣatriyavaiśyaśūdraantaavasāyinām apareṇa pūrvasya tripaṇauttarā daṇḍāḥ, pūrveṇaaparasya dvipaṇaadharāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Speaking ill of habits If among Bráhmans, Kshatriyas, Vaisyas, Súdras, and outcastes antávasáyins, any one of a lower caste abuses the habits of one of a higher caste, the fines imposed shall increase from panas upwards commencing from the lowest caste

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kubrāhmaṇaādibhiś ca kutsāyām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Contemptuous expressions such as a bad Bráhman shall also be punished as above

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kārukuśīlavānāṃ vṛttyupavādaḥ, prājjūṇakagāndhāraādīnāṃ ca janapadaupavādā vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rules shall apply to calumnies regarding learning sruta, the profession of buffoons vágjívana, artisans, or musicians, and relating to nationalities such as Prájjunaka, Gándhára, etc

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaḥ paraṃ evaṃ tvāṃ kariṣyāmi iti karaṇenaabhibhartsayed, akaraṇe yas tasya karaṇe daṇḍas tatoardhadaṇḍaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Intimidation If a person intimidates another by using such expressions as „ shall render thee thus‟, the bravado shall be punished with half as much fine as will be levied on him who actually does so

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aśaktaḥ kopaṃ madaṃ mohaṃ vāapadiśed dvādaśapaṇaṃ daṇḍaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a person, being unable to carry his threat into effect, pleads provocation, intoxication, or loss of sense as his excuse, he shall be fined panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jātavairaāśayaḥ śaktaś caapakartuṃ yāvajjīvikaavasthaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a person capable to do harm and under the influence of Kautilyas Arthashastra enmity intimidates another, he shall be compelled to give lifelong security for the wellbeing of the intimidated

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svadeśagrāmayoḥ pūrvaṃ madhyamaṃ jātisaṃghayoḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Defamation of ones own nation or village shall be punished with the first amercement; that of ones own caste or assembly with the middlemost;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ākrośād devacaityānām uttamaṃ daṇḍam arhati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and that of gods or temples chaitya with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daṇḍapāruṣyaṃ sparśanam avagūrṇaṃ prahatam iti // nābher adhaḥkāyaṃ hastapaṅkabhasmapāṃsubhir iti spṛśatas tripaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: ASSAULT TOUCHING, striking, or hurting constitutes assault When a person touches with hand, mud, ashes or dust the body of another person below the naval, he shall be punished with a fine of panas; with some but unclean things, with the leg, or spittle, panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tair evaamedhyaiḥ pādaṣṭhīvikābhyāṃ ca ṣaṭpaṇaḥ, chardimūtrapurīṣaādibhir dvādaśapaṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: with saliva Chhardi, urine, faeces, etc panas If the same offence is committed above the navel, the fines shall be doubled;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śirasi caturguṇāḥ sameṣu //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and on the head, quadrupled

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viśiṣṭeṣu dviguṇāḥ, hīneṣv ardhadaṇḍāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the same offence is committed on persons of superior rank, the fines shall be twice as much and on persons of lower rank, half of the above fines

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parastrīṣu dviguṇāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the same offence is committed on the women of others, the fines shall be doubled

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pramādamadamohaādibhir ardhadaṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the offence is due to carelessness, intoxication, or loss of sense, the fines shall be halved

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pādavastrahastakeśaavalambaneṣu ṣaṭpaṇauttarā daṇḍāḥ // pīḍanaāveṣṭanaañcanaprakarṣaṇaadhyāsaneṣu pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For catching hold of a man by his legs, clothes, hands or hair, Kautilyas Arthashastra fines ranging above panas shall be imposed Squeezing, rounding with arms, thrusting, dragging, or sitting over the body of another person shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pātayitvāapakrāmatoardhadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Running away after making a person fall, shall be punished with half of the above fines

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śūdro yenaaṅgena brāhmaṇam abhihanyāt tad asyacchedayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: That limb of a Súdra with which he strikes a Bráhman shall be cut off

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: avagūrṇe niṣkrayaḥ, sparśeardhadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Striking For striking compensation is to be paid and half of the fines levied for touching

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena caṇḍālaaśucayo vyākhyātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This rule shall also apply to Chandalas and other profane persons committing the same offence

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hastenaavagūrṇe tripaṇaavaro dvādaśapaṇaparo daṇḍaḥ, pādena dviguṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Striking with the hand shall be punished with fines below panas, with the leg twice as much as the above fine;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: duḥkhautpādanena dravyeṇa pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and striking with an instrument so as to cause swellings shall be punished with the first amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prāṇaābādhikena madhyamaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and striking so as to endanger life shall be punished with the middlemost amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāṣṭhaloṣṭapāṣāṇalohadaṇḍarajjudravyāṇām anyatamena duḥkham aśoṇitam utpādayataś caturviṃśatipaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hurting Causing a bloodless wound with a stick, mud, a stone, an iron bar, or a rope shall be punished with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śoṇitautpādane dviguṇaḥ, anyatra duṣṭaśoṇitāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Causing the blood to gush out excepting bad or diseased blood shall be punished with double the fine

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mṛtakalpam aśoṇitaṃ ghnato hastapādapārañcikaṃ vā kurvataḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ, pāṇipādadantabhaṅge karṇanāsaācchedane vraṇavidāraṇe cca,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Beating a person almost to death, though without causing blood, breaking the hands, legs, or teeth, tearing off the ear or the nose, or breaking open the flesh of a person except in ulcers or boils shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sakthigrīvaābhañjane netrabhedane vā vākyaceṣṭābhojanauparodheṣu ca madhyamaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ samutthānavyayaś ca // vipattau kaṇṭakaśodhanāya nīyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Causing hurt in the thigh or the neck, wounding the eye, or hurting so as to impede eating, speaking, or any other bodily movements shall not only be punished with the middlemost amercement, but also be made liable Kautilyas Arthashastra to the payment to the sufferer of such compensation as is necessary to cure him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mahājanasyaekaṃ ghnataḥ pratyekaṃ dviguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Each one of a confederacy of persons who have inflicted hurt on another person shall be punished with double the usual fine

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paryuṣitaḥ kalahoanupraveśo vā naabhiyojyaḥ ity ācāryāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: My preceptor holds that quarrels or assaults of a remote date shall not be complained of

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: naasty apakāriṇo mokṣa iti kauṭilyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But Kautilya holds that there shall be no acquittal for an offender

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kalahe pūrvaāgato jayati, akṣamamāṇo hi pradhāvati ity ācāryāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: My preceptor thinks that he who is the first to complain of a quarrel wins inasmuch as it is pain that drives one to law

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: naiti kauṭilyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But Kautilya objects to it;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūrvaṃ paścād vāabhigatasya sākṣiṇaḥ pramāṇam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for whether a complaint is lodged first or last, it is the evidence of witnesses that must be depended upon

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: asākṣike ghātaḥ kalahaupaliṅganaṃ vā // ghātaabhiyogam apratibruvatas tad ahar eva paścātkāraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the absence of witnesses, the nature of the hurt and other circumstances connected with the quarrel in question shall be evidences Sentence of punishment shall be passed the very day that a defendant accused of assault fails to answer the charge made against him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kalahe dravyam apaharato daśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Robbery in quarrels A person stealing anything under the tumult of a quarrel shall be fined 0 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣudrakadravyahiṃsāyāṃ tac ca tāvac ca daṇḍaḥ, sthūlakadravyahiṃsāyāṃ tac ca dviguṇaś ca daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Destruction of articles of small value shall be punished with a fine equal to the value of the articles besides the payment to the sufferer of an adequate compensation Destruction of big things with a compensation equal to the value of Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 the articles and a fine equal to twice the value

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vastraābharaṇahiraṇyasuvarṇabhāṇḍahiṃsāyāṃ tac ca pūrvaś ca sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the case of destruction of such things as clothes, gold, goldcoins, and vessels or merchandise, the first amercement together with the value of the articles shall be levied

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parakuḍyam abhighātena kṣobhayatas tripaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Causing damage to a wall of another mans house by knocking shall be fined panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: chedanabhedane ṣaṭpaṇaḥ, pratīkāraś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: breaking open or demolishing the same shall be fined panas, besides the restoration of the wall

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: duḥkhautpādanaṃ dravyam anyaveśmani prakṣipato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Throwing harmful things inside the house of a man shall be fined panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prāṇaābādhikaṃ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and throwing such things as endanger the lives of the inmates shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣudrapaśūnāṃ kāṣṭhaādibhir duḥkhautpādane paṇo dviguṇo vā daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For causing pain with sticks, etc, to minor quadrupeds one or two panas shall be levied;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śoṇitautpādane dviguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and for causing blood to the same, the fine shall be doubled

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mahāpaśūnām eteṣv eva sthāneṣv dviguṇo daṇḍaḥ samutthānavyayaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the case of large quadrupeds, not only double the above fines, but also an adequate compensation necessary to cure the beasts shall be levied

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: puraupavanavanaspatīnāṃ puṣpaphalacchāyāvatāṃ prarohacchedane ṣaṭpaṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For cutting off the tender sprouts of fruittrees, flowertrees or shady trees in the parks near a city, a fine of panas shall be imposed;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣudraśākhācchedane dvādaśapaṇaḥ, pīnaśākhāccchedane caturviṃśatipaṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for cutting off the minor branches of the same trees, panas; and for cutting off the big branches, panas shall be levied

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: skandhavadhe pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Cutting off the trunks of the same shall be punished with the first amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samucchittau madhyamaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and felling the same shall be punished with the middlemost amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: puṣpaphalacchāyāvadgulmalatāsv ardhadaṇḍāḥ, puṇyasthānatapovanaśmaśānadrumeṣu ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the case of plants which bear flowers, fruits, or provide shade, half of the above fines shall be levied The same fines shall be levied in the case of trees that have grown in places of pilgrimage, forests of hermits, or cremation or burial grounds

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sīmavṛkṣeṣu caityeṣu drumeṣv ālakṣiteṣu ca / ta eva dviguṇā daṇḍāḥ kāryā rājavaneṣu ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For similar offences committed in connection with the trees Kautilyas Arthashastra which mark boundaries, or which are worshipped or observed chaityeshválakshiteshucha, or trees which are grown in the kings forests, double the above fines shall be levied

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dyūtaadhyakṣo dyūtam ekamukhaṃ kārayet // anyatra dīvyato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍo gūḍhaājīvijñāpanaartham //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: GAMBLING AND BETTING AND MISCELLANEOUS OFFENCES WITH a view to find out spies or thieves, the Superintendent of gambling shall, under the penalty of a fine of panas if played elsewhere, centralise gambling

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dyūtaabhiyoge jetuḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ, parājitasya madhyamaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: My preceptor is of opinion that in complaints regarding gambling, the winner shall be punished with the first amercement and the vanquished with the middlemost amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: naity kauṭilyaḥ // parājitaś ced dviguṇadaṇḍaḥ kriyeta na kaścana rājānam abhisariṣyati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for though not skillful enough to win as ardently desired by him, the vanquished fellow does not tolerate his defeat But Kautilya objects to it for if the punishment for the vanquished were to be doubled, none would complain to the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prāyaśo hi kitavāḥ kūṭadevinaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Yet gamblers are naturally false players

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣām adhyakṣāḥ śuddhāḥ kākaṇīr akṣāṃś ca sthāpayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The Superintendents of gambling shall, therefore, be honest and supply dice at the rate of a kákani of hire per pair

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kākaṇyakṣāṇām anyaupadhāne dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Substitution by tricks of hand of dice other than thus supplied shall be punished with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kūṭakarmaṇi pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍo jitapratyādānam, upadhau steyadaṇḍaś ca // jitadravyād adhyakṣaḥ pañcakaṃ śatam ādadīta, kākaṇyakṣaarālāśalākāavakrayam udakabhūmikarmakrayaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A false player shall not only be punished with the first amercement and fines leviable for theft and deceipt, but also be made to forfeit the stakes he has won Kautilyas Arthashastra The Superintendent shall take not only per cent of the stakes won by every winner, and the hire payable for supplying dice and other accessories of diceplay, but also the fee chargeable for supplying water and accommodation, besides the charge for license

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dravyāṇām ādhānaṃ vikrayaṃ ca kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He can at the same time carry on the transactions of sale or mortgage of things

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akṣabhūmihastadoṣāṇāṃ caapratiṣedhane dviguṇo daṇḍaḥ // tena samāhvayo vyākhyātaḥ, anyatra vidyāśilpasamāhvayāt / iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If he does not forbid tricks of hand and other deceitful practices, be shall be punished with twice the amount of the fine levied from the deceitful gamblers The same rules shall apply to betting and challenging except those in learning and art

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prakīrṇakaṃ tu yācitakaavakrītakaāhitakanikṣepakāṇāṃ yathādeśakālam adāne, yāmacchāyāsamupaveśasaṃsthitīnāṃ vā deśakālaatipātane, gulmataradeyaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ sādhayataḥ, prativeśaanuveśayor upari nimantraṇe ca dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Miscellaneous offences As regards miscellaneous offences When a person does not return in required place or time the property he has borrowed or hired, or placed in his custody as a deposit, sits under the shade for more than one and a quarter of an hour ayáma as prescribed, evades under the excuse of being a Bráhman the payment due while passing military stations or crossing rivers, and bawls out or invites others to fight against his neighbours, he shall be punished with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paravaktavyaṃ paṇyaṃ krīṇānasya, samudraṃ gṛham udbhindataḥ, sāmantacatvāriṃśatkulyaābādhām ācarataś caaṣṭacatvāriṃśatpaṇo daṇḍaḥ // kulanīvīgrāhakasyaapavyayane,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person does not hand over the property entrusted to him for delivery to a third person, drags with his hand the wife of his brother, has connection with a public woman kept by another, sells merchandise that is under ill repute, breaks open the sealed door of a house, or causes hurt to any of the fortyhouseholders or neighbours, a fine of panas shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vidhavāṃ chandavāsinīṃ prasahyaadhicarataḥ, caṇḍālasyaāryāṃ spṛśataḥ, pratyāsannam āpady anabhidhāvato, niṣkāraṇam abhidhāvanaṃ kurvataḥ, śākyaājīvakaādīn vṛṣalapravrajitān devapitṛkāryeṣu bhojayataḥ śatyo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person misappropriates the revenue he collects as the Kautilyas Arthashastra agent of a household, violates by force the chastity of a widow of independent living, when an outcast chandála person touches an Arya woman, when a person does not run to render help to another in danger, or runs without a cause, and when a person entertains, in dinner dedicated to gods or ancestors Buddhists sákya, Ajívakas, Súdras and exiled persons, pravrajita a fine of 00 panas shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śapathavākyaanuyogam aniṣṛṣṭaṃ kurvataḥ, yuktakarma caayuktasya, kṣudrapaśuvṛṣāṇāṃ puṃstvaupaghātinaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When an unauthorised person examines an offender on oath, executes Government work though not a Government servant, renders minor quadrupeds impotent, or causes abortion to a female slave by medicine, he shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pitāputrayor dampatyor bhrātṛbhaginyor mātulabhagineyayoḥ śiṣyaācāryayor vā parasparam apatitaṃ tyajataḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When between father and son, husband and wife brother and sister, maternal uncle and nephew or teacher and student, one abandons the other while neither of them is an apostate;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sārthaābhiprayātaṃ grāmamadhye vā tyajataḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and when a person abandons in the centre of a village another person whom he brought there for his own help, the first amercement shall be levied

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāntāre madhyamaḥ, tannimittaṃ bhreṣayata uttamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person abandons his companion in the midst of a forest, he shall be punished with the middlemost amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sahaprasthāyiṣv anyeṣv ardhadaṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whenever persons who have started together on some journey abandon one another as above, half of the above fine shall be levied

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: puruṣam abandhanīyaṃ badhnato bandhayato bandhaṃ vā mokṣayato, bālam aprāptavyavahāraṃ badhnato bandhayato vā sahasraṃ daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person keeps or causes to keep another person in illegal confinement, releases a prisoner from prison, keeps or Kautilyas Arthashastra causes another to keep a minor in confinement, he shall be punished with a fine of 000 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: puruṣaaparādhaviśeṣeṇa daṇḍaviśeṣaḥ kāryaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The rates of fines shall vary in accordance with the rank of persons concerned and the gravity of the crimes

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tīrthakaras tapasvī vyādhitaḥ kṣutpipāsāadhvaklāntas tirojanapado daṇḍakhedī niṣkiṃcanaś caanugrāhyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such persons as a pilgrim, an ascetic engaged in penance, a diseased person, any one suffering from hunger, thirst, or fatigue from journey, a villager from country parts, any one that has suffered much from punishment and a moneyless pauper shall be shown mercy

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: devabrāhmaṇatapasvistrībālavṛddhavyādhitānām anāthānām anabhisaratāṃ dharmasthāḥ kāryāṇi kuryuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such transactions as pertain to gods, Bráhmans, ascetics, women, minors, aged persons, diseased persons and helpless creatures shall, though not be complained of, be settled by the judges themselves;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na ca deśakālabhogacchalenaatihareyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and in such transactions as the above, excuses due to time, place, or possession shall not be pleaded

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūjyā vidyābuddhipauruṣaabhijanakarmaatiśayataś ca puruṣāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such persons as are noted for their learning, intelligence, bravery, high birth, or magnificent works shall be honoured

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evaṃ kāryāṇi dharmasthāḥ kuryur acchaladarśinaḥ /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: With this, ends the third Book Concerning Law of the Arthasástra of Kautilya] From Kautilya Arthashastra

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samāḥ sarveṣu bhāveṣu viśvāsyā lokasampriyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Translated by R Shamashastry Bangalore Government Press, ,

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pradeṣṭāras trayas trayoamātyāḥ kaṇṭakaśodhanaṃ kuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THREE Commissioners pradeshtárah or three ministers shall deal with measures to suppress disturbance to peace kantakasodhanam kuryuh

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: arthyapratīkārāḥ kāruśāsitāraḥ saṃnikṣeptāraḥ svavittakāravaḥ śreṇīpramāṇā nikṣepaṃ gṛhṇīyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who can be expected to relieve misery, who can give instructions to artisans, who can be trusted with deposits, who can plan artistic work after their own design, and who can be relied upon by guilds of artisans, may receive the deposits of the guilds

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vipattau śreṇī nikṣepaṃ bhajeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The guilds srení shall receive their deposits back in time of distress

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nirdiṣṭadeśakālakāryaṃ ca karma kuryuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: with their agreement as to time, place, and form of work, fulfill their engagements

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anirdiṣṭadeśakālaṃ kāryaapadeśam // kālaatipātane pādahīnaṃ vetanaṃ taddviguṇaś ca daṇḍaḥ // anyatra bhreṣaupanipātābhyāṃ naṣṭaṃ vinaṣṭaṃ vāabhyāvaheyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who postpone their engagements under the excuse that no agreement as to time, place and form of work has been entered into shall, except in troubles and calamities, not only forfeit ¼th of their wages, but also be punished with a fine equal to twice the amount of their wages

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāryasyaanyathākaraṇe vetananāśas taddviguṇaś ca daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who carry on their work contrary to orders shall not only forfeit their wages, but also pay a fine equal to twice the amount of their wages

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tantuvāyā daśaekādaśikaṃ sūtraṃ vardhayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Weavers Weavers shall increase the threads supplied to them for weaving cloths in the proportion of 0 to dasaikádasikam

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sūtramūlyaṃ vānavetanaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In weaving linen or silk cloths kshaumakauseyánam, the increase shall be to ½

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣaumakauśeyānām adhyardhaguṇaṃ, pattraūrṇākambaladukūlānāṃ dviguṇam // mānahīne hīnaavahīnaṃ vetanaṃ taddviguṇaś ca daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In weaving fibrous or woollen garments Kautilyas Arthashastra or blankets patronakambáladukúlánám, the increase shall be to In case of loss in length, the value of the loss shall be deducted from the wages and a fine equal to twice the loss shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tulāhīne hīnacaturguṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Loss in weight tuláhíne shall be punished with a fine equal to four times the loss

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sūtraparivartane mūlyadviguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Substitution of other kind of yarn, shall be punished with a fine equal to twice the value of the original

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena dvipaṭavānaṃ vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rules shall apply to the weaving of broad cloths dvipatavánam

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ūrṇātulāyāḥ pañcapaliko vihananacchedo romacchedaś ca // rajakāḥ kāṣṭhaphalakaślakṣṇaśilāsu vastrāṇi nenijyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The loss in weight in woollen threads due to threshing or falling of hair is palas Washermen Washermen shall wash clothes either on wooden planks or on stones of smooth surface

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyatra nenijato vastraupaghātaṃ ṣaṭpaṇaṃ ca daṇḍaṃ dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Washing elsewhere shall not only be punished with a fine of panas, but also be subject for the payment of a compensation equal to the damage

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mudgaraaṅkād anyad vāsaḥ paridadhānās tripaṇaṃ daṇḍaṃ dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Washermen wearing clothes other than such as are stamped with the mark of a cudgel shall be fined three panas For selling, mortgaging, or letting out for hire the clothes of others, a fine of panas shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paravastravikrayaavakrayaādhāneṣu ca dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In case of substitution of other clothes, they shall not only be punished with a fine equal to twice the value of the clothes, but also be made to restore the true ones

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parivartane mūlyadviguṇo vastradānaṃ ca // mukulaavadātaṃ śilāpaṭṭaśuddhaṃ dhautasūtravarṇaṃ pramṛṣṭaśvetaṃ caekarātrauttaraṃ dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For keeping for more than a night clothes which are to be made as white as a jasmin flower, or which are to attain the natural colour of their threads on washing on the surface of stones, or which are to be made whiter merely by removing their dirt by Kautilyas Arthashastra washing, proportional fines shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṣaḍrātrikaṃ nīlaṃ, puṣpalākṣāmañjiṣṭhāraktaṃ guruparikarma yatnaupacāryaṃ jātyaṃ vāsaḥ saptarātrikam // tataḥ paraṃ vetanahāniṃ prāpnuyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For keeping for more than nights such clothes as are to be given thin colouring, for more than six nights such as are to be made blue, for more than nights such as are to be made either as white as flowers or as beautiful and shiny as lac, saffron, or blood and such clothes as require much skill and care in making brilliant, wages shall be forfeited

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śraddheyā rāgavivādeṣu vetanaṃ kuśalāḥ kalpayeyuḥ // parārdhyānāṃ paṇo vetanaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Trustworthy persons shall be judges in disputes regarding colour and experts shall determine the necessary wages For washing the best garments, the wages shall be one pana;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: madhyamānām ardhapaṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for those of middle quality, half a pana;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sthūlakānāṃ māṣakadvimāṣakaṃ, dviguṇaṃ raktakānām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and for those of inferior quality ¼th of a pana For rough washing on big stones, the wages shall be ⅛th of a pana

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prathamanejane caturbhāgaḥ kṣayaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: [In the first wash of redcoloured clothes, there is a loss of ¼th part of the colour;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvitīye pañcabhāgaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: in the second wash, /th part

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tenauttaraṃ vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This explains subsequent losses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rajakais tunnavāyā vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The rules pertaining to washermen are also applicable to weavers

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: suvarṇakārāṇām aśucihastād rūpyaṃ suvarṇam anākhyāya sarūpaṃ krīṇatāṃ dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Goldsmiths who, without giving information to the government, purchase from unclean hands silver or golden articles without changing the form of the articles shall be fined panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: virūpaṃ caturviṃśatipaṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if they do the same changing the form of the articles ie, melting, they shall be fined panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: corahastād aṣṭacatvāriṃśatpaṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if they purchase the same from the hands of a thief, they shall be fined panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pracchannavirūpamūlyahīnakrayeṣu steyadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if they purchase an article for less than its value after melting it in secret, they shall be liable to the punishment for theft;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛtabhāṇḍaupadhau ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: likewise for deception with manufactured articles

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: suvarṇān māṣakam apaharato dviśato daṇḍaḥ, rūpyadharaṇān māṣakam apaharato dvādaśapaṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a goldsmith steals from a suvarna gold equal to the weight of a másha /th of a suvarna, he shall be punished 00 panas; when he steals from a silver dharana silver Kautilyas Arthashastra equal to the value of a másha, he shall be fined panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tenauttaraṃ vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This explains the proportional enhancement of punishments

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: varṇautkarṣam apasāraṇaṃ yogaṃ vā sādhayataḥ pañcaśato daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a goldsmith removes the whole amount of the gold karsha from a suvarna by apasárana method or by any other deceiptful combination yoga, he shall be punished with a fine of 00 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tayor apacaraṇe rāgasyaapahāraṃ vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In case of contaminating them gold and silver in any way, the offence shall be regarded as loss of their intrinsic colour

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: māṣako vetanaṃ rūpyadharaṇasya,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: One másha shall be the fee for the manufacture of a silver dharana;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: suvarṇasyaaṣṭabhāgaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for the manufacture of a suvarna, ⅛th of the same;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śikṣāviśeṣeṇa dviguṇo vetanavṛddhiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: or fees may be increased to twice the above according to the skill of the manufacturer

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tenauttaraṃ vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This explains the proportional increase of fees

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tāmravṛttakaṃsavaikṛntakaārakūṭakānāṃ pañcakaṃ śataṃ vetanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Fees for the manufacture of articles from copper, brass, vaikrinataka, and árakúta shall be five percent In the manufacture of articles from copper ?, /0th of the copper will be lost

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: palahīne hīnadviguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For the loss of a pala in weight, a fine of twice the loss shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tenauttaraṃ vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This explains the proportional increase of punishments

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sīsatrapupiṇḍo viṃśatibhāgakṣayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the manufacture of articles from lead and tin, /0th of the mass will be lost

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kākaṇī caasya palavetanam // kālaāyasapiṇḍaḥ pañcabhāgakṣayaḥ // kākaṇīdvayaṃ caasya palavetanam //
