Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: One kákani shall be the fee for manufacturing an article of a pala in weight of the above In the manufacture of articles from iron, /th of the mass will be lost; two kákanis shall be the fee for manufacturing an article of a pala in weight from iron

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tenauttaraṃ vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This explains the proportional increase of fees

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rūpadarśakasya sthitāṃ paṇayātrām akopyāṃ kopayataḥ kopyām akopayato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When the examiner of coins declares an unacceptable current coin to be worthy of being entered into the treasury or rejects an acceptable current coin, he shall be fined panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vyājīpariśuddhau paṇayātrā // paṇān māṣakam upajīvato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When the examiner of coins misappropriates a másha from a current coin of a pana, the tax, Vyájí of five percent on the coin having been duly paid, he shall be fined panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tenauttaraṃ vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This explains the proportional increase of fines

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kūṭarūpaṃ kārayataḥ pratigṛhṇato niryāpayato vā sahasraṃ daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person causes a counterfeit coin to be manufactured, or accepts it, or exchanges it, he shall be fined ,000 panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kośe prakṣipato vadhaḥ // carakapāṃsudhāvakāḥ sāratribhāgaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: he who enters a counterfeit coin into the treasury shall be put to death] Kautilyas Arthashastra Scavengers Of whatever precious things sweepers come across while sweeping, onethird shall be taken by them and twothirds by the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvau rājā ratnaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But precious stones shall be wholly surrendered to the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ratnaapahāra uttamo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Seizure of precious stones shall be punished with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: khaniratnanidhinivedaneṣu ṣaṣṭham aṃśaṃ nivettā labheta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A discoverer of mines, precious stones, or treasure troves shall, on supplying the information to the king, receive /th of it as his share;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvādaśam aṃśaṃ bhṛtakaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but if the discoverer happens to be a peon bhritaka, his share shall be only /th of it

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śatasahasrād ūrdhvaṃ rājagāmī nidhiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Treasure troves valued beyond 00,000 shall wholly be taken by the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ūne ṣaṣṭham aṃśaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But if they are of less value, the discover shall receive /th of it as his share

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paurvapauruṣikaṃ nidhiṃ jānapadaḥ śuciḥ svakaraṇena samagraṃ labheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such treasure troves as a man of pure and honest life can prove to be his ancestral property shall wholly be taken by the man himself

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svakaraṇaabhāve pañcaśato daṇḍaḥ, pracchannaādāne sahasram //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Taking possession of a treasure trove without establishing such claim shall be punished with a fine of 00 panas Taking possession of the same in secret shall be punished with a fine of ,000 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhiṣajaḥ prāṇaābādhikam anākhyāyaupakramamāṇasya vipattau pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Physicians undertaking medical treatment without intimating to the government the dangerous nature of the disease shall, if the patient dies, be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmaaparādhena vipattau madhyamaḥ // marmavadhavaiguṇyakaraṇe daṇḍapāruṣyaṃ vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the death of a patient under treatment is due to carelessness in the treatment, the physician shall be punished with the middlemost amercement Growth of disease due to negligence or indifference karmavadha of a physician shall be regarded as assault or violence

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kuśīlavā varṣārātram ekasthā vaseyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Bands of musicians kúsílavah shall, during the rainy season, stay in a particular place

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāmadānam atimātram ekasyaativādaṃ ca varjayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They shall strictly avoid giving too much indulgence or causing too much loss atipátam to any one

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaatikrame dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Violation of the above rule shall be punished with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāmaṃ deśajātigotracaraṇamaithunaavahāsena narmayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They may hold their performances to their liking in accordance with the procedure of their country, caste, family, profession, or copulation

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kuśīlavaiś cāraṇā bhikṣukāś ca vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rules shall apply to dancers, dumbplayers and other mendicants

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣām ayaḥśūlena yāvataḥ paṇān abhivadeyus tāvantaḥ śiphāprahārā daṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For offences, mendicants shall receive as many lashes with an iron rod as the number of panas imposed on them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śeṣāṇāṃ karmaṇāṃ niṣpattivetanaṃ śilpināṃ kalpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Wages for the works of other kinds of artisans shall be similarly determined

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evaṃ corān acoraākhyān vaṇikkārukuśīlavān / bhikṣukān kuhakāṃś caanyān vārayed deśapīḍanāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus traders, artisans, musicians, beggers, buffoons and other idlers who are thieves in effect though not in name shall be restrained from oppression on the country [Thus ends Chapter , Protection of artisans in Book , The Removal of Thorns of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃsthāadhyakṣaḥ paṇyasaṃsthāyāṃ purāṇabhāṇḍānāṃ svakaraṇaviśuddhānām ādhānaṃ vikrayaṃ vā sthāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE Superintendent of Commerce shall allow the sale or mortgage of any old commodities purána bhándanám only when Kautilyas Arthashastra the seller or mortgagor of such articles proves his ownership of the same

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tulāmānabhāṇḍāni caavekṣeta pautavaapacārāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: With a view to prevent deception, he shall also supervise weights and measures

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parimāṇīdroṇayor ardhapalahīnaatiriktam adoṣaḥ // palahīnaatirikte dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Difference of half a pala in such measures as are called parimání and drona is no offence But difference of a pala in them shall be punished with a fine of panas Fines for greater differences shall be proportionally increased

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tulāyāḥ karṣahīnaatiriktam adoṣaḥ // dvikarṣahīnaatirikte ṣaṭpaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Difference of a karsha in the balance called tulá is no offence Difference of two karshas shall be punished with a fine of panas Fines for greater differences shall be proportionally increased

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: āḍhakasyaardhakarṣahīnaatiriktam adoṣaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Difference of half a karsha in the measure called ádhaka is no offence;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karṣahīnaatirikte tripaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but difference of a karsha shall be punished with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tulāmānaviśeṣāṇām atoanyeṣām anumānaṃ kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Fines for differences in weight in other kinds of balances shall be inferred on the basis of the above rule

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tulāmānābhyām atiriktābhyāṃ krītvā hīnābhyāṃ vikrīṇānasya ta eva dviguṇā daṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a merchant purchases by a false balance a greater quantity of a commodity and sells under the same nominal weight a less quantity by the same or another false balance, he shall be punished with double the above fines

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gaṇyapaṇyeṣv aṣṭabhāgaṃ paṇyamūlyeṣv apaharataḥ ṣaṇṇavatir daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Deception on the part of a seller to the extent of ⅛th part of the articles valued at a pana and sold by number shall be punished with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāṣṭhalohamaṇimayaṃ rajjucarmamṛṇmayaṃ sūtravalkaromamayaṃ vā jātyam ity ajātyaṃ vikrayaādhānaṃ nayato mūlyaaṣṭaguṇo
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The sale or mortgage of articles such as timber, iron, brilliant Kautilyas Arthashastra stones, ropes, skins, earthenware, threads, fibrous garments, and woollen clothes as superior though they are really inferior shall be punished with a fine of times the value of the articles thus sold

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / sārabhāṇḍam ity asārabhāṇḍaṃ tajjātam ity atajjātaṃ rādhāyuktam ity upadhiyuktaṃ samudgaparivartimaṃ vā vikrayaādhānaṃ nayato hīnamūlyaṃ catuṣpañcāśatpaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a trader sells or mortgages inferior as superior commodities, articles of some other locality, as the produce of a particular locality, adulterated things, or deceitful mixtures, or when he dexterously substitutes other articles for those just sold samutparivartimam, he shall not only be punished with a fine of panas but also be compelled to make good the loss

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvipaṇamūlyaṃ dviśataḥ // tenaarghavṛddhau daṇḍavṛddhir vyākhyātā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: By making the fine two panas for the loss of the value of a pana, and 00 panas for that of 00, fines can be determined for any of such false sales

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāruśilpināṃ karmaguṇaapakarṣam ājīvaṃ vikrayakrayaupaghātaṃ vā sambhūya samutthāpayatāṃ sahasraṃ daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who conspire to lower the quality of the works of artisans, to hinder their income, or to obstruct their sale or purchase shall be fined thousand panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaidehakānāṃ vā sambhūya paṇyam avarundhatām anargheṇa vikrīṇatāṃ vā sahasraṃ daṇḍaḥ // tulāmānaantaram arghavarṇaantaraṃ vā dharakasya māyakasya vā paṇamūlyād aṣṭabhāgaṃ hastadoṣeṇaācarato dviśato daṇḍaḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Merchants who conspire either to prevent the sale of merchandise or to sell or purchase commodities at higher prices shall be fined ,000 panas Middlemen who cause to a merchant or a purchaser the loss of ⅛th of a pana by substituting with tricks of hand false weights or measures or other kinds of inferior articles shall be punished with a fine of 00 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena dviśatauttarā daṇḍavṛddhir vyākhyātā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Fines for, greater losses shall be proportionally increased commencing from 00 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dhānyasnehakṣāralavaṇagandhabhaiṣajyadravyāṇāṃ samavarṇaupadhāne dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Adulteration of grains, oils, alkalis, salts, scents, and medicinal articles with similar articles of no quality shall be punished with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yanniṣṛṣṭam upajīveyus tad eṣāṃ divasasaṃjātaṃ saṃkhyāya vaṇik sthāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra It is the duty of the trader to calculate the daily earnings of middlemen and to fix that amount on which they are authorised to live;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kretṛvikretror antarapatitam ādāyād anyad bhavati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for whatever income falls between sellers and purchasers ie, brokerage is different from profit

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena dhānyapaṇyanicayāṃś caanujñātāḥ kuryuḥ // anyathānicitam eṣāṃ paṇyaadhyakṣo gṛhṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence authorised persons alone shall collect grains and other merchandise Collection of such things without permission shall be confiscated by the Superintendent of Commerce

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena dhānyapaṇyavikraye vyavaharetaanugraheṇa prajānām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence shall merchants be favourably disposed towards the people in selling grains and other commodities

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anujñātakrayād upari caeṣāṃ svadeśīyānāṃ paṇyānāṃ pañcakaṃ śatam ājīvaṃ sthāpayet, paradeśīyānāṃ daśakam // tataḥ param arghaṃ vardhayatāṃ kraye vikraye vā bhāvayatāṃ paṇaśate pañcapaṇād dviśato daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The Superintendent of Commerce shall fix a profit of five per cent over and above the fixed price of local commodities, and ten per cent on foreign produce Merchants who enchance the price or realise profit even to the extent of half a pana more than the above in the sale or purchase of commodities shall be punished with a fine of from five panas in case of realising 00 panas up to 00 panas Fines for greater enhancement shall be proportionally increased

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sambhūyakraye caeṣām avikrīte naanyaṃ sambhūyakrayaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In case of failure to sell collected merchandise wholesale at a fixed rate, the rate shall be altered

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paṇyaupaghāte caeṣām anugrahaṃ kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In case of obstruction to traffic, the Superintendent shall show necessary concessions

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paṇyabāhulyāt paṇyaadhyakṣaḥ sarvapaṇyāny ekamukhāni vikrīṇīta // teṣv avikrīteṣu naanye vikrīṇīran //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whenever there is an excessive supply of merchandise, the Superintendent shall centralise its sale and prohibit the sale of similar merchandise elsewhere before the centralised supply is disposed of

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tāni divasavetanena vikrīṇīrann anugraheṇa prajānām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Favourably disposed towards the people, shall merchants sell this centralised supply for daily wages

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: deśakālaantaritānāṃ tu paṇyānāṃ prakṣepaṃ paṇyaniṣpattiṃ śulkaṃ vṛddhim avakrayam / vyayān anyāṃś ca saṃkhyāya sthāpayed argham arghavit //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra The Superintendent shall, on consideration of the outlay, the quantity manufactured, the amount of toll, the interest on outlay, hire, and other kinds of accessory expenses, fix the price of such merchandise with due regard to its having been manufactured long ago or imported from a distant country desakálántaritánám panyánám [Thus ends Chapter , Protection of merchants in Book The Removal of Thorns of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daivāny aṣṭau mahābhayāni agnir udakaṃ vyādhir durbhikṣaṃ mūṣikā vyālāḥ sarpā rakṣāṃsiiti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THERE are eight kinds of providential visitations They are fire, floods, pestilential diseases, famine, rats, tigers vyáláh, serpents, and demons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tebhyo janapadaṃ rakṣet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: From these shall the king protect his kingdom

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: grīṣme bahiradhiśrayaṇaṃ grāmāḥ kuryuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Fire During the summer, villages shall carry on cooking operations outside

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daśamūlīsaṃgraheṇaadhiṣṭhitā vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or they shall provide themselves with the ten remedial instruments dasamúlí

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nāgarikapraṇidhāv agnipratiṣedho vyākhyātaḥ, niśāntapraṇidhau rājaparigrahe ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Precautionary measures against fire have been dealt with in connection with the description not only of the duties of superintendents of villages, but also of the kings, harem and retinue

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: balihomasvastivācanaiḥ parvasu caagnipūjāḥ kārayet // varṣārātram ānūpagrāmāḥ pūravelām utsṛjya vaseyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Not only on ordinary days, but also on fullmoon days shall offerings, oblations, and prayers be made to fire Kautilyas Arthashastra Floods Villagers living on the banks of rivers shall, during the rainy reason, remove themselves to upcountries

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāṣṭhaveṇunāvaś caupagṛhṇīyuḥ // uhyamānam alābudṛtiplavagaṇḍikāveṇikābhis tārayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They shall provide themselves with wooden planks, bamboos, and boats They shall, by means of bottlegourds, canoes, trunks of trees, or boats rescue persons that are being carried off by floods

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anabhisaratāṃ dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ, anyatra plavahīnebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Persons neglecting rescue with the exception of those who have no boats, etc, shall be fined panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parvasu ca nadīpūjāḥ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On new and fullmoon days shall rivers be worshipped

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: māyāyogavido vedavido vā varṣam abhicareyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Experts in sacred magic and mysticism máyáyogavidah, and persons learned in the Vedas, shall perform, incantations against rain

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: varṣaavagrahe śacīnāthagaṅgāparvatamahākacchapūjāḥ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: During drought shall Indra sachínátha, the Ganges, mountains, and Mahákachchha be worshipped

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vyādhibhayam aupaniṣadikaiḥ pratīkāraiḥ pratikuryuḥ, auṣadhaiś cikitsakāḥ śāntiprāyaścittair vā siddhatāpasāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Pestilences Such remedial measures as will be treated of in the th book shall be taken against pestilences Physicians with their medicines, and ascetics and prophets with their auspicious and purificatory ceremonials shall also overcome pestilences

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena marako vyākhyātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same remedial measures shall be taken against epidemics maraka killer

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tīrthaabhiṣecanaṃ mahākacchavardhanaṃ gavāṃ śmaśānaavadohanaṃ kabandhadahanaṃ devarātriṃ ca kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Besides the above measures, oblations to gods, the ceremonial called, Mahákachchhavardhana, milking the cows on cremation or burial grounds, burning the trunk of a corpse, and spending nights in devotion to gods shall also be observed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paśuvyādhimarake sthānaarthanīrājanaṃ svadaivatapūjanaṃ ca kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: With regard to cattle diseases pasuvyádhimarake, not only the ceremony of waving lights in cowsheds nirájanam shall be half done, but also the worship of familygods be carried out

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: durbhikṣe rājā bījabhaktaupagrahaṃ kṛtvāanugrahaṃ kuryāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Famines Kautilyas Arthashastra During famine, the king shall show favour to his people by providing them with seeds and provision bíjabhaktopagráham

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: durgasetukarma vā bhaktaanugraheṇa,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He may either do such works as are usually resorted to in calamities;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhaktasaṃvibhāgaṃ vā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: or seek for help from his friends among kings

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: deśanikṣepaṃ vā // mitrāṇi vā vyapāśrayeta, karśanaṃ vamanaṃ vā kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or the policy of thinning the rich by exacting excessive revenue karsanam, or causing them to vomit their accumulated wealth vamanam may be resorted to

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: niṣpannasasyam anyaviṣayaṃ vā sajanapado yāyāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or the king with his subjects may emigrate to another kingdom with abundant harvest

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samudrasarastaṭākāni vā saṃśrayeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or he may remove himself with his subjects to seashores or to the banks of rivers or lakes

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dhānyaśākamūlaphalaāvāpān vā setuṣu kurvīta, mṛgapaśupakṣivyālamatsyaārambhān vā // mūṣikabhaye mārjāranakulautsargaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He may cause his subjects to grow grains, vegetables, roots, and fruits wherever water is available He may, by hunting and fishing on a large scale, provide the people with wild beasts, birds, elephants, tigers or fish Rats To ward off the danger from rats, cats and mongooses may be let loose

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ grahaṇahiṃsāyāṃ dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ, śunām anigrahe caanyatraaraṇyacarebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Destruction of rats that have been caught shall be punished with a fine of panas The same punishment shall be meted out to those who, with the exception of wild tribes, do not hold their dogs in check

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: snuhikṣīraliptāni dhānyāni visṛjed, upaniṣadyogayuktāni vā // mūṣikakaraṃ vā prayuñjīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: With a view to destroy rats, grains mixed with the milk of the milkhedge plants snuhi Euphorbia Antiquorum, or grains mixed with such ingredients as are treated of in the th book may be left on the ground

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śāntiṃ vā siddhatāpasāḥ kuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Asceties and prophets may perform auspicious ceremonials

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parvasu ca mūṣikapūjāḥ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On new and fullmoon days rats may be worshipped

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena śalabhapakṣikrimibhayapratīkārā vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Similar measures may also be taken against the danger from locusts, birds and insects

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: lubdhakāḥ śvagaṇino vā kūṭapañjaraavapātaiś careyuḥ // āvaraṇinaḥ śastrapāṇayo vyālān abhihanyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Snakes [When there is fear from snakes, experts in applying remedies against snake poison shall resort to incantations and medicines; or they may destroy snakes in a body; or those who are learned in the Atharvaveda may perform auspicious rites

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anabhisartur dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On new and full moon days, snakes may be worshipped

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa eva lābho vyālaghātinaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This explains the measures to be taken against the dangers from wateranimals

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parvasu ca parvatapūjāḥ kārayet // tena mṛgapaśupakṣisaṃghagrāhapratīkārā vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Tigers In order to destroy tigers, either the carcasses of cattle mixed with the juice of madana plant, or the carcasses of calves filled with the juice of madana and kodrava plants may be thrown in suitable places

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarpabhaye mantrair oṣadhibhiś ca jāṅgulīvidaś careyuḥ // sambhūya vāapi sarpān hanyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or hunters or keepers of hounds may catch tigers by entrapping them in nets Or persons under the protection of armour may kill tigers with arms

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parvasu ca nāgapūjāḥ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On new and full moon days mountains may be worshipped

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tenaudakaprāṇibhayapratīkārā vyākhyātāḥ // rakṣobhaye rakṣoghnāny atharvavedavido māyāyogavido vā karmāṇi kuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Similar measures may be taken against the inroad of beasts, birds, or crocodiles Demons Persons acquainted with the rituals of the Atharvaveda, and Kautilyas Arthashastra experts in sacred magic and mysticism shall perform such ceremonials as ward off the danger from demons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parvasu ca vitardicchatraullopikāhastapatākācchāgaupahāraiś caityapūjāḥ kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On fullmoon days the worship of Chaityas may be performed by placing on a verandah offerings such as an umbrella, the picture of an arm, a flag, and some goats flesh

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: caruṃ vaś carāmaḥ ity evaṃ sarvabhayeṣv ahorātraṃ careyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In all kinds of dangers from demons, the incantation „we offer thee cooked rice‟ shall be performed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvatra caupahatān pitāivaanugṛhṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The king shall always protect the afflicted among his people as a father his sons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: māyāyogavidas tasmād viṣaye siddhatāpasāḥ / vaseyuḥ pūjitā rājñā daivaāpatpratikāriṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such ascetics as are experts in magical arts, and being endowed with supernatural powers, can ward off providential visitations, shall, therefore, be honoured by the king and made to live in his kingdom

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samāhartṛpraṇidhau janapadarakṣaṇam uktam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: [Thus ends Chapter , Remedies against national Calamities in Book , The Removal of Thorns, of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasya kaṇṭakaśodhanaṃ vakṣyāmaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: We are now going to treat of in detail such measures as can remove the disturbing elements of peace

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / samāhartā janapade siddhatāpasapravrajitacakracaracāraṇakuhakapracchandakakārtāntikanaimittikamauhūrtikacikitsakaunmattamūkabadhirajaḍaandhavaidehakakāruśilpikuśīlavaveśaśauṇḍikaāpūpikapākvamāṃsikaaudanikavyañjanān
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra The Collectorgeneral shall employ spies disguised as persons endowed with supernatural power, persons engaged in penance, ascetics, world trotters chakrachara, bards, buffoons, mystics prachchhandaka, astrologers, prophets foretelling the future, persons capable of reading good or bad time, physicians, lunatics, the dumb, the deaf, idiots, the blind, traders, painters, carpenters, musicians, dancers, vintners, and manufacturers of cakes, flesh and cooked rice, and send them abroad into the country for espionage

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: te grāmāṇām adhyakṣāṇāṃ ca śaucaāśaucaṃ vidyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The spies shall ascertain the fair or foul dealings of villagers, or of the Superintendents of villages and report the same

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaṃ caatra gūḍhaājīvinaṃ śaṅketa taṃ sattriṇāapasarpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If any person is found to be of foul life gúdhajívi, a spy who is acquainted with similar avocation shall be let loose upon him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dharmasthaṃ viśvāsaupagataṃ sattrī brūyāt asau me bandhur abhiyuktaḥ, tasyaayam anarthaḥ pratikriyatām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On acquiring friendship with the suspected person who may be either a judge or a commissioner, the spy may request him that the misfortune in which a friend of the spy is involved may be warded off and that a certain amount of money may be accepted

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa cet tathā kuryād upadāgrāhaka iti pravāsyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the judge accedes to the request, he shall be proclaimed as the receiver of bribes and banished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena pradeṣṭāro vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same rule shall also apply to commissioners

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: grāmakūṭam adhyakṣaṃ vā sattrī brūyāt asau jālmaḥ prabhūtadravyaḥ, tasyaayam anarthaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A spy may tell the congregation of villages grámakútam or its superintendent that a wealthy man of wicked character is involved in some trouble and that this opportunity may be availed of to squeeze money from him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tenaenam āhārayasva iti // sa cet tathā kuryād utkocaka iti pravāsyeta // kṛtakaabhiyukto vā kūṭasākṣiṇoabhijñātaanarthavaipulyenaārabheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If either the one or the other complies with the spy, banishment shall be ordered under the proclamation of „extortion‟ Under the pretence of having been charged with criminal offence, a spy may, with promise of large sums money, begin to deal with false witnesses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: te cet tathā kuryuḥ kūṭasākṣiṇa iti pravāsyeran //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If they agree with him, they shall be proclaimed as false witnesses and banished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena kūṭaśrāvaṇakārakā vyākhyātāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra 00 Manufacturers of counterfeit coins shall also be treated similarly

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaṃ vā mantrayogamūlakarmabhiḥ śmāśānikair vā saṃvadanakarakaṃ manyeta taṃ sattrī brūyāt amuṣya bhāryāṃ snuṣāṃ duhitaraṃ vā kāmaye, sā māṃ pratikāmayatām,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever is believed to secure for others the love of women by means of magical charms, drugs or ceremonials performed on cremation grounds may be approached by a spy with the request that the wife, daughter, or daughterinlaw of some one, whom the spy pretends to love may be made to return the love and that a certain amount of money may be accepted

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa cet tathā kuryāt saṃvadanakāraka iti pravāsyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If he consents to it, he shall be proclaimed as one engaged in witchcraft samvadanakáraka and banished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena kṛtyaabhicāraśīlau vyākhyātau //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Similar steps may be taken against persons engaged in such witchcraft as is hurtful to others

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaṃ vā rasasya kartāraṃ kretāraṃ vikretāraṃ bhaiṣajyaāhāravyavahāriṇaṃ vā rasadaṃ manyeta taṃ sattrī brūyāt asau me śatruḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever is suspected of administering poison rasa mercury to others by reason of his talking of it or selling or purchasing mercury, or using it in preparing medicines, may be approached with the tale that a certain enemy of the spy may be killed and that a certain amount of money may be received as reward

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa cet tathā kuryād rasada iti pravāsyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If he does so, he shall be proclaimed as a poisoner rasada, and banished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena madanayogavyavahārī vyākhyātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Similar steps may be taken against those who deal with medicines prepared from madana plant

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / yaṃ vā nānālohakṣārāṇām aṅgārabhasmaasaṃdaṃśamuṣṭikaadhikaraṇībimbaṭaṅkamūṣāṇām abhīkṣṇakretāraṃ maṣībhasmadhūmadigdhahastavastraliṅgaṃ karmāraupakaraṇasaṃsargaṃ kūṭarūpakārakaṃ manyeta taṃ sattrī śiṣyatvena saṃvyavahāreṇa caanupraviśya prajñāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever is suspected of manufacturing counterfeit coins in that he often purchases various kinds of metals, alkalis, charcoal, bellows, pincers, crucibles, stove, and hammers, has his hands and cloths dirty with ashes and smoke, or possesses such other accessory instruments as are necessary for this illegal manufacture, may be requested by a spy to take the latter as an apprentice, and being gradually betrayed by the spy, such person, on proclamation of his guilt as the manufacturer of false coins, shall be banished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena rāgasyaapahartā kūṭasuvarṇavyavahārī ca vyākhyātaḥ // ārabdhāras tu hiṃsāyāṃ gūḍhaājīvās trayodaśa /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 Similar steps may be taken against those who lower the quality of gold by mixing it with an alloy, or deal with counterfeit gold suvarna coin ? There are thirteen kinds of criminals who, secretly attempting to live by foul means, destroy the peace of the country

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pravāsyā niṣkrayaarthaṃ vā dadyur doṣaviśeṣataḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They shall either be banished or made to pay an adequate compensation according as their guilt is light or serious

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sattriprayogād ūrdhvaṃ siddhavyañjanā māṇavān māṇavavidyābhiḥ pralobhayeyuḥ, prasvāpanaantardhānadvāraapohamantreṇa pratirodhakān,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: ON availing themselves of the opening made by ordinary spies sent in advance, special spies pretending to be endowed with supernatural powers may, under the pretence of knowing such incantations as cause rapid speed in running away, or render persons invisible, or cause hard fastened doors to open, induce highway robbers to robbery;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ kṛtautsāhānāṃ mahāntaṃ saṃgham ādāya rātrāv anyaṃ grāmam uddiśyaanyaṃ grāmaṃ kṛtakastrīpuruṣaṃ gatvā brūyuḥ ihaeva vidyāprabhāvo dṛśyatāṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On taking these enthusiasts thus induced to a village, where persons under the guise of women and men are previously stationed and which is different from the one intended to be reached, the youths may be told that it is difficult to reach in time the village aimed at and that the power of incantation may be seen Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 then and there alone

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tato dvāraapohamantreṇa dvārāṇy apohya praviśyatām iti brūyuḥ // antardhānamantreṇa jāgratām ārakṣiṇāṃ madhyena māṇavān atikrāmayeyuḥ // prasvāpanamantreṇa prasvāpayitvā rakṣiṇaḥ śayābhir māṇavaiḥ saṃcārayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Having opened the doors seemingly with the power of incantation, the youths may be asked to get in Having, in the midst of wakeful watchmen under concert, rendered the youths invisible with incantation, they may be asked to go into the interior Having caused the watchmen seemingly sleepy, the youths may, as ordered, move the beds of the watchmen with no hesitation

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃvadanamantreṇa bhāryāvyañjanāḥ pareṣāṃ māṇavaiḥ sammodayeyuḥ // upalabdhavidyāprabhāvāṇāṃ puraścaraṇāādy ādiśeyur abhijñānaartham // kṛtalakṣaṇadravyeṣu vā veśmasu karma kārayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Persons under the guise of others, wives may, seemingly under the influence of incantation, please the youths Soon after the youths have actually experienced the powers of incantation, they may be taught the recitation and other accessory procedure of that art They may afterwards be asked to test the power of their new learning in plundering such houses as contain articles or money with marks of identification, and simultaneously caught hold of in the very act

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛtalakṣaṇadravyakrayavikrayaādhāneṣu yogasurāmattān vā grāhayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They may either be arrested while selling, purchasing, or mortgaging articles with marks of identification, or caught hold of while under intoxication brought about by medicinal drinks yogasurámatta

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gṛhītān pūrvaapadānasahāyān anuyuñjīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: From these youths thus arrested may be gathered information regarding the past life of them and of their accomplices

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: purāṇacoravyañjanā vā corān anupraviṣṭās tathāeva karma kārayeyur grāhayeyuś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Spies under the disguise of old and notorious thieves may similarly associate with robbers and, instituting similar measures, cause the latter to be arrested

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gṛhītān samāhartā paurajānapadānāṃ darśayet coragrahaṇīṃ vidyām adhīte rājā, tasyaupadeśād ime corā gṛhītāḥ, bhūyaś ca grahīṣyāmi, vārayitavyo vaḥ svajanaḥ pāpaācārah iti // yaṃ caatraapasarpaupadeśena śamyāpratodaādīnām apahartāraṃ jānīyāt tam eṣāṃ pratyādiśet eṣa rājñaḥ prabhāvaḥ iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The Collectorgeneral shall exhibit these arrested robbers and announce to the public that their arrest is due to the instructions obtained from the king who has learnt the divine art of catching robbers „ shall similarly catch hold of other robbers again and again, and you, people, ought to prevent any one of your own kinsmen from his wicked deeds‟ Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 Whoever is known, through the information of spies, to have been a robber of yoking ropes, whips and other agricultural implements may be arrested and told that his arrest is due to the omniscient power of the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: purāṇacoragopālakavyādhaśvagaṇinaś ca vanacoraāṭavikān anupraviṣṭāḥ prabhūtakūṭahiraṇyakupyabhāṇḍeṣu sārthavrajagrāmeṣv
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Spies under the disguise of old and notorious robbers, herdsmen, hunters, or keepers of hounds may mix themselves with criminal tribes living in forests, and conspire with them to attack villages or caravanserais which, according to previous plan, contain plenty of counterfeit gold and other articles

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: enān abhiyojayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: During the tumult, they may be killed by armed men concealed for the purpose

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: abhiyoge gūḍhabalair ghātayeyuḥ, madanarasayuktena vā pathyadanena // gṛhītaloptrabhārān āyatagatapariśrāntān prasvapataḥ prahavaṇeṣu yogasurāmattān vā grāhayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or on their securing plenty of stolen treasure, the robbers may either be made to eat such food as is mixed with the intoxicating juice of madana plant, or caught hold of either while sleeping with fatigue caused by incessant movements or while under intoxication due to the drinking of medicinal beverage on the occasions of religious festivals

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūrvavac ca gṛhītvāenān samāhartā prarūpayet / sarvajñakhyāpanaṃ rājñaḥ kārayan rāṣṭravāsiṣu //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The Collectorgeneral shall exhibit in public these and other arrested criminals and proclaim the omniscient power of the king among the people at large

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: siddhaprayogād ūrdhvaṃ śaṅkārūpakarmaabhigrahaḥ // kṣīṇadāyakuṭumbam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: [Thus ends Chapter , Detection of youths of criminal tendency by ascetic spies, in Book , The Removal Thorns of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: alpanirveśaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who have little or no comfort;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viparītadeśajātigotranāmakarmaapadeśaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who frequently change their residence, caste and the names, not only of themselves, but also of their family gotra;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pracchannavṛttikarmāṇaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who conceal their own avocations and calls;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: māṃsasurābhakṣyabhojanagandhamālyavastravibhūṣaṇeṣu prasaktam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who have betaken themselves to such luxurious modes of life as eating flesh and condiments, drinking liquor, wearing scents, garlands, fine dress, and jewels;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ativyayakartāraṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who have been squandering away their money;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: puṃścalīdyūtaśauṇḍikeṣu prasaktam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who constantly move with profligate women, gamblers, or vintners;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: abhīkṣṇapravāsinam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who frequently leave their residence;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: avijñātasthānagamanam, ekāntaaraṇyaniṣkuṭavikālacāriṇaṃ, pracchanne saāmiṣe vā deśe bahumantrasaṃnipātaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: whose commercial transaction, journey, or destination is difficult to understand; who travel alone in such solitary places as forests and mountainous tracts; who hold secret meetings in lonely places near to, or far from, their residence;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sadyaḥkṣatavraṇānāṃ gūḍhapratīkārakārayitāram, antargṛhanityam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who hurry on to get their fresh wounds or boils cured; who always hide themselves in the interior of their houses;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāntāparaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who are excessively attached to women;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paraparigrahāṇāṃ parastrīdravyaveśmanām abhīkṣṇapraṣṭāraṃ, kutsitakarmaśāstraupakaraṇasaṃsargaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who are always inquisitive to gather information as to the women and property of others; who associate themselves with men of condemnable learning and work;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: virātre channakuḍyacchāyāsaṃcāriṇaṃ, virūpadravyāṇām adeśakālavikretāraṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who loiter in the dark behind walls or under shades; who purchase rare or suspicious articles in suspicious times or places;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hīnakarmajātiṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who are known for their inimical dealings;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vigūhamānarūpaṃ, liṅgenaāliṅginaṃ, liṅginaṃ vā bhinnaācāraṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: whose caste and avocation are very low; who keep false appearances or put on different caste signs;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pūrvakṛtaapadānaṃ, svakarmabhir apadiṣṭaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who change their ancestral customs under false excuses; whose notoriety is already marked;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nāgarikamahāmātradarśane guhamānam apasarantam anucchvāsaupaveśinam āvignaṃ śuṣkabhinnasvaramukhavarṇaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who, though in charge of villages, are terribly afraid of appearing before the prime minister and conceal themselves or go elsewhere; who pant in fear while sitting alone; who show undue agitation or palpitation of heart; whose face is pale and dry while the voice is indistinct and stammering;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śastrahastamanuṣyasampātatrāsinaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who always move in company with armed men; or who keep threatening appearance;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hiṃsrastenanidhinikṣepaapahāraparaprayogagūḍhaājīvinām anyatamaṃ śaṅketa //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: these and other persons may be suspected to be either murderers or robbers or offenders guilty of misappropriation of treasuretrove or deposits or to be any other kind of knaves subsisting by foul means Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 secretly employed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti śaṅkāabhigrahaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus the seizure of criminals on suspicion is dealt with

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rūpaabhigrahas tu naṣṭaapahṛtam avidyamānaṃ tajjātavyavahāriṣu nivedayet // tac cen niveditam āsādya pracchādayeyuḥ sācivyakaradoṣam āpnuyuḥ // / ajānantoasya dravyasyaatisargeṇa mucyeran //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Seizure of stolen articles AS regards the seizure of criminals in the very act Information regarding such articles as are either lost or stolen shall, if the articles are not found out, be supplied to those who trade in similar articles Traders who conceal the articles as to the loss of which they have already received information shall be condemned as abettors If they are found not to be aware of the loss, they may be acquitted on restoring the articles

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na caanivedya saṃsthāadhyakṣasya purāṇabhāṇḍānām ādhānaṃ vikrayaṃ vā kuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: No person shall, without giving information to the superintendent of commerce, mortgage or purchase for himself any old or secondhand article

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tac cen niveditam āsādyeta, rūpaabhigṛhītam āgamaṃ pṛcchet kutas te labdham iti // sa cet brūyāt dāyādyād avāptam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: On receiving information regarding the sale or mortgage of old articles, the Superintendent shall ask the owner how he came by it He may reply it has been inherited; it has been received from a third person;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: amuṣmāl labdhaṃ krītaṃ kāritam ādhipracchannam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: it is purchased by himself; or it has been made to order; or it is a secret pledge;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ayam asya deśaḥ kālaś caupasamprāpteḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: he may definitely state that the time and place when and where it came into being

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaāgamasamādhau mucyeta // nāṣṭikaś cet tad eva pratisaṃdadhyāt, yasyā pūrvo dīrghaś ca paribhogaḥ śucir vā deśas tasya dravyam iti vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the article in question is found to be the one lost by another person whose deposition regarding the antecedent circumstances of the article in no way differs from the previous story, the article shall be considered to belong to that person who is found to have long been enjoying it and whose life is very pure

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: catuṣpadadvipadānām api hi rūpaliṅgasāmānyaṃ bhavati, kim aṅga punar ekayonidravyakartṛprasūtānāṃ kupyaābharaṇabhāṇḍānām iti // sa ced brūyāt yācitakam avakrītakam āhitakaṃ nikṣepam upanidhiṃ vaiyāvṛtyakarma vāamuṣya iti,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For while even Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 quadrupeds and bipeds are found to bear such common evidences of identification as colour, gait and form, can there be any difficulty in identifying such articles as, in the form of raw materials, jewels, or vessels, are the product of a single source, definite materials, a particular manufacturer for a definite purpose? The possessor of an article in question may plead that the article is either borrowed or hired, a pledge or a sealed deposit, or one obtained from a particular person for retail sale

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaapasārapratisaṃdhānena mucyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If he proves his allegation by producing the referee, he shall be let off;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: naevam ity apasāro vā brūyāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: or the referee may deny having had any concern in the matter

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rūpaabhigṛhītaḥ parasya dānakāraṇam ātmanaḥ pratigrahakāraṇam upaliṅganaṃ vā dāyakadāpakanibandhakapratigrāhakaupadraṣṭṛbhir upaśrotṛbhir vā pratisamānayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: With regard to the reasons which a person, seized with an article lost by another, assigns as to his having taken the article as a gift from a third person, he shall corroborate them by producing as witnesses not only those who gave and caused to give the article to him, but also those who, being mediators, custodians, bearers, or witnesses, arranged for the transfer of the article

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ujjhitapranaṣṭaniṣpatitaupalabdhasya deśakālalābhaupaliṅganena śuddhiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person is found possessed of an article which he alleges to have been thrown out, lost, or forgotten by a third person, he shall prove his innocence by adducing evidence as to the time, place, and circumstances of finding the article

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aśuddhas tac ca tāvac ca daṇḍaṃ dadyāt // anyathā steyadaṇḍaṃ bhajeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Otherwise he shall restore the article, besides paying a fine equal to its value; or he may be punished as a thief

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti rūpaabhigrahaḥ / karmaabhigrahas tu muṣitaveśmanaḥ praveśaniṣkasanam advāreṇa,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus the seizure of criminals in the very act is dealt with Circumstancial Evidence As regards the seizure of criminals on the clue of circumstancial evidence Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 In cases of house breaking and theft the circumstances, such as entrance and exit effected through other than doors;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvārasya saṃdhinā bījena vā vedham, uttamaagārasya jālavātaayananīpravedham,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: breaking the door by means of special contrivances breaking the windows with or without lattice work, or pulling off the roof in houses consisting of upstairs, ascending and descending upstairs;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ārohaṇaavataraṇe ca kuḍyasya vedham, upakhananaṃ vā gūḍhadravyanikṣepaṇagrahaṇaupāyam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: breaking the wall; tunnelling; such contrivances as are necessary to carry off the treasure secretly hoarded, information about which can only be gathered from internal sources;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: upadeśaupalabhyam abhyantaracchedautkaraparimardaupakaraṇam abhyantarakṛtaṃ vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: these and other accessory circumstances of wear and tear cognisable in the interior shall tend to indicate the concern of internal hands in the crime, and those of reverse nature, external agencies

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viparyaye bāhyakṛtam, ubhayata ubhayakṛtam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The blending of these two kinds of circumstances shall indicate both internal and external agencies

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: abhyantarakṛte puruṣam āsannaṃ vyasaninaṃ krūrasahāyaṃ taskaraupakaraṇasaṃsargaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Regarding crimes suspected to be the work of internal agencies Any person of miserable appearance, present on the occasion, associated with rogues or thieves, and possessed of such instruments as are necessary for theft;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: striyaṃ vā daridrakulām anyaprasaktāṃ vā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: a woman who is born of a poor family, or has placed her affections elsewhere;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paricārakajanaṃ vā tadvidhaācāram,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: any person addicted to too much sleep or who is suffering from want of sleep;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nidrāklāntam, āvignaṃ śuṣkabhinnasvaramukhavarṇam, anavasthitam, atipralāpinam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: any person who shows signs of fatigue, or whose face is pale and dry with voice stammering and indistinct and who may be watching the movements of others or bewailing too much;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: uccaārohaṇasaṃrabdhagātraṃ, vilūnanighṛṣṭabhinnapāṭitaśarīravastraṃ, jātakiṇasaṃrabdhahastapādaṃ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: any person whose body bears the signs of scaling heights; any person whose body appears to have been scratched or wounded with dress torn off; any one whose legs and hands bear the signs of rubbing and scratching;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pāṃsupūrṇakeśanakhaṃ vilūnabhugnakeśanakhaṃ vā, samyaksnātaanuliptaṃ tailapramṛṣṭagātraṃ sadyodautahastapādaṃ vā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: any one whose hair and nails are either full of dirt or freshly broken; any one who has just bathed and daubed his body with sandal; any one who has smeared his body with oil and has just washed his hands and legs;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pāṃsupicchileṣu tulyapādapadanikṣepaṃ, praveśaniṣkasanayor vā tulyamālyamadyagandhavastracchedavilepanasvedaṃ parīkṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: any one whose footprints can be identified with those made near the house during ingress or egress; any one whose broken fragments of garlands, sandal or dress can be identified with those thrown out in or near the house during entrance or exit;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: coraṃ pāradārikaṃ vā vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A citizen or a person of adulterous habits may also be suspected

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sagopasthāniko bāhyaṃ pradeṣṭā coramārgaṇam / kuryān nāgarikaś caantardurge nirdiṣṭahetubhiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A commissioner pradeshtá with his retinue of gopas and sthánikas shall take steps to find out external thieves; and the officer in charge of a city nágaraka shall, under the circumstances sketched above, try to detect internal thieves inside fortified towns

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tailaabhyaktam āśumṛtakaṃ parīkṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: IN cases of sudden death, the corpse shall be smeared over with oil and examined

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: niṣkīrṇamūtrapurīṣaṃ vātapūrṇakoṣṭhatvakkaṃ śūnapādapāṇimān mīlitaakṣaṃ savyañjanakaṇṭhaṃ pīṭananiruddhaucchvāsahataṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person whose corpse is tainted with mucus and urine, with organs inflated with wind, with hands and legs swollen, with eyes open, and with neck marked with ligatures may be regarded as having been killed by suffocation and suppression of breathing

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tam eva saṃkucitabāhusakthim udbandhahataṃ vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person with contracted arms and thighs may be regarded as having been killed by hanging

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śūnapāṇipādaudaram apagataakṣam udvṛttanābhim avaropitaṃ vidyāt // nistabdhagudaakṣaṃ saṃdaṣṭajihvam ādhmātaudaram udakahataṃ vidyāt // śoṇitaanusiktaṃ bhagnabhinnagātraṃ kāṣṭhair aśmabhir vā hataṃ vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any dead person with swollen hands, legs and belly, with Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 sunken eyes and inflated navel may be regarded as having been killed by hanging Any dead person with stiffened rectum and eyes, with tongue bitten between the teeth, and with belly swollen, may be considered as having been killed by drowning Any dead person, wetted with blood and with limb, wounded and broken, may be regarded as having been killed with sticks or ropes

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sambhagnasphuṭitagātram avakṣiptaṃ vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any dead person with fractures and broken limbs, may be regarded as having been thrown down

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śyāvapāṇipādadantanakhaṃ śithilamāṃsaromacarmāṇaṃ phenaupadigdhamukhaṃ viṣahataṃ vidyāt // tam eva saśoṇitadaṃśaṃ sarpakīṭahataṃ vidyāt / vikṣiptavastragātram ativantaviriktaṃ madanayogahataṃ vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any dead person with dark coloured hands, legs, teeth, and nails, with loose skin, hairs fallen, flesh reduced, and with face bedaubed with foam and saliva, may be regarded as having been poisoned Any dead person of similar description with marks of a bleeding bite, may be considered as baving been bitten by serpents and other poisonous creatures Any dead person, with body spread and dress thrown out after excessive vomitting and purging may be considered as having been killed by the administration of the juice of the madana plant

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: atoanyatamena kāraṇena hataṃ hatvā vā daṇḍabhayād udbaddhanikṛttakaṇṭhaṃ vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Death due to any one of the above causes is, sometimes under the fear of punishment, made to appear as having been brought about by voluntary hanging, by causing marks of ligature round the neck

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viṣahatasya bhojanaśeṣaṃ vayobhiḥ parīkṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In death due to poison, the undigested portion of meat may be examined in milk

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hṛdayād uddhṛtyaagnau prakṣiptaṃ ciṭiciṭāyadindradhanurvarṇaṃ vā viṣayuktaṃ vidyāt, dagdhasya hṛdayam adagdhaṃ dṛṣṭvā vā // tasya paricārakajanaṃ vāgdaṇḍapāruṣyaatilabdhaṃ mārgeta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or the same extracted from the belly and thrown on fire may, if it makes „chitchita‟ sound and assumes the rainbow Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 colour, be declared as poisoned Or when the belly hridayam remains unburnt, although the rest of the body is reduced to ashes, the dead mans servants may be examined as to any violent and cruel treatments they may have received at the hands of the dead

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: duḥkhaupahatam anyaprasaktaṃ vā strījanaṃ, dāyavṛttistrījanaabhimantāraṃ vā bandhum //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Similarly such of the dead mans relatives as a person of miserable life, a woman with affections placed elsewhere or a relative defending some woman that has been deprived of her inheritance by the dead man may also be examined

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tad eva hataudbaddhasya parīkṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same kind of examination shall be conducted concerning the hanging of the body of an already dead man

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svayam udbaddhasya vā viprakāram ayuktaṃ mārgeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Causes such as past evils or harm done to others by a dead man, shall be inquired into regarding any death due to voluntary hanging

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarveṣāṃ vā strīdāyādyadoṣaḥ karmaspardhā pratipakṣadveṣaḥ paṇyasaṃsthāsamavāyo vā vivādapadānām anyatamad vā roṣasthānam
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: All kinds of sudden death, centre round one or the other of the following causes Offence to women or kinsmen, claiming inheritance, professional competition, hatred against rivals, commerce, guilds and any one of the legal disputes, is the cause of anger anger is the cause of death

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svayaṃādiṣṭapuruṣair vā, corair arthanimittaṃ, sādṛśyād anyavairibhir vā hatasya ghātam āsannebhyaḥ parīkṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When, owing to false resemblance, ones own hirelings, or thieves for money, or the enemies of a third person murder one, the relatives of the deceased shall be inquired as follows Who called the deceased;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yenaāhūtaḥ saha sthitaḥ prasthito hatabhūmim ānīto vā tam anuyuñjīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: who was with him; who accompanied him on his journey;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ye caasya hatabhūmāv āsannacarās tān ekaekaśaḥ pṛcchet kenaayam ihaānīto hato vā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and who took him to the scene of death? Those who happened to be at the locality of murder shall be Kautilyas Arthashastra severally asked as follows By whom the deceased was brought there;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kaḥ saśastraḥ saṃgūhamāna udvigno vā yuṣmābhir dṛṣṭaḥ iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: whether they the witnesses saw any armed person lurking in the place and showing signs of troubled appearance? Any clue afforded by them shall be followed in further enquiry

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vastraṃ veṣaṃ vibhūṣāṃ vā dṛṣṭvā tadvyavahāriṇaḥ // anuyuñjīta saṃyogaṃ nivāsaṃ vāsakāraṇam / karma ca vyavahāraṃ ca tato mārgaṇam ācaret //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: After examining the personal property such as travelling requisites, dress, jewels, or other things which the deceased had on his body while murdered, such persons as supplied or had something to do with those things shall be examined as to the associates, residence, causes of journey, profession, and other calls of the deceased

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rajjuśastraviṣair vāapi kāmakrodhavaśena yaḥ / ghātayet svayam ātmānaṃ strī vā pāpena mohitā // rajjunā rājamārge tāṃś caṇḍālenaapakarṣayet /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a man or woman under the infatuation of love, anger, or other sinful passions commits or causes to commit suicide by means of ropes, arms, or poison, he or she shall be dragged by means of a rope along the public road by the hands of a Chandála

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na śmaśānavidhis teṣāṃ na sambandhikriyās tathā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For such murderers as the above, neither cremation rites nor any obsequies usually performed by relatives shall be observed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bandhus teṣāṃ tu yaḥ kuryāt pretakāryakriyāvidhim / tadgatiṃ sa caret paścāt svajanād vā pramucyate // saṃvatsareṇa patati patitena samācaran / yājanaadhyāpanād yaunāt taiś caanyoapi samācaran //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any relative who performs funeral rites to such wretches, shall either himself be deprived of his own funerals or be abandoned by his kith and kin Whoever associates himself with such persons as perform forbidden rites, shall with his other associates, if any, forfeit within a year the privileges of conducting or superintending a sacrifice, of teaching, and of giving or receiving gifts

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: muṣitasaṃnidhau bāhyānām abhyantarāṇāṃ ca sākṣiṇām abhiśastasya deśajātigotranāmakarmasārasahāyanivāsān anuyuñjīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: WHETHER an accused is a stranger or a relative to a complainant, his defence witness shall, in the presence of the complainant, be asked as to the defendants country, caste, family, name, occupation, property, friends, and residence

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tāṃś caapadeśaiḥ pratisamānayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The answers obtained shall be compared with the defendants own statements regarding the same

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tataḥ pūrvasyaahnaḥ pracāraṃ rātrau nivāsaṃ ca grahaṇād ity anuyuñjīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Then the defendant shall be asked as to not only the nature of the work he did during the day previous to the theft, but also the place where he spent the night till he was caught hold of

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaapasārapratisaṃdhāne śuddhaḥ syāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If his answers for these questions are attested to by reliable referees or witnesses, he shall be acquitted

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyathā karmaprāptaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Otherwise he shall be subjected torture anyatha karmapráptah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: trirātrād ūrdhvam agrāhyaḥ śaṅkitakaḥ pṛcchāabhāvād anyatraupakaraṇadarśanāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Three days after the commission of a crime, no suspected person sankitakah shall be arrested inasmuch as there is no room for questions unless there is strong evidence to bring home the charge

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: acoraṃ cora ity abhivyāharataś corasamo daṇḍaḥ, coraṃ pracchādayataś ca // coreṇaabhiśasto vairadveṣābhyām apadiṣṭakaḥ śuddhaḥ syāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Persons who charge an innocent man with theft, or conceal a thief shall themselves be liable to the punishment for theft When a person accused of theft proves in his defence the complainants enmity or hatred towards himself he shall be acquitted

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śuddhaṃ parivāsayataḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person who keeps an innocent man in confinement parivásayatah suddham shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śaṅkāniṣpannam upakaraṇamantrisahāyarūpavaiyāvṛtyakarān niṣpādayet // karmaṇaś ca pradeśadravyaādānaaṃśavibhāgaiḥ pratisamānayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Guilt against a suspected person shall be established by the production of such evidences as the instruments made use of by the accused, his accomplices or abettors, the stolen article, and any Kautilyas Arthashastra middlemen involved in selling or purchasing the stolen article

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: eteṣāṃ kāraṇānām anabhisaṃdhāne vipralapantam acoraṃ vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When there are no such evidences and when the accused is wailing much, he shall be regarded as innocent

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dṛśyate hy acoroapi coramārge yadṛcchayā saṃnipāte coraveṣaśastrabhāṇḍasāmānyena gṛhyamāṇaś corabhāṇḍasyaupavāsena vā, yathāaṇimāṇḍavyaḥ karmakleśabhayād acoraḥ coroasmi iti bruvāṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For owing to ones accidental presence on the scene of theft, or to ones accidental resemblance to the real thief in respect to his appearance, his dress, his weapons, or possession of articles similar to those stolen, or owing to ones presence near the stolen articles as in the case of Mándavya who under the fear of torture admitted himself to be the thief, one, though innocent, is often seized as a thief

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasmāt samāptakaraṇaṃ niyamayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence the production of conclusive evidences shall be insisted upon

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mandaaparādhaṃ bālaṃ vṛddhaṃ vyādhitaṃ mattam unmattaṃ kṣutpipāsāadhvaklāntam atyāśitam āmakaaśitaṃ durbalaṃ vā na karma kārayet
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: tasmátsamáptakaranam niyamayet hence punishment shall be meted out only when the charge is quite established against the accused? Ignoramuses, youngsters, the aged, the afflicted, persons under intoxication, lunatics, persons suffering from hunger, thirst, or fatigue from journey, persons who have just taken more than enough of meal, persons who have confessed of their own accord átmakásitam, and persons who are very weak,none of these shall be subjected to torture

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tulya śīlapuṃścalīprāpāvikakathāavakāśabhojanadātṛbhir apasarpayet // evam atisaṃdadhyāt, yathā vā nikṣepaapahāre vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Among the spies such as harlots, suppliers of water and other drinks to travellers, storytellers, hotelkeepers providing travellers with boarding and lodging, any one who happens to be acquainted with the work similar to that of the suspected may be let off to watch his movements, as described in connection with misappropriation of sealed deposits

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: āptadoṣaṃ karma kārayet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those whose guilt is believed to be true shall be subjected to torture áptadosham karma kárayet

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na tv eva striyaṃ garbhiṇīṃ sūtikāṃ vā māsaavaraprajātām //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But not women who are Kautilyas Arthashastra carrying or who have not passed a month after delivery

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: striyās tv ardhakarma,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Torture of women shall be half of the prescribed standard

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vākyaanuyogo vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or women with no exception may be subjected to the trial of crossexamination vákyanuyogo vá

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brāhmaṇasya sattriparigrahaḥ śrutavatas tapasvinaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those of Bráhman caste and learned in the Vedas as well as asceties shall only be subjected to espionage

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaatikrama uttamo daṇḍaḥ kartuḥ kārayituś ca,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who violate or cause to violate the above rules shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmaṇā vyāpādanena ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same punishment shall be imposed in case of causing death to any one by torture

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vyāvahārikaṃ karmacatuṣkaṃ ṣaḍ daṇḍāḥ, sapta kaśāḥ, dvāv uparinibandhau, udakanālikā ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: There are in vogue four kinds of torture karma Six punishments shatdandáh, seven kinds of whipping kasa, two kinds of suspension from above upari nibandhau, and watertube udakanáliká cha

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paraṃ pāpakarmaṇāṃ nava vetralatāḥ, dvādaśa kaśāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: As to persons who have committed grave offences, the form of torture will be nine kinds of blows with a cane beats on each of the thighs;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viṃśatir naktamālalatāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: beats with a stick of the tree naktamála;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvātriṃśattalāḥ, dvau vṛścikabandhau, ullaṃbane ca dve,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: two on the knuckles, the hands being joined so as to appear like a scorpion; two kinds of suspensions, face downwards ullambane chale;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yavāgūpītasya ekaparvadahanam aṅgulyāḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: burning one of the joints of a finger after the accused has been made to drink rice gruel;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: snehapītasya pratāpanam ekam ahaḥ, śiśirarātrau balbajaagraśayyā ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: heating his body for a day after be has been made to drink oil; causing him to lie on coarse green grass for a night in winter

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ity aṣṭādaśakaṃ karma //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: These are the kinds of torture

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaupakaraṇaṃ pramāṇaṃ praharaṇaṃ pradharaṇam avadhāraṇaṃ ca kharapaṭṭād āgamayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The instruments of the accused such as ropes, clubs, arrows, spades, knives, etc, shall be paraded on the back of an ass

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: divasaantaram ekaekaṃ ca karma kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Each day a fresh kind of the torture may be employed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / pūrvakṛtaapadānaṃ pratijñāyaapaharantam ekadeśadṛṣṭadravyaṃ karmaṇā rūpeṇa vā gṛhītaṃ rājakośam avastṛṇantaṃ karmavadhyaṃ vā rājavacanāt samastaṃ vyastam abhyastaṃ vā karma kārayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Regarding those criminals who rob in accordance with the threat previously made by them, who have made use of the stolen articles in part, who have been caught hold of in the very act or with the stolen articles, who have attempted to seize the kings treasury, or who have committed culpable crime, may, in accordance with the order of the king, be subjected once or many times to one all of the above kinds of torture

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvaaparādheṣv apīḍanīyo brāhmaṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whatever may be the nature of the crime, no Bráhman offender shall be tortured

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaabhiśastaaṅko lalāṭe syād vyavahārapatanāya,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The face of a Bráhman convict shall be branded so as to leave a mark indicating his crimethe sign of a dog in theft, that of a headless body in murder;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: steyo śvā, manuṣyavadhe kabandhaḥ, gurutalpe bhagam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: that of the female part bhaga in rape with the wife of a teacher, and that of the flag of vintners for drinking liquor

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: surāpāne madyadhvajaḥ // brāhmaṇaṃ pāpakarmāṇam udghuṣyaaṅkakṛtavraṇam / kuryān nirviṣayaṃ rājā vāsayed ākareṣu vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: After having thus branded to a wound and proclaimed his crime in public, the king shall either banish a Bráhman offender or send him to the mines for life [Thus ends Chapter , Trial and Torture to Elicit Confession in Book , The Removal of Thorns of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samāhartṛpradeṣṭāraḥ pūrvam adhyakṣāṇām adhyakṣapuruṣāṇāṃ ca niyamanaṃ kuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: PROTECTION OF ALL KINDS OF GOVERNMENT DEPARTMENTS COMMISSIONERS appointed by the Collectorgeneral shall first check the proceedings of Superintendents and their subordinates

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: phalgudravyakarmaantebhyaḥ phalgu dravyam upaskaraṃ vā pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ // paṇyabhūmibhyo vā rājapaṇyaṃ māṣamūlyād ūrdhvam āpādamūlyād ity apaharato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who seize valuable articles or precious stones from either mines or any great manufactories shall be beheaded Those Kautilyas Arthashastra who seize ordinary articles or necessaries of life from manufactories of articles of small value shall be punished with the first amercement Those who seize from manufactories or from the kings granary articles of / to / a pana in value shall be fined panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: āpaṇamūlyād ity aṣṭacatvāriṃśatpaṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: articles of / to / a pana in value, panas; articles / to / pana in value, panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ādvipaṇamūlyād iti pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who seize articles of to panas in value shall be punished with the first amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ācatuṣpaṇamūlyād iti madhyamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: articles of to panas in value with the middlemost;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ādaśapaṇamūlyād
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and articles of to panas in value with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti vadhaḥ // koṣṭhapaṇyakupyaāyudhaagārebhyaḥ kupyabhāṇḍaupaskaraapahāreṣv ardhamūlyeṣu eta eva daṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who seize articles of to 0 panas in value shall be condemned to death When any one seizes from courtyards, shops, or arsenals commodities such as raw materials, manufactured articles, etc, of half the above value, he shall also be punished as above

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kośabhāṇḍaagāraakṣaśālābhyaś caturbhāgamūlyeṣu eta eva dviguṇā daṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When any person seizes articles of ¼th of the above value from Government treasury, granaries, or offices of Superintendents, he shall be punished with twice the above fines

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: corāṇām abhipradharṣaṇe citro ghātaḥ // iti rājaparigraheṣu vyākhyātam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It has already been laid down in connection with the kings harem that those who intimidate thieves with a view to give them a signal to run away shall be tortured to death

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bāhyeṣu tu pracchannam ahani kṣetrakhalaveśmaāpaṇebhyaḥ kupyabhāṇḍam upaskaraṃ vā māṣamūlyād ūrdhvam āpādamūlyād ity apaharatas tripaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When any person other than a Government servant steals during the day from fields, yards prepared for threshing out grains, houses, or shops commodities such as raw materials, manufactured articles, or necessaries of life, of /th to /th of a pana in value, he shall be fined panas or paraded through the streets, his body being smeared over with cowdung, and an earthen ware pan with blazing light tied round his loins sarávamekhalayá

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gomayapradehena vā pralipyaavaghoṣaṇam ādvipādamūlyād iti ṣaṭpaṇaḥ, gomayabhasmanā vā pralipyaavaghoṣaṇam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When any person steals articles of ¼ to ½ of a pana in value, he shall be fined panas, or his head may be shaved, or he may be exiled Kautilyas Arthashastra mundanam pravrajanam vá

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gomayabhasmanā vā pralipyaavaghoṣaṇam, śarāvamekhalayā vā āpaṇamūlyād iti dvādaśapaṇaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person steals articles of ½ to / of a pana in value, he shall be fined panas, or he may be paraded through streets, his body being bedaubed with cowdung or ashes or with an earthenware pan with blazing light tied round his waist

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: muṇḍanaṃ pravrājanaṃ vā ādvipaṇamūlyād iti caturviṃśatipaṇaḥ, muṇḍasyaiṣṭakāśakalena pravrājanaṃ vā ācatuṣpaṇamūlyād iti ṣaṭtriṃśatpaṇah āpañcapaṇamūlyād
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person steals articles of / to pana in value, be shall be fined panas, or his head may be shaved, or he may be banished When a person steals commodities of to panas in value, he shall be fined panas, or his head may be shaved with a piece of brick, or he may be exiled When a person steals articles of to panas in value, he shall be punished with a fine of panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ādaśapaṇamūlyād iti pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍah āviṃśatipaṇamūlyād it dviśatah ātriṃśatpaṇamūlyād
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: articles of to panas in value, panas; articles of to 0 panas in value, with the first amercement; articles of 0 to 0 panas in value, with a fine of 00 panas; articles of 0 to 0 panas in value, with a fine of 00 panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti pañcaśatah ācatvāriṃśatpaṇamūlyād iti sāhasrah āpañcāśatpaṇamūlyād iti vadhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: articles of 0 to 0 panas in value, with a fine of ,000 panas; and articles of 0 to 0 panas in value, he shall be condemned to death

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prasahya divā rātrau vāāntaryāmikam apaharatoardhamūlyeṣu eta eva daṇḍāḥ // prasahya divā rātrau vā saśastrasyaapaharataś caturbhāgamūlyeṣu eta eva dviguṇā daṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person seizes by force, whether during the early part of the day or night, articles of half the above values, he shall be punished with double the above fines When any person with weapons in hand seizes by force, whether during the day or night, articles of ¼th of the above values, he shall be punished with the same fines

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kuṭuṃbikaadhyakṣamukhyasvāmināṃ kūṭaśāsanamudrākarmasu pūrvamadhyauttamavadhā daṇḍāḥ, yathāaparādhaṃ vā // dharmasthaś ced vivadamānaṃ puruṣaṃ tarjayati bhartsayaty apasārayaty abhigrasate vā pūrvam asmai sāhasadaṇḍaṃ kuryāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a master of a household kutumbádhyaksha, a superintendent, or an independent officer mukhyaswámi issues or makes use of unauthorised orders or seals, he shall be punished with the first, middlemost, or highest amercement, or he may be condemned to death, or punished in any other way in proportion to the gravity of his crime When a judge threatens, browbeats, sends out, or unjustly silences any one of the disputants in his court, he shall first of all be Kautilyas Arthashastra punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vākpāruṣye dviguṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If he defames or abuses any one of them, the punishment shall be doubled

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pṛṣṭvā vā visṛjati, śikṣayati, smārayati, pūrvaṃ dadāti vā, iti madhyamam asmai sāhasadaṇḍaṃ kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If he does not ask what ought to be asked, or asks what ought not to be asked, or leaves out what he himself has asked, or teaches, reminds, or provides any one with previous statement, he shall be punished with the middlemost amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: deyaṃ deśaṃ na pṛcchati, adeyaṃ deśaṃ pṛcchati, kāryam adeśenaativāhayati, chalenaatiharati, kālaharaṇena śrāntam apavāhayati,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a judge does not inquire into necessary circumstances, inquires into unnecessary circumstances, desa, makes unnecessary delay in discharging his duty, postpones work with spite, causes parties to leave the court by tiring them with delay, evades or causes to evade statements that lead to the settlement of a case, helps witnesses giving them clues, or resumes cases already settled or disposed of, he shall be punished with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: punaraparādhe dviguṇaṃ sthānād vyavaropaṇaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If he repeats the offence, he shall both be punished with double the above fine and dismissed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathāaparādhaṃ vā // dharmasthaḥ pradeṣṭā vā hairaṇyadaṇḍam adaṇḍye kṣipati kṣepadviguṇam asmai daṇḍaṃ kuryāt, hīnaatiriktaaṣṭaguṇaṃ vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a clerk does not take down what has been deposed by parties, but enters what has not been deposed, evades what has been badly said duruktam, or renders either diverse or ambiguous in meaning such depositions as are satisfactorily given out, he shall be punished either with the first amercement or in proportion to his guilt When a judge or commissioner imposes an unjust fine in gold, he shall be fined either double the amount of the fine, or eight times that amount of imposition which is either more or less than the prescribed limit

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śarīradaṇḍaṃ kṣipati śārīram eva daṇḍaṃ bhajeta, niṣkrayadviguṇaṃ vā //
