Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a judge or commissioner imposes an unjust corporeal punishment, he shall himself be either condemned to the same punishment or made to pay twice the amount of ransom leviable for that kind of injustice

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaṃ vā bhūtam arthaṃ nāśayati abhūtam arthaṃ karoti tadaṣṭaguṇaṃ daṇḍaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a judge falsifies whatever is a true amount or declares Kautilyas Arthashastra as true whatever amount is false, he shall be fined eight times that amount

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dharmasthīye cārake bandhanaagāre vā śayyāāsanabhojanauccārasaṃcārarodhabandhaneṣu tripaṇauttarā daṇḍāḥ kartuḥ kārayituś
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When an officer lets out or causes to let out offenders from lockup cháraka, obstructs or causes to obstruct prisoners in such of their daily avocations as sleeping, sitting, eating, or execreting, he shall be punished with fines ranging from panas and upwards

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: cārakād abhiyuktaṃ muñcato niṣpātayato vā madhyamaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When any person lets out or causes to let out debtors from lockup, he shall not only be punished with the middlemost amercement, but also be compelled to pay the debt the offender has to pay

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: abhiyogadānaṃ ca, bandhanaagārāt sarvasvaṃ vadhaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person lets out or causes to let out prisoners from jails bandhanágára, he shall be condemned to death and the whole of his property confiscated

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bandhanaagāraadhyakṣasya saṃruddhakam anākhyāya cārayataś caturviṃśatipaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When the superintendeat of jails puts any person in lockup without declaring the grounds of provocation samkrudhakamanákhyáya, he shall be fined panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sthānaanyatvaṃ gamayatoannapānaṃ vā rundhataḥ ṣaṇṇavatir daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: when he subjects any person to unjust torture, panas; when he transfers a prisoner to another place, or deprives a prisoner of food and water, panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parikleśayata utkoṭayato vā madhyamaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: when be troubles or receives bribes from a prisoner, he shall be punished, with the middlemost amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ghnataḥ sāhasraḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: when he beats a prisoner to death, he shall be fined ,000 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parigṛhītāṃ dāsīm āhitikāṃ vā saṃruddhikām adhicarataḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person commits rape with a captive, slave, or hired woman in lockup, he shall be punished with the first amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: coraḍāmarikabhāryāṃ madhyamaḥ, saṃruddhikām āryām uttamaḥ // saṃruddhasya vā tatraeva ghātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: when he commits rape with the wife of a thief, or of any other man who is dead in an epidemic dámara, he shall be punished with the middlemost amercement; and when he commits rape with an Arya woman in lockup, he shall be punished with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tad evaakṣaṇagṛhītāyām āryāyāṃ vidyāt, dāsyāṃ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: when a similar offence is committed with a woman under slavery, the offender shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: cārakam abhittvā niṣpātayato madhyamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: An officer who causes a prisoner to escape from a lockup without breaking it open, shall be punished with the middlemost amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bandhanaagārāt sarvasvaṃ vadhaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When he lets out a prisoner from the jail, he shall be put to death and his property confiscated

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evam arthacarān pūrvaṃ rājā daṇḍena śodhayet / śodhayeyuś ca śuddhās te paurajānapadān damaiḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Thus shall the king, with adequate punishments, test first the conduct of Government servants, and then shall, through those officers of approved character, examine the conduct of his people both in towns and villages

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tīrthaghātagranthibhedaūrdhvakarāṇāṃ prathameaparādhe saṃdeśacchedanaṃ catuṣpañcāśatpaṇo vā daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: WHEN Government servants arthachara commit for the first time such offences as violation of sacred institutions tírthágháta, or pickpocketing granthibheda, they shall have their index finger cut off or shall pay a fine of panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dvitīye chedanaṃ paṇasya śatyo vā daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: when for a Kautilyas Arthashastra second time they commit the same, they shall have their cut off or pay a fine of 00 panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tṛtīye dakṣiṇahastavadhaś catuḥśato vā daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: when for a third time, they shall have their right hand cut off or pay a fine of 00 panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: caturthe yathākāmī vadhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and when for a fourth time, they shall in any way be put to death

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pañcaviṃśatipaṇaavareṣu kukkuṭanakulamārjāraśvasūkarasteyeṣu hiṃsāyāṃ vā catuṣpañcāśatpaṇo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person steals or destroys cocks, mangoose, cats, dogs or pigs, of less than panas in value, he shall have the edge of his nose cut off or pay a fine of panas If these animals belong to either Chandalas or wild tribes half of the above fine shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: nāsaagracchedanaṃ vā caṇḍālaaraṇyacarāṇām ardhadaṇḍāḥ // pāśajālakūṭaavapāteṣu baddhānāṃ mṛgapaśupakṣivyālamatsyānām ādāne tac ca tāvac ca daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When any person steals wild beasts, cattle, birds, elephants, tigers, fish, or any other animals confined in traps, fences, or pits, he shall not only pay a fine equal to the value of the stolen animals, but also restore the animals

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mṛgadravyavanān mṛgadravyaapahāre śātyo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For stealing beasts or raw materials from forests, a fine of 00 panas shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: biṃbavihāramṛgapakṣisteye hiṃsāyāṃ vā dviguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For stealing or destroying dolls, beasts, or birds from infirmaries, twice the above fine shall be levied

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāruśilpikuśīlavatapasvināṃ kṣudrakadravyaapahāre śatyo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person steals articles of small value, belonging to artisans, musicians, or ascetics he shall pay a fine of 00 panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sthūlakadravyaapahāre dviśataḥ, kṛṣidravyaapahāre ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and when he steals big articles or any agricultural implements, he shall pay double the above fine

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: durgam akṛtapraveśasya praviśataḥ prākāracchidrād vā nikṣepaṃ gṛhītvāapasarataḥ kāṇḍarāvadho, dviśāto vā daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When any person enters into a fort without permission, or carries off treasure through a hole or passage in the wall of the fort, he shall either be beheaded or be made to pay a fine of 00 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: cakrayuktaṃ nāvaṃ kṣudrapaśuṃ vāapaharata ekapādavadhaḥ, triśato vā daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person steals a cart, a boat or minor quadruped, he shall have one of his legs cut off or pay a fine of 00 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kūṭakākaṇyakṣaarālāśalākāhastaviṣamakāriṇa ekahastavadhaḥ, catuḥśato vā daṇḍaḥ // stenapāradārikayoḥ sācivyakarmaṇi striyāḥ saṃgṛhītāyāś ca karṇanāsācchedanam, pañcaśato vā daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a gambler substitutes false dice to be hired for a kákaní or any other accessory things of diceplay, or commits fraud by Kautilyas Arthashastra tricks of hand, he shall have his hand cut off or pay a fine of 00 panas When any person abets a thief or an adulterer, he as well as the woman who voluntarily yields herself for adultery shall have their ears and nose cut off or pay each a fine of 00 panas, while the thief or the adulterer shall pay double the above fine

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mahāpaśum ekaṃ dāsaṃ dāsīṃ vāapaharataḥ pretabhāṇḍaṃ vā vikrīṇānasya dvipādavadhaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When any person steals a big animal, abducts a male or female slave, or sells the articles belonging to a dead body pretabhándam, he shall have both of his legs cut off or pay a fine of 00 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṣaṭchato vā daṇḍaḥ // varṇauttamānāṃ gurūṇāṃ ca hastapādalaṅghane rājayānavāhanaādyārohaṇe caekahastapādavadhaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man contemptuously rushes against the hands or legs of any person of a higher caste, or of a teacher, or mounts the horse, elephant, coach, etc, of the king, he shall have one of his legs and one of his hands cut off or pay a fine of 00 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saptaśato vā daṇḍaḥ // śūdrasya brāhmaṇavādino devadravyam avastṛṇato rājadviṣṭam ādiśato dvinetrabhedinaś ca yogaañjanenaandhatvam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a Súdra calls himself a Bráhman, or when any person steals the property of gods, conspires against the king, or destroys both the eyes of another, he shall either have his eyes destroyed by the application of poisonous ointment, or pay a fine of 00 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kanyāṃ dāsīṃ vā sahiraṇyam aparahataḥ kūṭavyavahāriṇo vimāṃsavikrayiṇaś ca vāmahastadvipādavadho, navaśato vā daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person causes a thief or an adulterer to be let off or adds or omits anything while writing down the kings order, abducts a girl or a slave possessed of gold, carries off any deceitful transaction, or sells rotten flesh, he shall either have his two legs and one hand cut off or pay a fine of 00 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mānuṣamāṃsavikraye vadhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person who sells human flesh shall be condemned to death

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: devapaśupratimāmanuṣyakṣetragṛhahiraṇyasuvarṇaratnasasyaapahāriṇa uttamo daṇḍaḥ, śuddhavadho vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person steals images of gods or of animals, abducts men, or takes possession of fields, houses, gold, goldcoins, precious stones, or crops of others, he shall either be beheaded or Kautilyas Arthashastra compelled to pay the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: puruṣaṃ caaparādhaṃ ca kāraṇaṃ gurulāghavam / anubandhaṃ tadātvaṃ ca deśakālau samīkṣya ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Taking into consideration the social position of persons, the nature of the offence, the cause, whether grave or slight that led to the perpetration of the offence, the antecedent and present circumstances, the time, and the place;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: uttamaavaramadhyatvaṃ pradeṣṭā daṇḍakarmaṇi / rājñaś ca prakṛtīnāṃ ca kalpayed antarā sthitaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and without failing to notice equitable distinctions among offenders, whether belonging to royal family or to the common people, shall the commissioner determine the propriety of imposing the first, middlemost, or highest amercements

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kalahe ghnataḥ puruṣaṃ citro ghātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: WHEN a man murders another in a quarrel, he shall be tortured to death

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saptarātrasyaantarmṛte śuddhavadhaḥ, pakṣasyaantar uttamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person wounded in a fight dies within seven nights, he who caused the wound shall be put to instantaneous death suddhavadhah

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: māsasyaantaḥ pañcaśataḥ samutthānavyayaś ca // śastreṇa praharata uttamo daṇḍaḥ // madena hastavadhaḥ, mohena dviśataḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the wounded man dies within a fortnight, the offender shall be punished with the highest amercement If the wounded man dies within a month, the offender shall be compelled to pay not only a fine of 00 panas, but also an adequate compensation to the bereaved

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vadhe vadhaḥ // prahāreṇa garbhaṃ pātayata uttamo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man hurts another with a weapon, he shall pay the highest amercement; when he does so under intoxication, his hand shall be cut off;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhaiṣajyena madhyamaḥ, parikleśena pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra When a person causes abortion in pregnancy by striking, or with medicine, or by annoyance, the highest, middlemost, and first amercements shall be imposed respectively

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / prasabhastrīpuruṣaghātakaabhisārakanigrāhakaavaghoṣakaavaskandakaupavedhakān pathiveśmapratirodhakān rājahastyaśvarathānāṃ hiṃsakān stenān vā śūlān ārohayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who cause violent death either to men or women, or those who are in the habit of often going to meet prostitutes abhisáraka, those who inflict unjust punishment upon others, those who spread false or contemptuous rumours, who assault or obstruct travellers on their way, who commit housebreaking, or who steal or cause hurt to royal elephants, horses, or carriages shall be hanged

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yaś caenān dahed apanayed vā sa tam eva daṇḍaṃ labheta, sāhasam uttamaṃ vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever burns or carries away the corpses of the above offenders shall meet with similar punishment or pay the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hiṃsrastenānāṃ bhaktavāsaupakaraṇaagnimantradānavaiyāvṛtyakarmasuuttamo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person supplies murderers or thieves with food, dress, any requisites, fire, information, any plan, or assistance in any way, he shall be punished with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paribhāṣaṇam avijñāte //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When he does so under ignorance, he shall be censured

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hiṃsrastenānāṃ putradāram asamantraṃ visṛjet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Sons or wives of murderers or of thieves shall, if they are found not in concert, be acquitted;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: samantram ādadīta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but they shall be seized if found to have been in concert

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājyakāmukam antaḥpurapradharṣakam aṭavyamitrautsāhakaṃ durgarāṣṭradaṇḍakopakaṃ vā śirohastapradīpikaṃ ghātayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person who aims at the kingdom, who forces entrance into the kings harem, who instigates wild tribes or enemies against the king, or who creates disaffection in forts, country parts, or in the army shall be burnt alive from head to foot

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brāhmaṇaṃ tamaḥ praveśayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a Bráhman does similar acts, he shall be drowned

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mātṛpitṛputrabhrātrācāryatapasvighātakaṃ vāatvakśiraḥprādīpikaṃ ghātayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person who murders his father, mother, son, brother, teacher, or an ascetic, shall be put to death by burning both his head Kautilyas Arthashastra and skin;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣām ākrośe jihvācchedaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if he insults any of the above persons, his tongue shall be cut off;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aṅgaabhiradane tadaṅgān mocyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if he bites any limb of these persons, be shall be deprived of the corresponding limb

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yadṛcchāghāte puṃsaḥ paśuyūthasteye ca śuddhavadhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man wantonly murders another, or steals a herd of cattle, he shall be beheaded

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daśaavaraṃ ca yūthaṃ vidyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A herd of cattle shall be considered to consist of not more than ten heads

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: udakadhāraṇaṃ setuṃ bhindatas tatraevaapsu nimajjanam,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person breaks the dam of a tank full of water, he shall be drowned in the very tank;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anudakam uttamaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: of a tank without water, he shall be punished with the highest amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhagnautsṛṣṭakaṃ madhyamaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and of a tank which is in ruins owing to neglect, he shall be punished with the middlemost amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: viṣadāyakaṃ puruṣaṃ striyaṃ ca puruṣaghnīm apaḥ praveśayed agarbhiṇīm, garbhiṇīṃ māsaavaraprajātām // patiguruprajāghātikām agniviṣadāṃ saṃdhicchedikāṃ vā gobhiḥ pāṭayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any man who poisons another and any woman who murders a man shall be drowned Any woman who murders her husband, preceptor, or offspring, sets fire to anothers property, poisons a man or cuts off any of the bodily joints of another shall be torn off by bulls, no matter whether or not she is big with a child, or has not passed a month after giving birth to a child

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vivītakṣetrakhalaveśmadravyahastivanaādīpikam agninā dāhayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person who sets fire to pasture lands, fields, yards prepared for threshing out grains, houses, forests, of timber or of elephants shall be thrown into fire

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājaākrośakamantrabhedakayor aniṣṭapravṛttikasya brāhmaṇamahānasaavalehinaś ca jihvām utpāṭayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person who insults the king, betrays the kings council, makes evil attempts against the king, or disregards the sanctity of the kitchens of Bráhmans shall have his tongue cut off

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: praharaṇaāvaraṇastenam anāyudhīyam iṣubhir ghātayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man other than a soldier steals weapons or armour, Kautilyas Arthashastra he shall be shot down by arrows;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: āyudhīyasyauttamaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if he is a soldier, he shall pay the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jihvānāsaupaghāte saṃdaṃśavadhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who hurts the tongue or nose of another shall have his fingers cut off

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ete śāstreṣv anugatāḥ kleśadaṇḍā mahātmanām /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such painful punishments klesadanda as the above have been laid down in the Śástras of great sages;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akliṣṭānāṃ tu pāpānāṃ dharmyaḥ śuddhavadhaḥ smṛtaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but it has been declared as just to put to simple death those offenders who have not been cruel

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: savarṇām aprāptaphalāṃ prakurvato hastavadhaḥ, catuḥśato vā daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: HE who defiles a maiden of equal caste before she has reached her maturity shall have his hand cut off or pay a fine of 00 panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mṛtāyāṃ vadhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if the maiden dies in consequence, the offender shall be put to death

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prāptaphalāṃ prakurvato madhyamāpradeśinīvadho, dviśato vā daṇḍaḥ // pituś caavahīnaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who defiles a maiden who has attained maturity shall have his middle finger cut off or pay a fine of 00 panas, besides giving an adequate compensation to her father

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na ca prākāmyam akāmāyāṃ labbheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: No man shall have sexual intercourse with any woman Kautilyas Arthashastra against her will

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sakāmāyāṃ catuṣpañcāśatpaṇo daṇḍaḥ, striyās tv ardhadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who defiles a willing maiden shall pay a fine of panas, while the maiden herself shall pay a fine of half the amount

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paraśulkaavaruddhāyāṃ hastavadhaḥ, catuḥśato vā daṇḍaḥ, śulkadānaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man impersonates another man who has already paid the nuptial fee to a woman parasulkopadháyám, he shall have his hand cut off or pay a fine of 00 panas, besides making good the nuptial fee

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saptaārtavaprajātāṃ varaṇād ūrdhvam alabhamānaḥ prakṛtya prākāmī syāt, na ca pitur avahīnaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: No man who has connection with a maiden that has passed seven menses and has not yet succeeded in marrying her, though she has been betrothed to him, shall either be guilty or pay any compensation to her father;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ṛtupratirodhibhiḥ svāmyād apakrāmati //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for her father has lost his authority over her in consequence of having deprived her so long of the result of her menses

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: trivarṣaprajātaārtavāyās tulyo gantum adoṣaḥ, tataḥ param atulyoapy analaṃkṛtāyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Nor is it an offence for a man, even of different caste, to have connection with a maiden who has spent more than three years after her first menses and has no jewellery on her person;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pitṛdravyaādāne steyaṃ bhajeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for taking possession of paternal property under such circumstances shall be regarded as theft

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na ca prākāṃyam akāmāyāṃ labheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: No man shall have sexual intercourse with any woman against her will

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kanyām anyāṃ darśayitvāanyāṃ prayacchataḥ śatyo daṇḍas tulyāyām, hīnāyāṃ dviguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a person substitutes in marriage another maiden for the one he has before shown, he shall, if the substitute is of the same rank, be fined 00 panas, and 00 panas if she is of lower rank

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prakarmaṇy akumāryāś catuṣpañcāśatpaṇo daṇḍaḥ, śulkavyayakarmaṇī ca pratidadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The Kautilyas Arthashastra substituted maiden shall be fined panas, while the offender shall also be compelled to return both the nuptial fee and the amount of expenditure incurred by the bridegroom

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: avasthāya tajjātaṃ paścātkṛtā dviguṇaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man refuses to live in marriage a particular maiden as agreed upon, he shall pay double the above fine

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyaśoṇitaupadhāne dviśato daṇḍaḥ, mithyāabhiśaṃsinaś ca puṃsaḥ // śulkavyayakarmaṇī ca jīyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man substitutes in marriage a maiden of different blood or is found to have bestowed false praises on her quality, he shall not only pay a fine of 00 panas and return the nuptial fee, but also make good the expenditure

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na ca prākāṃyam akāmāyāṃ labheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: No man shall have sexual intercourse with any woman against her will

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: strīprakṛtā sakāmā samānā dvādaśapaṇaṃ daṇḍaṃ dadyāt, prakartrī dviguṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a woman being desirous of intercourse, yields herself to a man of the same caste and rank, she shall be fined panas, while any other woman who is an abettor in the case shall be fined twice as much

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: akāmāyāḥ śatyo daṇḍa ātmarāgaartham, śulkadānaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any woman who abets a man in having intercourse with a maiden against her will shall not only pay a fine of 00 panas, but also please the maiden providing her with an adequate nuptial fee

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svayaṃ prakṛtā rājadāsyaṃ gacchet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A woman who, of her own accord, yields herself to a man shall be a slave to the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bahirgrāmasya prakṛtāyāṃ mithyāabhiśaṃsane ca dviguṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: For committing intercourse with a woman outside a village, or for spreading false report regarding such things, double the usual fines shall be imposed

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: prasahya kanyām apaharato dviśataḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who carries off a maiden by force shall be fined 00 panas;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sasuvarṇām uttamaḥ // bahūnāṃ kanyāapahāriṇāṃ pṛthag yathāuktā daṇḍāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: if the maiden thus carried off has golden ornaments on her person, the highest amercement shall be imposed If a number of persons abduct a maiden, each of them shall be punished as above

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śulkaṃ mātur bhogaḥ ṣoḍaśaguṇaḥ // / dāsasya dāsyā vā duhitaram adāsīṃ prakurvataś caturviṃśatipaṇo daṇḍaḥ śulkaābandhyadānaṃ ca // niṣkrayaanurūpāṃ dāsīṃ prakurvato dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍo vastraābandhyadānaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra When a man has connection with a harlots daughter, he shall not only pay a fine of panas, but also give her mother sixteen times her daily income When a man defiles the daughter of his own male or female slave, he shall not only pay a fine of panas, but also provide the maiden with an adequate nuptial fee sulka and jewellery ábaddhya When a man has connection with a woman who has been held in slavery on account of certain ransom due from her, he shall not only pay a fine of panas, but also provide the woman with dress and maintenance

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sācivyaavakāśadāne kartṛsamo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Abettors in all the above cases shall each have the same punishment as the principal offender

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: proṣitapatikām apacarantīṃ patibandhus tatpuruṣo vā saṃgṛhṇīyāt // saṃgṛhītā patim ākāṅkṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A relative, or a servant of an absentee husband may take the latters wife of loose character under his own protection samgrihníyat may marry her Being under such protection, she shall wait for the return of her husband

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: patiś cet kṣameta visṛjyetaubhayam // akṣamāyāṃ striyāḥ karṇanāsaācchedanam, vadhaṃ jāraś ca prāpnuyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If her husband, on his return, entertains no objection, both the protector and the woman shall be acquitted If he raises any objection, the woman shall have her ears and nose cut off, while her keeper shall be put to death as an adulterer

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jāraṃ cora ity abhiharataḥ pañcaśato daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man falsely accuses another of having committed theft while in reality the latter is guilty of adultery, the complainant shall be fined 00 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hiraṇyena muñcatas tadaṣṭaguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who lets off an adulterer by receiving gold shall pay a fine of eight times the value of the gold he received

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: keśākeśikaṃ saṃgrahaṇam, upaliṅganād vā śarīraupabhogānām, tajjātebhyaḥ(tajjñātebhyaḥ? cfṇ) )
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Adultery may be proved by circumstances such as hand to Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 hand fight, abduction, any marks made on the body of the culprits, opinion of experts on consideration of the circumstances, or the statements of women involved in it

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: , strīvacanād vā // paracakraaṭavīhṛtām oghapravyūḍhām araṇyeṣu durbhikṣe vā tyaktāṃ pretabhāvautsṛṣṭāṃ vā parastriyaṃ nistārayitvā yathāsaṃbhāṣitaṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man rescues a woman from enemies, forests, or floods, or saves the life of a woman who has been abandoned in forests, forsaken in famine, or thrown out as if dead, he may enjoy her as agreed upon during the rescue

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: jātiviśiṣṭām akāmām apatyavatīṃ niṣkrayeṇa dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A woman of high caste, with children and having no desire for sexual enjoyment, may be let off after receiving an adequate amount of ransom

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: corahastān nadīvegād durbhikṣād deśavibhramāt / nistārayitvā kāntārān naṣṭāṃ tyaktāṃ mṛtāiti vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those women who have been rescued from the hands of thieves, from floods, in famine, or in national calamities, or who, having been abandoned, missed, or thrown out as if dead in forests, have been taken home may be enjoyed by the rescuer as agreed upon

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na tu rājapratāpena pramuktāṃ svajanena vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But no such women as have been cast out under royal edict, or by their own kinsmen;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na cauttamāṃ na caakāmāṃ pūrvaapatyavatīṃ na ca /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: nor such as belong to high caste, or do not like to be rescued, nor even those who have children shall be rescued either for ransom or for their person

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: īdṛśīṃ tv anurūpeṇa niṣkrayeṇaapavāhayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: [Thus ends Chapter , Sexual Intercourse with Immature Girls, in Book , The Removal of Thorns of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brāhmaṇam apeyam abhakṣyaṃ vā grāsayata uttamo daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: HE who causes a Bráhman to partake of whatever food or drink is prohibited shall be punished with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣatriyaṃ madhyamaḥ, vaiśyaṃ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ, śūdraṃ catuṣpañcāśatpaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who causes a Kshatriya to do the same shall be punished with Kautilyas Arthashastra the middlemost amercement; a Vaisya, with the first amercement; and a Súdra, with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svayaṃ grasitāro nirviṣayāḥ kāryāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who voluntarily partake of whatever is condemned either as food or drink shall be outcast

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paragṛhaabhigamane divā pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who forces his entrance into anothers house during the day shall be punished with the first amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rātrau madhyamaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and during the night with the middlemost

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: divā rātrau vā saśastrasya praviśata uttamo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any person who with weapon in hand enters into anothers house either during the day or night shall be punished with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhikṣukavaidehakau mattaunmattau balād āpadi caatisaṃnikṛṣṭāḥ pravṛttapraveśāś caadaṇḍyāḥ, anyatra pratiṣedhāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When beggars or peddlers and lunatics or mad persons attempt to enter into a house by force, or when neighbours force their entrance into a house in danger, they shall not be punished provided no such entrance is specially prohibited

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svaveśmano virātrād ūrdhvaṃ parivāram ārohataḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who mounts the roof of his own house after midnight shall be punished with the first amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: paraveśmano madhyamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and of anothers house, with the middlemost amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: grāmaārāmavāṭabhedinaś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who break the fences of villages, gardens, or fields shall also be punished with the middlemost amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: grāmeṣv antaḥ sārthikā jñātasārā vaseyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Having made the value, etc, of their merchandise known to the headman of the village, traders shall halt in some part of a village

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: muṣitaṃ pravāsitaṃ caeṣām anirgataṃ rātrau grāmasvāmī dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When any part of their merchandise which has not been truly sent out of the village during the night has been stolen or lost, the headman of the village shall make good the loss

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: grāmaantareṣu vā muṣitaṃ pravāsitaṃ vivītaadhyakṣo dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whatever of their merchandise is stolen or lost in the intervening places between any two villages shall the superintendent of pasture lands make good

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: avivītānāṃ corarajjukaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If there are no pasture lands in such places, the officer called Chorarajjuka shall make good the loss

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tathāapy aguptānāṃ sīmaavarodhena vicayaṃ dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the loss of merchandise occurs in such parts of the Kautilyas Arthashastra country as are not provided even with such security a Chorarajjuka, the people in the boundaries of the place shall contribute to make up the loss

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: asīmaavarodhe pañcagrāmī daśagrāmī vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If there are no people in the boundaries, the people of five or ten villages of the neighbourhood shall make up the loss

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: durbalaṃ veśma śakaṭam anuttabdham ūrdhastaṃbhaṃ śastram anapāśrayam apraticchannaṃ śvabhraṃ kūpaṃ kūṭaavapātaṃ vā kṛtvā hiṃsāyāṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Harm due to the construction of unstable houses, carts with no support or with a beam or weapon hung above or with damaged support or with no covering, and harm due to causing a cart to fall in pits, or a tank, or from a dam, shall be treated as assault

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / vṛkṣacchedane daṃyaraśmiharaṇe catuṣpadānām adāntasevane vāhane vā kāṣṭhaloṣṭapāṣāṇadaṇḍabāṇabāhuvikṣepaṇeṣu yāne hastinā ca smaghaṭṭane apehi
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Cutting of trees, stealing the rope with which a tameable animal is tied, employing untamed quadrupeds, throwing sticks, mud, stones, rods, or arrows on chariots or elephants, raising or waiving the arm against chariots or elephants, shall also be treated as assault

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti prakośann adaṇḍyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The charioteer who cries out to a passerby „get out‟ shall not be punished for collision samghattane

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hastinā roṣitena hato droṇaannaṃ madyakuṃbhaṃ mālyaanulepanaṃ dantapramārjanaṃ ca paṭaṃ dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A man who is hurt to death by an elephant under provocation caused by himself shall supply not only a kumbha of liquor less by a drona, garlands, and scents but also as much cloth as is necessary to wash the tusks;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aśvamedhaavabhṛthasnānena tulyo hastinā vadha iti pādaprakṣālanam // udāsīnavadhe yātur uttamo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Hence this offer of liquor, etc, is known as „washing the legs‟ When an indifferent passerby is killed by an elephant the driver shall be punished with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śṛṅgiṇā daṃṣṭriṇā vā hiṃsyamānam amokṣayataḥ svāminaḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When the owner of a horned or tusked animal does not rescue a man from being destroyed by his animal, he shall be punished with the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratikruṣṭasya dviguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If he heedlessly keeps quite from rescuing though entreated, he shall be punished with twice the first Kautilyas Arthashastra amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śṛṅgidaṃṣṭribhyām anyonyaṃ ghātayatas tac ca tāvac ca daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person causes or allows horned or tusked animals to destroy each other, he shall not only pay a fine equal to the value of the destroyed animal or animals, but also make good the loss to the sufferer

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: devapaśum ṛṣabham ukṣāṇaṃ gokumārīṃ vā vāhayataḥ pañcaśato daṇḍaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man rides over an animal which is left off in the name of gods, or over a bull, an ox, or over a female calf, he shall be fined 00 panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pravāsayata uttamaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He who drives away the above animals shall be punished with the highest amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: lomadohavāhanaprajananaupakāriṇāṃ kṣudrapaśūnām adāne tac ca tāvac ca daṇḍaḥ, pravāsane ca,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a person carries off such inferior quadrupeds as are productive of wool or milk, or are useful for loading or riding, he shall not only pay a fine equal to their value, but also restore them

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyatra devapitṛkāryebhyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The same punishment shall be imposed in the case of driving away inferior quadrupeds for purposes other than ceremonials performed in honour of gods or ancestors

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: chinnanasyaṃ bhagnayugaṃ tiryakpratimukhaāgataṃ pratyāsarad vā cakrayuktaṃ yātā paśumanuṣyasaṃbādhe vā hiṃsāyām adaṇḍyaḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When an animal which has its nosestring cut off or which is not well tamed to yoke causes hurt; or when an animal, either coming furiously against a man or receding backwards with the cart to which it is tied, causes hurt or when an animal causes hurt in confusion brought about by the thronging of people and other animals;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyathā yathāuktaṃ mānuṣaprāṇihiṃsāyāṃ daṇḍam abhyāvahet // amānuṣaprāṇivadhe prāṇidānaṃ ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but for hurt caused to men under circumstances other than the above, fines shall be imposed as laid down before, while the loss of any animal life due to such causes shall be made good

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bāle yātari yānasthaḥ svāmī daṇḍyaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If the driver of a cart or carriage causing hurt is a minor, the master inside the cart or carriage shall be punished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: asvāmini yānasthaḥ, prāptavyavahāro vā yātā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In the absence of the master, any person who is seated inside, or the driver himself if he has attained his majority shall be punished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bālaadhiṣṭhitam apuruṣaṃ vā yānaṃ rājā haret //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Carts or carriages occupied by a minor or with no person shall be taken possession of by the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṛtyaabhicārābhyāṃ yatparam āpādayet tadāpādayitavyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Whatever a man attempts to do to others by witchcraft shall be practically applied to the doer himself

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāmaṃ bhāryāyām anicchantyāṃ kanyāyāṃ vā dāraarthino bhartari bhāryāyā vā saṃvadanakaraṇam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Witchcraft merely to arouse love in an indifferent wife, in a maiden by her lover, or in a wife by her husband is no offence

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: anyathāhiṃsāyāṃ madhyamaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: But when it is injurious to others, the doer shall be punished with the middle most amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mātāpitror bhaginīṃ mātulānīm ācāryāṇīṃ snuṣāṃ duhitaraṃ bhaginīṃ vāadhicaratas triliṅgacchedanaṃ vadhaś ca // sakāmā tad eva labheta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man performs witchcraft to win the sister of his own father or mother, the wife of a maternal uncle or of a preceptor, his own daughterinlaw, daughter, or sister, he shall have his limb cut off and also put to death, ,while any woman who yields herself to such an offender shall also, receive similar punishment

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dāsaparicārakaāhitakabhuktā ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Any woman who yields herself to a slave, a servant, or a hired labourer shall be similarly punished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: brāhmaṇyām aguptāyāṃ kṣatriyasyauttamaḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A Kshatriya who commits adultery with an unguarded Bráhman woman shall be punished with the highest amercement;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvasvaṃ vaiśyasya,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: a Vaisya doing the same shall be deprived of the whole of his property;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śūdraḥ kaṭaagninā dahyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and a Súdra shall be burnt alive wound round in mats

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sarvatra rājabhāryāgamane kuṃbhīpākaḥ // śvapākīgamane kṛtakabandhaaṅkaḥ paraviṣayaṃ gacchet,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever commits adultery with the queen of the land shall be burnt alive in a vessel kumbhílpákah A man who commits adultery with a woman of low caste shall be banished with prescribed mark branded on his forehead, or shall be degraded to the same caste

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śvapākatvaṃ vā śūdraḥ // śvapākasyaāryāgamane vadhaḥ, striyāḥ karṇanāsaācchedanam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A Súdra or a svapáka who commits adultery with a woman of low caste shall be put to death, while the woman shall have her ears and nose cut off

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pravrajitāgamane caturviṃśatipaṇo daṇḍaḥ // sakāmā tad eva labheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Adultery with a nun pravrajitá shall be punishable with a fine of panas while the nun who submits herself shall also pay a similar fine

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rūpaājīvāyāḥ prasahyaupabhoge dvādaśapaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra A man who forces his connection with a harlot shall be fined panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bahūnām ekām adhicaratāṃ pṛthak caturviṃśatipaṇo daṇḍaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When many persons perform witchcraft towards a single woman, each of them shall be punished with a fine of panas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: striyam ayonau gacchataḥ pūrvaḥ sāhasadaṇḍaḥ, puruṣam adhimehataś ca //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a man has connection with a woman against the order of nature ayonau, he shall be punished with the first amercement A man having sexual intercourse with another man shall also pay the first amercement

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: maithune dvādaśapaṇas tiryagyoniṣv anātmanaḥ / daivatapratimānāṃ ca gamane dviguṇaḥ smṛtaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a senseless man has sexual intercourse with beasts, he shall be fined panas; when he comits the same act with idols representatives of goddesses daivatapratimá, he shall be fined twice as much

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: adaṇḍyadaṇḍane rājño daṇḍas triṃśadguṇoaṃbhasi / varuṇāya pradātavyo brāhmaṇebhyas tataḥ param //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When the king punishes an innocent man, he shall throw into water dedicating to god Varuna a fine equal to thirty times the unjust imposition; and this amount shall afterwards be distributed among the Bráhmans

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena tat pūyate pāpaṃ rājño daṇḍaapacārajam /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: By this act, the king will be free from the sin of unjust imposition;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śāstā hi varuṇo rājñāṃ mithyā vyācaratāṃ nṛṣu //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: for king Varuna is the ruler of sinners among men [Thus ends Chapter , Punishment for violating justice in Book , The Removal of Thorns of the Arthasástra of Kautilya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: durgarāṣṭrayoḥ kaṇṭakaśodhanam uktam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Bangalore Government Press, , Kautilyas Arthashastra Book , The Conduct of Courtiers CHAPTER

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājarājyayor vakṣyāmaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: We shall now proceed to treat of measures to suppress treason against the king and his kingdom

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rājānam avagṛhyaupajīvinaḥ śatrusādhāraṇā vā ye mukhyās teṣu gūḍhapuruṣapraṇidhiḥ kṛtyapakṣaupagraho vā siddhiḥ yathāuktaṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: With regard to those chiefs who, though living by service under the king, are inimically disposed towards him, or have taken the side of his enemy, a spy with secret mission or one in the guise of an ascetic and devoted to the kings cause shall set to work as described before;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: upajāpoapasarpo vā yathā pāragrāmike vakṣyāmaḥ // rājyaupaghātinas tu vallabhāḥ saṃhatā vā ye mukhyāḥ prakāśam aśakyāḥ pratiṣeddhuṃ dūṣyāḥ teṣu dharmarucir upāṃśudaṇḍaṃ prayuñjīta
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: or a spy trained in the art of sowing the seeds of dissension may set to work, as will be described in connection with the „Invasion of an enemys villages‟ The king in the interests of righteousness may inflict punishment in secret on those courtiers or confederacy of chiefs who are dangerous to the safety of the kingdom and who cannot be put down in open daylight

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dūṣyamahāmātrabhrātaram asatkṛtaṃ sattrī protsāhya rājānaṃ darśayet // taṃ rājā dūṣyadravyaupabhogaatisargeṇa dūṣye vikramayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A spy may instigate the brother of a seditious minister and with necessary inducements, take him to the king for an interview The king, having conferred upon him the title to possess and enjoy the property of his seditious brother, may cause him to attack his brother;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: śastreṇa rasena vā vikrāntaṃ tatraeva ghātayed bhrātṛghātakoayam iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and when he murders his brother with a weapon or with poison, he shall be put to death in the same spot under the plea that he is a parricide

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dūṣyaṃmahāmātraṃ vā sattriprotsāhito bhrātā dāyaṃ yāceta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or instigated by a spy, the brother of a seditious minister may put forward his claim for inheritance

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: taṃ dūṣyagṛhapratidvāri rātrāv upaśayānam anyatra vā vasantaṃ tīkṣṇo hantā brūyād hatoayaṃ dāyakāmukaḥ iti // tato hatapakṣam upagṛhyaitaraṃ nigṛhṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: While the claimant is lying at night at the door of the house of the seditious minister or elsewhere, a fiery spy tîshna may murder him and declare Alas! the claimant for inheritance is thus murdered by his brother Then taking the side of the injured party, the king may punish the other the seditious minister

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dūṣyasamīpasthā vā sattriṇo bhrātaraṃ dāyaṃ yācamānaṃ ghātena paribhartsayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Spies in the presence of a seditious minister may threaten to beat his brother claiming inheritance Then while the claimant is lying at the door of, etc

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dūṣyamahāmātrayor vā yaḥ putraḥ pituḥ pitā vā putrasya dārān adhicarati, bhrātā vā bhrātuḥ, tayoḥ kāpaṭikamukhaḥ kalahaḥ pūrveṇa vyākhyātaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: as before The same proceedings will explain the quarrel fraudulently caused to crop up between any two seditious ministers, in whose family a son or a father has had sexual intercourse with a daughterinlaw, or a brother with the wife of another brother

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dūṣyamahāmātraputram ātmasaṃbhāvitaṃ vā sattrī rājaputras tvam, śatrubhayād iha nyastoasi ity upajapet // pratipannaṃ rājā rahasi pūjayet prāptayauvarājyakālaṃ tvāṃ mahāmātrabhayān naabhiṣiñcāmi iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A spy may flatter to the vanity of a seditious ministers son, of gentle manners and dignified conduct by telling him Though thou art the kings son, thou art kept here in fear of enemies The king may secretly honour this deluded person and tell him that apprehending danger from the minister, have put off thy installation, though thou hast attained the age of heir apparent Then the spy may instigate him to murder the minister

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vikrāntaṃ tatraeva ghātayet pitṛghātakoayam iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The task being accomplished, he, too, may be put to death in the same spot under the plea that he is a parricide

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhikṣukī vā dūṣyabhāryāṃ sāṃvadanikībhir auṣadhībhiḥ saṃvāsya rasenaatisaṃdadhyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A mendicant woman, having captivated the wife of a seditious minister by administering such medicines as excite the feelings of love, may through that wife contrive to poison the minister

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ity āpyaprayogaḥ // / dūṣyamahāmātram aṭavīṃ paragrāmaṃ vā hantuṃ kāntāravyavahite vā deśe rāṣṭrapālam antapālaṃ vā sthāpayituṃ nāgarasthānaṃ vā kupitam avagrāhituṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra Failing these measures, the king may send a seditious minister with an army of inefficient soldiers and fiery spies to put down a rebellious wild tribe or a village, or to set up a new superintendent of countries or of boundaries in a locality bordering upon a wilderness, or to bring under control a highlyrebellious city, or to fetch a caravan bringing in the tribute due to the king from a neighbouring country

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: rātrau divā vā yuddhe pravṛtte tīkṣṇāḥ pratirodhakavyañjanā vā hanyuḥ abhiyoge hataḥ iti // yātrāvihāragato vā dūṣyamahāmātrān darśanāyaāhvayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: In an affray that ensues in consequence of the above mission either by day or at night, the fiery spies, or spies under the guise of robbers pratirodhaka may murder the minister and declare that he was killed in the battle While marching against an enemy or being engaged in sports, the king may send for his seditious ministers for an interview

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: te gūḍhaśastrais tīkṣṇaiḥ saha praviṣṭā madhyamakakṣyāyām ātmavicayam antaḥpraveśanaarthaṃ dadyuḥ // tato dauvārikaabhigṛhītās tīkṣṇāḥ dūṣyaprayuktāḥ sma iti brūyuḥ // te tadabhivikhyāpya dūṣyān hanyuḥ // tīkṣṇasthāne caanye vadhyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: While leading the ministers to the king, fiery spies with concealed weapons shall, in the middle enclosure of the kings pavilion, offer themselves to be searched for admittance into the interior, and, when caught, with their weapons by the doorkeepers, declare themselves to be the accomplices of the seditious ministers Having made this affair known to the public, the doorkeepers shall put the ministers to death, and in the place of the fiery spies, some others are to be hanged

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bahirvihāragato vā dūṣyān āsannaāvāsān pūjayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: While engaged in sports outside the city, the king may honour his seditious ministers with accommodation close to his own

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ devīvyañjanā vā duḥstrī rātrāv āvāseṣu gṛhyetaiti samānaṃ pūrveṇa //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A woman of bad character under the guise of the queen may be caught in the apartment of these ministers and steps may be taken against them as before

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dūṣyamahāmātraṃ vā sūdo bhakṣakāro vā te śobhanaḥ iti stavena bhakṣyabhojyaṃ yāceta, bahir vā kvacid adhvagataḥ pānīyam // tadubhayaṃ rasena yojayitvā pratisvādane tāv evaupayojayet // tadabhivikhyāpya rasadau iti ghātayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A saucemaker or a sweetmeatmaker may request of a seditious minister some sauce and sweetmeat by flattering himthou alone art worthy of such things Having mixed those two things and half a cup of water with poison, he may substitute those things in the luncheon of the king outside the city Having made this event known to the public, the king may put them the Kautilyas Arthashastra minister and the cook to death under the plea that they are poisoners

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: abhicāraśīlaṃ vā siddhavyañjano godhākūrmakarkaṭakakūṭānāṃ lakṣaṇyānām anyatamaprāśanena manorathān avāpsyasi iti grāhayet pratipannaṃ karmaṇi rasena lohamusalair vā ghātayet karmavyāpadā hataḥ iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: If a seditious minister is addicted to witchcraft, a spy under the guise of an accomplished wizard may make him believe that by manifesting in witchcraft any one of the beautiful things,a pot containing an alligator, or a tortoise or crabhe can attain his desired end While, with this belief, he is engaged in the act of witchcraft, a spy may murder him either by poisoning him or by striking him with an iron bar, and declare that he brought his own death by his proclivity to witchcraft

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: cikitsakavyañjano vā daurātmikam asādhyaṃ vā vyādhiṃ dūṣyasya sthāpayitvā bhaiṣajyaāhārayogeṣu rasenaatisaṃdadhyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A spy under the guise of a physician may make a seditious minister believe that he is suffering from a fatal or incurable disease and contrive to poison him while prescribing medicine and diet to him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sūdaārālikavyañjanā vā praṇihitā dūṣyaṃ rasenaatisaṃdadhyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Spies under the guise of saucemakers and sweet meatmakers may, when opportunity occurs, contrive to poison him

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ity upaniṣatpratiṣedhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such are the secret measures to get rid of seditious persons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: ubhayadūṣyapratiṣedhas tu // yatra dūṣyaḥ pratiṣeddhavyas tatra dūṣyam eva phalgubalatīkṣṇayuktaṃ preṣayet, gaccha, amuṣmin durge rāṣṭre vā sainyam utthāpaya hiraṇyaṃ vā,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: As to measures to get rid of seditious persons conspiring against both the king and his kingdom When a seditious person is to be got rid of, another seditious person with an army of inefficient soldiers and fiery spies may be sent with the mission Go out into this fort or country and raise an army or some revenue;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vallabhād vā hiraṇyam āhāraya,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: deprive a courtier of his gold;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vallabhakanyāṃ vā prasahyaānaya,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: bring by force the daughter of a courtier;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: durgasetuvaṇikpathaśūnyaniveśakhanidravyahastivanakarmaṇām anyatamad vā kāraya rāṣṭrapālyam antapālyaṃ vā yaś ca tvā pratiṣedhayen
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: construct a road for traffic; set up a new village; exploit a mine; form forestpreserves for timber or elephants;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na vā te sāhāyyaṃ dadyāt sa bandhavyaḥ syāt iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: set up a district or a boundary;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tathaivaitareṣāṃ preṣayed amuṣyaavinayaḥ pratiṣeddhavyaḥ iti // tam eteṣu kalahasthāneṣu karmapratighāteṣu vā vivadamānaṃ tīkṣṇāḥ śastraṃ pātayitvā pracchannaṃ hanyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and arrest and capture those who prevent your work or do not give you help Similarly the other party may be instructed Kautilyas Arthashastra 0 to curb the spirit of the above person When a quarrel arises between the two parties at work, fiery spies under cover may throw their weapons and murder the seditious person;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena doṣeṇaitare niyantavyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and others are to be arrested and punished for the crime

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / purāṇāṃ grāmāṇāṃ kulānāṃ vā dūṣyāṇāṃ sīmākṣetrakhalaveśmamaryādāsu dravyaupakaraṇasasyavāhanahiṃsāsu prekṣākṛtyautsaveṣu vā samutpanne kalahe tīkṣṇair utpādite vā tīkṣṇāḥ śastraṃ pātayitvā brūyuḥ evaṃ kriyante yeamunā kalahāyante iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When with reference to boundaries, fieldproduce, and boundaries of houses, or with reference to any damage done to things, instruments, crops, and beasts of burden or on occasions of witnessing spectacles and processions, any dispute, real or caused by fiery spies, arises in seditious towns, villages, or families, fiery spies may hurl weapons and say This is what is done to them who quarrel with this man;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena doṣeṇaitare niyantavyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and for this offence others may be punished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bandhusaṃbandhiṣu vāhaneṣu vā tīkṣṇāḥ śastraṃ pātayitvā tathaiva brūyuḥ amunā prayuktāḥ smaḥ iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When there arises a quarrel among seditious persons, fiery spies may set fire to their fields, harvestgrounds, and houses, hurl weapons on their relatives, friends and beasts of burden, and say that they did so at the instigation of the seditious;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena doṣeṇaitare niyantavyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and for this offence others may be punished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: durgarāṣṭradūṣyān vā sattriṇaḥ parasparasyaāveśanikān kārayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Spies may induce seditious persons in forts or in country parts to be each others guests at a dinner in which poisoners may administer poison;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena doṣeṇaitare niyantavyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and for this offence others may be punished

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhikṣukī vā dūṣyarāṣṭramukhyaṃ dūṣyarāṣṭramukhyasya bhāryā snuṣā duhitā vā kāmayate ity upajapet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A mendicant woman may delude a seditious chief of a district into the belief that the wife, daughter, or daughterinlaw of another seditious chief of another district loves the former

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratipannasyaābharaṇam ādāya svāmine darśayet asau te mukhyo yauvanautsikto bhāryāṃ snuṣāṃ duhitaraṃ vāabhimanyate iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: She may take the jewellery which the deluded chief gives her for delivery to the wife, daughter, etc, and, presenting it before the other chief, narrate that this chief in the pride of his youth makes love to the others wife, daughter, or daughterinlaw

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tayoḥ kalaho rātrau iti samānam // dūṣyadaṇḍaupanateṣu tu yuvarājaḥ senāpatir vā kiṃcid apakṛtyaapakrānto vikrameta // tato rājā dūṣyadaṇḍaupanatān eva preṣayet phalgubalatīkṣṇayuktān iti samānāḥ sarva eva yogāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The prince or the commander of the army may confer some benefit upon such inimical persons as have been cowed down by a Kautilyas Arthashastra seditious army, and may declare his displeasure against them afterwards And then some other persons, who are equally cowed down by another seditious army of the king, may be sent against the former along with an army of inefficient soldiers and fiery spies Thus all the measures to get rid of seditious persons are of the same type

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: teṣāṃ ca putreṣv anukṣiyatsu yo nirvikāraḥ sa pitṛdāyaṃ labheta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever among the sons of the seditious persons thus put down shows no perturbance of mind shall receive his fathers property

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: evam asya putrapautrān anuvartate rājyam apāstapuruṣadoṣam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: It is only thus that the whole of the country will loyally follow the sons and grandsons of the king, and will be free from all troubles caused by men

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svapakṣe parapakṣe vā tūṣṇīṃ daṇḍaṃ prayojayet / āyatyāṃ ca tadātve ca kṣamāvān aviśaṅkitaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Possessed of forbearance and apprehending no disturbance either in the present or future, the king may award punishments in secret both upon his own subjects and those who uphold the enemys cause

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kośam akośaḥ pratyutpannaarthakṛcchraḥ saṃgṛhṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The Conduct of Courtiers of the Arthasástra of Kautilya End of the ninetyfirst chapter from the beginning] CHAPTER

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: janapadaṃ mahāntam alpapramāṇaṃ vāadevamātṛkaṃ prabhūtadhānyaṃ dhānyasyaaṃśaṃ tṛtīyaṃ caturthaṃ vā yāceta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: THE king who finds himself in a great financial trouble and needs money, may collect revenue by demand In such parts of his country as depend solely upon rain for water and are rich in grain, he may demand of his subjects onethird or onefourth of their grain according to their capacity

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yathāsāraṃ madhyam avaraṃ vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall never demand of such of his subjects as live in tracts of middle or low quality;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: durgasetukarmavaṇikpathaśūnyaniveśakhanidravyahastivanakarmaupakāriṇaṃ pratyantam alpapramāṇaṃ vā na yāceta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: nor of people who are of great help in the construction of fortifications, Kautilyas Arthashastra gardens, buildings, roads for traffic, colonisation of waste lands, exploitation of mines, and formation of forestpreserves for timber and, elephants;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dhānyapaśuhiraṇyaādi niviśamānāya dadyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall, on the other hand, supply with grain and cattle those who colonise waste lands

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: caturtham aṃśaṃ dhānyānāṃ bījabhaktaśuddhaṃ ca hiraṇyena krīṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He may purchase for gold onefourth of what remains, after deducting as much of the grain as is required for seeds and subsistence of his subjects

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: araṇyajātaṃ śrotriyasvaṃ ca pariharet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He shall avoid the property of forest tribes, as well as of Bráhmans learned in the Vedas srotriya

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tad apy anugraheṇa krīṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: He may purchase this, too, offering favourable price to the owners

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaakaraṇe vā samāhartṛpuruṣā grīṣme karṣakāṇām udvāpaṃ kārayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Failing these measures, the servants of the collectorgeneral may prevail upon the peasantry to raise summer crops

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pramādaavaskannasyaatyayaṃ dviguṇam udāharanto bījakāle bījalekhyaṃ kuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Saying that double the amount of fines will be levied from those who are guilty among peasants, they the kings employees shall sow seeds in sowing seasons

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: niṣpanne haritapakvaādānaṃ vārayeyuḥ, anyatra śākakaṭabhaṅgamuṣṭibhyāṃ devapitṛpūjādānaarthaṃ gavaarthaṃ vā // bhikṣukagrāmabhṛtakaarthaṃ ca rāśimūlaṃ parihareyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When crops are ripe, they may beg a portion of vegetable and other ripe produce except what is gleaned in the form of vegetables and grains They shall avoid the grains scattered in harvestfields, so that they may be utilised in making offerings to gods and ancestors on occasions of worship, in feeding cows, or for the subsistence of mendicants and village employees grâlmabhritaka

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svasasyaapahāriṇaḥ pratipātoaṣṭaguṇaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Whoever conceals his own grain shall pay a fine of eight times the amount in each kind;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: parasasyaapahāriṇaḥ pañcāśadguṇaḥ sītāatyayaḥ, svavargasya,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and whoever steals the crops of another person shall pay a fine of fifty times the amount, provided the robber belongs to the same community svavarga;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bāhyasya tu vadhaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: but if he is a foreigner, he shall be put to death

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: / caturtham aṃśaṃ dhānyānāṃ ṣaṣṭhaṃ vanyānāṃ tūlalākṣākṣaumavalkakārpāsaraumakauśeyakauṣadhagandhapuṣpaphalaśākapaṇyānāṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They the kings employees may demand of cultivators onefourth of their grain, and onesixth of forest produce vanya and of such commodities as cotton, wax, fabrics, barks of trees, hemp, wool, silk, medicines, sandal, flowers, fruits, vegetables, firewood, bamboos, flesh, and dried flesh

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāṣṭhaveṇumāṃsavallūrāṇāṃ ca gṛhṇīyuḥ, dantaajinasyaardham //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: They may also take onehalf of all ivory and skins of animals, and punish with the first amercement those who trade in any article without obtaining a license from the king

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti karṣakeṣu praṇayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: So much for Kautilyas Arthashastra demands on cultivators

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: suvarṇarajatavajramaṇimuktāpravālaaśvahastipaṇyāḥ pañcāśatkarāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Merchants dealing in gold, silver, diamonds, precious stones, pearls, coral, horses, and elephants shall pay 0 karas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sūtravastratāmravṛttakaṃsagandhabhaiṣajyaśīdhupaṇyāś catvāriṃśatkarāḥ // dhānyarasalohapaṇyāḥ śakaṭavyavahāriṇaś ca triṃśatkarāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those that trade in cotton threads, clothes, copper, brass, bronze, sandal, medicines, and liquor shall pay 0 karas Those that trade in grains, liquids, metals loha, and deal with carts shall pay 0 karas Those that carry on their trade in glass kâcha;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kācavyavahāriṇo mahākāravaś ca viṃśatikarāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and also artisans of fine workmanship shall pay 0 karas

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kṣudrakāravo bandhakīpoṣakāś ca daśakarāḥ // kāṣṭhaveṇupāṣāṇamṛdbhāṇḍapakvaannaharitapaṇyāḥ pañcakarāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Articles of inferior workmanship, as well as those who keep prostitutes, shall pay 0 karas Those that trade in firewood, bamboos, stones, earthenpots, cooked rice, and vegetables shall pay karas Dramatists and prostitutes shall pay half of their wages

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: hiraṇyakaraṃ karmaṇyān āhārayeyuḥ,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The entire property of goldsmiths shall be taken possession of;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: na caeṣāṃ kaṃcid aparādhaṃ parihareyuḥ // te hy aparigṛhītam abhinīya vikrīṇīran //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and no offence of theirs shall be forgiven; for they carry on their fraudulent trade while pretending at the same time to be honest and innocent

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti vyavahāriṣu praṇayaḥ // /
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: So much about demands on merchants

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kukkuṭasūkaram ardhaṃ dadyāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those that rear inferior animals shall give onesixth

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: gomahiṣaaśvatarakharauṣṭrāś ca daśabhāgam //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those that keep cows, buffaloes, mules, asses, and camels shall give onetenth of their livestock

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bandhakīpoṣakā rājapreṣyābhiḥ paramarūpayauvanābhiḥ kośaṃ saṃhareyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those who maintain prostitutes bandhakiposhaka, shall, with the help of women noted for their beauty and youth in the service of the king, collect revenue

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: iti yonipoṣakeṣu praṇayaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: So much about demands on herdsmen

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sakṛd eva na dviḥ prayojyaḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Such demands shall be made only once and never twice

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tasyaakaraṇe vā samāhartā kāryam apadiśya paurajānapadān bhikṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When such demands are not made, the collector general shall seek subscriptions from citizens and country people alike under false pretences of carrying this or that kind of business

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yogapuruṣāś caatra pūrvam atimātraṃ dadyuḥ // etena pradeśena rājā paurajānapadān bhikṣeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Persons taken in concert shall publicly pay handsome donations and with this example, the king may demand of others among his subjects

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: kāpaṭikāś caenān alpaṃ prayacchataḥ kutsayeyuḥ // sārato vā hiraṇyam āḍhyān yāceta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Spies posing as citizens shall revile those who pay less Wealthy persons may be requested to give as much of their gold as they can

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: svavaśā vā yad upahareyuḥ // sthānacchatraveṣṭanavibhūṣāś caeṣāṃ hiraṇyena prayacchet // pāṣaṇḍasaṃghadravyam aśrotriyaupabhogyaṃ devadravyaṃ vā kṛtyakarāḥ pretasya dagdhagṛhasya vā haste nyastam ity upahareyuḥ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Those Kautilyas Arthashastra who, of their own accord or with the intention of doing good, offer their wealth to the king shall be honoured with a rank in the court, an umbrella, or a turban or some ornaments in return for their gold Spies, under the guise of sorcerers, shall, under the pretence of ensuring safety, carry away the money, not only of the society of heretics and of temples, but also of a dead man and of a man whose house is burnt, provided that it is not enjoyable by Bráhmans

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: devatāadhyakṣo durgarāṣṭradevatānāṃ yathāsvam ekasthaṃ kośaṃ kuryāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: The Superintendent of Religious Institutions may collect in one place the various kinds of property of the gods of fortified cities and country parts and carry away the property to the kings treasury

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: daivatacaityaṃ siddhapuṇyasthānam aupapādikaṃ vā rātrāv utthāpya yātrāsamājābhyām ājīvet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or having on some night set up a god or an altar, or having opened a sacred place of ascetics or having pointed out an evil omen, the king may collect subsistence under the pretence of holding processions and congregations to avert calamities

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: caityaupavanavṛkṣeṇa vā devatāabhigamanam anārtavapuṣpaphalayuktena khyāpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or else he shall proclaim the arrival of gods, by pointing out to the people any of the sacred trees in the kings garden which has produced untimely flowers and fruits

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: manuṣyakaraṃ vā vṛkṣe rakṣobhayaṃ prarūpayitvā siddhavyañjanāḥ paurajānapadānāṃ hiraṇyena pratikuryuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or by causing a false panic owing to the arrival of an evil spirit on a tree in the city, wherein a man is hidden making all sorts of devilish noises, the kings spies, under the guise of ascetics, may collect money with a view to propitiate the evil spirit and send it back

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: suruṅgāyukte vā kūpe nāgam aniyataśiraskaṃ hiraṇyaupahāreṇa darśayet // nāgapratimāyām antaśchannāyāṃ caityacchidre valmīkacchidre vā sarpadarśanam āhāreṇa pratibaddhasaṃjñaṃ kṛtvā śraddadhānānāṃ
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or spies may call upon spectators to see a serpent with numberless heads in a well connected with a subterranean passage and collect fees from them for the sight Or they may place in a borehole made in the body of an image of a serpent, or in a hole in the corner of a temple, or in the hollow of an anthill, a cobra, which is, by diet, rendered unconscious, and call upon credulous Kautilyas Arthashastra spectators to see it on payment of a certain amount of fee

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: aśraddadhānānām ācamanaprokṣaṇeṣu rasam upacārya devatāabhiśāpaṃ brūyāt, abhityaktaṃ vā daṃśayitvā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: As to persons who are not by nature credulous, spies may sprinkle over or give a drink of, such sacred water as is mixed with anasthetic ingredients and attribute their insensibility to the curse of gods

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: yogadarśanapratīkāreṇa vā kośaabhisaṃharaṇaṃ kuryāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or by causing an outcast person âbhityáktá to be bitten by a cobra, spies may collect revenue under the pretext of undertaking remedial measures against ominous phenomena

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaidehakavyañjano vā prabhūtapaṇyaantevāsī vyavahareta // sa yadā paṇyamūlye nikṣepaprayogair upacitaḥ syāt tadāenaṃ rātrau moṣayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or one of the kings spies in the garb of a merchant, may become a partner of a rich merchant and carry on trade in concert with him As soon as a considerable amount of money has been gathered as saleproceeds, deposits and loans, he may cause himself to be robbed of the amount

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: etena rūpadarśakaḥ suvarṇakāraś ca vyākhyātau //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: This will explain what the examiner of coins and the stategoldsmith may also do

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: vaidehakavyañjano vā prakhyātavyavahāraḥ prahavaṇanimittaṃ yācitakam avakrītakaṃ vā rūpyasuvarṇabhāṇḍam anekaṃ gṛhṇīyāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or else a spy, in the garb of a rich merchant, or a real rich merchant famous for his vast commerce, may borrow or take on pledge vast quantities of gold, silver, and other commodities, or borrow from corporations bar gold, or coined gold for various kinds of merchandise to be procured from abroad

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tad ubhayaṃ rātrau moṣayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: After having done this he may allow himself to be robbed of it the same night

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sādhvīvyañjanābhiḥ strībhir dūṣyān unmādayitvā tāsām eva veśmasv abhigṛhya sarvasvāny āhareyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Prostitute spies under the garb of chaste women, may cause themselves to be enamoured of persons who are seditious No sooner are the seditious persons seen within the abode of the female spies than they shall be seized and their property confiscated to the Government

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dūṣyakulyānāṃ vā vivāde pratyutpanne rasadāḥ praṇihitā rasaṃ dadyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or whenever a quarrel arises between any two seditious parties of the same family, poisoners, previously engaged for the purpose, may administer poison to one party;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tena doṣeṇaitare paryādātavyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and the other party may be accused of the offence and deprived of their

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dūṣyam abhityakto vā śraddheyaapadeśaṃ paṇyaṃ hiraṇyanikṣepam ṛṇaprayogaṃ dāyaṃ vā yāceta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Kautilyas Arthashastra An outcast, under the guise of a highborn man, may claim from a seditious person a large amount of money professed to have been placed in the latters custody by the claimant, or a large debt outstanding against the seditious person, or a share of parental property

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dāsaśabdena vā dūṣyam ālambeta,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: An outcast may pretend to be the slave of a seditious person;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: bhāryām asya snuṣāṃ duhitaraṃ vā dāsīśabdena bhāryāśabdena vā //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and he may represent the wife, daughter, or daughterinlaw of the seditious person as a slavewoman or as his own wife;

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: taṃ dūṣyagṛhapratidvāri rātrāv upaśayānam anyatra vā vasantaṃ tīkṣṇo hatvā brūyāt hatoayam arthakāmukaḥ iti // tena doṣeṇaitare paryādātavyāḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: and when the outcast is lying at the door of the seditious persons house at night or is living elsewhere, a fiery spy may murder him and declareThe claimant of his own property or wife has been thus killed And for this offence others ie, the seditious person and his followers shall be deprived of their property

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: siddhavyañjano vā dūṣyaṃ jambhakavidyābhiḥ pralobhayitvā brūyāt akṣayahiraṇyaṃ rājadvārikaṃ strīhṛdayam arivyādhikaram āyuṣyaṃ putrīyaṃ vā karma jānāmi iti // pratipannaṃ caityasthāne rātrau prabhūtasurāmāṃsagandham upahāraṃ kārayet // ekarūpaṃ caatra hiraṇyaṃ pūrvanikhātaṃ pretaaṅgaṃ pretaśiśur vā yatra nihitaḥ syāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or a spy, under the garb of an ascetic, may offer inducements to a seditious person to acquire more wealth by taking in aid the art of witchcraft, and sayI am proficient in such witchcraft as brings inexhaustible wealth, or entitles a man to get admission into the kings palace, or can win the love of any woman, or can put an end to the life of ones enemy, or can lengthen the duration of ones life, or can give a son to any one, if desired If the seditious person shows his desire to carry on the process of witchcraft securing wealth, the spy may make rich offerings, consisting of flesh, wine, and scent to the deity near an altar in a burialground wherein a dead body of a man or of a child with a little quantity of money has been previously hidden

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: tato hiraṇyam asya darśayed atyalpam iti ca brūyāt // prabhūtahiraṇyahetoḥ punar upahāraḥ kartavya iti svayam evaetena hiraṇyena śvobhūte prabhūtam aupahārikaṃ krīṇīhi iti //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: After the performance of worship is over, the hidden treasure may be dug out and the seditious person, may be told that as the offerings fell short, the treasure is proportionately small; that the richest of offerings should be made to acquire vast amount of treasure, and that he may purchase with the newlyacquired wealth rich offerings

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: sa tena hiraṇyenaaupahārikakraye gṛhyeta //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Then he may be caught in the very act of purchasing commodities for offering

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: mātṛvyañjanayā vā putro me tvayā hataḥ ity avakupitā syāt //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A female spy, under the garb of a bereaved mother, may in Kautilyas Arthashastra connection with the above case raise an alarm, crying that her child was murdered for the purposes of witchcraft

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: saṃsiddham evaasya rātriyāge vanayāge vanakrīḍāyāṃ vā pravṛttāyāṃ tīkṣṇā viśasyaabhityaktam atinayeyuḥ //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: When a seditious person is engaged in sorcery at night or in a sacrificial performance in a forest, or in sports in a park, fiery spies may murder him and carry away the corpse as that of an outcast

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: dūṣyasya vā bhṛtakavyañjano vetanahiraṇye kūṭarūpaṃ prakṣipya prarūpayet //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or a spy, under the garb of a servant of a seditious person, may mix counterfeit coins with the wages he has received from his master, and pave the way for his arrest

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: karmakaravyañjano vā gṛhe karma kurvāṇaḥ stenakūṭarūpakārakaupakaraṇam upanidadhyāt,
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: Or a spy, under the garb of a goldsmith, may undertake to do some work in the house of a seditious person, and gather in his employers house such instruments as are necessary to manufacture counterfeit coins

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: cikitsakavyañjano vā garam agadaapadeśena //
Óm Salutation to Sukra and Brihaspati: A spy, under the garb of a physician, may declare a healthy person of seditious character to be unhealthy and administer poison

oṃnamaḥśukrabṛhaspatibhyāṃ: pratyāsanno vā dūṣyasya sattrī praṇihitam abhiṣekabhāṇḍam amitraśāsanaṃ ca kāpaṭikamukhenaācakṣīta, kāraṇaṃ ca brūyāt //
